Text

CHAPTER I. The Period It was the best of times , it was the worst of times , it was the age of wisdom , it was the age of foolishness , it was the epoch of belief , it was the epoch of incredulity , it was the season of Light , it was the season of Darkness , it was the spring of hope , it was the winter of despair , [we]297-we had everything before [us]297-we , [we]297-we had nothing before [us]297-we , [we]297-we were all going direct to [Heaven]298-heaven , [we]297-we were all going direct the other way -- in short , the period was so far like the present period , that [some of [its]300-its noisiest authorities]299-some of its noisiest authorities insisted on its being received , for good or for evil , in the superlative degree of comparison only . There were [a king with a large jaw]301-a king with a large jaw and [a queen with a plain face]302-a queen with a plain face , on the throne of [England]1-england ; there were [a king with a large jaw]301-a king with a large jaw and [a queen with a fair face]304-a queen with a fair face , on [the throne of [France]2-france]305-the throne of france . In [both countries]306-both countries it was clearer than crystal to [the lords of [the State]308-the state]307-the lords of the state preserves of loaves and fishes , that things in general were settled for ever . It was the year of [Our]297-we Lord one thousand seven hundred and seventy - five . Spiritual revelations were conceded to [England]1-england at that favoured period , as at this . [Mrs. Southcott]127-mrs. southcott had recently attained [her]127-mrs. southcott five - and - twentieth blessed birthday , of whom [a prophetic private in the Life Guards]309-a prophetic private in the life guards had heralded the sublime appearance by announcing that arrangements were made for the swallowing up of [London]3-london and [Westminster]4-westminster . Even the Cock - lane ghost had been laid only a round dozen of years , after rapping out its messages , as [the spirits of this very year last past]310-the spirits of this very year last past ( supernaturally deficient in originality ) rapped out [theirs]310-the spirits of this very year last past . Mere messages in the earthly order of events had lately come to [the English Crown and People]311-the english crown and people , from [a congress of [British subjects in [America]5-america]313-british subjects in america]312-a congress of british subjects in america : which , strange to relate , have proved more important to [the human race]314-the human race than any communications yet received through any of the chickens of [the Cock - lane brood]315-the cock - lane brood . [France]2-france , less favoured on the whole as to matters spiritual than [[her]316-her sister]317-her sister of the shield and trident , rolled with exceeding smoothness down hill , making paper money and spending it . Under the guidance of [[her]127-mrs. southcott Christian pastors]318-her christian pastors , [she]127-mrs. southcott entertained [herself]127-mrs. southcott , besides , with such humane achievements as sentencing [a youth]319-a youth to have [his]319-a youth hands cut off , [his]319-a youth tongue torn out with pincers , and [his]319-a youth body burned alive , because [he]319-a youth had not kneeled down in the rain to do honour to a dirty procession of monks which passed within [his]319-a youth view , at a distance of some fifty or sixty yards . It is likely enough that , rooted in [the woods of [France]2-france and [Norway]6-norway]320-the woods of france and norway , there were growing trees , when [that sufferer]321-that sufferer was put to death , already marked by [the Woodman , Fate]322-the woodman , fate , to come down and be sawn into boards , to make a certain movable framework with a sack and a knife in it , terrible in history . It is likely enough that in [the rough outhouses of [some tillers of [the heavy lands]325-the heavy lands adjacent to [Paris]7-paris]324-some tillers of the heavy lands adjacent to paris]323-the rough outhouses of some tillers of the heavy lands adjacent to paris , there were sheltered from the weather that very day , rude carts , bespattered with rustic mire , snuffed about by pigs , and roosted in by poultry , which [the Farmer]326-the farmer , [Death]128-death , had already set apart to be [his]128-death tumbrils of the Revolution . But [that Woodman]327-that woodman and [that Farmer]328-that farmer , though [they]329-they work unceasingly , work silently , and [no one]330-no one heard [them]329-they as [they]329-they went about with muffled tread : the rather , forasmuch as to entertain any suspicion that [they]329-they were awake , was to be atheistical and traitorous . In [England]1-england , there was scarcely an amount of order and protection to justify much national boasting . Daring burglaries by [armed men]331-armed men , and highway robberies , took place in [the capital]332-the capital itself every night ; [families]333-families were publicly cautioned not to go out of [town]334-town without removing [their]333-families furniture to [upholsterers ’ warehouses]335-upholsterers ’ warehouses for security ; [the highwayman in the dark]336-the highwayman in the dark was [a City tradesman in the light]337-a city tradesman in the light , and , being recognised and challenged by [[his]336-the highwayman in the dark fellow - tradesman]338-his fellow - tradesman whom [he]336-the highwayman in the dark stopped in [his]336-the highwayman in the dark character of “ [the Captain]4847-the captain , ”[336-the highwayman in the dark] gallantly shot [him]336-the highwayman in the dark through the head and rode away ; the mail was waylaid by [seven robbers]339-seven robbers , and [the guard]340-the guard shot three dead , and then got shot dead [himself]340-the guard by [the other four]341-the other four , “ in consequence of the failure of [his]340-the guard ammunition : ”[344-one highwayman] after which the mail was robbed in peace ; [that magnificent potentate , [the Lord Mayor of [London]3-london]343-the lord mayor of london]342-that magnificent potentate , the lord mayor of london , was made to stand and deliver on [Turnham Green]8-turnham green , by [one highwayman]344-one highwayman , who despoiled the illustrious creature in sight of all [[his]344-one highwayman retinue]345-his retinue ; [prisoners in [[London]3-london gaols]347-london gaols]346-prisoners in london gaols fought battles with [their]346-prisoners in london gaols turnkeys , and the majesty of the law fired blunderbusses in among [them]346-prisoners in london gaols , loaded with rounds of shot and ball ; [thieves]348-thieves snipped off diamond crosses from the necks of [noble lords]349-noble lords at [Court drawing - rooms]350-court drawing - rooms ; [musketeers]351-musketeers went into [St. Giles ’s]9-st. giles ’s , to search for contraband goods , and [the mob]352-the mob fired on [the musketeers]353-the musketeers , and [the musketeers]353-the musketeers fired on [the mob]352-the mob , and [nobody]356-nobody thought any of these occurrences much out of the common way . In the midst of [them]357-them , [the hangman]358-the hangman , ever busy and ever worse than useless , was in constant requisition ; now , stringing up long rows of [miscellaneous criminals]359-miscellaneous criminals ; now , hanging a housebreaker on Saturday who had been taken on Tuesday ; now , burning [people]360-people in the hand at [Newgate]10-newgate by the dozen , and now burning pamphlets at the door of [Westminster Hall]11-westminster hall ; to - day , taking the life of [an atrocious murderer]361-an atrocious murderer , and to - morrow of [a wretched pilferer who had robbed [a farmer ’s boy of sixpence]363-a farmer ’s boy of sixpence]362-a wretched pilferer who had robbed a farmer ’s boy of sixpence . All these things , and a thousand like them , came to pass in and close upon the dear old year one thousand seven hundred and seventy - five . Environed by [them]357-them , while [the Woodman]364-the woodman and [the Farmer]326-the farmer worked unheeded , those two of the large jaws , and [those other two of the plain and the fair faces]366-those other two of the plain and the fair faces , trod with stir enough , and carried [their]357-them divine rights with a high hand . Thus did the year one thousand seven hundred and seventy - five conduct [their]357-them Greatnesses , and myriads of small creatures -- the creatures of this chronicle among [the rest]367-the rest -- along [the roads that lay before [them]357-them]368-the roads that lay before them . CHAPTER II . The Mail It was [the Dover road]369-the dover road that lay , on a Friday night late in November , before the first of [the persons with whom this history has business]370-the persons with whom this history has business . [The Dover road]369-the dover road lay , as to [him]358-the hangman , beyond the Dover mail , as [it]372-it lumbered up [Shooter ’s Hill]12-shooter ’s hill . [He]358-the hangman walked up hill in the mire by the side of the mail , as [the rest of [the passengers]374-the passengers]373-the rest of the passengers did ; not because [they]373-the rest of the passengers had the least relish for walking exercise , under the circumstances , but because [the hill]375-the hill , and the harness , and the mud , and the mail , were all so heavy , that the horses had three times already come to a stop , besides once drawing [the coach]376-the coach across [the road]377-the road , with the mutinous intent of taking [it]376-the coach back to [Blackheath]13-blackheath . Reins and whip and [coachman]378-coachman and [guard]379-guard , however , in combination , had read that article of war which forbade a purpose otherwise strongly in favour of the argument , that some brute animals are endued with Reason ; and [the team]380-the team had capitulated and returned to [their]380-the team duty . With drooping heads and tremulous tails , [they]380-the team mashed [their]380-the team way through the thick mud , floundering and stumbling between whiles , as if [they]380-the team were falling to pieces at the larger joints . As often as [the driver]381-the driver rested [them]380-the team and brought [them]380-the team to a stand , with a wary “ Wo - ho ! so - ho - then ! ”[382-the near leader] [the near leader]382-the near leader violently shook [his]382-the near leader head and everything upon it -- like an unusually emphatic horse , denying that [the coach]376-the coach could be got up [the hill]375-the hill . Whenever [the leader]385-the leader made this rattle , [the passenger]386-the passenger started , as [a nervous passenger]387-a nervous passenger might , and was disturbed in mind . There was a steaming mist in [all the hollows]388-all the hollows , and it had roamed in its forlornness up [the hill]375-the hill , like an evil spirit , seeking rest and finding none . A clammy and intensely cold mist , it made its slow way through the air in ripples that visibly followed and overspread one another , as the waves of [an unwholesome sea]390-an unwholesome sea might do . It was dense enough to shut out everything from the light of the coach - lamps but these [its]376-the coach own workings , and a few yards of [road]391-road ; and the reek of the labouring horses steamed into it , as if [they]380-the team had made it all . [Two other passengers]392-two other passengers , besides [the one]393-the one , were plodding up [the hill]375-the hill by the side of the mail . [All three]395-all three were wrapped to the cheekbones and over the ears , and wore jack - boots . Not one of [the three]396-the three could have said , from anything [he]382-the near leader saw , what either of the other two was like ; and each was hidden under almost as many wrappers from the eyes of the mind , as from the eyes of the body , of [[his]382-the near leader two companions]397-his two companions . In those days , [travellers]398-travellers were very shy of being confidential on a short notice , for [anybody on [the road]377-the road]399-anybody on the road might be [a robber]401-a robber or in league with [robbers]402-robbers . As to the latter , when [every posting - house]403-every posting - house and [ale - house]404-ale - house could produce [somebody]405-somebody in “ [the Captain]4847-the captain ’s ”[406-the landlord] pay , ranging from [the landlord]406-the landlord to the lowest stable non - descript , it was the likeliest thing upon the cards . So [the guard of the Dover mail]407-the guard of the dover mail thought to [himself]407-the guard of the dover mail , that Friday night in November , one thousand seven hundred and seventy - five , lumbering up [Shooter ’s Hill]12-shooter ’s hill , as [he]407-the guard of the dover mail stood on [his]407-the guard of the dover mail own particular perch behind the mail , beating [his]407-the guard of the dover mail feet , and keeping an eye and a hand on the arm - chest before [him]407-the guard of the dover mail , where a loaded blunderbuss lay at the top of six or eight loaded horse - pistols , deposited on a substratum of cutlass . The [Dover]15-dover mail was in its usual genial position that [the guard]340-the guard suspected [the passengers]374-the passengers , [the passengers]374-the passengers suspected [one another]411-one another and [the guard]340-the guard , [they]374-the passengers all suspected [everybody else]413-everybody else , and [the coachman]414-the coachman was sure of nothing but the horses ; as to which cattle [he]414-the coachman could with a clear conscience have taken [his]414-the coachman oath on [the two Testaments]415-the two testaments that [they]415-the two testaments were not fit for the journey . “ Wo - ho ! ”[414-the coachman] said [the coachman]414-the coachman . “ So , then ! One more pull and [you]340-the guard ’re at the top and be damned to [you]340-the guard , for [I]414-the coachman have had trouble enough to get [you]340-the guard to it!--Joe ! ”[414-the coachman] “ [Halloa]129-halloa ! ”[340-the guard] [the guard]340-the guard replied . “ What o’clock do [you]414-the coachman make it , [Joe]130-joe ? ”[340-the guard] “ Ten minutes , good , past eleven . ”[414-the coachman] “ [My]418-the vexed coachman blood ! ”[418-the vexed coachman] ejaculated [the vexed coachman]418-the vexed coachman , “ and not atop of [Shooter]131-shooter ’s yet ! Tst ! Yah ! Get on with [you]130-joe ! ”[418-the vexed coachman] [The emphatic horse , cut short by the whip in a most decided negative]419-the emphatic horse , cut short by the whip in a most decided negative , made a decided scramble for it , and [the three other horses]420-the three other horses followed suit . Once more , the Dover mail struggled on , with the jack - boots of [its passengers]421-its passengers squashing along by [its]421-its passengers side . [They]420-the three other horses had stopped when [the coach]376-the coach stopped , and [they]420-the three other horses kept close company with [it]421-its passengers . If [any one of [the three]396-the three]423-any one of the three had had the hardihood to propose to another to walk on a little ahead into the mist and darkness , [he]423-any one of the three would have put [himself]423-any one of the three in a fair way of getting shot instantly as [a highwayman]425-a highwayman . The last burst carried the mail to [the summit of [the hill]375-the hill]426-the summit of the hill . The horses stopped to breathe again , and [the guard]340-the guard got down to skid the wheel for the descent , and open the coach - door to let [the passengers]374-the passengers in . “ Tst ! [Joe]130-joe ! ”[414-the coachman] cried [the coachman]414-the coachman in a warning voice , looking down from [his]414-the coachman box . “ What do [you]130-joe say , [Tom]132-tom ? ”[414-the coachman] [They]420-the three other horses both listened . “ [I]414-the coachman say a horse at a canter coming up , [Joe]130-joe . ”[414-the coachman] “ _ [I]340-the guard _ say a horse at a gallop , [Tom]132-tom , ”[340-the guard] returned [the guard]340-the guard , leaving [his]340-the guard hold of the door , and mounting nimbly to [his]340-the guard place . “ [Gentlemen]4849-gentlemen ! In [the king]4850-the king ’s name , all of [you]4849-gentlemen ! ”[414-the coachman] With this hurried adjuration , [he]414-the coachman cocked [his]414-the coachman blunderbuss , and stood on the offensive . [The passenger booked by this history]432-the passenger booked by this history , was on the coach - step , getting in ; [the two other passengers]433-the two other passengers were close behind [him]414-the coachman , and about to follow . [He]414-the coachman remained on the step , half in [the coach]376-the coach and half out of ; [they]433-the two other passengers remained in [the road below [him]414-the coachman]435-the road below him . [They]433-the two other passengers all looked from [the coachman]414-the coachman to [the guard]340-the guard , and from [the guard]340-the guard to [the coachman]414-the coachman , and listened . [The coachman]414-the coachman looked back and [the guard]340-the guard looked back , and even [the emphatic leader]442-the emphatic leader pricked up [his]442-the emphatic leader ears and looked back , without contradicting . The stillness consequent on the cessation of the rumbling and labouring of [the coach]376-the coach , added to the stillness of the night , made it very quiet indeed . The panting of the horses communicated a tremulous motion to [the coach]376-the coach , as if it were in a state of agitation . The hearts of [the passengers]374-the passengers beat loud enough perhaps to be heard ; but at any rate , the quiet pause was audibly expressive of [people out of breath , and holding the breath , and having the pulses quickened by expectation]446-people out of breath , and holding the breath , and having the pulses quickened by expectation . The sound of a horse at a gallop came fast and furiously up [the hill]375-the hill . “ So - ho ! ”[340-the guard] [the guard]340-the guard sang out , as loud as [he]340-the guard could roar . “ Yo there ! Stand ! [I]340-the guard shall fire ! ”[340-the guard] The pace was suddenly checked , and , with much splashing and floundering , [a man]449-a man ’s voice called from the mist , “ Is that the Dover mail ? ”[449-a man] “ Never [you]340-the guard mind what it is ! ”[340-the guard] [the guard]340-the guard retorted . “ What are [you]340-the guard ? ”[449-a man] “ _ Is _ that the Dover mail ? ”[449-a man] “ Why do [you]340-the guard want to know ? ”[449-a man] “ [I]449-a man want [a passenger]4851-a passenger , if it is . ”[449-a man] “ [What passenger]4852-what passenger ? ”[449-a man] “ [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry . ”[451-our] [[Our]451-our booked passenger]452-our booked passenger showed in a moment that it was [his]452-our booked passenger name . [The guard]340-the guard , [the coachman]414-the coachman , and [the two other passengers]433-the two other passengers eyed [him]452-our booked passenger distrustfully . “ Keep where [you]386-the passenger are , ”[340-the guard] [the guard]340-the guard called to [the voice in the mist]457-the voice in the mist , “ because , if [I]340-the guard should make a mistake , it could never be set right in [your]386-the passenger lifetime . [Gentleman of the name of [Lorry]133-mr. lorry]4853-gentleman of the name of lorry answer straight . ”[340-the guard] “ What is the matter ? ”[386-the passenger] asked [the passenger]386-the passenger , then , with mildly quavering speech . “ Who wants [me]340-the guard ? [The rider]467-the rider ’s horse was blown , and both horse and [rider]465-rider were covered with mud , from the hoofs of the horse to the hat of [the man]472-the man . “ [Guard]379-guard ! ”[386-the passenger] said [the passenger]386-the passenger , in a tone of quiet business confidence . [The watchful guard]474-the watchful guard , with [his]474-the watchful guard right hand at the stock of [his]474-the watchful guard raised blunderbuss , [his]474-the watchful guard left at the barrel , and [his]474-the watchful guard eye on [the horseman]475-the horseman , answered curtly , “ [Sir]4862-sir . ”[474-the watchful guard] “ There is nothing to apprehend . [I]474-the watchful guard may read this ? ”[474-the watchful guard] “ If so be as [you]386-the passenger ’re quick , [sir]4862-sir . ”[474-the watchful guard] [He]474-the watchful guard opened it in the light of the coach - lamp on that side , and read -- first to [himself]474-the watchful guard and then aloud : “ ‘ Wait at [Dover]15-dover for [Mam’selle]4867-mam’selle . ’ It ’s not long , [you]386-the passenger see , [guard]379-guard . With no more definite purpose than to escape the hazard of originating any other kind of action . [The coach]376-the coach lumbered on again , with heavier wreaths of mist closing round it as it began the descent . [The guard]340-the guard soon replaced [his]340-the guard blunderbuss in [his]340-the guard arm - chest , and , having looked to the rest of [its]376-the coach contents , and having looked to the supplementary pistols that [he]340-the guard wore in [his]340-the guard belt , looked to a smaller chest beneath [his]340-the guard seat , in which there were a few [smith]480-smith ’s tools , a couple of torches , and a tinder - box . For [he]340-the guard was furnished with that completeness that if the coach - lamps had been blown and stormed out , which did occasionally happen , [he]340-the guard had only to shut [himself]340-the guard up inside , keep the flint and steel sparks well off the straw , and get a light with tolerable safety and ease ( if [he]340-the guard were lucky ) in five minutes . “ [Tom]132-tom ! ”[340-the guard] softly over the coach roof . “ [Hallo]135-hallo , [Joe]130-joe . ”[340-the guard] “ Did [you]130-joe hear the message ? ”[340-the guard] “ [I]340-the guard did , [Joe]130-joe . ”[340-the guard] “ What did [you]130-joe make of it , [Tom]132-tom ? ”[340-the guard] “ Nothing at all , [Joe]130-joe . ”[340-the guard] “ That ’s a coincidence , too , ”[340-the guard] [the guard]340-the guard mused , “ for [I]340-the guard made the same of it [myself]340-the guard . ”[340-the guard] [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , left alone in the mist and darkness , dismounted meanwhile , not only to ease [his]133-mr. lorry spent horse , but to wipe the mud from [his]133-mr. lorry face , and shake the wet out of [his]133-mr. lorry hat - brim , which might be capable of holding about half a gallon . After standing with the bridle over [his]133-mr. lorry heavily - splashed arm , until the wheels of the mail were no longer within hearing and the night was quite still again , [he]133-mr. lorry turned to walk down [the hill]375-the hill . “ After that there gallop from [Temple Bar]18-temple bar , [old lady]4869-old lady , [I]483-this hoarse messenger wo n’t trust [your]133-mr. lorry fore - legs till [I]483-this hoarse messenger get [you]133-mr. lorry on the level , ”[483-this hoarse messenger] said [this hoarse messenger]483-this hoarse messenger , glancing at [his]483-this hoarse messenger mare . “ ‘ Recalled to life . ’ That ’s a Blazing strange message . Much of that would n’t do for [you]133-mr. lorry , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry ! [I]483-this hoarse messenger say , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry ! [You]133-mr. lorry ’d be in a Blazing bad way , if recalling to life was to come into fashion , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry ! ”[483-this hoarse messenger] CHAPTER III . The Night Shadows A wonderful fact to reflect upon , that [every human creature]484-every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other . A solemn consideration , when [I]0-i enter [a great city]485-a great city by night , that [every one of [those darkly clustered houses]487-those darkly clustered houses]486-every one of those darkly clustered houses encloses [its]486-every one of those darkly clustered houses own secret ; that [every room in every one of [them]487-those darkly clustered houses]488-every room in every one of them encloses its own secret ; that every beating heart in the hundreds of thousands of breasts there , is , in some of its imaginings , a secret to the heart nearest it ! Something of the awfulness , even of Death itself , is referable to this . No more can [I]0-i turn the leaves of this dear book that [I]0-i loved , and vainly hope in time to read it all . No more can [I]0-i look into the depths of [this unfathomable water]489-this unfathomable water , wherein , as momentary lights glanced into it , [I]0-i have had glimpses of buried treasure and other things submerged . It was appointed that the book should shut with a spring , for ever and for ever , when [I]0-i had read but a page . It was appointed that [the water]490-the water should be locked in an eternal frost , when the light was playing on [its]490-the water surface , and [I]0-i stood in ignorance on [the shore]491-the shore . [[My]0-i friend]492-my friend is dead , [[my]0-i neighbour]493-my neighbour is dead , [[my]0-i love]494-my love , [the darling of [my]0-i soul]495-the darling of my soul , is dead ; it is the inexorable consolidation and perpetuation of the secret that was always in that individuality , and which [I]0-i shall carry in [mine]0-i to [my]0-i life ’s end . In [any of the burial - places of [this city]497-this city through which [I]0-i pass]496-any of the burial - places of this city through which i pass , is there [a sleeper more inscrutable than [[its]497-this city busy inhabitants]499-its busy inhabitants are , in [their]499-its busy inhabitants innermost personality , to [me]0-i , or than [I]0-i am to [them]499-its busy inhabitants]498-a sleeper more inscrutable than its busy inhabitants are , in their innermost personality , to me , or than i am to them ? As to this , [his]500-his natural and not to be alienated inheritance , [the messenger on horseback]501-the messenger on horseback had exactly the same possessions as [the King]4850-the king , [the first Minister of State]503-the first minister of state , or [the richest merchant in [London]3-london]504-the richest merchant in london . So with [the three passengers]505-the three passengers shut up in [the narrow compass of [one lumbering old mail coach]507-one lumbering old mail coach]506-the narrow compass of one lumbering old mail coach ; [they]505-the three passengers were mysteries to [one another]411-one another , as complete as if [each]509-each had been in [[his]500-his own coach]510-his own coach and six , or [[his]500-his own coach]510-his own coach and sixty , with the breadth of [a county]512-a county between [him]500-his and the next . [The messenger]513-the messenger rode back at an easy trot , stopping pretty often at [ale - houses]514-ale - houses by the way to drink , but evincing a tendency to keep [his]500-his own counsel , and to keep [his]500-his hat cocked over [his]500-his eyes . [He]513-the messenger had eyes that assorted very well with that decoration , being of a surface black , with no depth in the colour or form , and much too near together -- as if [they]505-the three passengers were afraid of being found out in something , singly , if [they]505-the three passengers kept too far apart . [They]505-the three passengers had a sinister expression , under an old cocked - hat like a three - cornered spittoon , and over a great muffler for the chin and throat , which descended nearly to [the wearer]515-the wearer ’s knees . When [he]513-the messenger stopped for drink , [he]513-the messenger moved this muffler with [his]513-the messenger left hand , only while [he]513-the messenger poured [his]513-the messenger liquor in with [his]513-the messenger right ; as soon as that was done , [he]513-the messenger muffled again . “ No , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , no ! ”[513-the messenger] said [the messenger]513-the messenger , harping on one theme as [he]513-the messenger rode . “ It would n’t do for [you]133-mr. lorry , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , [[you]133-mr. lorry honest tradesman]4870-you honest tradesman , it would n’t suit _ [your]133-mr. lorry _ line of business ! [Recalled--]4871-recalled-- ! Bust [me]513-the messenger if [I]513-the messenger do n’t think [he]513-the messenger ’d been [a drinking]4872-a drinking ! ”[513-the messenger] [His]513-the messenger message perplexed [his]513-the messenger mind to that degree that [he]513-the messenger was fain , several times , to take off [his]513-the messenger hat to scratch [his]513-the messenger head . Except on the crown , which was raggedly bald , [he]513-the messenger had stiff , black hair , standing jaggedly all over it , and growing down hill almost to [his]513-the messenger broad , blunt nose . It was so like [Smith]136-smith ’s work , so much more like the top of a strongly spiked wall than a head of hair , that the best of [players at leap - frog]517-players at leap - frog might have declined [him]513-the messenger , as [the most dangerous man in [the world]519-the world to go over]518-the most dangerous man in the world to go over . While [he]513-the messenger trotted back with the message [he]513-the messenger was to deliver to [the night watchman]520-the night watchman in [his]513-the messenger box at the door of [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s Bank]19-tellson ’s bank , by [Temple Bar]18-temple bar , who was to deliver it to [greater authorities within , the shadows of the night]521-greater authorities within , the shadows of the night took such shapes to [him]513-the messenger as arose out of the message , and took such shapes to the mare as arose out of _ [her]522-her _ private topics of uneasiness . [They]523-they seemed to be numerous , for [she]522-her shied at every shadow on [the road]377-the road . What time , [the mail - coach]525-the mail - coach lumbered , jolted , rattled , and bumped upon its tedious way , with its three fellow - inscrutables inside . To whom , likewise , the shadows of the night revealed themselves , in the forms [their]523-they dozing eyes and wandering thoughts suggested . [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s Bank]4863-tellson ’s bank had a run upon [it]4863-tellson ’s bank in the mail . As [the bank passenger]527-the bank passenger -- with an arm drawn through the leathern strap , which did what lay in it to keep [him]513-the messenger from pounding against [the next passenger]528-the next passenger , and driving [him]513-the messenger into [his]513-the messenger corner , whenever [the coach]376-the coach got a special jolt -- nodded in [his]513-the messenger place , with half - shut eyes , the little coach - windows , and the coach - lamp dimly gleaming through them , and the bulky bundle of [opposite passenger]530-opposite passenger , became [the bank]531-the bank , and did a great stroke of business . The rattle of the harness was the chink of money , and more drafts were honoured in five minutes than even [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , with all [its]4863-tellson ’s bank foreign and home connection , ever paid in thrice the time . Then [the strong - rooms underground]532-the strong - rooms underground , at [Tellson ’s]134-tellson , with such of [their]532-the strong - rooms underground valuable stores and secrets as were known to [the passenger]386-the passenger ( and it was not a little that [he]513-the messenger knew about them ) , opened before [him]513-the messenger , and [he]513-the messenger went in among [them]532-the strong - rooms underground with the great keys and the feebly - burning candle , and found them safe , and strong , and sound , and still , just as [he]513-the messenger had last seen [them]532-the strong - rooms underground . But , though [the bank]531-the bank was almost always with [him]513-the messenger , and though [the coach]376-the coach ( in a confused way , like the presence of pain under an opiate ) was always with [him]513-the messenger , there was another current of impression that never ceased to run , all through the night . [He]513-the messenger was on [his]513-the messenger way to dig some one out of [a grave]536-a grave . Now , which of the multitude of faces that showed [themselves]532-the strong - rooms underground before [him]513-the messenger was the true face of [the buried person]537-the buried person , the shadows of the night did not indicate ; but they were all the faces of [a man of five - and - forty by years]538-a man of five - and - forty by years , and [they]532-the strong - rooms underground differed principally in the passions [they]532-the strong - rooms underground expressed , and in the ghastliness of [their]532-the strong - rooms underground worn and wasted state . Pride , contempt , defiance , stubbornness , submission , lamentation , succeeded one another ; so did varieties of sunken cheek , cadaverous colour , emaciated hands and figures . But the face was in the main one face , and every head was prematurely white . A hundred times [the dozing passenger]539-the dozing passenger inquired of [this spectre]540-this spectre : “ Buried how long ? ”[539-the dozing passenger] The answer was always the same : “ Almost eighteen years . ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ [You]513-the messenger had abandoned all hope of being dug out ? ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ Long ago . ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ [You]513-the messenger know that [you]513-the messenger are recalled to life ? ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ [They]532-the strong - rooms underground tell [me]539-the dozing passenger so . ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ [I]539-the dozing passenger hope [you]513-the messenger care to live ? ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ [I]539-the dozing passenger ca n’t say . ”[539-the dozing passenger] “ Shall [I]539-the dozing passenger show [her]537-the buried person to [you]513-the messenger ? Will [you]513-the messenger come and see [her]537-the buried person ? ”[539-the dozing passenger] The answers to this question were various and contradictory . Sometimes the broken reply was , “ Wait ! It would kill [me]539-the dozing passenger if [I]539-the dozing passenger saw [her]537-the buried person too soon . ”[539-the dozing passenger] Sometimes , it was given in a tender rain of tears , and then it was , “ Take [me]539-the dozing passenger to [her]537-the buried person . ”[539-the dozing passenger] Sometimes it was staring and bewildered , and then it was , “ [I]539-the dozing passenger do n’t know [her]537-the buried person . [I]539-the dozing passenger do n’t understand . ”[539-the dozing passenger] After such imaginary discourse , [the passenger in [his]541-the passenger in his fancy fancy]541-the passenger in his fancy would dig , and dig , dig -- now with a spade , now with a great key , now with [his]541-the passenger in his fancy hands -- to dig [this wretched creature]542-this wretched creature out . Got out at last , with earth hanging about [his]541-the passenger in his fancy face and hair , [he]541-the passenger in his fancy would suddenly fan away to dust . [The passenger]386-the passenger would then start to [himself]541-the passenger in his fancy , and lower the window , to get the reality of mist and rain on [his]541-the passenger in his fancy cheek . Yet even when [his]541-the passenger in his fancy eyes were opened on the mist and rain , on the moving patch of light from the lamps , and the hedge at the roadside retreating by jerks , the night shadows outside [the coach]376-the coach would fall into the train of the night shadows within . [The real Banking - house]545-the real banking - house by [Temple Bar]18-temple bar , the real business of the past day , [the real strong rooms]546-the real strong rooms , the real express sent after [him]541-the passenger in his fancy , and the real message returned , would all be there . Out of the midst of [them]547-them , the ghostly face would rise , and [he]541-the passenger in his fancy would accost it again . “ Buried how long ? ”[541-the passenger in his fancy] “ Almost eighteen years . ”[541-the passenger in his fancy] “ [I]541-the passenger in his fancy hope [you]541-the passenger in his fancy care to live ? ”[541-the passenger in his fancy] “ [I]541-the passenger in his fancy ca n’t say . ”[541-the passenger in his fancy] Dig -- dig -- dig -- until an impatient movement from [one of [the two passengers]549-the two passengers]548-one of the two passengers would admonish [him]541-the passenger in his fancy to pull up the window , draw [his]541-the passenger in his fancy arm securely through the leathern strap , and speculate upon the two slumbering forms , until [his]541-the passenger in his fancy mind lost its hold of them , and [they]547-them again slid away into [the bank]531-the bank and the grave . “ Buried how long ? ”[549-the two passengers] “ Almost eighteen years . ”[549-the two passengers] “ [You]541-the passenger in his fancy had abandoned all hope of being dug out ? ”[549-the two passengers] “ Long ago . ”[549-the two passengers] The words were still in [his]541-the passenger in his fancy hearing as just spoken -- distinctly in [his]541-the passenger in his fancy hearing as ever spoken words had been in [his]541-the passenger in his fancy life -- when [the weary passenger]551-the weary passenger started to the consciousness of daylight , and found that the shadows of the night were gone . [He]541-the passenger in his fancy lowered the window , and looked out at the rising sun . There was [a ridge of ploughed land]552-a ridge of ploughed land , with a plough upon [it]552-a ridge of ploughed land where [it]552-a ridge of ploughed land had been left last night when the horses were unyoked ; beyond , a quiet coppice - wood , in which many leaves of burning red and golden yellow still remained upon the trees . Though the earth was cold and wet , the sky was clear , and the sun rose bright , placid , and beautiful . “ Eighteen years ! ”[386-the passenger] said [the passenger]386-the passenger , looking at the sun . “ [Gracious Creator of day]4873-gracious creator of day ! To be buried alive for eighteen years ! ”[386-the passenger] CHAPTER IV . The Preparation When the mail got successfully to [Dover]15-dover , in the course of the forenoon , [the head drawer at [the Royal George Hotel]555-the royal george hotel]554-the head drawer at the royal george hotel opened the coach - door as [his]541-the passenger in his fancy custom was . [He]541-the passenger in his fancy did it with some flourish of ceremony , for a mail journey from [London]3-london in winter was an achievement to congratulate [an adventurous traveller]556-an adventurous traveller upon . By that time , there was [only one adventurous traveller]557-only one adventurous traveller left be congratulated : for [the two others]558-the two others had been set down at [[their]558-the two others respective roadside destinations]559-their respective roadside destinations . The mildewy inside of [the coach]376-the coach , with its damp and dirty straw , its disagreeable smell , and its obscurity , was rather like a larger dog - kennel . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , [the passenger]386-the passenger , shaking [himself]133-mr. lorry out of it in chains of straw , a tangle of shaggy wrapper , flapping hat , and muddy legs , was rather like a larger sort of dog . “ There will be a packet to [Calais]21-calais , tomorrow , [drawer]4874-drawer ? ”[386-the passenger] “ Yes , [sir]4862-sir , if the weather holds and the wind sets tolerable fair . The tide will serve pretty nicely at about two in the afternoon , [sir]4862-sir . Bed , [sir]4862-sir ? ”[386-the passenger] “ [I]386-the passenger shall not go to bed till night ; but [I]386-the passenger want [a bedroom]4878-a bedroom , and [a barber]4879-a barber . ”[386-the passenger] “ And then breakfast , [sir]4862-sir ? Yes , [sir]4862-sir . That way , [sir]4862-sir , if [you]4862-sir please . Show [Concord]22-concord ! [Gentleman]4883-gentleman ’s valise and hot water to [Concord]22-concord . Pull off [gentleman]4883-gentleman ’s boots in [Concord]22-concord . ( [You]4862-sir will find a fine sea - coal fire , [sir]4862-sir . ) [Fetch barber]4886-fetch barber to [Concord]22-concord . Stir about [there]4887-there , now , for [Concord]22-concord ! ”[386-the passenger] [The Concord bed - chamber]562-the concord bed - chamber being always assigned to [a passenger]4851-a passenger by the mail , and [passengers by the mail]564-passengers by the mail being always heavily wrapped up from head to foot , [the room]565-the room had the odd interest for the establishment of [the Royal George]566-the royal george , that although but [one kind of man]567-one kind of man was seen to go into [it]565-the room , all kinds and varieties of [men]568-men came out of it . Consequently , [another drawer]569-another drawer , and [two porters]570-two porters , and [several maids]571-several maids and [the landlady]572-the landlady , were all loitering by accident at various points of [the road]377-the road between [the Concord]574-the concord and [the coffee - room]575-the coffee - room , when [a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets , passed along on [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets way to [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets breakfast . [The coffee - room]575-the coffee - room had [no other occupant , that forenoon]578-no other occupant , that forenoon , than [the gentleman in brown]579-the gentleman in brown . [His]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets breakfast - table was drawn before the fire , and as [he]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets sat , with its light shining on [him]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets , waiting for the meal , [he]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets sat so still , that [he]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets might have been sitting for [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets portrait . Very orderly and methodical [he]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets looked , with a hand on each knee , and a loud watch ticking a sonorous sermon under [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets flapped waist - coat , as though it pitted its gravity and longevity against the levity and evanescence of the brisk fire . [He]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets had a good leg , and was a little vain of it , for [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets brown stockings fitted sleek and close , and were of a fine texture ; [his]576-a gentleman of sixty , formally dressed in a brown suit of clothes , pretty well worn , but very well kept , with large square cuffs and large flaps to the pockets shoes and buckles , too , though plain , were trim . When [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry had finished [his]133-mr. lorry breakfast , [he]133-mr. lorry went out for a stroll on [the beach]594-the beach . [The little narrow , crooked town of [Dover]15-dover]595-the little narrow , crooked town of dover hid [itself]595-the little narrow , crooked town of dover away from [the beach]594-the beach , and ran its head into [the chalk cliffs]597-the chalk cliffs , like a marine ostrich . [The beach]594-the beach was a desert of heaps of sea and stones tumbling wildly about , and [the sea]599-the sea did what it liked , and what it liked was destruction . It thundered at [the town]600-the town , and thundered at [the cliffs]601-the cliffs , and brought [the coast]602-the coast down , madly . The air among [the houses]603-the houses was of so strong a piscatory flavour that one might have supposed sick fish went up to be dipped in it , as [sick people]604-sick people went down to be dipped in [the sea]599-the sea . A little fishing was done in [the port]606-the port , and a quantity of strolling about by night , and looking seaward : particularly at those times when the tide made , and was near flood . [Small tradesmen]607-small tradesmen , who did no business whatever , sometimes unaccountably realised large fortunes , and it was remarkable that [nobody in [the neighbourhood]609-the neighbourhood]608-nobody in the neighbourhood could endure a lamplighter . As the day declined into the afternoon , and the air , which had been at intervals clear enough to allow [the French coast]610-the french coast to be seen , became again charged with mist and vapour , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s thoughts seemed to cloud too . When it was dark , and [he]133-mr. lorry sat before the coffee - room fire , awaiting [his]133-mr. lorry dinner as [he]133-mr. lorry had awaited [his]133-mr. lorry breakfast , [his]133-mr. lorry mind was busily digging , digging , digging , in the live red coals . A bottle of good claret after dinner does [a digger in the red coals]611-a digger in the red coals no harm , otherwise than as it has a tendency to throw [him]611-a digger in the red coals out of work . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry had been idle a long time , and had just poured out [his]133-mr. lorry last glassful of wine with as complete an appearance of satisfaction as is ever to be found in [an elderly gentleman of a fresh complexion who has got to the end of a bottle , when a rattling of wheels]612-an elderly gentleman of a fresh complexion who has got to the end of a bottle , when a rattling of wheels came up [the narrow street]613-the narrow street , and rumbled into [the inn - yard]614-the inn - yard . [He]133-mr. lorry set down [his]133-mr. lorry glass untouched . “ This is [Mam’selle]139-mam’selle ! ”[133-mr. lorry] said [he]133-mr. lorry . [The gentleman from [Tellson ’s]134-tellson]616-the gentleman from tellson ’s had nothing left for it but to empty [his]616-the gentleman from tellson ’s glass with an air of stolid desperation , settle [his]616-the gentleman from tellson ’s odd little flaxen wig at the ears , and follow [the waiter]590-the waiter to [[Miss Manette]140-miss manette ’s apartment]621-miss manette ’s apartment . [It]621-miss manette ’s apartment was [a large , dark room]622-a large , dark room , furnished in a funereal manner with black horsehair , and loaded with heavy dark tables . These had been oiled and oiled , until the two tall candles on the table in the middle of [the room]565-the room were gloomily reflected on every leaf ; as if _ [they]624-they _ were buried , in deep graves of black mahogany , and no light to speak of could be expected from [them]624-they until they were dug out . The obscurity was so difficult to penetrate that [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , picking [his]133-mr. lorry way over the well - worn Turkey carpet , supposed [Miss Manette]140-miss manette to be , for the moment , in [some adjacent room]625-some adjacent room , until , having got past the two tall candles , [he]133-mr. lorry saw standing to receive [him]133-mr. lorry by the table between [them]626-them and the fire , [a young lady of not more than seventeen]627-a young lady of not more than seventeen , in a riding - cloak , and still holding [her]627-a young lady of not more than seventeen straw travelling - hat by its ribbon in [her]627-a young lady of not more than seventeen hand . As [his]133-mr. lorry eyes rested on [a short , slight , pretty figure , a quantity of golden hair]628-a short , slight , pretty figure , a quantity of golden hair , a pair of blue eyes that met [his]133-mr. lorry own with an inquiring look , and a forehead with a singular capacity ( remembering how young and smooth it was ) , of rifting and knitting itself into an expression that was not quite one of perplexity , or wonder , or alarm , or merely of a bright fixed attention , though it included all the four expressions -- as [his]133-mr. lorry eyes rested on these things , a sudden vivid likeness passed before [him]133-mr. lorry , of [a child whom [he]133-mr. lorry had held in [his]133-mr. lorry arms on the passage across [that very Channel]630-that very channel]629-a child whom he had held in his arms on the passage across that very channel , one cold time , when the hail drifted heavily and [the sea]599-the sea ran high . No ; [you]140-miss manette have been [the ward of [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s House]4976-tellson ’s house]4975-the ward of tellson ’s house since , and [I]642-the young lady have been busy with the other business of [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s House]4976-tellson ’s house since . [I]642-the young lady pass [my]642-the young lady whole life , [miss]4912-miss , in turning [an immense pecuniary Mangle]4979-an immense pecuniary mangle . ”[642-the young lady] After this odd description of [his]643-i daily routine of employment , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry flattened [his]643-i flaxen wig upon [his]643-i head with both hands ( which was most unnecessary , for nothing could be flatter than its shining surface was before ) , and resumed [his]643-i former attitude . “ So far , [miss]4912-miss ( as [you]4912-miss have remarked ) , this is the story of [[your]4912-miss regretted father]4981-your regretted father . Now comes the difference . If [[your]4912-miss father]4947-your father had not died when [he]4947-your father did -- Don’t be frightened ! How [you]133-mr. lorry start ! ”[644-she] [She]644-she did , indeed , start . And [she]644-she caught [his]643-i wrist with both [her]644-she hands . “ Pray , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , in a soothing tone , bringing [his]643-i left hand from the back of the chair to lay it on the supplicatory fingers that clasped [him]643-i in so violent a tremble : “ pray control [your]4912-miss agitation -- a matter of business . That ’s good ! ”[645-his] ( Though [his]645-his manner was less satisfied than [his]645-his words . ) “ A matter of business . Regard it as a matter of business -- business that must be done . [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , [[your]4862-sir mother]5011-your mother took this course with [you]4862-sir . And when [she]5011-your mother died -- [I]646-she believe broken - hearted -- having never slackened [her]5011-your mother unavailing search for [[your]4862-sir father]4947-your father , [she]5011-your mother left [you]4862-sir , at two years old , to grow to be blooming , beautiful , and happy , without the dark cloud upon [you]4862-sir of living in uncertainty whether [[your]4862-sir father]4947-your father soon wore [his]4947-your father heart out in [prison]5014-prison , or wasted there through many lingering years . ”[646-she] As [he]133-mr. lorry said the words [he]133-mr. lorry looked down , with an admiring pity , on the flowing golden hair ; as if [he]133-mr. lorry pictured to [himself]133-mr. lorry that it might have been already tinged with grey . “ [You]4862-sir know that [[your]4862-sir parents]5015-your parents had no great possession , and that what [they]5015-your parents had was secured to [[your]4862-sir mother]5011-your mother and to [you]4862-sir . There has been no new discovery , of money , or of any other property ; but-- ”[133-mr. lorry] [He]133-mr. lorry felt [his]133-mr. lorry wrist held closer , and [he]133-mr. lorry stopped . The expression in the forehead , which had so particularly attracted [his]133-mr. lorry notice , and which was now immovable , had deepened into one of pain and horror . “ But [he]4947-your father has been -- been found . [He]4947-your father is alive . Greatly changed , it is too probable ; almost a wreck , it is possible ; though [we]5017-we will hope the best . Still , alive . [[Your]4862-sir father]4947-your father has been taken to [the house of [an old servant in [Paris]7-paris]5020-an old servant in paris]5019-the house of an old servant in paris , and [we]5017-we are going [there]4887-there : [I]648-her , to identify [him]4947-your father if [I]648-her can : [you]4862-sir , to restore [him]4947-your father to life , love , duty , rest , comfort . ”[648-her] A shiver ran through [her]648-her frame , and from it through [his]133-mr. lorry . [She]648-her said , in a low , distinct , awe - stricken voice , as if [she]648-her were saying it in a dream , “ [I]648-her am going to see [[his]4947-your father Ghost]5022-his ghost ! It will be [[his]4947-your father Ghost]5022-his ghost -- not [him]4947-your father ! ”[648-her] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry quietly chafed the hands that held [his]133-mr. lorry arm . “ There , there , there ! See now , see now ! The best and the worst are known to [you]4862-sir , now . [You]4862-sir are well on [your]4862-sir way to [the poor wronged gentleman]5024-the poor wronged gentleman , and , with a fair sea voyage , and a fair land journey , [you]4862-sir will be soon at [his]4947-your father dear side . ”[648-her] [She]648-her repeated in the same tone , sunk to a whisper , “ [I]648-her have been free , [I]648-her have been happy , yet [[his]4947-your father Ghost]5022-his ghost has never haunted [me]648-her ! ”[648-her] “ Only one thing more , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , laying stress upon it as a wholesome means of enforcing [her]648-her attention : “ [he]4947-your father has been found under another name ; [his]4947-your father own , long forgotten or long concealed . It would be worse than useless now to inquire which ; worse than useless to seek to know whether [he]4947-your father has been for years overlooked , or always designedly held prisoner . It would be worse than useless now to make any inquiries , because it would be dangerous . Better not to mention the subject , anywhere or in any way , and to remove [him]4947-your father -- for a while at all events -- out of [France]2-france . Even [I]133-mr. lorry , safe as [an Englishman]5026-an englishman , and even [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , important as [they]5027-they are to [French]26-french credit , avoid all naming of the matter . [Miss Manette]140-miss manette ! ”[133-mr. lorry] Perfectly still and silent , and not even fallen back in [her]648-her chair , [she]648-her sat under [his]133-mr. lorry hand , utterly insensible ; with [her]648-her eyes open and fixed upon [him]133-mr. lorry , and with that last expression looking as if it were carved or branded into [her]648-her forehead . So close was [her]648-her hold upon [his]133-mr. lorry arm , that [he]133-mr. lorry feared to detach [himself]133-mr. lorry lest [he]133-mr. lorry should hurt [her]648-her ; therefore [he]133-mr. lorry called out loudly for assistance without moving . [A wild - looking woman , whom even in [his]133-mr. lorry agitation]649-a wild - looking woman , whom even in his agitation , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry observed to be all of a red colour , and to have red hair , and to be dressed in some extraordinary tight - fitting fashion , and to have on [her]649-a wild - looking woman , whom even in his agitation head a most wonderful bonnet like [a Grenadier wooden measure , and good measure too , or a great Stilton cheese]650-a grenadier wooden measure , and good measure too , or a great stilton cheese , came running into [the room]565-the room in advance of [the inn servants]652-the inn servants , and soon settled the question of [his]133-mr. lorry detachment from [the poor young lady]653-the poor young lady , by laying a brawny hand upon [his]133-mr. lorry chest , and sending [him]133-mr. lorry flying back against the nearest wall . ( “ [I]133-mr. lorry really think this must be [a man]449-a man ! ”[133-mr. lorry] was [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s breathless reflection , simultaneously with [his]133-mr. lorry coming against the wall . ) “ Why , look at [you]652-the inn servants all ! ”[654-this figure] bawled [this figure]654-this figure , addressing [the inn servants]652-the inn servants . “ Why do n’t [you]652-the inn servants go and fetch things , instead of standing there staring at [me]654-this figure ? Do [you]133-mr. lorry call _ that _ being [a Banker]5030-a banker ? ”[653-the poor young lady] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry was so exceedingly disconcerted by a question so hard to answer , that [he]133-mr. lorry could only look on , at a distance , with much feebler sympathy and humility , while [the strong woman]657-the strong woman , having banished [the inn servants]652-the inn servants under the mysterious penalty of “ letting [them]652-the inn servants know ”[657-the strong woman] something not mentioned if [they]652-the inn servants stayed [there]4887-there , staring , recovered [her]657-the strong woman charge by a regular series of gradations , and coaxed [her]657-the strong woman to lay [her]657-the strong woman drooping head upon [her]657-the strong woman shoulder . “ [I]133-mr. lorry hope [she]653-the poor young lady will do well now , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ No thanks to [you]657-the strong woman in brown , if [she]653-the poor young lady does . [[My]133-mr. lorry darling pretty]5031-my darling pretty ! ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry hope , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , after another pause of feeble sympathy and humility , “ that [you]657-the strong woman accompany [Miss Manette]140-miss manette to [France]2-france ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ A likely thing , too ! ”[657-the strong woman] replied [the strong woman]657-the strong woman . “ If it was ever intended that [I]657-the strong woman should go across [salt water]5032-salt water , do [you]133-mr. lorry suppose [Providence]143-providence would have cast [my]657-the strong woman lot in [an island]5033-an island ? ”[657-the strong woman] This being another question hard to answer , [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry withdrew to consider it . CHAPTER V. [The Wine - shop]661-the wine - shop A large cask of wine had been dropped and broken , in [the street]662-the street . The accident had happened in getting it out of [a cart]663-a cart ; the cask had tumbled out with a run , the hoops had burst , and it lay on the stones just outside the door of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop , shattered like a walnut - shell . All [the people within reach]665-the people within reach had suspended [their]665-the people within reach business , or [their]665-the people within reach idleness , to run to the spot and drink the wine . The rough , irregular stones of [the street]662-the street , pointing every way , and designed , [one]4965-one might have thought , expressly to lame all living creatures that approached [them]668-them , had dammed it into little pools ; these were surrounded , each by its own jostling group or crowd , according to [its]669-its size . [Some men]670-some men kneeled down , made scoops of [their]670-some men two hands joined , and sipped , or tried to help [women]671-women , who bent over [their]671-women shoulders , to sip , before the wine had all run out between [their]671-women fingers . [Others]672-others , [men]568-men and [women]671-women , dipped in the puddles with little mugs of mutilated earthenware , or even with handkerchiefs from [women]671-women ’s heads , which were squeezed dry into [infants]676-infants ’ mouths ; others made small mud - embankments , to stem the wine as it ran ; others , directed by [lookers - on up at high windows]677-lookers - on up at high windows , darted here and there , to cut off little streams of wine that started away in new directions ; [others]672-others devoted [themselves]672-others to the sodden and lee - dyed pieces of the cask , licking , and even champing the moister wine - rotted fragments with eager relish . There was no drainage to carry off the wine , and not only did it all get taken up , but so much mud got taken up along with it , that there might have been a scavenger in [the street]662-the street , if [anybody acquainted with it]680-anybody acquainted with it could have believed in such a miraculous presence . A shrill sound of laughter and of amused voices -- voices of [men]568-men , [women]671-women , and [children]683-children -- resounded in [the street]662-the street while this wine game lasted . There was little roughness in the sport , and much playfulness . There was a special companionship in it , an observable inclination on the part of [every one]685-every one to join some other one , which led , especially among [the luckier or lighter - hearted]686-the luckier or lighter - hearted , to frolicsome embraces , drinking of healths , shaking of hands , and even joining of hands and dancing , a dozen together . When the wine was gone , and the places where it had been most abundant were raked into a gridiron - pattern by fingers , these demonstrations ceased , as suddenly as they had broken out . [The man who had left [his]687-the man who had left his saw sticking in the firewood he was cutting saw sticking in the firewood [he]687-the man who had left his saw sticking in the firewood he was cutting was cutting]687-the man who had left his saw sticking in the firewood he was cutting , set it in motion again ; [the women who had left on a door - step the little pot of hot ashes , at which [she]671-women had been trying to soften the pain in [her]671-women own starved fingers and toes , or in those of [[her]671-women child]689-her child]688-the women who had left on a door - step the little pot of hot ashes , at which she had been trying to soften the pain in her own starved fingers and toes , or in those of her child , returned to it ; [men with bare arms , matted locks , and cadaverous faces , who had emerged into the winter light from cellars]690-men with bare arms , matted locks , and cadaverous faces , who had emerged into the winter light from cellars , moved away , to descend again ; and a gloom gathered on the scene that appeared more natural to it than sunshine . The wine was red wine , and had stained the ground of [the narrow street in [the suburb of [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine]692-the suburb of saint antoine]691-the narrow street in the suburb of saint antoine , in [Paris]7-paris , where it was spilled . It had stained many hands , too , and many faces , and many naked feet , and many wooden shoes . The hands of [the man who sawed the wood]693-the man who sawed the wood , left red marks on the billets ; and the forehead of [the woman who nursed [her]671-women baby]694-the woman who nursed her baby , was stained with the stain of the old rag [she]671-women wound about [her]671-women head again . [Those who had been greedy with the staves of the cask]695-those who had been greedy with the staves of the cask , had acquired a tigerish smear about the mouth ; and [one tall joker so besmirched]696-one tall joker so besmirched , [his]696-one tall joker so besmirched head more out of a long squalid bag of a nightcap than in it , scrawled upon a wall with [his]696-one tall joker so besmirched finger dipped in muddy wine - lees -- BLOOD . The time was to come , when that wine too would be spilled on the street - stones , and when the stain of it would be red upon many there . And now that the cloud settled on [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine , which a momentary gleam had driven from [his]144-saint antoine sacred countenance , the darkness of [it]697-it was heavy -- cold , dirt , sickness , ignorance , and want , were [the lords in waiting on the saintly presence]698-the lords in waiting on the saintly presence -- nobles of great power [all of [them]699-all of them]699-all of them ; but , most especially [the last]700-the last . Samples of [a people that had undergone a terrible grinding and regrinding in the mill]701-a people that had undergone a terrible grinding and regrinding in the mill , and certainly not in [the fabulous mill which [ground old people young]703-ground old people young]702-the fabulous mill which ground old people young , shivered at every corner , passed in and out at every doorway , looked from every window , fluttered in every vestige of a garment that the wind shook . [The mill which had worked [them]701-a people that had undergone a terrible grinding and regrinding in the mill down]704-the mill which had worked them down , was [the mill that grinds [young people old]706-young people old]705-the mill that grinds young people old ; [the children]707-the children had ancient faces and grave voices ; and upon [them]707-the children , and upon the grown faces , and ploughed into every furrow of age and coming up afresh , was the sigh , Hunger . It was prevalent everywhere . Hunger was pushed out of [the tall houses]708-the tall houses , in the wretched clothing that hung upon poles and lines ; Hunger was patched into them with straw and rag and wood and paper ; Hunger was repeated in every fragment of the small modicum of firewood that [the man]472-the man sawed off ; Hunger stared down from the smokeless chimneys , and started up from [the filthy street]710-the filthy street that had no offal , among [its]710-the filthy street refuse , of anything to eat . Hunger was the inscription on [the baker]711-the baker ’s shelves , written in every small loaf of [his]711-the baker scanty stock of bad bread ; at [the sausage - shop]712-the sausage - shop , in every dead - dog preparation that was offered for sale . [Hunger]145-hunger rattled its dry bones among the roasting chestnuts in [the turned cylinder]713-the turned cylinder ; [Hunger]145-hunger was shred into atomics in every farthing porringer of husky chips of potato , fried with some reluctant drops of oil . [Its]145-hunger abiding place was in all things fitted to [it]145-hunger . [A narrow winding street , full of offence and stench]714-a narrow winding street , full of offence and stench , with [other narrow winding streets]715-other narrow winding streets diverging , [all peopled by rags and nightcaps]716-all peopled by rags and nightcaps , and all smelling of rags and nightcaps , and all visible things with a brooding look upon them that looked ill . In the hunted air of [the people]717-the people there was yet some wild - beast thought of the possibility of turning at bay . Depressed and slinking though [they]717-the people were , eyes of fire were not wanting among [them]717-the people ; nor compressed lips , white with what [they]717-the people suppressed ; nor foreheads knitted into the likeness of the gallows - rope [they]717-the people mused about enduring , or inflicting . The trade signs ( and they were almost as many as [the shops]718-the shops ) were , all , grim illustrations of Want . [The butcher]719-the butcher and [the porkman]720-the porkman painted up , only the leanest scrags of meat ; [the baker]711-the baker , the coarsest of meagre loaves . [The people]717-the people rudely pictured as drinking in [the wine - shops]723-the wine - shops , croaked over [their]717-the people scanty measures of thin wine and beer , and were gloweringly confidential together . Nothing was represented in a flourishing condition , save tools and weapons ; but , [the cutler]724-the cutler ’s knives and axes were sharp and bright , [the smith]725-the smith ’s hammers were heavy , and [the gunmaker]726-the gunmaker ’s stock was murderous . The crippling stones of [the pavement]727-the pavement , with [their]728-their many little reservoirs of mud and water , had no footways , but broke off abruptly at the doors . [The kennel]729-the kennel , to make amends , ran down the middle of [the street]662-the street -- when it ran at all : which was only after heavy rains , and then it ran , by many eccentric fits , into [the houses]603-the houses . Across [the streets]732-the streets , at wide intervals , one clumsy lamp was slung by a rope and pulley ; at night , when [the lamplighter]733-the lamplighter had let these down , and lighted , and hoisted them again , a feeble grove of dim wicks swung in a sickly manner overhead , as if [they]717-the people were at [sea]581-sea . Indeed [they]717-the people were at [sea]581-sea , and [the ship]736-the ship and [crew]737-crew were in peril of tempest . For , the time was to come , when [the gaunt scarecrows of [that region]739-that region]738-the gaunt scarecrows of that region should have watched [the lamplighter]733-the lamplighter , in [their]738-the gaunt scarecrows of that region idleness and hunger , so long , as to conceive the idea of improving on [his]733-the lamplighter method , and hauling up [men by those ropes and pulleys]741-men by those ropes and pulleys , to flare upon the darkness of [their]738-the gaunt scarecrows of that region condition . But , the time was not come yet ; and every wind that blew over [France]2-france shook the rags of [the scarecrows]742-the scarecrows in vain , for the birds , fine of song and feather , took no warning . [The wine - shop]661-the wine - shop was [a corner shop]744-a corner shop , better than most others in [its]661-the wine - shop appearance and degree , and [the master of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]745-the master of the wine - shop had stood outside [it]661-the wine - shop , in a yellow waistcoat and green breeches , looking on at the struggle for the lost wine . “ It ’s not [my]745-the master of the wine - shop affair , ”[745-the master of the wine - shop] said [he]745-the master of the wine - shop , with a final shrug of the shoulders . “ [The people from [the market]5035-the market]5034-the people from the market did it . Let [them]5034-the people from the market bring another . ”[745-the master of the wine - shop] There , [his]745-the master of the wine - shop eyes happening to catch [the tall joker]747-the tall joker writing up [his]747-the tall joker joke , [he]745-the master of the wine - shop called to [him]747-the tall joker across the way : “ Say , then , [[my]745-the master of the wine - shop Gaspard]5036-my gaspard , what do [you]747-the tall joker do there ? ”[745-the master of the wine - shop] [The fellow]748-the fellow pointed to [his]747-the tall joker joke with immense significance , as is often the way with [[his]747-the tall joker tribe]749-his tribe . It missed its mark , and completely failed , as is often the way with [[his]747-the tall joker tribe]749-his tribe too . “ What now ? Are [you]747-the tall joker a subject for [the mad hospital]5037-the mad hospital ? ”[751-the wine - shop keeper] said [the wine - shop keeper]751-the wine - shop keeper , crossing [the road]377-the road , and obliterating the jest with a handful of mud , picked up for the purpose , and smeared over it . “ Why do [you]747-the tall joker write in [the public streets]5038-the public streets ? Is there -- tell [me]751-the wine - shop keeper [thou]5039-thou -- is there no other place to write such words in ? ”[751-the wine - shop keeper] In [his]751-the wine - shop keeper expostulation [he]751-the wine - shop keeper dropped [his]751-the wine - shop keeper cleaner hand ( perhaps accidentally , perhaps not ) upon [the joker]753-the joker ’s heart . [The joker]753-the joker rapped it with [his]753-the joker own , took a nimble spring upward , and came down in a fantastic dancing attitude , with one of [his]753-the joker stained shoes jerked off [his]753-the joker foot into [his]753-the joker hand , and held out . [A joker of an extremely , not to say wolfishly practical character]755-a joker of an extremely , not to say wolfishly practical character , [he]753-the joker looked , under those circumstances . “ Put it on , put it on , ”[756-the other] said [the other]756-the other . “ Call wine , wine ; and finish there . ”[751-the wine - shop keeper] With that advice , [he]751-the wine - shop keeper wiped [his]751-the wine - shop keeper soiled hand upon [the joker]753-the joker ’s dress , such as it was -- quite deliberately , as having dirtied the hand on [his]751-the wine - shop keeper account ; and then recrossed [the road]377-the road and entered [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop . [This wine - shop keeper]760-this wine - shop keeper was [a bull - necked , martial - looking man of thirty]761-a bull - necked , martial - looking man of thirty , and [he]760-this wine - shop keeper should have been of a hot temperament , for , although it was a bitter day , [he]760-this wine - shop keeper wore no coat , but carried one slung over [his]760-this wine - shop keeper shoulder . [His]760-this wine - shop keeper shirt - sleeves were rolled up , too , and [his]760-this wine - shop keeper brown arms were bare to the elbows . Neither did [he]760-this wine - shop keeper wear anything more on [his]760-this wine - shop keeper head than [his]760-this wine - shop keeper own crisply - curling short dark hair . [He]760-this wine - shop keeper was [a dark man]762-a dark man altogether , with good eyes and a good bold breadth between them . Good - humoured looking on the whole , but implacable - looking , too ; evidently [a man of a strong resolution and a set purpose]763-a man of a strong resolution and a set purpose ; [a man not desirable to be met , rushing down a narrow pass with a gulf on either side]764-a man not desirable to be met , rushing down a narrow pass with a gulf on either side , for nothing would turn [the man]472-the man . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , [[his]760-this wine - shop keeper wife]4987-his wife , sat in [the shop behind the counter]767-the shop behind the counter as [he]760-this wine - shop keeper came in . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge was a stout woman of about [his]760-this wine - shop keeper [own age , with a watchful eye that seldom seemed to look at anything , a large hand heavily ringed , a steady face , strong features , and great composure of manner]768-own age , with a watchful eye that seldom seemed to look at anything , a large hand heavily ringed , a steady face , strong features , and great composure of manner . There was a character about [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , from which one might have predicated that [she]146-madame defarge did not often make mistakes against [herself]146-madame defarge in any of the reckonings over which [she]146-madame defarge presided . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge being sensitive to cold , was wrapped in fur , and had a quantity of bright shawl twined about [her]146-madame defarge head , though not to the concealment of [her]146-madame defarge large earrings . [Her]146-madame defarge knitting was before [her]146-madame defarge , but [she]146-madame defarge had laid it down to pick [her]146-madame defarge teeth with a toothpick . Thus engaged , with [her]146-madame defarge right elbow supported by [her]146-madame defarge left hand , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge said nothing when [[her]146-madame defarge lord]769-her lord came in , but coughed just one grain of cough . This , in combination with the lifting of [her]146-madame defarge darkly defined eyebrows over [her]146-madame defarge toothpick by the breadth of a line , suggested to [[her]146-madame defarge husband]770-her husband that [he]770-her husband would do well to look round [the shop]771-the shop among [the customers]772-the customers , for [any new customer who had dropped in while [he]770-her husband stepped over the way]773-any new customer who had dropped in while he stepped over the way . [The wine - shop keeper]751-the wine - shop keeper accordingly rolled [his]751-the wine - shop keeper eyes about , until [they]775-they rested upon [an elderly gentleman]776-an elderly gentleman and [a young lady]777-a young lady , who were seated in a corner . [Other company]778-other company were there : two playing cards , two playing dominoes , [three standing by the counter]779-three standing by the counter lengthening out a short supply of wine . As [he]770-her husband passed behind the counter , [he]770-her husband took notice that [the elderly gentleman]780-the elderly gentleman said in a look to [the young lady]642-the young lady , “ This is [[our]782-the two strangers man]5040-our man . ”[780-the elderly gentleman] “ What the devil do _ [you]782-the two strangers _ do in [that galley there]5041-that galley there ? ”[147-defarge] said [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge to [himself]147-defarge ; “ [I]147-defarge do n’t know [you]782-the two strangers . ”[147-defarge] But , [he]770-her husband feigned not to notice [the two strangers]782-the two strangers , and fell into discourse with the triumvirate of [customers who were drinking at the counter]783-customers who were drinking at the counter . “ How goes it , [Jacques]148-jacques ? ”[147-defarge] said one of these three to [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge . “ Is all the spilt wine swallowed ? ”[147-defarge] “ Every drop , [Jacques]148-jacques , ”[147-defarge] answered [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge . The eyes of [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge were studying [[his]147-defarge wife]4987-his wife at [her]4987-his wife knitting when [the elderly gentleman]780-the elderly gentleman advanced from [his]147-defarge corner , and begged the favour of a word . “ Willingly , [sir]4862-sir , ”[147-defarge] said [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge , and quietly stepped with [him]780-the elderly gentleman to the door . [Their]790-they conference was very short , but very decided . Almost at the first word , [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge started and became deeply attentive . It had not lasted a minute , when [he]147-defarge nodded and went out . [The gentleman]4926-the gentleman then beckoned to [the young lady]642-the young lady , and [they]790-they , too , went out . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge knitted with nimble fingers and steady eyebrows , and saw nothing . [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry and [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , emerging from [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop thus , joined [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge in the doorway to which [he]147-defarge had directed [[his]147-defarge own company]797-his own company just before . [It]798-it opened from [a stinking little black courtyard]799-a stinking little black courtyard , and was the general public entrance to [a great pile of [houses]801-houses , inhabited by [a great number of people]802-a great number of people]800-a great pile of houses , inhabited by a great number of people .
