It was a gentle action , but not at all gently done ; a very remarkable transformation had come over [him]147-defarge in a few seconds . [He]147-defarge had no good - humour in [his]147-defarge face , nor any openness of aspect left , but had become [a secret , angry , dangerous man]806-a secret , angry , dangerous man . “ It is very high ; it is a little difficult . [God]149-god help [him]147-defarge , who should be with [him]147-defarge ! ”[756-the other] said [the other]756-the other , in the same low voice . “ Is [he]147-defarge always alone , then ? ”[756-the other] “ Yes . ”[147-defarge] “ Of [his]147-defarge own desire ? ”[756-the other] “ Of [his]147-defarge own necessity . No direct answer could have been half so forcible . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s spirits grew heavier and heavier , as [he]133-mr. lorry and [[his]133-mr. lorry two companions]397-his two companions ascended higher and higher . Such a staircase , with [its]814-its accessories , in [the older and more crowded parts of [Paris]7-paris]815-the older and more crowded parts of paris , would be bad enough now ; but , at that time , it was vile indeed to unaccustomed and unhardened senses . [Every little habitation within [the great foul nest of one high building]817-the great foul nest of one high building]816-every little habitation within the great foul nest of one high building -- that is to say , [the room or rooms within every door that opened on [the general staircase]819-the general staircase]818-the room or rooms within every door that opened on the general staircase -- left its own heap of refuse on [its]816-every little habitation within the great foul nest of one high building own landing , besides flinging other refuse from its own windows . The uncontrollable and hopeless mass of decomposition so engendered , would have polluted the air , even if poverty and deprivation had not loaded it with [their]397-his two companions intangible impurities ; the two bad sources combined made it almost insupportable . Through such an atmosphere , by [a steep dark shaft of dirt and poison]820-a steep dark shaft of dirt and poison , the way lay . Yielding to [his]133-mr. lorry own disturbance of mind , and to [[his]133-mr. lorry young companion]821-his young companion ’s agitation , which became greater every instant , [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry twice stopped to rest . Each of these stoppages was made at a doleful grating , by which any languishing good airs that were left uncorrupted , seemed to escape , and all spoilt and sickly vapours seemed to crawl in . Through the rusted bars , tastes , rather than glimpses , were caught of [the jumbled neighbourhood]822-the jumbled neighbourhood ; and nothing within range , nearer or lower than the summits of [the two great towers of [Notre - Dame]28-notre dame]823-the two great towers of notre - dame , had any promise on it of healthy life or wholesome aspirations . At last , the top of the staircase was gained , and [they]824-they stopped for the third time . There was yet an upper staircase , of a steeper inclination and of contracted dimensions , to be ascended , before the garret story was reached . [The keeper of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]811-the keeper of the wine - shop , always going a little in advance , and always going on the side which [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry took , as though [he]133-mr. lorry dreaded to be asked any question by [the young lady]642-the young lady , turned [himself]133-mr. lorry about here , and , carefully feeling in the pockets of the coat [he]133-mr. lorry carried over [his]133-mr. lorry shoulder , took out a key . “ The door is locked then , [[my]133-mr. lorry friend]492-my friend ? ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , surprised . “ Ay . Yes , ”[147-defarge] was the grim reply of [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge . “ [You]133-mr. lorry think it necessary to keep [the unfortunate gentleman]5056-the unfortunate gentleman so retired ? ”[147-defarge] “ [I]147-defarge think it necessary to turn the key . ”[147-defarge] [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge whispered it closer in [his]133-mr. lorry ear , and frowned heavily . “ Why ? ”[147-defarge] “ Why ! Because [he]5056-the unfortunate gentleman has lived so long , locked up , that [he]5056-the unfortunate gentleman would be frightened -- rave -- tear [himself]5056-the unfortunate gentleman to pieces -- die -- come to [I]147-defarge know not what harm -- if [his]5056-the unfortunate gentleman door was left open . ”[147-defarge] “ Is it possible ! ”[133-mr. lorry] exclaimed [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ Is it possible ! ”[147-defarge] repeated [Defarge]147-defarge , bitterly . “ Yes . And [a beautiful world]5057-a beautiful world [we]5058-we live in , when it _ is _ possible , and when many other such things are possible , and not only possible , but done -- done , see you!--under that sky there , every day . Long live [the Devil]5059-the devil . Let [us]5058-we go on . ”[147-defarge] This dialogue had been held in so very low a whisper , that not a word of it had reached [the young lady]642-the young lady ’s ears . But , by this time [she]642-the young lady trembled under such strong emotion , and [her]642-the young lady face expressed such deep anxiety , and , above all , such dread and terror , that [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry felt it incumbent on [him]133-mr. lorry to speak a word or two of reassurance . “ Courage , [dear miss]5060-dear miss ! Courage ! Business ! The worst will be over in a moment ; it is but passing [the room]565-the room - door , and the worst is over . Then , all the good [you]133-mr. lorry bring to [him]5056-the unfortunate gentleman , all the relief , all the happiness [you]133-mr. lorry bring to [him]5056-the unfortunate gentleman , begin . Let [[our]5058-we good friend]5062-our good friend here , assist [you]133-mr. lorry on that side . That ’s well , [friend Defarge]147-defarge . Come , now . Business , business ! ”[829-they] [They]829-they went up slowly and softly . [The staircase]5048-the staircase was short , and [they]829-they were soon at the top . There , as [it]5048-the staircase had an abrupt turn in [it]5048-the staircase , [they]829-they came all at once in sight of [three men , whose heads were bent down close together at the side of a door]831-three men , whose heads were bent down close together at the side of a door , and who were intently looking into the room to which the door belonged , through some chinks or holes in the wall . On hearing footsteps close at hand , [these three]832-these three turned , and rose , and showed [themselves]832-these three to be [the three of one name who had been drinking in [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]833-the three of one name who had been drinking in the wine - shop . “ [I]147-defarge forgot [them]832-these three in the surprise of [your]832-these three visit , ”[147-defarge] explained [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge . “ Leave [us]396-the three , [good boys]5063-good boys ; [we]396-the three have business [here]4902-here . ”[396-the three] [The three]396-the three glided by , and went silently down . There appearing to be no other door on that floor , and [the keeper of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]811-the keeper of the wine - shop going straight to this one when [they]829-they were left alone , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry asked [him]811-the keeper of the wine - shop in a whisper , with a little anger : “ Do [you]811-the keeper of the wine - shop make a show of [Monsieur Manette]141-monsieur manette ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]811-the keeper of the wine - shop show [him]141-monsieur manette , in the way [you]811-the keeper of the wine - shop have seen , to [a chosen few]5065-a chosen few . ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] “ Is that well ? ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] “ _ [I]133-mr. lorry _ think it is well . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Who are [the few]5066-the few ? Enough ; [you]838-you are English ; that is another thing . Stay there , if [you]838-you please , a little moment . ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] With an admonitory gesture to keep [them]838-you back , [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop stooped , and looked in through the crevice in the wall . Soon raising [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop head again , [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop struck twice or thrice upon the door -- evidently with no other object than to make a noise there . With the same intention , [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop drew the key across it , three or four times , before [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop put it clumsily into the lock , and turned it as heavily as [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop could . The door slowly opened inward under [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop hand , and [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop looked into [the room]565-the room and said something . A faint voice answered something . Little more than a single syllable could have been spoken on either side . [He]811-the keeper of the wine - shop looked back over [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop shoulder , and beckoned [them]838-you to enter . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry got [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop arm securely round [the daughter]840-the daughter ’s waist , and held [her]840-the daughter ; for [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop felt that [she]840-the daughter was sinking . “ A - a - a - business , business ! ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop urged , with a moisture that was not of business shining on [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop cheek . “ Come in , come in ! ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] “ [I]840-the daughter am afraid of it , ”[840-the daughter] [she]840-the daughter answered , shuddering . “ Of it ? What ? ”[840-the daughter] “ [I]811-the keeper of the wine - shop mean of [him]811-the keeper of the wine - shop . Of [[my]811-the keeper of the wine - shop father]4969-my father . ”[811-the keeper of the wine - shop] Rendered in a manner desperate , by [her]840-the daughter state and by the beckoning of [[their]838-you conductor]841-their conductor , [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop drew over [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop neck the arm that shook upon [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop shoulder , lifted [her]840-the daughter a little , and hurried [her]840-the daughter into [the room]565-the room . [He]811-the keeper of the wine - shop sat [her]840-the daughter down just within the door , and held [her]840-the daughter , clinging to [him]811-the keeper of the wine - shop . [Defarge]147-defarge drew out the key , closed the door , locked it on the inside , took out the key again , and held it in [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop hand . All this [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop did , methodically , and with as loud and harsh an accompaniment of noise as [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop could make . Finally , [he]811-the keeper of the wine - shop walked across [the room]565-the room with a measured tread to where the window was . [He]811-the keeper of the wine - shop stopped there , and faced round . [The garret]844-the garret , built to be [a depository for firewood and the like]845-a depository for firewood and the like , was dim and dark : for , the window of dormer shape , was in truth a door in the roof , with a little crane over it for the hoisting up of [stores]846-stores from [the street]662-the street : unglazed , and closing up the middle in two pieces , like any other door of French construction . To exclude the cold , one half of this door was fast closed , and the other was opened but a very little way . Such a scanty portion of light was admitted through these means , that it was difficult , on first coming in , to see anything ; and long habit alone could have slowly formed in any one , the ability to do any work requiring nicety in such obscurity . Yet , work of that kind was being done in [the garret]844-the garret ; for , with [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop back towards the door , and [his]811-the keeper of the wine - shop face towards the window where [the keeper of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]811-the keeper of the wine - shop stood looking at [him]811-the keeper of the wine - shop , [a white - haired man]851-a white - haired man sat on a low bench , stooping forward and very busy , making shoes . CHAPTER VI . [The Shoemaker]852-the shoemaker “ Good day ! ”[147-defarge] said [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge , looking down at the white head that bent low over the shoemaking . It was raised for a moment , and a very faint voice responded to the salutation , as if it were at a distance : “ Good day ! ”[147-defarge] “ [You]853-the questioner are still hard at work , [I]147-defarge see ? ”[147-defarge] After a long silence , the head was lifted for another moment , and the voice replied , “ Yes -- [I]854-i am working . ”[854-i] This time , a pair of haggard eyes had looked at [the questioner]853-the questioner , before the face had dropped again . The faintness of the voice was pitiable and dreadful . It was not the faintness of physical weakness , though confinement and hard fare no doubt had [their]854-i part in it . [Its]855-its deplorable peculiarity was , that it was the faintness of solitude and disuse . It was like the last feeble echo of a sound made long and long ago . So entirely had it lost the life and resonance of the human voice , that it affected the senses like a once beautiful colour faded away into a poor weak stain . So sunken and suppressed it was , that it was like a voice underground . So expressive it was , of [a hopeless and lost creature]856-a hopeless and lost creature , that [a famished traveller , wearied out by lonely wandering in a wilderness]857-a famished traveller , wearied out by lonely wandering in a wilderness , would have remembered [home]858-home and [friends]859-friends in such a tone before lying down to die . Some minutes of silent work had passed : and the haggard eyes had looked up again : not with any interest or curiosity , but with a dull mechanical perception , beforehand , that the spot where [the only visitor [they]854-i were aware of]860-the only visitor they were aware of had stood , was not yet empty . “ [I]147-defarge want , ”[147-defarge] said [Defarge]147-defarge , who had not removed [his]147-defarge gaze from [the shoemaker]852-the shoemaker , “ to let in a little more light here . [You]852-the shoemaker can bear a little more ? ”[147-defarge] [The shoemaker]852-the shoemaker stopped [his]852-the shoemaker work ; looked with a vacant air of listening , at the floor on [one side of [him]852-the shoemaker]863-one side of him ; then similarly , at the floor on [the other side of [him]852-the shoemaker]864-the other side of him ; then , upward at [the speaker]865-the speaker . “ What did [you]852-the shoemaker say ? ”[865-the speaker] “ [You]852-the shoemaker can bear a little more light ? ”[865-the speaker] “ [I]865-the speaker must bear it , if [you]852-the shoemaker let it in . ”[865-the speaker] ( Laying the palest shadow of a stress upon the second word . ) The opened half - door was opened a little further , and secured at that angle for the time . A broad ray of light fell into [the garret]844-the garret , and showed [the workman]867-the workman with an unfinished shoe upon [his]867-the workman lap , pausing in [his]867-the workman labour . [His]867-the workman few common tools and various scraps of leather were at [his]867-the workman feet and on [his]867-the workman bench . [He]867-the workman had a white beard , raggedly cut , but not very long , a hollow face , and exceedingly bright eyes . The hollowness and thinness of [his]867-the workman face would have caused them to look large , under [his]867-the workman yet dark eyebrows and [his]867-the workman confused white hair , though they had been really otherwise ; but , they were naturally large , and looked unnaturally so . [His]867-the workman yellow rags of shirt lay open at the throat , and showed [his]867-the workman body to be withered and worn . [He]867-the workman , and [his]867-the workman old canvas frock , and [his]867-the workman loose stockings , and all [his]867-the workman poor tatters of clothes , had , in a long seclusion from direct light and air , faded down to such a dull uniformity of parchment - yellow , that it would have been hard to say which was which . [He]867-the workman had put up a hand between [his]867-the workman eyes and the light , and the very bones of it seemed transparent . So [he]867-the workman sat , with a steadfastly vacant gaze , pausing in [his]867-the workman work . [He]867-the workman never looked at the figure before [him]867-the workman , without first looking down on this side of [himself]867-the workman , then on that , as if [he]867-the workman had lost the habit of associating place with sound ; [he]867-the workman never spoke , without first wandering in this manner , and forgetting to speak . “ Are [you]867-the workman going to finish that pair of shoes to - day ? ”[147-defarge] asked [Defarge]147-defarge , motioning to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry to come forward . “ What did [you]867-the workman say ? ”[147-defarge] “ Do [you]867-the workman mean to finish that pair of shoes to - day ? ”[147-defarge] “ [I]133-mr. lorry ca n’t say that [I]133-mr. lorry mean to . [I]133-mr. lorry suppose so . [I]133-mr. lorry do n’t know . ”[133-mr. lorry] But , the question reminded [him]867-the workman of [his]867-the workman work , and [he]867-the workman bent over it again . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry came silently forward , leaving [the daughter]840-the daughter by the door . When [he]133-mr. lorry had stood , for a minute or two , by the side of [Defarge]147-defarge , [the shoemaker]852-the shoemaker looked up . [He]852-the shoemaker showed no surprise at seeing [another figure]870-another figure , but the unsteady fingers of one of [his]852-the shoemaker hands strayed to [his]852-the shoemaker lips as [he]852-the shoemaker looked at it ( [his]852-the shoemaker lips and [his]852-the shoemaker nails were of the same pale lead - colour ) , and then the hand dropped to [his]852-the shoemaker work , and [he]852-the shoemaker once more bent over the shoe . The look and the action had occupied but an instant . “ [You]852-the shoemaker have [a visitor]5069-a visitor , [you]852-the shoemaker see , ”[147-defarge] said [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge . “ What did [you]147-defarge say ? ”[147-defarge] “ Here is [a visitor]5069-a visitor . ”[852-the shoemaker] [The shoemaker]852-the shoemaker looked up as before , but without removing a hand from [his]852-the shoemaker work . “ Come ! ”[147-defarge] said [Defarge]147-defarge . “ Here is [monsieur]5071-monsieur , who knows a well - made shoe when [he]5071-monsieur sees one . Show [him]5071-monsieur that shoe [you]852-the shoemaker are working at . Take it , [monsieur]5071-monsieur . ”[147-defarge] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry took it in [his]133-mr. lorry hand . “ Tell [monsieur]5071-monsieur what kind of shoe it is , and [the maker]5073-the maker ’s name . ”[133-mr. lorry] There was a longer pause than usual , before [the shoemaker]852-the shoemaker replied : “ [I]852-the shoemaker forget what it was [you]147-defarge asked [me]852-the shoemaker . What did [you]147-defarge say ? ”[852-the shoemaker] “ [I]147-defarge said , could n’t [you]147-defarge describe the kind of shoe , for [monsieur]5071-monsieur ’s information ? ”[147-defarge] “ It is [a lady]5075-a lady ’s shoe . [It]5076-it is [a young lady]777-a young lady ’s walking - shoe . It is in the present mode . [I]133-mr. lorry never saw the mode . [I]133-mr. lorry have had a pattern in [my]133-mr. lorry hand . ”[133-mr. lorry] [He]133-mr. lorry glanced at the shoe with some little passing touch of pride . “ And [the maker]5073-the maker ’s name ? ”[147-defarge] said [Defarge]147-defarge . Now that [he]147-defarge had no work to hold , [he]147-defarge laid the knuckles of the right hand in the hollow of the left , and then the knuckles of the left hand in the hollow of the right , and then passed a hand across [his]147-defarge bearded chin , and so on in regular changes , without a moment ’s intermission . The task of recalling [him]147-defarge from the vagrancy into which [he]147-defarge always sank when [he]147-defarge had spoken , was like recalling [some very weak person]873-some very weak person from a swoon , or endeavouring , in the hope of some disclosure , to stay the spirit of [a fast - dying man]874-a fast - dying man . “ Did [you]147-defarge ask [me]147-defarge for [my]147-defarge name ? ”[147-defarge] “ Assuredly [I]133-mr. lorry did . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ One Hundred and Five , [North Tower]29-north tower . ”[147-defarge] “ Is that all ? ”[147-defarge] “ [One Hundred]30-one hundred and Five , [North Tower]29-north tower . ”[147-defarge] With a weary sound that was not a sigh , nor a groan , [he]147-defarge bent to work again , until the silence was again broken . “ [You]147-defarge are not [a shoemaker by trade]5079-a shoemaker by trade ? ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , looking steadfastly at [him]147-defarge . [His]133-mr. lorry haggard eyes turned to [Defarge]147-defarge as if [he]133-mr. lorry would have transferred the question to [him]147-defarge : but as no help came from [that quarter]875-that quarter , [they]876-they turned back on [the questioner]853-the questioner when [they]876-they had sought the ground . “ [I]147-defarge am not [a shoemaker by trade]5079-a shoemaker by trade ? No , [I]147-defarge was not a shoemaker by trade . [I]147-defarge - [I]147-defarge learnt it here . [I]147-defarge taught [myself]147-defarge . [I]147-defarge asked leave to-- ”[147-defarge] [He]147-defarge lapsed away , even for minutes , ringing those measured changes on [his]147-defarge hands the whole time . [His]147-defarge eyes came slowly back , at last , to the face from which they had wandered ; when they rested on it , [he]147-defarge started , and resumed , in the manner of [a sleeper that moment awake , reverting to a subject of last night]878-a sleeper that moment awake , reverting to a subject of last night . “ [I]147-defarge asked leave to teach [myself]147-defarge , and [I]147-defarge got it with much difficulty after a long while , and [I]147-defarge have made shoes ever since . ”[147-defarge] As [he]147-defarge held out [his]147-defarge hand for the shoe that had been taken from [him]147-defarge , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry said , still looking steadfastly in [his]147-defarge face : “ [Monsieur Manette]141-monsieur manette , do [you]141-monsieur manette remember nothing of [me]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] The shoe dropped to the ground , and [he]147-defarge sat looking fixedly at [the questioner]853-the questioner . “ [Monsieur Manette]141-monsieur manette ”[147-defarge] ; [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry laid [his]133-mr. lorry hand upon [Defarge]147-defarge ’s arm ; “ do [you]141-monsieur manette remember nothing of [this man]5081-this man ? Look at [him]5081-this man . Look at [me]133-mr. lorry . Is there [no old banker]5082-no old banker , [no old business]5083-no old business , [no old servant]5084-no old servant , no old time , rising in [your]141-monsieur manette mind , [Monsieur Manette]141-monsieur manette ? ”[133-mr. lorry] As [the captive of many years]880-the captive of many years sat looking fixedly , by turns , at [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry and at [Defarge]147-defarge , some long obliterated marks of an actively intent intelligence in the middle of the forehead , gradually forced themselves through the black mist that had fallen on [him]147-defarge . [They]881-they were overclouded again , [they]881-they were fainter , [they]881-they were gone ; but they had been there . And so exactly was the expression repeated on the fair young face of [her]882-her who had crept along the wall to a point where [she]882-her could see [him]147-defarge , and where [she]882-her now stood looking at [him]147-defarge , with hands which at first had been only raised in frightened compassion , if not even to keep [him]147-defarge off and shut out the sight of [him]147-defarge , but which were now extending towards [him]147-defarge , trembling with eagerness to lay the spectral face upon [her]882-her warm young breast , and love it back to life and hope -- so exactly was the expression repeated ( though in stronger characters ) on [her]882-her fair young face , that it looked as though it had passed like a moving light , from [him]147-defarge to [her]882-her . Darkness had fallen on [him]147-defarge in its place . [He]147-defarge looked at [the two]883-the two , less and less attentively , and [his]147-defarge eyes in gloomy abstraction sought the ground and looked about [him]147-defarge in the old way . Finally , with a deep long sigh , [he]147-defarge took the shoe up , and resumed [his]147-defarge work . “ Have [you]147-defarge recognised [him]147-defarge , [monsieur]5071-monsieur ? ”[147-defarge] asked [Defarge]147-defarge in a whisper . “ Yes ; for a moment . At first [I]882-her thought it quite hopeless , but [I]882-her have unquestionably seen , for a single moment , the face that [I]882-her once knew so well . Hush ! Let [us]5086-us draw further back . Hush ! ”[882-her] [She]882-her had moved from the wall of [the garret]844-the garret , very near to the bench on which [he]147-defarge sat . There was something awful in [his]147-defarge unconsciousness of the figure that could have put out its hand and touched [him]147-defarge as [he]147-defarge stooped over [his]147-defarge labour . Not a word was spoken , not a sound was made . [She]882-her stood , like a spirit , beside [him]147-defarge , and [he]147-defarge bent over [his]147-defarge work . It happened , at length , that [he]147-defarge had occasion to change the instrument in [his]147-defarge hand , for [his]147-defarge shoemaker ’s knife . It lay on that side of [him]147-defarge which was not the side on which [she]882-her stood . [He]147-defarge had taken it up , and was stooping to work again , when [his]147-defarge eyes caught the skirt of [her]882-her dress . [He]147-defarge raised them , and saw [her]882-her face . [The two spectators]885-the two spectators started forward , but [she]882-her stayed [them]885-the two spectators with a motion of [her]882-her hand . [She]882-her had no fear of [his]147-defarge striking at [her]882-her with the knife , though [they]885-the two spectators had . [He]147-defarge stared at [her]882-her with a fearful look , and after a while [his]147-defarge lips began to form some words , though no sound proceeded from them . By degrees , in the pauses of [his]147-defarge quick and laboured breathing , [he]147-defarge was heard to say : “ What is this ? ”[147-defarge] With the tears streaming down [her]882-her face , [she]882-her put [her]882-her two hands to [her]882-her lips , and kissed them to [him]147-defarge ; then clasped them on [her]882-her breast , as if [she]882-her laid [his]147-defarge ruined head there . “ [You]147-defarge are not [[the gaoler]5087-the gaoler ’s daughter]5088-the gaoler ’s daughter ? ”[882-her] [She]882-her sighed “ No . ”[882-her] “ Who are [you]147-defarge ? ”[882-her] Not yet trusting the tones of [her]882-her voice , [she]882-her sat down on the bench beside [him]147-defarge . [He]147-defarge recoiled , but [she]882-her laid [her]882-her hand upon [his]147-defarge arm . A strange thrill struck [him]147-defarge when [she]882-her did so , and visibly passed over [his]147-defarge frame ; [he]147-defarge laid the knife down softly , as [he]147-defarge sat staring at [her]882-her . [Her]882-her golden hair , which [she]882-her wore in long curls , had been hurriedly pushed aside , and fell down over [her]882-her neck . Advancing [his]147-defarge hand by little and little , [he]147-defarge took it up and looked at it . In the midst of the action [he]147-defarge went astray , and , with another deep sigh , fell to work at [his]147-defarge shoemaking . But not for long . Releasing [his]147-defarge arm , [she]882-her laid [her]882-her hand upon [his]147-defarge shoulder . After looking doubtfully at it , two or three times , as if to be sure that it was really there , [he]147-defarge laid down [his]147-defarge work , put [his]147-defarge hand to [his]147-defarge neck , and took off a blackened string with a scrap of folded rag attached to it . [He]147-defarge opened this , carefully , on [his]147-defarge knee , and it contained a very little quantity of hair : not more than one or two long golden hairs , which [he]147-defarge had , in some old day , wound off upon [his]147-defarge finger . [He]147-defarge took [her]882-her hair into [his]147-defarge hand again , and looked closely at it . “ It is the same . How can it be ! When was it ! How was it ! ”[147-defarge] As the concentrated expression returned to [his]147-defarge forehead , [he]147-defarge seemed to become conscious that it was in [hers]882-her too . [He]147-defarge turned [her]882-her full to the light , and looked at [her]882-her . “ [She]882-her had laid [her]882-her head upon [my]147-defarge shoulder , that night when [I]147-defarge was summoned out -- [she]882-her had a fear of [my]147-defarge going , though [I]147-defarge had none -- and when [I]147-defarge was brought to [the North Tower]29-north tower [they]5089-they found these upon [my]147-defarge sleeve . ‘ [You]147-defarge will leave [me]147-defarge them ? [They]886-they can never help [me]147-defarge to escape in the body , though they may in the spirit . ’ Those were the words [I]147-defarge said . [I]147-defarge remember them very well . ”[147-defarge] [He]147-defarge formed this speech with [his]147-defarge lips many times before [he]147-defarge could utter it . But when [he]147-defarge did find spoken words for it , [they]886-they came to [him]147-defarge coherently , though slowly . “ How was this?--_Was it [you]147-defarge _ ? ”[886-they] Once more , [the two spectators]885-the two spectators started , as [he]147-defarge turned upon [her]888-she with a frightful suddenness . But [she]888-she sat perfectly still in [his]147-defarge grasp , and only said , in a low voice , “ [I]888-she entreat [you]147-defarge , [good gentlemen]5090-good gentlemen , do not come near [us]885-the two spectators , do not speak , do not move ! ”[888-she] “ [Hark]150-hark ! ”[147-defarge] [he]147-defarge exclaimed . “ Whose voice was that ? ”[147-defarge] [His]147-defarge hands released [her]888-she as [he]147-defarge uttered this cry , and went up to [his]147-defarge white hair , which they tore in a frenzy . It died out , as everything but [his]147-defarge shoemaking did die out of [him]147-defarge , and [he]147-defarge refolded [his]147-defarge little packet and tried to secure it in [his]147-defarge breast ; but [he]147-defarge still looked at [her]888-she , and gloomily shook [his]147-defarge head . “ No , no , no ; [you]888-she are too young , too blooming . It ca n’t be . See what [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner is . These are not the hands [she]888-she knew , this is not the face [she]888-she knew , this is not a voice [she]888-she ever heard . No , no . [She]888-she was -- and [He]147-defarge was -- before the slow years of [the North Tower]29-north tower -- ages ago . What is [your]888-she name , [[my]147-defarge gentle angel]5092-my gentle angel ? ”[147-defarge] Hailing [his]147-defarge softened tone and manner , [[his]147-defarge daughter]889-his daughter fell upon [her]889-his daughter knees before [him]147-defarge , with [her]889-his daughter appealing hands upon [his]147-defarge breast . “ O , [sir]4862-sir , at another time [you]4862-sir shall know [my]890-my name , and who [[my]890-my mother]4973-my mother was , and who [[my]890-my father]4969-my father , and how [I]890-my never knew [their]5096-their hard , hard history . But [I]890-my can not tell [you]4862-sir at this time , and [I]890-my can not tell [you]4862-sir here . All that [I]890-my may tell [you]4862-sir , here and now , is , that [I]890-my pray to [you]4862-sir to touch [me]890-my and to bless [me]890-my . Kiss [me]890-my , kiss [me]890-my ! O [[my]890-my dear]5097-my dear , [[my]890-my dear]5097-my dear ! ”[890-my] [His]890-my cold white head mingled with [her]891-her radiant hair , which warmed and lighted it as though it were the light of Freedom shining on [him]890-my . “ If [you]4862-sir hear in [my]892-my voice -- [I]892-my do n’t know that it is so , but [I]892-my hope it is -- if [you]4862-sir hear in [my]892-my voice any resemblance to a voice that once was sweet music in [your]4862-sir ears , weep for it , weep for it ! If [you]4862-sir touch , in touching [my]892-my hair , anything that recalls a beloved head that lay on [your]4862-sir breast when [you]4862-sir were young and free , weep for it , weep for it ! If , when [I]892-my hint to [you]4862-sir of [a Home that is before [us]5100-us]5099-a home that is before us , where [I]892-my will be true to [you]4862-sir with all [my]892-my duty and with all [my]892-my faithful service , [I]892-my bring back the remembrance of a Home long desolate , while [your]4862-sir poor heart pined away , weep for it , weep for it ! ”[892-my] [She]892-my held [him]893-him closer round the neck , and rocked [him]893-him on [her]892-my breast like [a child]894-a child . “ If , when [I]892-my tell [you]4862-sir , [dearest dear]5101-dearest dear , that [your]4862-sir agony is over , and that [I]892-my have come here to take [you]4862-sir from it , and that [we]5100-us go to [England]1-england to be at peace and at rest , [I]892-my cause [you]4862-sir to think of [your]4862-sir useful life laid waste , and of [[our]5100-us native [France]2-france]5102-our native france so wicked to [you]4862-sir , weep for it , weep for it ! And if , when [I]892-my shall tell [you]4862-sir of [my]892-my name , and of [[my]892-my father]4969-my father who is living , and of [[my]892-my mother]4973-my mother who is dead , [you]4862-sir learn that [I]892-my have to kneel to [[my]892-my honoured father]5105-my honoured father , and implore [his]5105-my honoured father pardon for having never for [his]5105-my honoured father sake striven all day and lain awake and wept all night , because the love of [[my]892-my poor mother]5106-my poor mother hid [his]5105-my honoured father torture from [me]892-my , weep for it , weep for it ! Weep for [her]5106-my poor mother , then , and for [me]892-my ! [Good gentlemen]5090-good gentlemen , thank [God]149-god ! [I]892-my feel [his]5105-my honoured father sacred tears upon [my]892-my face , and [his]5105-my honoured father sobs strike against [my]892-my heart . O , see ! Thank [God]149-god for [us]897-the two beholders , thank [God]149-god ! ”[892-my] [He]895-him had sunk in [her]896-her arms , and [his]895-him face dropped on [her]896-her breast : a sight so touching , yet so terrible in the tremendous wrong and suffering which had gone before it , that [the two beholders]897-the two beholders covered [their]897-the two beholders faces . When the quiet of [the garret]844-the garret had been long undisturbed , and [his]895-him heaving breast and shaken form had long yielded to the calm that must follow all storms -- emblem to humanity , of the rest and silence into which the storm called Life must hush at last -- [they]897-the two beholders came forward to raise [the father]899-the father and [daughter]900-daughter from the ground . [He]895-him had gradually dropped to the floor , and lay there in a lethargy , worn out . [She]896-her had nestled down with [him]895-him , that [his]895-him head might lie upon [her]896-her arm ; and [her]896-her hair drooping over [him]895-him curtained [him]895-him from the light . “ If , without disturbing [him]895-him , ”[896-her] [she]896-her said , raising [her]896-her hand to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry as [he]133-mr. lorry stooped over [them]897-the two beholders , after repeated blowings of [his]895-him nose , “ all could be arranged for [our]897-the two beholders leaving [Paris]7-paris at once , so that , from the very door , [he]895-him could be taken away-- ”[896-her] “ But , consider . Is [he]895-him fit for the journey ? ”[133-mr. lorry] asked [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ More fit for that , [I]133-mr. lorry think , than to remain in [this city]497-this city , so dreadful to [him]895-him . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ It is true , ”[147-defarge] said [Defarge]147-defarge , who was kneeling to look on and hear . “ More than that ; [Monsieur Manette]141-monsieur manette is , for all reasons , best out of [France]2-france . Say , shall [I]147-defarge hire [a carriage]5109-a carriage and post - horses ? ”[147-defarge] “ That ’s business , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , resuming on the shortest notice [his]133-mr. lorry methodical manners ; “ and if business is to be done , [I]133-mr. lorry had better do it . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Then be so kind , ”[140-miss manette] urged [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , “ as to leave [us]897-the two beholders [here]4902-here . [You]133-mr. lorry see how composed [he]895-him has become , and [you]133-mr. lorry can not be afraid to leave [him]895-him with [me]140-miss manette now . Why should [you]133-mr. lorry be ? If [you]133-mr. lorry will lock the door to secure [us]897-the two beholders from interruption , [I]140-miss manette do not doubt that [you]133-mr. lorry will find [him]895-him , when [you]133-mr. lorry come back , as quiet as [you]133-mr. lorry leave [him]895-him . In any case , [I]140-miss manette will take care of [him]895-him until [you]133-mr. lorry return , and then [we]897-the two beholders will remove [him]895-him straight . ”[140-miss manette] Both [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry and [Defarge]147-defarge were rather disinclined to this course , and in favour of one of [them]901-they remaining . But , as there were not only [carriage]902-carriage and horses to be seen to , but travelling papers ; and as time pressed , for the day was drawing to an end , it came at last to [their]901-they hastily dividing the business that was necessary to be done , and hurrying away to do it . Then , as the darkness closed in , [the daughter]840-the daughter laid [her]840-the daughter head down on the hard ground close at [the father]899-the father ’s side , and watched [him]899-the father . The darkness deepened and deepened , and [they]901-they both lay quiet , until a light gleamed through the chinks in the wall . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry and [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge had made all ready for the journey , and had brought with [them]901-they , besides travelling cloaks and wrappers , bread and meat , wine , and hot coffee . [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge put [this provender]905-this provender , and the lamp [he]147-defarge carried , on the shoemaker ’s bench ( there was nothing else in the garret but a pallet bed ) , and [he]147-defarge and [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry roused [the captive]906-the captive , and assisted [him]906-the captive to [his]906-the captive feet . [No human intelligence]907-no human intelligence could have read the mysteries of [his]899-the father mind , in the scared blank wonder of [his]899-the father face . Whether [he]899-the father knew what had happened , whether [he]899-the father recollected what [they]901-they had said to [him]899-the father , whether [he]899-the father knew that [he]899-the father was free , were questions which no sagacity could have solved . [They]901-they tried speaking to [him]899-the father ; but , [he]899-the father was so confused , and so very slow to answer , that [they]901-they took fright at [his]899-the father bewilderment , and agreed for the time to tamper with [him]899-the father no more . [He]899-the father had a wild , lost manner of occasionally clasping [his]899-the father head in [his]899-the father hands , that had not been seen in [him]899-the father before ; yet , [he]899-the father had some pleasure in the mere sound of [[his]899-the father daughter]889-his daughter ’s voice , and invariably turned to it when [she]889-his daughter spoke . In the submissive way of one long accustomed to obey under coercion , [he]899-the father ate and drank what [they]901-they gave [him]899-the father to eat and drink , and put on the cloak and other wrappings , that [they]901-they gave [him]899-the father to wear . [He]899-the father readily responded to [[his]899-the father daughter]889-his daughter ’s drawing [her]889-his daughter arm through [his]899-the father , and took -- and kept -- [her]889-his daughter hand in both [his]899-the father own . [They]910-they began to descend ; [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge going first with the lamp , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry closing the little procession . [They]910-they had not traversed many steps of [the long main staircase]911-the long main staircase when [he]899-the father stopped , and stared at the roof and round at the walls . “ [You]889-his daughter remember [the place]791-the place , [[my]899-the father father]4969-my father ? [You]889-his daughter remember coming up [here]4902-here ? ”[899-the father] “ What did [you]889-his daughter say ? ”[889-his daughter] But , before [she]889-his daughter could repeat the question , [he]899-the father murmured an answer as if [she]889-his daughter had repeated it . “ Remember ? No , [I]899-the father do n’t remember . It was so very long ago . ”[899-the father] That [he]899-the father had no recollection whatever of [his]899-the father having been brought from [[his]899-the father prison]912-his prison to [that house]913-that house , was apparent to [them]910-they . [They]910-they heard [him]899-the father mutter , “ [One Hundred and Five]32-one hundred and five , [North Tower]29-north tower ; ”[899-the father] and when [he]899-the father looked about [him]899-the father , it evidently was for [the strong fortress - walls which had long encompassed [him]899-the father]914-the strong fortress - walls which had long encompassed him . On [their]910-they reaching [the courtyard]915-the courtyard [he]899-the father instinctively altered [his]899-the father tread , as being in expectation of [a drawbridge]916-a drawbridge ; and when there was no drawbridge , and [he]899-the father saw [the carriage]917-the carriage waiting in [the open street]918-the open street , [he]899-the father dropped [[his]899-the father daughter]889-his daughter ’s hand and clasped [his]899-the father head again . [No crowd]920-no crowd was about the door ; [no people]921-no people were discernible at any of the many windows ; not even [a chance passerby]922-a chance passerby was in [the street]662-the street . An unnatural silence and desertion reigned there . [Only one soul]924-only one soul was to be seen , and that was [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge -- who leaned against the door - post , knitting , and saw nothing . [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner had got into [a coach]926-a coach , and [[his]5091-the prisoner daughter]889-his daughter had followed [him]899-the father , when [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s feet were arrested on the step by [his]5091-the prisoner asking , miserably , for [his]5091-the prisoner shoemaking tools and the unfinished shoes . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge immediately called to [[her]146-madame defarge husband]770-her husband that [she]146-madame defarge would get them , and went , knitting , out of the lamplight , through [the courtyard]915-the courtyard . [She]146-madame defarge quickly brought them down and handed them in;--and immediately afterwards leaned against the door - post , knitting , and saw nothing . [Defarge]146-madame defarge got upon the box , and gave the word “ To [the Barrier]5114-the barrier ! ”[146-madame defarge] [The postilion]930-the postilion cracked [his]930-the postilion whip , and [they]931-they clattered away under the feeble over - swinging lamps . Under the over - swinging lamps -- swinging ever brighter in [the better streets]932-the better streets , and ever dimmer in the worse -- and by [lighted shops]933-lighted shops , [gay crowds]934-gay crowds , [illuminated coffee - houses]935-illuminated coffee - houses , and theatre - doors , to one of [the city gates]936-the city gates . [Soldiers with lanterns]937-soldiers with lanterns , at [the guard - house]938-the guard - house [there]4887-there . “ [Your]930-the postilion papers , [travellers]398-travellers ! ”[937-soldiers with lanterns] “ See here then , [Monsieur the Officer]151-monsieur the officer , ”[146-madame defarge] said [Defarge]146-madame defarge , getting down , and taking [him]930-the postilion gravely apart , “ these are the papers of [monsieur inside]5116-monsieur inside , with the white head . [They]5117-they were consigned to [me]930-the postilion , with [him]930-the postilion , at the-- ”[930-the postilion] [He]930-the postilion dropped [his]930-the postilion voice , there was a flutter among the military lanterns , and one of them being handed into [the coach]376-the coach by an arm in uniform , the eyes connected with the arm looked , not an every day or an every night look , at [monsieur with the white head]941-monsieur with the white head . “ It is well . Forward ! ”[941-monsieur with the white head] from the uniform . “ Adieu ! ”[941-monsieur with the white head] from [Defarge]146-madame defarge . And so , under a short grove of [feebler and feebler over - swinging lamps]942-feebler and feebler over - swinging lamps , out under the great grove of stars . [Beneath that arch of unmoved and eternal lights]943-beneath that arch of unmoved and eternal lights ; some , so remote from [this little earth]944-this little earth that [the learned]945-the learned tell [us]946-us it is doubtful whether [their]945-the learned rays have even yet discovered it , as a point in space where anything is suffered or done : the shadows of the night were broad and black . All through the cold and restless interval , until dawn , [they]947-i once more whispered in the ears of [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry -- sitting opposite [the buried man who had been dug out]948-the buried man who had been dug out , and wondering what subtle powers were for ever lost to [him]948-the buried man who had been dug out , and what were capable of restoration -- the old inquiry : “ [I]947-i hope [you]133-mr. lorry care to be recalled to life ? ”[947-i] And the old answer : “ [I]947-i ca n’t say . ”[947-i] The end of the first book . Book the Second -- the Golden Thread CHAPTER I. Five Years Later [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s Bank by [Temple Bar]18-temple bar]33-tellson ’s bank by temple bar was [an old - fashioned place]949-an old - fashioned place , even in the year one thousand seven hundred and eighty . [It]33-tellson ’s bank by temple bar was very small , very dark , very ugly , very incommodious . [It]33-tellson ’s bank by temple bar was an old - fashioned place , moreover , in the moral attribute that [the partners in [the House]951-the house]950-the partners in the house were proud of [its]951-the house smallness , proud of its darkness , proud of [its]951-the house ugliness , proud of [its]951-the house incommodiousness . [They]950-the partners in the house were even boastful of its eminence in those particulars , and were fired by an express conviction that , if it were less objectionable , it would be less respectable . This was no passive belief , but an active weapon which [they]950-the partners in the house flashed at more convenient places of business . [Tellson]134-tellson ’s ( [they]950-the partners in the house said ) wanted no elbow - room , [Tellson]134-tellson ’s wanted no light , [Tellson]134-tellson ’s wanted no embellishment . [Noakes]152-noakes and Co. ’s might , or [Snooks Brothers]952-snooks brothers ’ might ; but [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , thank [Heaven--]153-heaven-- ! [Any one of [these partners]954-these partners]953-any one of these partners would have disinherited [[his]953-any one of these partners son]955-his son on the question of rebuilding [Tellson]134-tellson ’s . In this respect [the House]154-the house was much on a par with [the Country]956-the country ; which did very often disinherit [[its]154-the house sons]957-its sons for suggesting improvements in laws and customs that had long been highly objectionable , but were only the more respectable . Thus it had come to pass , that [Tellson]134-tellson ’s was the triumphant perfection of inconvenience . After bursting open a door of idiotic obstinacy with a weak rattle in its throat , [you]958-your fell into [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s]959-tellson ’s down two steps , and came to [your]958-your senses in [a miserable little shop]960-a miserable little shop , with two little counters , where [the oldest of men]961-the oldest of men made [your]958-your cheque shake as if the wind rustled it , while [they]961-the oldest of men examined the signature by the dingiest of windows , which were always under a shower - bath of mud from [Fleet - street]962-fleet - street , and which were made the dingier by [their]961-the oldest of men own iron bars proper , and the heavy shadow of [Temple Bar]18-temple bar . If [your]958-your business necessitated [your]958-your seeing “ [the House]951-the house , ”[958-your] [you]958-your were put into a species of Condemned Hold at the back , where [you]958-your meditated on a misspent life , until [the House]951-the house came with its hands in its pockets , and [you]958-your could hardly blink at [it]951-the house in the dismal twilight . [Your]958-your money came out of , or went into , wormy old wooden drawers , particles of which flew up [your]958-your nose and down [your]958-your throat when they were opened and shut . [Your]958-your bank - notes had a musty odour , as if they were fast decomposing into rags again . [Your]958-your plate was stowed away among [the neighbouring cesspools]964-the neighbouring cesspools , and evil communications corrupted its good polish in a day or two . [Your]958-your deeds got into [extemporised strong - rooms made of [kitchens]966-kitchens and sculleries]965-extemporised strong - rooms made of kitchens and sculleries , and fretted all the fat out of [their]961-the oldest of men parchments into the banking - house air . [Your]958-your lighter boxes of family papers went up - [stairs]967-stairs into [a Barmecide room]968-a barmecide room , that always had a great dining - table in [it]968-a barmecide room and never had a dinner , and where , even in the year one thousand seven hundred and eighty , the first letters written to [you]958-your by [[your]958-your old love]969-your old love , or by [[your]958-your little children]970-your little children , were but newly released from the horror of being ogled through the windows , by the heads exposed on [Temple Bar]18-temple bar with an insensate brutality and ferocity worthy of [Abyssinia]34-abyssinia or [Ashantee]35-ashantee . But indeed , at that time , putting to death was a recipe much in vogue with all trades and professions , and not least of all with [Tellson]134-tellson ’s . Death is Nature ’s remedy for all things , and why not Legislation ’s ? Accordingly , [the forger]971-the forger was put to [Death]128-death ; [the utterer of a bad note]972-the utterer of a bad note was put to [Death]128-death ; the unlawful opener of a letter was put to [Death]128-death ; [the purloiner of forty shillings and sixpence]973-the purloiner of forty shillings and sixpence was put to [Death]128-death ; [the holder of a horse at [Tellson]134-tellson]974-the holder of a horse at tellson ’s door , who made off with it , was put to Death ; [the coiner of a bad shilling]975-the coiner of a bad shilling was put to Death ; the sounders of three - fourths of the notes in the whole gamut of Crime , were put to [Death]128-death . Not that it did the least good in the way of prevention -- it might almost have been worth remarking that the fact was exactly the reverse -- but , it cleared off ( as to [this world]976-this world ) the trouble of each particular case , and left nothing else connected with it to be looked after . Thus , [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , in [its]134-tellson day , like greater places of business , [[its]134-tellson contemporaries]977-its contemporaries , had taken so many lives , that , if the heads laid low before it had been ranged on [Temple Bar]18-temple bar instead of being privately disposed of , [they]978-they would probably have excluded what little light the ground floor had , in a rather significant manner . Cramped in all kinds of dim cupboards and hutches at [Tellson ’s]134-tellson , [the oldest of [men]568-men]961-the oldest of men carried on the business gravely . When [they]978-they took [a young man]981-a young man into [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s [London]3-london house]982-tellson ’s london house , [they]978-they hid [him]981-a young man somewhere till [he]981-a young man was old . [They]978-they kept [him]981-a young man in a dark place , like a cheese , until [he]981-a young man had the full Tellson flavour and blue - mould upon [him]981-a young man . Then only was [he]981-a young man permitted to be seen , spectacularly poring over large books , and casting [his]981-a young man breeches and gaiters into the general weight of [the establishment]983-the establishment . [Outside Tellson’s]36-outside tellson’s -- never by any means in [it]982-tellson ’s london house , unless called in -- was [an odd - job - man]984-an odd - job - man , [an occasional porter]985-an occasional porter and messenger , who served as the live sign of [the house]951-the house . [He]134-tellson was never absent during business hours , unless upon an errand , and then [he]134-tellson was represented by [[his]134-tellson son]955-his son : [a grisly urchin of twelve , who was [his]134-tellson express image]988-a grisly urchin of twelve , who was his express image . [People]360-people understood that [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , in a stately way , tolerated [the odd - job - man]990-the odd - job - man . [The house]951-the house had always tolerated [some person]992-some person in that capacity , and time and tide had drifted [this person]993-this person to the post . [His]134-tellson surname was [Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher , and on the youthful occasion of [his]134-tellson renouncing by proxy the works of darkness , in [the easterly parish church of Hounsditch]994-the easterly parish church of hounsditch , [he]134-tellson had received the added appellation of [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . The scene was [[Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s private lodging]995-mr. cruncher ’s private lodging in [Hanging - sword - alley]996-hanging - sword - alley , [Whitefriars]37-whitefriars : the time , half - past seven of the clock on a windy March morning , Anno Domini seventeen hundred and eighty . ( [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher [himself]156-mr. cruncher always spoke of the year of [[our]997-our Lord]998-our lord as [Anna Dominoes]157-anna dominoes : apparently under the impression that the Christian era dated from the invention of a popular game , by [a lady who had bestowed [her]999-a lady who had bestowed her name upon it name upon it]999-a lady who had bestowed her name upon it . ) [[Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s apartments]1000-mr. cruncher ’s apartments were not in [a savoury neighbourhood]1001-a savoury neighbourhood , and were but two in number , even if [a closet with a single pane of glass in [it]1002-a closet with a single pane of glass in it]1002-a closet with a single pane of glass in it might be counted as one . But [they]1000-mr. cruncher ’s apartments were very decently kept . Early as it was , on the windy March morning , [the room in which [he]156-mr. cruncher lay abed]1003-the room in which he lay abed was already scrubbed throughout ; and between the cups and saucers arranged for breakfast , and the lumbering deal table , a very clean white cloth was spread . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher reposed under a patchwork counterpane , like a Harlequin at [home]858-home . At first , [he]156-mr. cruncher slept heavily , but , by degrees , began to roll and surge in bed , until [he]156-mr. cruncher rose above the surface , with [his]156-mr. cruncher spiky hair looking as if it must tear the sheets to ribbons . At which juncture , [he]156-mr. cruncher exclaimed , in a voice of dire exasperation : “ Bust [me]156-mr. cruncher , if [she]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance ai n’t at it agin ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] [A woman of orderly and industrious appearance]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance rose from [her]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance knees in a corner , with sufficient haste and trepidation to show that [she]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance was [the person referred to]1006-the person referred to . “ What ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , looking out of bed for a boot . “ [You]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance ’re at [it]5119-it agin , are [you]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] After hailing [the morn]1007-the morn with this second salutation , [he]156-mr. cruncher threw a boot at [the woman]1008-the woman as a third . It was a very muddy boot , and may introduce the odd circumstance connected with [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s domestic economy , that , whereas [he]156-mr. cruncher often came [home]858-home after banking hours with clean boots , [he]156-mr. cruncher often got up next morning to find the same boots covered with clay . “ What , ”[156-mr. cruncher] said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , varying [his]156-mr. cruncher apostrophe after missing [his]156-mr. cruncher mark--“what are [you]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance up to , [Aggerawayter]158-aggerawayter ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ [I]156-mr. cruncher was only saying [my]156-mr. cruncher prayers . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Saying [your]1005-a woman of orderly and industrious appearance prayers ! [Young Jerry]159-young jerry , dress [yourself]1010-his mother , [[my]156-mr. cruncher boy]5127-my boy , and while [I]156-mr. cruncher clean [my]156-mr. cruncher boots keep a eye upon [[your]1010-his mother mother]5011-your mother now and then , and if [you]1010-his mother see any signs of more flopping , give [me]156-mr. cruncher a call . In the meantime , [[his]1012-his son]955-his son , whose head was garnished with tenderer spikes , and whose young eyes stood close by [one another]411-one another , as [[his]955-his son father]1015-his father ’s did , kept the required watch upon [[his]955-his son mother]1010-his mother . [He]156-mr. cruncher greatly disturbed [that poor woman]1017-that poor woman at intervals , by darting out of [[his]156-mr. cruncher sleeping closet]1018-his sleeping closet , where [he]156-mr. cruncher made [his]156-mr. cruncher toilet , with a suppressed cry of “ [You]1017-that poor woman are going to flop , [mother]5143-mother . --Halloa , [father]5144-father ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] and , after raising this fictitious alarm , darting in again with an undutiful grin . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s temper was not at all improved when [he]156-mr. cruncher came to [his]156-mr. cruncher breakfast . [He]156-mr. cruncher resented [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher ’s saying grace with particular animosity . “ Now , [Aggerawayter]158-aggerawayter ! What are [you]158-aggerawayter up to ? At it again ? ”[4987-his wife] [[His]156-mr. cruncher wife]4987-his wife explained that [she]4987-his wife had merely “ asked a blessing . ”[4987-his wife] “ Do n’t do it ! ”[160-mr. crunches] said [Mr. Crunches]160-mr. crunches looking about , as if [he]160-mr. crunches rather expected to see the loaf disappear under the efficacy of [[his]156-mr. cruncher wife]4987-his wife ’s petitions . “ [I]156-mr. cruncher ai n’t a going to be blest out of [house]5145-house and [home]858-home . [I]156-mr. cruncher wo n’t have [my]156-mr. cruncher wittles blest off [my]156-mr. cruncher table . Keep still ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] Exceedingly red - eyed and grim , as if [he]156-mr. cruncher had been up all night at a party which had taken anything but a convivial turn , [Jerry Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher worried [his]156-mr. cruncher breakfast rather than ate it , growling over it like any four - footed inmate of [a menagerie]1021-a menagerie . Towards nine o’clock [he]156-mr. cruncher smoothed [his]156-mr. cruncher ruffled aspect , and , presenting as respectable and business - like an exterior as [he]156-mr. cruncher could overlay [his]156-mr. cruncher natural self with , issued forth to the occupation of the day . It could scarcely be called a trade , in spite of [his]156-mr. cruncher favourite description of [himself]156-mr. cruncher as “ [a honest tradesman]5147-a honest tradesman . ”[156-mr. cruncher] [His]156-mr. cruncher stock consisted of a wooden stool , made out of a broken - backed chair cut down , which stool , [young Jerry]156-mr. cruncher , walking at [[his]156-mr. cruncher father]1015-his father ’s side , carried every morning to beneath [the banking - house window that was nearest [Temple Bar]18-temple bar]1023-the banking - house window that was nearest temple bar : where , with the addition of the first handful of straw that could be gleaned from [any passing vehicle]1024-any passing vehicle to keep the cold and wet from [the odd - job - man]990-the odd - job - man ’s feet , [it]1026-it formed the encampment for the day . On this post of [his]156-mr. cruncher , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher was as well known to [Fleet - street]38-fleet - street and [the Temple]1027-the temple , as [the Bar itself,--and]1028-the bar itself,--and was almost as in - looking . Encamped at a quarter before nine , in good time to touch [his]156-mr. cruncher three - cornered hat to [the oldest of [men]568-men]961-the oldest of men as [they]961-the oldest of men passed in to [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher took up [his]156-mr. cruncher station on this windy March morning , with [young Jerry]156-mr. cruncher standing by [him]156-mr. cruncher , when not engaged in making forays through [the Bar]1031-the bar , to inflict bodily and mental injuries of an acute description on [passing boys who were small enough for [his]156-mr. cruncher amiable purpose]1032-passing boys who were small enough for his amiable purpose . [Father]5144-father and [son]1034-son , extremely like [each other]1035-each other , looking silently on at the morning traffic in [Fleet - street]962-fleet - street , with [their]1037-their two heads as near to one another as the two eyes of each were , bore a considerable resemblance to a pair of monkeys . The resemblance was not lessened by the accidental circumstance , that [the mature Jerry]156-mr. cruncher bit and spat out straw , while the twinkling eyes of [the youthful Jerry]1038-the youthful jerry were as restlessly watchful of [him]156-mr. cruncher as of everything else in [Fleet - street]962-fleet - street . [The head of one of the regular indoor messengers attached to [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s establishment]1041-tellson ’s establishment]1040-the head of one of the regular indoor messengers attached to tellson ’s establishment was put through the door , and the word was given : “ [Porter]161-porter wanted ! ”[1040-the head of one of the regular indoor messengers attached to tellson ’s establishment] “ Hooray , [father]5144-father ! Here ’s an early job to begin with ! ”[1040-the head of one of the regular indoor messengers attached to tellson ’s establishment] Having thus given [his]156-mr. cruncher parent God speed , [young Jerry]156-mr. cruncher seated [himself]156-mr. cruncher on the stool , entered on [his]156-mr. cruncher reversionary interest in the straw [[his]156-mr. cruncher father]1015-his father had been chewing , and cogitated . “ [Al - ways rusty]5149-al - ways rusty ! [His]1015-his father fingers is al - ways rusty ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] muttered [young Jerry]156-mr. cruncher . “ Where does [[my]156-mr. cruncher father]4969-my father get all that iron rust from ? [He]4969-my father do n’t get no iron rust here ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] CHAPTER II . A Sight “ [You]156-mr. cruncher know [the Old Bailey]39-the old bailey well , no doubt ? ”[1045-clerks] said [one of [the oldest of [clerks]1045-clerks]1044-the oldest of clerks to [[Jerry]156-mr. cruncher [the messenger]513-the messenger]1046-jerry the messenger]1043-one of the oldest of clerks to jerry the messenger . “ [Ye]156-mr. cruncher - es , [sir]4862-sir , ”[156-mr. cruncher] returned [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher , in something of a dogged manner . “ [I]156-mr. cruncher _ do _ know [the Bailey]40-the bailey . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Just so . And [you]156-mr. cruncher know [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . ”[1044-the oldest of clerks] “ [I]133-mr. lorry know [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , [sir]4862-sir , much better than [I]133-mr. lorry know [the Bailey]5153-the bailey .
