[He]5157-the door - keeper will then let [you]156-mr. cruncher in . ”[1044-the oldest of clerks] “ Into [the court]4990-the court , [sir]4862-sir ? ”[1044-the oldest of clerks] “ Into [the court]4990-the court . ”[156-mr. cruncher] [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s eyes seemed to get a little closer to [one another]411-one another , and to interchange the inquiry , “ What do [you]4862-sir think of this ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Am [I]156-mr. cruncher to wait in [the court]4990-the court , [sir]4862-sir ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] [he]156-mr. cruncher asked , as the result of that conference . “ [I]156-mr. cruncher am going to tell [you]4862-sir . [The door - keeper]5157-the door - keeper will pass the note to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , and do [you]4862-sir make any gesture that will attract [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s attention , and show [him]133-mr. lorry where [you]4862-sir stand . Then what [you]4862-sir have to do , is , to remain there until [he]133-mr. lorry wants [you]4862-sir . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Is that all , [sir]4862-sir ? ”[1050-the ancient clerk] “ That ’s all . [He]133-mr. lorry wishes to have [a messenger]4927-a messenger at hand . This is to tell [him]133-mr. lorry [you]4862-sir are there . ”[156-mr. cruncher] As [the ancient clerk]1050-the ancient clerk deliberately folded and superscribed the note , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , after surveying [him]1050-the ancient clerk in silence until [he]156-mr. cruncher came to the blotting - paper stage , remarked : “ [I]156-mr. cruncher suppose [they]5166-they ’ll be trying Forgeries this morning ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Treason ! ”[1050-the ancient clerk] “ That ’s quartering , ”[156-mr. cruncher] said [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher . “ Barbarous ! ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ It is the law , ”[1050-the ancient clerk] remarked [the ancient clerk]1050-the ancient clerk , turning [his]1050-the ancient clerk surprised spectacles upon [him]1050-the ancient clerk . “ It is the law . ”[1050-the ancient clerk] “ It ’s hard in the law to spile [a man]449-a man , [I]156-mr. cruncher think . It ’s hard enough to kill [him]449-a man , but it ’s [wery]5168-wery hard to spile [him]449-a man , [sir]4862-sir . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Not at all , ”[1050-the ancient clerk] retained [the ancient clerk]1050-the ancient clerk . “ Speak well of the law . Take care of [your]4862-sir chest and voice , [[my]1050-the ancient clerk good friend]5170-my good friend , and leave the law to take care of itself . [I]1050-the ancient clerk give [you]4862-sir that advice . ”[1050-the ancient clerk] “ It ’s the damp , [sir]4862-sir , what settles on [my]156-mr. cruncher chest and voice , ”[156-mr. cruncher] said [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher . “ [I]156-mr. cruncher leave [you]4862-sir to judge what a damp way of earning a living [mine]5172-mine is . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Well , well , ”[1053-the old clerk] said [the old clerk]1053-the old clerk ; “ [we]5173-us all have [our]5173-us various ways of gaining a livelihood . Some of [us]5173-us have damp ways , and some of [us]5173-us have dry ways . Here is the letter . Go along . ”[1053-the old clerk] [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher took the letter , and , remarking to [himself]156-mr. cruncher with less internal deference than [he]156-mr. cruncher made an outward show of , “ [You]156-mr. cruncher are [a lean old one]5174-a lean old one , too , ”[156-mr. cruncher] made [his]156-mr. cruncher bow , informed [[his]156-mr. cruncher son]955-his son , in passing , of [his]156-mr. cruncher destination , and went [his]156-mr. cruncher way . [They]1055-they hanged at [Tyburn]41-tyburn , in those days , so [the street outside [Newgate]10-newgate]1056-the street outside newgate had not obtained one infamous notoriety that has since attached to it . But , [the gaol]1057-the gaol was [a vile place]1058-a vile place , in which most kinds of debauchery and villainy were practised , and where dire diseases were bred , that came into court with [the prisoners]1059-the prisoners , and sometimes rushed straight from [the dock]1060-the dock at [[my]0-i Lord Chief Justice [himself]1061-my lord chief justice himself]1061-my lord chief justice himself , and pulled [him]1061-my lord chief justice himself off the bench . It had more than once happened , that [the Judge in the black cap]1062-the judge in the black cap pronounced [his]1062-the judge in the black cap own doom as certainly as [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s , and even died before [him]1062-the judge in the black cap . For the rest , [the Old Bailey]1064-the old bailey was famous as a kind of deadly [inn - yard]1065-inn - yard , from which [pale travellers]1066-pale travellers set out continually , in [carts and coaches]1067-carts and coaches , on a violent passage into [the other world]1068-the other world : traversing some two miles and a half of [public street]1069-public street and [road]391-road , and shaming [few good citizens]1071-few good citizens , if any . So powerful is use , and so desirable to be good use in the beginning . It was famous , too , for the pillory , [a wise old institution]1072-a wise old institution , that inflicted a punishment of which [no one]330-no one could foresee the extent ; also , for the whipping - post , another dear old institution , very humanising and softening to behold in action ; also , for extensive transactions in blood - money , another fragment of ancestral wisdom , systematically leading to the most frightful mercenary crimes that could be committed under Heaven . Altogether , [the Old Bailey]39-the old bailey , at that date , was a choice illustration of the precept , that “ Whatever is is right ; ”[1061-my lord chief justice himself] an aphorism that would be as final as it is lazy , did it not include the troublesome consequence , that nothing that ever was , was wrong . Making [his]1061-my lord chief justice himself way through [the tainted crowd]1074-the tainted crowd , dispersed up and down this hideous scene of action , with the skill of [a man accustomed to make [his]1061-my lord chief justice himself way quietly]1075-a man accustomed to make his way quietly , [the messenger]513-the messenger found out the door [he]1061-my lord chief justice himself sought , and handed in [his]1061-my lord chief justice himself letter through a trap in it . For , [people]360-people then paid to see the play at [the Old Bailey]1064-the old bailey , just as [they]360-people paid to see the play in [Bedlam]42-bedlam -- only the former entertainment was much the dearer . Therefore , [all the Old Bailey]1079-all the old bailey doors were well guarded -- except , indeed , the social doors by which [the criminals]1080-the criminals got [there]4887-there , and those were always left wide open . After some delay and demur , the door grudgingly turned on its hinges a very little way , and allowed [Mr. Jerry Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher to squeeze [himself]156-mr. cruncher into [court]1082-court . “ What ’s on ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] [he]156-mr. cruncher asked , in a whisper , of [the man [he]156-mr. cruncher found [himself]156-mr. cruncher next to]1083-the man he found himself next to . “ Nothing yet . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ What ’s coming on ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ The Treason case . ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ The quartering one , eh ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] “ Ah ! ”[472-the man] returned [the man]472-the man , with a relish ; “ [he]513-the messenger ’ll be drawn on a hurdle to be half hanged , and then [he]513-the messenger ’ll be taken down and sliced before [his]513-the messenger own face , and then [his]513-the messenger inside will be taken out and burnt while [he]513-the messenger looks on , and then [his]513-the messenger head will be chopped off , and [he]513-the messenger ’ll be cut into quarters . That ’s the sentence . ”[472-the man] “ If [he]513-the messenger ’s found Guilty , [you]156-mr. cruncher mean to say ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher added , by way of proviso . “ Oh ! [they]5175-they ’ll find [him]513-the messenger guilty , ”[756-the other] said [the other]756-the other . “ Do n’t [you]156-mr. cruncher be afraid of that . ”[756-the other] [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s attention was here diverted to [the door - keeper , whom [he]156-mr. cruncher saw making [his]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand way to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , with the note in [his]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand hand]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry sat at a table , among [the gentlemen in wigs]1087-the gentlemen in wigs : not far from [a wigged gentleman]1088-a wigged gentleman , [[the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s counsel]1090-the prisoner ’s counsel , who had a great bundle of papers before [him]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand : and nearly opposite [another wigged gentleman with [his]1091-another wigged gentleman with his hands in his pockets hands in [his]1091-another wigged gentleman with his hands in his pockets pockets]1091-another wigged gentleman with his hands in his pockets , whose whole attention , when [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher looked at [him]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand then or afterwards , seemed to be concentrated on the ceiling of [the court]4990-the court . After some gruff coughing and rubbing of [his]156-mr. cruncher chin and signing with [his]156-mr. cruncher hand , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry attracted the notice of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , who had stood up to look for [him]133-mr. lorry , and who quietly nodded and sat down again . “ What ’s _ [he]1086-the door - keeper , whom he saw making his way to mr. lorry , with the note in his hand _ got to do with the case ? ”[133-mr. lorry] asked [the man [he]133-mr. lorry had spoken with]1093-the man he had spoken with . “ Blest if [I]133-mr. lorry know , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . “ What have _ [you]1093-the man he had spoken with _ got to do with it , then , if [a person]5176-a person may inquire ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Blest if [I]133-mr. lorry know that either , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . The entrance of [the Judge]1094-the judge , and a consequent great stir and settling down in [the court]4990-the court , stopped the dialogue . Presently , [the dock]1060-the dock became the central point of interest . [Two gaolers , who had been standing there]1097-two gaolers , who had been standing there , went out , and [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner was brought in , and put to the bar . [Everybody present]1099-everybody present , except [the one wigged gentleman who looked at the ceiling]1100-the one wigged gentleman who looked at the ceiling , stared at [him]133-mr. lorry . All the human breath in [the place]791-the place , rolled at [him]133-mr. lorry , like a sea , or a wind , or a fire . Eager faces strained round pillars and corners , to get a sight of [him]133-mr. lorry ; [spectators in back rows]1102-spectators in back rows stood up , not to miss a hair of [him]133-mr. lorry ; [people on the floor of [the court]4990-the court]1103-people on the floor of the court , laid [their]1103-people on the floor of the court hands on the shoulders of [the people before [them]1103-people on the floor of the court]1105-the people before them , to help [themselves]1103-people on the floor of the court , at [anybody]636-anybody ’s cost , to a view of [him]133-mr. lorry -- stood a - tiptoe , got upon ledges , stood upon next to nothing , to see every inch of [him]133-mr. lorry . Conspicuous among [these latter]1107-these latter , like an animated bit of the spiked wall of [Newgate]10-newgate , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry stood : aiming at [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner the beery breath of a whet [he]133-mr. lorry had taken as [he]133-mr. lorry came along , and discharging it to mingle with the waves of other beer , and gin , and tea , and coffee , and what not , that flowed at [him]133-mr. lorry , and already broke upon the great windows behind [him]133-mr. lorry in an impure mist and rain . [The object of all this staring and blaring]1109-the object of all this staring and blaring , was [a young man of about five - and - twenty]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty , well - grown and well - looking , with a sunburnt cheek and a dark eye . [His]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty condition was that of [a young gentleman]1111-a young gentleman . [He]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty was plainly dressed in black , or very dark grey , and [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty hair , which was long and dark , was gathered in a ribbon at the back of [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty neck ; more to be out of [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty way than for ornament . As an emotion of the mind will express itself through any covering of the body , so the paleness which [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty situation engendered came through the brown upon [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty cheek , showing the soul to be stronger than the sun . [He]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty was otherwise quite self - possessed , bowed to [the Judge]1094-the judge , and stood quiet . The sort of interest with which [this man]5081-this man was stared and breathed at , was not a sort that elevated humanity . Had [he]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty stood in peril of a less horrible sentence -- had there been a chance of any one of its savage details being spared -- by just so much would [he]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty have lost in [his]1110-a young man of about five - and - twenty fascination . The form that was to be doomed to be so shamefully mangled , was the sight ; the immortal creature that was to be so butchered and torn asunder , yielded the sensation . Whatever gloss [the various spectators]1114-the various spectators put upon the interest , according to [their]1114-the various spectators several arts and powers of self - deceit , the interest was , at the root of it , Ogreish . Silence in [the court]4990-the court ! [Charles Darnay]162-darnay had yesterday pleaded Not Guilty to an indictment denouncing [him]162-darnay ( with infinite jingle and jangle ) for that [he]162-darnay was [a false traitor to [our]1117-our serene , illustrious , excellent , and so forth , [prince]1118-prince , [[our]1117-our Lord [the King]4850-the king]1119-our lord the king]1116-a false traitor to our serene , illustrious , excellent , and so forth , prince , our lord the king , by reason of [his]162-darnay having , on divers occasions , and by divers means and ways , assisted [Lewis]163-the said french lewis , [the French King]1121-the french king , in [his]163-the said french lewis wars against [our]1117-our said serene , illustrious , excellent , and so forth ; that was to say , by coming and going , between the dominions of [[our]1117-our said serene]1122-our said serene , illustrious , excellent , and so forth , and those of [the said French Lewis]163-the said french lewis , and wickedly , falsely , traitorously , and otherwise evil - adverbiously , revealing to [the said French Lewis]163-the said french lewis what forces [our]1117-our said serene , illustrious , excellent , and so forth , had in preparation to send to [Canada]43-canada and [North America]44-north america . This much , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , with [his]133-mr. lorry head becoming more and more spiky as the law terms bristled it , made out with huge satisfaction , and so arrived circuitously at the understanding that [the aforesaid]1123-the aforesaid , and over and over again aforesaid , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , stood there before [him]133-mr. lorry upon [his]133-mr. lorry trial ; that [the jury]1124-the jury were swearing in ; and that [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general was making ready to speak . [The accused]1126-the accused , who was ( and who knew [he]1126-the accused [was ) being mentally hanged , beheaded , and quartered]1127-was ) being mentally hanged , beheaded , and quartered , by [everybody there]1128-everybody there , neither flinched from the situation , nor assumed any theatrical air in it . [He]133-mr. lorry was quiet and attentive ; watched the opening proceedings with a grave interest ; and stood with [his]133-mr. lorry hands resting on the slab of wood before [him]133-mr. lorry , so composedly , that [they]1129-they had not displaced a leaf of the herbs with which it was strewn . [The court]4990-the court was all bestrewn with herbs and sprinkled with vinegar , as a precaution against gaol air and gaol fever . Over [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s head there was a mirror , to throw the light down upon [him]5091-the prisoner . [Crowds of the wicked]1132-crowds of the wicked and the wretched had been reflected in it , and had passed from its surface and [this earth]1133-this earth ’s together . Haunted in a most ghastly manner that abominable place would have been , if the glass could ever have rendered back its reflections , as [the ocean]1134-the ocean is one day to give up its dead . Some passing thought of the infamy and disgrace for which it had been reserved , may have struck [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s mind . Be that as it may , a change in [his]5091-the prisoner position making [him]5091-the prisoner conscious of a bar of light across [his]5091-the prisoner face , [he]5091-the prisoner looked up ; and when [he]5091-the prisoner saw the glass [his]5091-the prisoner face flushed , and [his]5091-the prisoner right hand pushed the herbs away . It happened , that the action turned [his]5091-the prisoner face to that side of the court which was on [his]5091-the prisoner left . About on a level with [his]5091-the prisoner eyes , there sat , in that corner of [[the Judge]1094-the judge ’s bench]1137-the judge ’s bench , [two persons upon whom]1138-two persons upon whom [his]5091-the prisoner look immediately rested ; so immediately , and so much to the changing of [his]5091-the prisoner aspect , that all the eyes that were turned upon [him]5091-the prisoner , turned to [them]1138-two persons upon whom . [The spectators]1139-the spectators saw in [the two figures]1140-the two figures , [a young lady of little more than twenty]1141-a young lady of little more than twenty , and [a gentleman who was evidently [[her]1141-a young lady of little more than twenty father]5008-her father ; [a man of a very remarkable appearance in respect of the absolute whiteness of [his]5091-the prisoner hair , and a certain indescribable intensity of face]1144-a man of a very remarkable appearance in respect of the absolute whiteness of his hair , and a certain indescribable intensity of face : [not of an active kind , but pondering and self - communing]1145-not of an active kind , but pondering and self - communing . When this expression was upon [him]5091-the prisoner , [he]5091-the prisoner looked as if [he]5091-the prisoner were old]1142-a gentleman who was evidently her father ; a man of a very remarkable appearance in respect of the absolute whiteness of his hair , and a certain indescribable intensity of face : not of an active kind , but pondering and self - communing . when this expression was upon him , he looked as if he were old ; but when it was stirred and broken up -- as it was now , in a moment , on [his]5091-the prisoner speaking to [[his]5091-the prisoner daughter]889-his daughter -- [he]5091-the prisoner became [a handsome man , not past the prime of life]1147-a handsome man , not past the prime of life . [[His]5091-the prisoner daughter]889-his daughter had one of [her]889-his daughter hands drawn through [his]5091-the prisoner arm , as [she]889-his daughter sat by [him]5091-the prisoner , and the other pressed upon it . [She]889-his daughter had drawn close to [him]5091-the prisoner , in [her]889-his daughter dread of the scene , and in [her]889-his daughter pity for [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . [Her]889-his daughter forehead had been strikingly expressive of an engrossing terror and compassion that saw nothing but the peril of [the accused]1126-the accused . This had been so very noticeable , so very powerfully and naturally shown , that starers who had had no pity for [him]5091-the prisoner were touched by [her]889-his daughter ; and the whisper went about , “ Who are [they]1152-they ? ”[133-mr. lorry] [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , [the messenger , who had made [his]133-mr. lorry own observations , in [his]133-mr. lorry own manner , and who had been sucking the rust off [his]133-mr. lorry fingers in [his]133-mr. lorry absorption]1151-the messenger , who had made his own observations , in his own manner , and who had been sucking the rust off his fingers in his absorption , stretched [his]133-mr. lorry neck to hear who [they]1152-they were . [The crowd about [him]133-mr. lorry]1153-the crowd about him had pressed and passed the inquiry on to [the nearest attendant]1154-the nearest attendant , and from [him]133-mr. lorry it had been more slowly pressed and passed back ; at last it got to [Jerry]133-mr. lorry : “ [Witnesses]5177-witnesses . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ For which side ? ”[1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction] “ Against . ”[1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction] “ Against what side ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s . ”[1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction] [The Judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction]1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction , recalled [them]1152-they , leaned back in [his]1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction seat , and looked steadily at [the man whose life was in [his]1155-the judge , whose eyes had gone in the general direction hand]1156-the man whose life was in his hand , as [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general rose to spin the rope , grind the axe , and hammer the nails into the scaffold . CHAPTER III . [A Disappointment Mr. Attorney - General]1158-a disappointment mr. attorney - general had to inform [the jury]1124-the jury , that [the prisoner before [them]1124-the jury]1160-the prisoner before them , though young in years , was old in the treasonable practices which claimed the forfeit of [his]1160-the prisoner before them life . That this correspondence with [the public enemy]1161-the public enemy was not a correspondence of to - day , or of yesterday , or even of last year , or of the year before . That , it was certain [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner had , for longer than that , been in the habit of passing and repassing between [France]2-france and [England]1-england , on secret business of which [he]5091-the prisoner could give no honest account . That , if it were in the nature of traitorous ways to thrive ( which happily it never was ) , the real wickedness and guilt of [his]5091-the prisoner business might have remained undiscovered . That [Providence]143-providence , however , had put it into the heart of [a person who was beyond fear and beyond reproach]1163-a person who was beyond fear and beyond reproach , to ferret out the nature of [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s schemes , and , struck with horror , to disclose them to [[his]5091-the prisoner Majesty ’s Chief Secretary of State]1165-his majesty ’s chief secretary of state and [most honourable Privy Council]1166-most honourable privy council . That , [this patriot]1167-this patriot would be produced before [them]1124-the jury . That , [his]1160-the prisoner before them position and attitude were , on the whole , sublime . That , [he]1160-the prisoner before them had been [[the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s friend]1169-the prisoner ’s friend , but , at once in an auspicious and an evil hour detecting [his]1160-the prisoner before them infamy , had resolved to immolate [the traitor [he]1160-the prisoner before them could no longer cherish in [his]1160-the prisoner before them bosom , on the sacred altar of [[his]1160-the prisoner before them country]1171-his country]1170-the traitor he could no longer cherish in his bosom , on the sacred altar of his country . That , if statues were decreed in [Britain]45-britain , as in ancient [Greece]46-greece and [Rome]47-rome , to [public benefactors]1172-public benefactors , [this shining citizen]1173-this shining citizen would assuredly have had one . That , as they were not so decreed , [he]1173-this shining citizen probably would not have one . That , Virtue , as had been observed by [the poets]1174-the poets ( in many passages which [he]1160-the prisoner before them well knew [the jury]1124-the jury would have , word for word , at the tips of [their]1124-the jury tongues ; whereat [the jury]1124-the jury ’s countenances displayed a guilty consciousness that [they]1124-the jury knew nothing about the passages ) , was in a manner contagious ; more especially the bright virtue known as patriotism , or love of [country]1177-country . That , the lofty example of [this immaculate and unimpeachable witness for the Crown]1178-this immaculate and unimpeachable witness for the crown , to refer to whom however unworthily was an honour , had communicated itself to [[the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s servant]1180-the prisoner ’s servant , and had engendered in [him]5091-the prisoner a holy determination to examine [[his]5091-the prisoner master]1181-his master ’s table - drawers and pockets , and secrete [his]5091-the prisoner papers . That , [he]1160-the prisoner before them ( [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general ) was prepared to hear some disparagement attempted of [this admirable servant]1183-this admirable servant ; but that , in a general way , [he]1160-the prisoner before them preferred [him]5091-the prisoner to [[his]1160-the prisoner before them ( [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general ’s ) brothers and [sisters]1186-sisters]1184-his ( mr. attorney - general ’s ) brothers and sisters , and honoured [him]5091-the prisoner more than [[his]1160-the prisoner before them ( [Mr. Attorney - General]164-mr. attorney - general ’s ) father]1187-his ( mr. attorney - general ’s ) father and [mother]5143-mother . That , [he]1160-the prisoner before them called with confidence on [the jury]1124-the jury to come and do likewise . That , the evidence of [these two witnesses]1190-these two witnesses , coupled with the documents of [their]1190-these two witnesses discovering that would be produced , would show [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner to have been furnished with lists of [[his]1160-the prisoner before them Majesty]1192-his majesty ’s forces , and of [their]1190-these two witnesses disposition and preparation , both by [sea]581-sea and [land]1194-land , and would leave no doubt that [he]5091-the prisoner had habitually conveyed such information to [a hostile power]1195-a hostile power . That , these lists could not be proved to be in [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s handwriting ; but that it was all the same ; that , indeed , it was rather the better for [the prosecution]1197-the prosecution , as showing [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner to be artful in [his]5091-the prisoner precautions . That , the proof would go back five years , and would show [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner already engaged in these pernicious missions , within a few weeks before the date of the very first action fought between [the British troops]1200-the british troops and [the Americans]165-the americans . That , for these reasons , [the jury]1124-the jury , being [a loyal jury]1202-a loyal jury ( as [he]5091-the prisoner knew [they]1124-the jury were ) , and being [a responsible jury]1203-a responsible jury ( as _ [they]1124-the jury _ knew [they]1124-the jury were ) , must positively find [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner Guilty , and make an end of [him]5091-the prisoner , whether [they]1124-the jury liked it or not . That , [they]1124-the jury never could lay [their]1124-the jury heads upon [their]1124-the jury pillows ; that , [they]1124-the jury never could tolerate the idea of [[their]1124-the jury wives]1205-their wives laying [their]1205-their wives heads upon [their]1205-their wives pillows ; that , [they]1124-the jury never could endure the notion of [[their]1124-the jury children]1206-their children laying [their]1206-their children heads upon [their]1206-their children pillows ; in short , that there never more could be , for [them]1206-their children or [theirs]1206-their children , any laying of heads upon pillows at all , unless [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s head was taken off . [That head Mr. Attorney - General]1208-that head mr. attorney - general concluded by demanding of [them]1124-the jury , in the name of everything [he]5091-the prisoner could think of with a round turn in it , and on the faith of [his]5091-the prisoner solemn asseveration that [he]5091-the prisoner already considered [the prisoner as good as dead and gone]1209-the prisoner as good as dead and gone . When [the Attorney - General]1210-the attorney - general ceased , a buzz arose in [the court]4990-the court as if a cloud of great blue - flies were swarming about [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , in anticipation of what [he]5091-the prisoner was soon to become . When toned down again , [the unimpeachable patriot]1213-the unimpeachable patriot appeared in the witness - box . [Mr. Solicitor - General]166-mr. solicitor - general then , following [[his]166-mr. solicitor - general leader]1214-his leader ’s lead , examined [the patriot]1215-the patriot : [John Barsad]167-barsad , [gentleman]4883-gentleman , by name . The story of [his]5091-the prisoner pure soul was exactly what [Mr. Attorney - General]164-mr. attorney - general had described it to be -- perhaps , if it had a fault , a little too exactly . Having released [his]5091-the prisoner noble bosom of its burden , [he]5091-the prisoner would have modestly withdrawn [himself]5091-the prisoner , but that [the wigged gentleman with the papers]1217-the wigged gentleman with the papers before [him]5091-the prisoner , sitting not far from [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , begged to ask [him]5091-the prisoner a few questions . [The wigged gentleman]1218-the wigged gentleman sitting opposite , still looking at the ceiling of [the court]4990-the court . Had [he]1218-the wigged gentleman ever been [a spy]1220-a spy [himself]1218-the wigged gentleman ? No , [he]1218-the wigged gentleman scorned the base insinuation . What did [he]1218-the wigged gentleman live upon ? [[His]1218-the wigged gentleman property]1221-his property . Where was [[his]1218-the wigged gentleman property]1221-his property ? [He]1218-the wigged gentleman did n’t precisely remember where it was . What was it ? No business of [anybody]636-anybody ’s . Had [he]1218-the wigged gentleman inherited it ? Yes , [he]1218-the wigged gentleman had . From whom ? [Distant relation]1224-distant relation . Very distant ? Rather . Ever been in [prison]5014-prison ? Certainly not . Never in [a debtors ’ prison]1226-a debtors ’ prison ? Did n’t see what that had to do with it . Never in [a debtors ’ prison?--Come]1227-a debtors ’ prison?--come , once again . Never ? Yes . How many times ? Two or three times . Not five or six ? Perhaps . Of what profession ? [Gentleman]4883-gentleman . Ever been kicked ? Might have been . Frequently ? No . Ever kicked [downstairs]1229-downstairs ? Decidedly not ; once received a kick on the top of a staircase , and fell [downstairs]1229-downstairs of [his]1218-the wigged gentleman own accord . Kicked on that occasion for cheating at dice ? Something to that effect was said by [the intoxicated liar who committed the assault]1231-the intoxicated liar who committed the assault , but it was not true . Swear it was not true ? Positively . Ever live by cheating at play ? Never . Ever live by play ? Not more than [other gentlemen]1232-other gentlemen do . Ever borrow money of [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ? Yes . Ever pay [him]5091-the prisoner ? No . Was not this intimacy with [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , in reality a very slight one , forced upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner in [coaches]1236-coaches , [inns]1237-inns , and [packets]1238-packets ? No . Sure [he]1218-the wigged gentleman saw [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner with these lists ? Certain . Knew no more about the lists ? No . Had not procured them [himself]1218-the wigged gentleman , for instance ? No . Expect to get anything by this evidence ? No . Not in regular government pay and employment , to lay traps ? Oh dear no . Or to do anything ? Oh dear no . Swear that ? Over and over again . No motives but motives of sheer patriotism ? None whatever . [The virtuous servant]1240-the virtuous servant , [Roger Cly]168-cly , swore [his]168-cly way through the case at a great rate . [He]168-cly had taken service with [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , in good faith and simplicity , four years ago . [He]168-cly had asked [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , aboard the [Calais]21-calais packet , if [he]168-cly wanted [a handy fellow]1243-a handy fellow , and [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner had engaged [him]168-cly . [He]168-cly had not asked [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner to take [the handy fellow]1246-the handy fellow as an act of charity -- never thought of such a thing . [He]168-cly began to have suspicions of [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , and to keep an eye upon [him]5091-the prisoner , soon afterwards . In arranging [his]168-cly clothes , while travelling , [he]168-cly had seen similar lists to these in [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s pockets , over and over again . [He]168-cly had taken these lists from the drawer of [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s desk . [He]168-cly had not put them there first . [He]168-cly had seen [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner show these identical lists to [French gentlemen]1251-french gentlemen at [Calais]21-calais , and similar lists to [French gentlemen]1251-french gentlemen , both at [Calais]21-calais and [Boulogne]48-boulogne . [He]168-cly loved [[his]168-cly country]1171-his country , and could n’t bear it , and had given information . [He]168-cly had never been suspected of stealing a silver tea - pot ; [he]168-cly had been maligned respecting a mustard - pot , but it turned out to be only a plated one . [He]168-cly had known [the last witness]1254-the last witness seven or eight years ; that was merely a coincidence . [He]168-cly did n’t call it a particularly curious coincidence ; most coincidences were curious . Neither did [he]168-cly call it a curious coincidence that true patriotism was _ [his]168-cly _ only motive too . [He]168-cly was [a true Briton]1255-a true briton , and hoped there were [many like [him]168-cly]1256-many like him . The blue - flies buzzed again , and [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general called [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry , are [you]133-mr. lorry [a clerk in [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s bank]4863-tellson ’s bank]5179-a clerk in tellson ’s bank ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]1125-mr. attorney - general am . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ On a certain Friday night in November one thousand seven hundred and seventy - five , did business occasion [you]133-mr. lorry to travel between [London]3-london and [Dover]15-dover by the mail ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ It did . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Were there [any other passengers in the mail]5181-any other passengers in the mail ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Two . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Did [they]5181-any other passengers in the mail alight on [the road]377-the road in the course of the night ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [They]5181-any other passengers in the mail did . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , look upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . Was [he]5091-the prisoner [one of [those two passengers]5185-those two passengers]5184-one of those two passengers ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]1125-mr. attorney - general can not undertake to say that [he]5091-the prisoner was . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Does [he]5091-the prisoner resemble [either of [these two passengers]5187-these two passengers]5186-either of these two passengers ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [Both]5188-both were so wrapped up , and the night was so dark , and [we]5187-these two passengers were all so reserved , that [I]133-mr. lorry can not undertake to say even that . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , look again upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . Supposing [him]5091-the prisoner wrapped up as [those two passengers]5185-those two passengers were , is there anything in [his]5091-the prisoner bulk and stature to render it unlikely that [he]5091-the prisoner was [one of [them]5185-those two passengers]5191-one of them ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ No . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [You]133-mr. lorry will not swear , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , that [he]5091-the prisoner was not one of [them]5185-those two passengers ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ No . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ So at least [you]133-mr. lorry say [he]5091-the prisoner may have been [one of [them]5185-those two passengers]5191-one of them ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Yes . Except that [I]1125-mr. attorney - general remember [them]5185-those two passengers both to have been -- like [myself]1125-mr. attorney - general -- timorous of [highwaymen]5193-highwaymen , and [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner has not a timorous air . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Did [you]133-mr. lorry ever see a counterfeit of timidity , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]1125-mr. attorney - general certainly have seen that . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , look once more upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . [He]5091-the prisoner was [the only passenger who came on board in the dead of the night]5200-the only passenger who came on board in the dead of the night ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [He]5091-the prisoner was . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Were [you]133-mr. lorry travelling alone , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , or with [any companion]5201-any companion ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ With [two companions]5202-two companions . The weather was stormy , and the passage long and rough , and [I]1125-mr. attorney - general lay on a sofa , almost from [shore]5206-shore to [shore]5206-shore . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [Miss Manette]140-miss manette ! ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] [The young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again , stood up where [she]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again had sat . [[Her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again father]5008-her father rose with [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again , and kept [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again hand drawn through [his]5008-her father arm . “ [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , look upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . ”[5008-her father] To be confronted with such pity , and such earnest youth and beauty , was far more trying to [the accused]1126-the accused than to be confronted with [all the crowd]1261-all the crowd . Standing , as it were , apart with [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again on the edge of [his]5008-her father grave , not all the staring curiosity that looked on , could , for the moment , nerve [him]5008-her father to remain quite still . [His]5008-her father hurried right hand parcelled out the herbs before [him]5008-her father into imaginary beds of flowers in [a garden]1262-a garden ; and [his]5008-her father efforts to control and steady [his]5008-her father breathing shook the lips from which the colour rushed to [his]5008-her father heart . The buzz of the great flies was loud again . “ [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , have [you]140-miss manette seen [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner before ? ”[1094-the judge] “ Yes , [sir]4862-sir . ”[1094-the judge] “ Where ? ”[1094-the judge] “ On board of [the packet - ship]5211-the packet - ship just now referred to , [sir]4862-sir , and on the same occasion . ”[1094-the judge] “ [You]140-miss manette are [the young lady]642-the young lady just now referred to ? ”[1094-the judge] “ O ! most unhappily , [I]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again am ! ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] The plaintive tone of [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again compassion merged into the less musical voice of [the Judge]1094-the judge , as [he]5008-her father said something fiercely : “ Answer the questions put to [you]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again , and make no remark upon them . ”[5008-her father] “ [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , had [you]140-miss manette any conversation with [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner on [that passage across [the Channel]5216-the channel]5215-that passage across the channel ? ”[1094-the judge] “ Yes , [sir]4862-sir . ”[1094-the judge] “ Recall it . ”[5008-her father] In the midst of a profound stillness , [she]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again faintly began : “ When [the gentleman]4926-the gentleman came on board-- ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ Do [you]140-miss manette mean [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ? ”[1094-the judge] inquired [the Judge]1094-the judge , knitting [his]1094-the judge brows . “ Yes , [[my]1094-the judge Lord]5220-my lord . ”[1094-the judge] “ Then say [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ When [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner came on board , [he]5091-the prisoner noticed that [[my]1094-the judge father]4969-my father , ”[1094-the judge] turning [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again eyes lovingly to [him]1094-the judge as [he]1094-the judge stood beside [her]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again , “ was much fatigued and in a very weak state of health . [[My]1094-the judge father]4969-my father was so reduced that [I]1094-the judge was afraid to take [him]4969-my father out of the air , and [I]1094-the judge had made a bed for [him]4969-my father on [the deck near [the cabin steps]5226-the cabin steps]5225-the deck near the cabin steps , and [I]1094-the judge sat on the deck at [his]4969-my father side to take care of [him]4969-my father . There were [no other passengers]5227-no other passengers that night , but [we]5228-we four . [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner was so good as to beg permission to advise [me]1094-the judge how [I]1094-the judge could shelter [[my]1094-the judge father]4969-my father from the wind and weather , better than [I]1094-the judge had done . [I]1094-the judge had not known how to do it well , not understanding how the wind would set when [we]5228-we were out of [the harbour]5231-the harbour . [He]5091-the prisoner did it for [me]1094-the judge . [He]5091-the prisoner expressed great gentleness and kindness for [[my]1094-the judge father]4969-my father ’s state , and [I]1094-the judge am sure [he]5091-the prisoner felt it . That was the manner of [our]5228-we beginning to speak together . ”[1094-the judge] “ Let [me]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again interrupt [you]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again for a moment . ”[1094-the judge] “ [Two French gentlemen]5233-two french gentlemen . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ Had [they]5233-two french gentlemen conferred together ? ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ [They]5233-two french gentlemen had conferred together until the last moment , when it was necessary for [the French gentlemen]5234-the french gentlemen to be landed in [[their]5233-two french gentlemen boat]5235-their boat . ”[1094-the judge] “ Had any papers been handed about among [them]5233-two french gentlemen , similar to these lists ? ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ Some papers had been handed about among [them]5233-two french gentlemen , but [I]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again do n’t know what papers . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ Like these in shape and size ? ”[1094-the judge] “ Possibly , but indeed [I]1094-the judge do n’t know , although [they]5233-two french gentlemen stood whispering very near to [me]1094-the judge : because [they]5233-two french gentlemen stood at the top of [the cabin steps]5226-the cabin steps to have the light of the lamp that was hanging there ; it was a dull lamp , and [they]5233-two french gentlemen spoke very low , and [I]1094-the judge did not hear what [they]5233-two french gentlemen said , and saw only that [they]5233-two french gentlemen looked at papers . ”[1094-the judge] “ Now , to [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s conversation , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner was as open in [his]5091-the prisoner confidence with [me]1094-the judge -- which arose out of [my]1094-the judge helpless situation -- as [he]5091-the prisoner was kind , and good , and useful to [[my]1094-the judge father]4969-my father . [I]1094-the judge hope , ”[1094-the judge] bursting into tears , “ [I]1094-the judge may not repay [him]5091-the prisoner by doing [him]5091-the prisoner harm to - day . ”[1094-the judge] Buzzing from the blue - flies . “ [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , if [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner does not perfectly understand that [you]140-miss manette give the evidence which it is [your]140-miss manette duty to give -- which [you]140-miss manette must give -- and which [you]140-miss manette can not escape from giving -- with great unwillingness , [he]5091-the prisoner is [the only person present in that condition]5241-the only person present in that condition . Please to go on . ”[1094-the judge] “ [He]5091-the prisoner told [me]1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again that [he]5091-the prisoner was travelling on business of a delicate and difficult nature , which might get [people]360-people into trouble , and that [he]5091-the prisoner was therefore travelling under an assumed name . [He]5091-the prisoner said that this business had , within a few days , taken [him]5091-the prisoner to [France]2-france , and might , at intervals , take [him]5091-the prisoner backwards and forwards between [France]2-france and [England]1-england for a long time to come . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ Did [he]5091-the prisoner say anything about [America]5-america , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette ? Be particular . ”[1258-the young lady , to whom all eyes had been turned before , and were now turned again] “ [He]5091-the prisoner tried to explain to [me]1094-the judge how that quarrel had arisen , and [he]5091-the prisoner said that , so far as [he]5091-the prisoner could judge , it was a wrong and foolish one on [England]1-england ’s part . [He]5091-the prisoner added , in a jesting way , that perhaps [George Washington]138-george washington might gain almost as great a name in history as [George the Third]169-george the third . But there was no harm in [his]5091-the prisoner way of saying this : it was said laughingly , and to beguile the time . ”[1094-the judge] Any strongly marked expression of face on the part of [a chief actor in a scene of great interest to whom many eyes]1265-a chief actor in a scene of great interest to whom many eyes are directed , will be unconsciously imitated by [the spectators]1139-the spectators . [Her]1267-she forehead was painfully anxious and intent as [she]1267-she gave this evidence , and , in the pauses when [she]1267-she stopped for [the Judge]1094-the judge to write it down , watched its effect upon [the counsel]1269-the counsel for and against . Among [the lookers - on]1270-the lookers - on there was the same expression in all quarters of [the court]4990-the court ; insomuch , that a great majority of the foreheads there , might have been mirrors reflecting [the witness]1272-the witness , when [the Judge]1094-the judge looked up from [his]1094-the judge notes to glare at that tremendous heresy about [George Washington]138-george washington . [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general now signified to [[my]0-i Lord]5220-my lord , that [he]1125-mr. attorney - general deemed it necessary , as a matter of precaution and form , to call [[the young lady]642-the young lady ’s father]1277-the young lady ’s father , [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette . Who was called accordingly . “ [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , look upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . Have [you]170-doctor manette ever seen [him]5091-the prisoner before ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Once . When [he]5091-the prisoner called at [[my]1125-mr. attorney - general lodgings in [London]3-london]5244-my lodgings in london . Some three years , or three years and a half ago . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Can [you]170-doctor manette identify [him]5091-the prisoner as [[your]170-doctor manette fellow - passenger on board [the packet]5246-the packet]5245-your fellow - passenger on board the packet , or speak to [his]5091-the prisoner conversation with [[your]170-doctor manette daughter]5247-your daughter ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [Sir]4862-sir , [I]1125-mr. attorney - general can do neither . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Is there any particular and special reason for [your]1125-mr. attorney - general being unable to do either ? ”[170-doctor manette] [He]170-doctor manette answered , in a low voice , “ There is . ”[170-doctor manette] “ Has it been [your]1125-mr. attorney - general misfortune to undergo a long imprisonment , without trial , or even accusation , in [[your]1125-mr. attorney - general native country]5249-your native country , [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette ? ”[170-doctor manette] [He]170-doctor manette answered , in a tone that went to every heart , “ A long imprisonment . ”[170-doctor manette] “ Were [you]1125-mr. attorney - general newly released on the occasion in question ? ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ [They]5250-they tell [me]1125-mr. attorney - general so . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] “ Have [you]1125-mr. attorney - general no remembrance of the occasion ? ”[170-doctor manette] “ None . [My]1125-mr. attorney - general mind is a blank , from some time -- [I]1125-mr. attorney - general can not even say what time -- when [I]1125-mr. attorney - general employed [myself]1125-mr. attorney - general , in [my]1125-mr. attorney - general captivity , in making shoes , to the time when [I]1125-mr. attorney - general found [myself]1125-mr. attorney - general living in [London]3-london with [[my]1125-mr. attorney - general dear daughter]5251-my dear daughter here . [She]5251-my dear daughter had become familiar to [me]1125-mr. attorney - general , when [a gracious God]5252-a gracious god restored [my]1125-mr. attorney - general faculties ; but , [I]1125-mr. attorney - general am quite unable even to say how [she]5251-my dear daughter had become familiar . [I]1125-mr. attorney - general have no remembrance of the process . ”[1125-mr. attorney - general] [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general sat down , and [the father]899-the father and [daughter]900-daughter sat down together . A singular circumstance then arose in the case . The object in hand being to show that [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner went down , with [some fellow - plotter untracked]1282-some fellow - plotter untracked , in the [Dover]15-dover mail on that Friday night in November five years ago , and got out of the mail in the night , as [a blind]1283-a blind , at a place where [he]5091-the prisoner did not remain , but from which [he]5091-the prisoner travelled back some dozen miles or more , to [a garrison and dockyard]1284-a garrison and dockyard , and there collected information ; [a witness]1285-a witness was called to identify [him]5091-the prisoner as having been at the precise time required , in [the coffee - room of [an hotel in [that garrison -]1288-that garrison - and - [dockyard town]1289-dockyard town]1287-an hotel in that garrison - and - dockyard town]1286-the coffee - room of an hotel in that garrison - and - dockyard town , waiting for [another person]1290-another person . [[The prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s counsel]1090-the prisoner ’s counsel was cross - examining [this witness]1293-this witness with no result , except that [he]1090-the prisoner ’s counsel had never seen [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner on any other occasion , when [the wigged gentleman who had all this time]1295-the wigged gentleman who had all this time been looking at the ceiling of [the court]4990-the court , wrote a word or two on a little piece of paper , screwed it up , and tossed it to [him]5091-the prisoner . Opening this piece of paper in the next pause , [the counsel]1269-the counsel looked with great attention and curiosity at [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . “ [You]1272-the witness say again [you]1272-the witness are quite sure that it was [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ? ”[1269-the counsel] [The witness]1272-the witness was quite sure . “ Did [you]1272-the witness ever see [anybody]636-anybody very like [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ? ”[1272-the witness] Not so like ( [the witness]1272-the witness said ) as that [he]1272-the witness could be mistaken . “ Look well upon [that gentleman]5256-that gentleman , [[my]1272-the witness learned friend]5257-my learned friend there , ”[1272-the witness] pointing to [him]1295-the wigged gentleman who had all this time who had tossed the paper over , “ and then look well upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . How say [you]1272-the witness ? Are [they]1302-they very like [each other]1035-each other ? ”[1272-the witness] Allowing for [[my]0-i learned friend]5257-my learned friend ’s appearance being careless and slovenly if not debauched , [they]1302-they were sufficiently like [each other]1035-each other to surprise , not only [the witness]1272-the witness , but [everybody present]1099-everybody present , when [they]1302-they were thus brought into comparison . [[My]0-i Lord]5220-my lord being prayed to bid [[my]0-i learned friend]5257-my learned friend lay aside [his]5257-my learned friend wig , and giving no very gracious consent , the likeness became much more remarkable . [[My]0-i Lord]5220-my lord inquired of [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver ( [[the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s counsel]1090-the prisoner ’s counsel ) , whether [they]1311-they were next to try [Mr. Carton]172-carton ( name of [[my]0-i learned friend]5257-my learned friend ) for treason ? But , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver replied to [[my]0-i Lord]5220-my lord , no ; but [he]171-mr. stryver would ask [the witness]1272-the witness to tell [him]171-mr. stryver whether what happened once , might happen twice ; whether [he]171-mr. stryver would have been so confident if [he]171-mr. stryver had seen this illustration of [his]171-mr. stryver rashness sooner , whether [he]171-mr. stryver would be so confident , having seen it ; and more . The upshot of which , was , to smash [this witness]1293-this witness like [a crockery vessel]1316-a crockery vessel , and shiver [his]171-mr. stryver part of the case to useless lumber . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher had by this time taken quite a lunch of rust off [his]156-mr. cruncher fingers in [his]156-mr. cruncher following of the evidence . [He]156-mr. cruncher had now to attend while [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver fitted [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s case on the jury , like a compact suit of clothes ; showing [them]1318-them how [the patriot]1215-the patriot , [Barsad]167-barsad , was [a hired spy]1320-a hired spy and [traitor]1321-traitor , [an unblushing trafficker in blood]1322-an unblushing trafficker in blood , and one of the greatest scoundrels upon [earth]1323-earth since [accursed Judas]173-accursed judas -- which [he]167-barsad certainly did look rather like . How [the virtuous servant]1240-the virtuous servant , [Cly]168-cly , was [[his]171-mr. stryver friend]1325-his friend and partner , and was worthy to be ; how the watchful eyes of those forgers and [false swearers]1326-false swearers had rested on [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner as [a victim]1328-a victim , because some family affairs in [France]2-france , [he]167-barsad being of French extraction , did require [his]167-barsad making those passages across [the Channel]5216-the channel -- though what those affairs were , a consideration for [others who were near and dear to [him]167-barsad]1330-others who were near and dear to him , forbade [him]167-barsad , even for [his]167-barsad life , to disclose . How the evidence that had been warped and wrested from [the young lady]642-the young lady , whose anguish in giving it [they]1332-they had witnessed , came to nothing , involving the mere little innocent gallantries and politenesses likely to pass between [any young gentleman]1333-any young gentleman and [young lady so thrown together;--with the exception of]1334-young lady so thrown together;--with the exception of that reference to [George Washington]138-george washington , which was altogether too extravagant and impossible to be regarded in any other light than as a monstrous joke . How it would be a weakness in [the government]1335-the government to break down in this attempt to practise for popularity on the lowest national antipathies and fears , and therefore [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general had made the most of it ; how , nevertheless , it rested upon nothing , save that vile and infamous character of evidence too often disfiguring such cases , and of which the State Trials of [this country]1337-this country were full . But , there [[my]0-i Lord]5220-my lord interposed ( with as grave a face as if it had not been true ) , saying that [he]5220-my lord could not sit upon [that Bench]1339-that bench and suffer those allusions . [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver then called [[his]171-mr. stryver few witnesses]1340-his few witnesses , and [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher had next to attend while [Mr. Attorney - General]1125-mr. attorney - general turned the whole suit of clothes [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver had fitted on the jury , inside out ; showing how [Barsad]167-barsad and [Cly]168-cly were even a hundred times better than [he]171-mr. stryver had thought them , and [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner a hundred times worse . Lastly , came [[my]0-i Lord]5220-my lord [himself]5220-my lord , turning the suit of clothes , now inside out , now outside in , but on the whole decidedly trimming and shaping them into grave - clothes for [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner . And now , [the jury]1124-the jury turned to consider , and the great flies swarmed again . [Mr. Carton]172-carton , who had so long sat looking at the ceiling of [the court]4990-the court , changed neither [his]172-carton place nor [his]172-carton attitude , even in this excitement . While [[his]172-carton learned friend]1347-his learned friend , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , massing [his]171-mr. stryver papers before [him]171-mr. stryver , whispered with [those who sat near]1348-those who sat near , and from time to time glanced anxiously at [the jury]1124-the jury ; while [all the spectators]1350-all the spectators moved more or less , and grouped [themselves]1350-all the spectators anew ; while even [[my]0-i Lord]5220-my lord [himself]5220-my lord arose from [his]5220-my lord seat , and slowly paced up and down [[his]5220-my lord platform]1352-his platform , not unattended by a suspicion in the minds of [the audience]1353-the audience that [his]5220-my lord state was feverish ; [this one man]1354-this one man sat leaning back , with [his]1354-this one man torn gown half off [him]1354-this one man , [his]1354-this one man untidy wig put on just as it had happened to light on [his]1354-this one man head after its removal , [his]1354-this one man hands in [his]1354-this one man pockets , and [his]1354-this one man eyes on the ceiling as they had been all day . Something especially reckless in [his]1354-this one man demeanour , not only gave [him]1354-this one man a disreputable look , but so diminished the strong resemblance [he]1354-this one man undoubtedly bore to [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ( which [his]1354-this one man momentary earnestness , when [they]1356-they were compared together , had strengthened ) , that many of [the lookers - on]1270-the lookers - on , taking note of [him]1354-this one man now , said to [one another]411-one another [they]1270-the lookers - on would hardly have thought [the two]883-the two were so alike . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher made the observation to [[his]156-mr. cruncher next neighbour]1360-his next neighbour , and added , “ [I]156-mr. cruncher ’d hold half a guinea that _ [he]1354-this one man _ do n’t get no law - work to do . Do n’t look like [the sort of one to get any]5260-the sort of one to get any , do [he]1354-this one man ? ”[156-mr. cruncher] Yet , [this Mr. Carton]172-carton took in more of the details of the scene than [he]1354-this one man appeared to take in ; for now , when [Miss Manette]140-miss manette ’s head dropped upon [[her]140-miss manette father]5008-her father ’s breast , [he]1354-this one man was the first to see it , and to say audibly : “ [Officer]5261-officer ! look to [that young lady]5262-that young lady . Help [the gentleman]4926-the gentleman to take [her]5262-that young lady out . Do n’t [you]5261-officer see [she]5262-that young lady will fall ! ”[1354-this one man] There was much commiseration for [her]140-miss manette as [she]140-miss manette was removed , and much sympathy with [[her]140-miss manette father]5008-her father . It had evidently been a great distress to [him]1354-this one man , to have the days of [his]1354-this one man imprisonment recalled . [He]1354-this one man had shown strong internal agitation when [he]1354-this one man was questioned , and that pondering or brooding look which made [him]1354-this one man old , had been upon [him]1354-this one man , like a heavy cloud , ever since . As [he]1354-this one man passed out , [the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment]1363-the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment , spoke , through [[their]1363-the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment foreman]1364-their foreman . [They]1363-the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment were not agreed , and wished to retire . [[My]0-i Lord]5220-my lord ( perhaps with [George Washington]138-george washington on [his]5220-my lord mind ) showed some surprise that [they]1363-the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment were not agreed , but signified [his]5220-my lord pleasure that [they]1363-the jury , who had turned back and paused a moment should retire under watch and ward , and retired [himself]5220-my lord . The trial had lasted all day , and the lamps in [the court]4990-the court were now being lighted . It began to be rumoured that [the jury]1124-the jury would be out a long while . [The spectators]1139-the spectators dropped off to get refreshment , and [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner withdrew to the back of [the dock]1060-the dock , and sat down . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , who had gone out when [the young lady]642-the young lady and [[her]642-the young lady father]5008-her father went out , now reappeared , and beckoned to [Jerry]133-mr. lorry : who , in the slackened interest , could easily get near [him]133-mr. lorry . “ [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , if [you]133-mr. lorry wish to take something to eat , [you]133-mr. lorry can . But , keep in the way . [You]133-mr. lorry will be sure to hear when [the jury]1124-the jury come in . Do n’t be a moment behind [them]1124-the jury , for [I]133-mr. lorry want [you]133-mr. lorry to take the verdict back to [the bank]531-the bank . [You]133-mr. lorry are [the quickest messenger [I]133-mr. lorry know]5266-the quickest messenger i know , and will get to [Temple Bar]18-temple bar long before [I]133-mr. lorry can . ”[133-mr. lorry] [Jerry]133-mr. lorry had just enough forehead to knuckle , and [he]133-mr. lorry knuckled it in acknowledgment of this communication and a shilling . [Mr. Carton]172-carton came up at the moment , and touched [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry on the arm . “ How is [the young lady]642-the young lady ? ”[172-carton] “ [She]642-the young lady is greatly distressed ; but [[her]642-the young lady father]5008-her father is comforting [her]642-the young lady , and [she]642-the young lady feels the better for being out of court . ”[172-carton] “ [I]133-mr. lorry ’ll tell [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner so . It wo n’t do for [a respectable bank gentleman like [you]133-mr. lorry]5270-a respectable bank gentleman like you , to be seen speaking to [him]5091-the prisoner publicly , [you]133-mr. lorry know . ”[133-mr. lorry] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry reddened as if [he]133-mr. lorry were conscious of having debated the point in [his]133-mr. lorry mind , and [Mr. Carton]172-carton made [his]172-carton way to the outside of the bar . The way out of [court]1082-court lay in that direction , and [Jerry]133-mr. lorry followed [him]172-carton , all eyes , ears , and spikes . “ [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ! ”[5091-the prisoner] [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner came forward directly . “ [You]162-darnay will naturally be anxious to hear of [the witness]1272-the witness , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette . [She]1272-the witness will do very well . [You]162-darnay have seen the worst of [her]1272-the witness agitation . ”[5091-the prisoner] “ [I]172-carton am deeply sorry to have been the cause of it . Could [you]162-darnay tell [her]1272-the witness so for [me]172-carton , with [my]172-carton fervent acknowledgments ? ”[172-carton] “ Yes , [I]172-carton could . [I]172-carton will , if [you]162-darnay ask it . ”[172-carton] [Mr. Carton]172-carton ’s manner was so careless as to be almost insolent . [He]172-carton stood , half turned from [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner , lounging with [his]172-carton elbow against the bar . “ [I]172-carton do ask it . Accept [my]172-carton cordial thanks . ”[172-carton] “ What , ”[172-carton] said [Carton]172-carton , still only half turned towards [him]172-carton , “ do [you]172-carton expect , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ? ”[172-carton] “ The worst . ”[172-carton] “ It ’s the wisest thing to expect , and the likeliest . But [I]172-carton think [their]1377-them withdrawing is in [your]172-carton favour . ”[172-carton] Loitering on the way out of [court]1082-court not being allowed , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry heard no more : but left [them]1377-them -- so like [each other]1035-each other in feature , so unlike [each other]1035-each other in manner -- standing side by side , both reflected in the glass above [them]1377-them . An hour and a half limped heavily away in [the thief - and - rascal crowded passages below]1380-the thief - and - rascal crowded passages below , even though assisted off with mutton pies and ale . [The hoarse messenger , uncomfortably seated on a form after taking that refection]1381-the hoarse messenger , uncomfortably seated on a form after taking that refection , had dropped into a doze , when a loud murmur and a rapid tide of [people]360-people setting up the stairs that led to [the court]4990-the court , carried [him]1381-the hoarse messenger , uncomfortably seated on a form after taking that refection along with [them]1377-them . “ [Jerry]133-mr. lorry ! [Jerry]133-mr. lorry ! ”[360-people] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry was already calling at the door when [he]133-mr. lorry got [there]4887-there . “ Here , [sir]4862-sir ! It ’s a fight to get back again . Here [I]133-mr. lorry am , [sir]4862-sir ! ”[133-mr. lorry] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry handed [him]133-mr. lorry a paper through [the throng]1385-the throng . “ Quick ! Have [you]133-mr. lorry got it ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Yes , [sir]4862-sir . ”[1385-the throng] Hastily written on the paper was the word “ ACQUITTED . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ If [you]133-mr. lorry had sent the message , ‘ Recalled to Life , ’ again , ”[133-mr. lorry] muttered [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , as [he]133-mr. lorry turned , “ [I]133-mr. lorry should have known what [you]133-mr. lorry meant , this time . ”[133-mr. lorry] [He]133-mr. lorry had no opportunity of saying , or so much as thinking , anything else , until [he]133-mr. lorry was clear of the Old Bailey ; for , [the crowd]1386-the crowd came pouring out with a vehemence that nearly took [him]133-mr. lorry off [his]133-mr. lorry legs , and a loud buzz swept into [the street]662-the street as if the baffled blue - flies were dispersing in search of other carrion . CHAPTER IV . Congratulatory From [the dimly - lighted passages of [the court]4990-the court]1388-the dimly - lighted passages of the court , the last sediment of the human stew that had been boiling there all day , was straining off , when [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , [Lucie Manette]174-lucie , [[his]170-doctor manette daughter]889-his daughter , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , [the solicitor for the defence]1391-the solicitor for the defence , and [[its]4990-the court counsel]1392-its counsel , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , stood gathered round [Mr. Charles Darnay]162-darnay -- just released -- congratulating [him]133-mr. lorry on [his]133-mr. lorry escape from death . It would have been difficult by a far brighter light , to recognise in [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , [intellectual of face and upright of bearing]1393-intellectual of face and upright of bearing , [the shoemaker of [the garret in [Paris]7-paris]1395-the garret in paris]1394-the shoemaker of the garret in paris . Yet , [no one]330-no one could have looked at [him]170-doctor manette twice , without looking again : even though the opportunity of observation had not extended to the mournful cadence of [his]170-doctor manette low grave voice , and to the abstraction that overclouded [him]170-doctor manette fitfully , without any apparent reason . While one external cause , and that a reference to [his]170-doctor manette long lingering agony , would always -- as on the trial -- evoke this condition from the depths of [his]170-doctor manette soul , it was also in its nature to arise of itself , and to draw a gloom over [him]170-doctor manette , as incomprehensible to those unacquainted with [his]170-doctor manette story as if [they]1397-they had seen the shadow of the actual Bastille thrown upon [him]170-doctor manette by a summer sun , when the substance was three hundred miles away . Only [[his]170-doctor manette daughter]889-his daughter had the power of charming this black brooding from [his]170-doctor manette mind . [She]889-his daughter was the golden thread that united [him]170-doctor manette to a Past beyond [his]170-doctor manette misery , and to a Present beyond [his]170-doctor manette misery : and the sound of [her]889-his daughter voice , the light of [her]889-his daughter face , the touch of [her]889-his daughter hand , had a strong beneficial influence with [him]170-doctor manette almost always . Not absolutely always , for [she]889-his daughter could recall some occasions on which [her]889-his daughter power had failed ; but they were few and slight , and [she]889-his daughter believed [them]1399-them over . [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay had kissed [her]889-his daughter hand fervently and gratefully , and had turned to [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , whom [he]162-darnay warmly thanked . [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , a man of little more than thirty , but looking twenty years older than [he]171-mr. stryver was , stout , loud , red , bluff , and free from any drawback of delicacy , had a pushing way of shouldering [himself]171-mr. stryver ( morally and physically ) into companies and conversations , that argued well for [his]171-mr. stryver shouldering [his]171-mr. stryver way up in life . [He]171-mr. stryver still had [his]171-mr. stryver wig and gown on , and [he]171-mr. stryver said , squaring [himself]171-mr. stryver at [[his]171-mr. stryver late client]1400-his late client to that degree that [he]171-mr. stryver squeezed [the innocent Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry clean out of [the group]1401-the group : “ [I]171-mr. stryver am glad to have brought [you]171-mr. stryver off with honour , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay . It was an infamous prosecution , grossly infamous ; but not the less likely to succeed on that account . ”[171-mr. stryver] “ [You]171-mr. stryver have laid [me]1400-his late client under an obligation to [you]171-mr. stryver for life -- in two senses , ”[1400-his late client] said [[his]171-mr. stryver late client]1400-his late client , taking [his]171-mr. stryver hand . “ [I]1400-his late client have done [my]1400-his late client best for [you]171-mr. stryver , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ; and [my]1400-his late client best is as good as [another man]5275-another man ’s , [I]1400-his late client believe . ”[1400-his late client] It clearly being incumbent on [some one]1403-some one to say , “ Much better , ”[133-mr. lorry] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry said it ; perhaps not quite disinterestedly , but with the interested object of squeezing [himself]133-mr. lorry back again . “ [You]171-mr. stryver think so ? ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver . “ Well ! [you]171-mr. stryver have been present all day , and [you]171-mr. stryver ought to know . [You]171-mr. stryver are [a man of business]4935-a man of business , too . ”[171-mr. stryver] “ And as such , ”[133-mr. lorry] quoth [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , whom [the counsel learned in the law]1404-the counsel learned in the law had now shouldered back into [the group]1401-the group , just as [he]171-mr. stryver had previously shouldered [him]171-mr. stryver out of it--“as such [I]171-mr. stryver will appeal to [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , to break up this conference and order [us]1401-the group all to [[our]1401-the group homes]5277-our homes . It has no good in it for [me]172-carton -- except wine like this -- nor [I]172-carton for it . So [we]5303-we are not much alike in that particular . Indeed , [I]172-carton begin to think [we]5303-we are not much alike in any particular , [you]162-darnay and [I.]172-carton ”[172-carton] Confused by the emotion of the day , and feeling [his]172-carton being there with this Double of coarse deportment , to be like a dream , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay was at a loss how to answer ; finally , answered not at all . “ Now [your]162-darnay dinner is done , ”[172-carton] [Carton]172-carton presently said , “ why do n’t [you]162-darnay call a health , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ; why do n’t [you]162-darnay give [your]162-darnay toast ? ”[172-carton] “ What health ? [He]162-darnay turned the dialogue to that point , and thanked [him]1434-this disagreeable companion for it . “ [I]1435-the careless rejoinder neither want any thanks , nor merit any , ”[1435-the careless rejoinder] was [the careless rejoinder]1435-the careless rejoinder . “ It was nothing to do , in the first place ; and [I]1435-the careless rejoinder do n’t know why [I]1435-the careless rejoinder did it , in the second . On [his]162-darnay answering in the affirmative , “ Then bring [me]162-darnay another pint of this same wine , drawer , and come and wake [me]162-darnay at ten . ”[162-darnay] The bill being paid , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay rose and wished [him]162-darnay good night . Without returning the wish , [Carton]172-carton rose too , with something of a threat of defiance in [his]172-carton manner , and said , “ A last word , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay : [you]162-darnay think [I]172-carton am drunk ? ”[172-carton] “ [I]172-carton think [you]162-darnay have been drinking , [Mr. Carton]172-carton . ”[172-carton] “ Think ? Good night ! ”[172-carton] When [he]1437-he was left alone , [this strange being]1438-this strange being took up a candle , went to a glass that hung against the wall , and surveyed [himself]1438-this strange being minutely in it . “ Do [you]172-carton particularly like [the man]472-the man ? ”[1438-this strange being] [he]1438-this strange being muttered , at [his]1438-this strange being own image ; “ why should [you]172-carton particularly like [a man who resembles [you]172-carton]5315-a man who resembles you ? A good reason for taking to [a man]449-a man , that [he]449-a man shows [you]172-carton what [you]172-carton have fallen away from , and what [you]172-carton might have been !
