[You]172-carton hate [the fellow]748-the fellow . ”[1438-this strange being] [He]1438-this strange being resorted to [his]1438-this strange being pint of wine for consolation , drank it all in a few minutes , and fell asleep on [his]1438-this strange being arms , with [his]1438-this strange being hair straggling over the table , and a long winding - sheet in the candle dripping down upon [him]1438-this strange being . [CHAPTER V. The Jackal Those]176-chapter v. the jackal those were drinking days , and [most men]1439-most men drank hard . So very great is the improvement Time has brought about in such habits , that a moderate statement of the quantity of wine and punch which [one man]1440-one man would swallow in the course of a night , without any detriment to [his]1438-this strange being reputation as [a perfect gentleman]1441-a perfect gentleman , would seem , in these days , a ridiculous exaggeration . [The learned profession of the law]1442-the learned profession of the law was certainly not behind any other learned profession in its Bacchanalian propensities ; neither was [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , already fast shouldering [his]171-mr. stryver way to a large and lucrative practice , behind [his]171-mr. stryver compeers in this particular , any more than in the drier parts of the legal race . [A favourite at the Old Bailey]1443-a favourite at the old bailey , and eke at the Sessions , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver had begun cautiously to hew away the lower staves of the ladder on which [he]171-mr. stryver mounted . Sessions and [Old Bailey]39-the old bailey had now to summon [[their]1444-their favourite]1445-their favourite , specially , to [their]1444-their longing arms ; and shouldering itself towards the visage of [the Lord Chief Justice in [the Court of King ’s Bench]51-the court of king ’s bench]1446-the lord chief justice in the court of king ’s bench , the florid countenance of [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver might be daily seen , bursting out of the bed of wigs , like a great sunflower pushing its way at the sun from among a rank garden - full of [flaring companions]1447-flaring companions . It had once been noted at [the Bar]1031-the bar , that while [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver was [a glib man]1449-a glib man , and an unscrupulous , and a ready , and a bold , [he]171-mr. stryver had not that faculty of extracting the essence from a heap of statements , which is among the most striking and necessary of [the advocate]1450-the advocate ’s accomplishments . But , a remarkable improvement came upon [him]171-mr. stryver as to this . The more business [he]171-mr. stryver got , the greater [his]171-mr. stryver power seemed to grow of getting at its pith and marrow ; and however late at night [he]171-mr. stryver sat carousing with [Sydney Carton]177-carton , [he]171-mr. stryver always had [his]171-mr. stryver points at [his]171-mr. stryver fingers ’ ends in the morning . [Sydney Carton]177-carton , idlest and most unpromising of [men]568-men , was [[Stryver]171-mr. stryver ’s great ally]1452-stryver ’s great ally . What [the two]883-the two drank together , between [Hilary Term]178-hilary term and [Michaelmas]179-michaelmas , might have floated [[a king]1454-a king ’s ship]1455-a king ’s ship . [Stryver]171-mr. stryver never had a case in hand , anywhere , but [Carton]177-carton was there , with [his]177-carton hands in [his]177-carton pockets , staring at the ceiling of [the court]4990-the court ; [they]883-the two went the same Circuit , and even there [they]883-the two prolonged [their]883-the two usual orgies late into the night , and [Carton]177-carton was rumoured to be seen at broad day , going [home]858-home stealthily and unsteadily to [[his]177-carton lodgings]1458-his lodgings , like a dissipated cat . At last , it began to get about , among such as were interested in the matter , that although [Sydney Carton]177-carton would never be a lion , [he]177-carton was [an amazingly good jackal]1459-an amazingly good jackal , and that [he]177-carton rendered suit and service to [Stryver]171-mr. stryver in that humble capacity . “ Ten o’clock , [sir]4862-sir , ”[1460-the man at the tavern] said [the man at [the tavern]1461-the tavern]1460-the man at the tavern , whom [he]1460-the man at the tavern had charged to wake him--“ten o’clock , [sir]4862-sir . ”[1460-the man at the tavern] “ _ What ’s _ the matter ? ”[1460-the man at the tavern] “ Ten o’clock , [sir]4862-sir . ”[1460-the man at the tavern] “ What do [you]472-the man mean ? Ten o’clock at night ? ”[1460-the man at the tavern] “ Yes , [sir]4862-sir . [[Your]472-the man honour]5322-your honour told [me]1460-the man at the tavern to call [you]472-the man . ”[1460-the man at the tavern] “ Oh ! [I]1460-the man at the tavern remember . Very well , very well . ”[1460-the man at the tavern] After a few dull efforts to get to sleep again , which [the man]472-the man dexterously combated by stirring the fire continuously for five minutes , [he]472-the man got up , tossed [his]472-the man hat on , and walked out . [He]472-the man turned into [the Temple]1027-the temple , and , having revived [himself]472-the man by twice pacing [the pavements of [King ’s Bench]52-king ’s bench - walk and [Paper - buildings]1465-paper - buildings]1464-the pavements of king ’s bench - walk and paper - buildings , turned into [the Stryver chambers]1466-the stryver chambers . [The Stryver clerk , who never assisted at these conferences]1467-the stryver clerk , who never assisted at these conferences , had gone [home]858-home , and [the Stryver principal]1469-the stryver principal opened the door . [He]472-the man had [his]472-the man slippers on , and a loose bed - gown , and [his]472-the man throat was bare for [his]472-the man greater ease . [He]472-the man had that rather wild , strained , seared marking about the eyes , which may be observed in all free livers of [[his]472-the man class]1470-his class , from the portrait of [Jeffries]180-jeffries downward , and which can be traced , under various disguises of Art , through the portraits of [every Drinking Age]1471-every drinking age . “ [You]472-the man are a little late , [Memory]181-memory , ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Stryver]171-mr. stryver . “ About the usual time ; it may be a quarter of an hour later . ”[171-mr. stryver] [They]1472-they went into [a dingy room lined with books and littered with papers]1473-a dingy room lined with books and littered with papers , where there was a blazing fire . Get to work , get to work . ”[171-mr. stryver] Sullenly enough , [the jackal]1474-the jackal loosened [his]1474-the jackal dress , went into [an adjoining room]1475-an adjoining room , and came back with a large jug of cold water , a basin , and a towel or two . Steeping the towels in the water , and partially wringing them out , [he]1474-the jackal folded them on [his]1474-the jackal head in a manner hideous to behold , sat down at the table , and said , “ Now [I]1474-the jackal am ready ! ”[1474-the jackal] “ Not much boiling down to be done to - night , [Memory]181-memory , ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , gaily , as [he]171-mr. stryver looked among [his]171-mr. stryver papers . “ How much ? ”[171-mr. stryver] “ Only two sets of them . ”[1474-the jackal] “ Give [me]171-mr. stryver the worst first . ”[171-mr. stryver] “ There they are , [Sydney]177-carton . Fire away ! ”[1476-the lion] [The lion]1476-the lion then composed [himself]1476-the lion on [his]1476-the lion back on a sofa on one side of the drinking - table , while [the jackal]1474-the jackal sat at [his]1474-the jackal own paper - bestrewn table proper , on the other side of it , with the bottles and glasses ready to [his]1474-the jackal hand . [Both]5188-both resorted to the drinking - table without stint , but each in a different way ; the lion for the most part reclining with [his]1476-the lion hands in [his]1476-the lion waistband , looking at the fire , or occasionally flirting with some lighter document ; [the jackal , with knitted brows and intent face]1479-the jackal , with knitted brows and intent face , so deep in [his]1474-the jackal task , that [his]1474-the jackal eyes did not even follow the hand [he]1474-the jackal stretched out for [his]1474-the jackal glass -- which often groped about , for a minute or more , before it found the glass for [his]1474-the jackal lips . Two or three times , the matter in hand became so knotty , that [the jackal]1474-the jackal found it imperative on [him]1474-the jackal to get up , and steep [his]1474-the jackal towels anew . From these pilgrimages to the jug and basin , [he]1474-the jackal returned with such eccentricities of damp headgear as no words can describe ; which were made the more ludicrous by [his]1474-the jackal anxious gravity . At length [the jackal]1474-the jackal had got together a compact repast for the lion , and proceeded to offer it to [him]1476-the lion . The lion took it with care and caution , made [his]1476-the lion selections from it , and [his]1476-the lion remarks upon it , and [the jackal]1474-the jackal assisted both . When the repast was fully discussed , the lion put [his]1476-the lion hands in [his]1476-the lion waistband again , and lay down to meditate . [The jackal]1474-the jackal then invigorated [himself]1474-the jackal with a bumper for [his]1474-the jackal throttle , and a fresh application to [his]1474-the jackal head , and applied [himself]1474-the jackal to the collection of a second meal ; this was administered to the lion in the same manner , and was not disposed of until the clocks struck three in the morning . “ And now [we]5326-we have done , [Sydney]177-carton , fill a bumper of punch , ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver . [She]5339-the picturesque doctor ’s daughter was [a golden - haired doll]5344-a golden - haired doll ! ”[171-mr. stryver] “ Do [you]171-mr. stryver know , [Sydney]177-carton , ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , looking at [him]171-mr. stryver with sharp eyes , and slowly drawing a hand across [his]171-mr. stryver florid face : “ do [you]171-mr. stryver know , [I]171-mr. stryver rather thought , at the time , that [you]171-mr. stryver sympathised with [the golden - haired doll]5345-the golden - haired doll , and were quick to see what happened to [the golden - haired doll]5345-the golden - haired doll ? ”[171-mr. stryver] “ Quick to see what happened ! And now [I]171-mr. stryver ’ll have no more drink ; [I]171-mr. stryver ’ll get to bed . ”[171-mr. stryver] When [[his]171-mr. stryver host]1491-his host followed [him]171-mr. stryver out on the staircase with a candle , to light [him]171-mr. stryver down the stairs , the day was coldly looking in through [its]1492-its grimy windows . When [he]171-mr. stryver got out of [the house]951-the house , the air was cold and sad , the dull sky overcast , [the river]1494-the river dark and dim , the whole scene like [a lifeless desert]1495-a lifeless desert . And wreaths of dust were spinning round and round before the morning blast , as if the desert - sand had risen far away , and the first spray of it in its advance had begun to overwhelm [the city]1496-the city . Waste forces within [him]171-mr. stryver , and [a desert]1497-a desert all around , [this man]5081-this man stood still on [his]171-mr. stryver way across [a silent terrace]1499-a silent terrace , and saw for a moment , lying in the wilderness before [him]171-mr. stryver , a mirage of honourable ambition , self - denial , and perseverance . In [the fair city of this vision]1500-the fair city of this vision , there were [airy galleries from which [the loves and graces]1502-the loves and graces looked upon [him]171-mr. stryver]1501-airy galleries from which the loves and graces looked upon him , [gardens in which the fruits of life hung ripening , waters of Hope that sparkled in [his]171-mr. stryver sight]1503-gardens in which the fruits of life hung ripening , waters of hope that sparkled in his sight . A moment , and it was gone . Sadly , sadly , the sun rose ; it rose upon no sadder sight than [the man of good abilities and good emotions]1506-the man of good abilities and good emotions , incapable of [their]1507-their directed exercise , incapable of [his]171-mr. stryver own help and [his]171-mr. stryver own happiness , sensible of the blight on [him]171-mr. stryver , and resigning [himself]171-mr. stryver to let it eat [him]171-mr. stryver away . CHAPTER VI . [Hundreds of People]1508-hundreds of people [The quiet lodgings of [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette]1509-the quiet lodgings of doctor manette were in [a quiet street - corner]1510-a quiet street - corner not far from [Soho - square]58-soho . On the afternoon of a certain fine Sunday when the waves of four months had rolled over the trial for treason , and carried it , as to the public interest and memory , far out to [sea]581-sea , [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry walked along [the sunny streets]1512-the sunny streets from [[Clerkenwell]57-clerkenwell where [he]133-mr. lorry lived]1513-clerkenwell where he lived , on [his]133-mr. lorry way to dine with [the Doctor]1514-the doctor . After several relapses into business - absorption , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry had become [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s friend]1516-the doctor ’s friend , and [the quiet street - corner]1517-the quiet street - corner was the sunny part of [his]133-mr. lorry life . On this certain fine Sunday , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry walked towards [Soho]58-soho , early in the afternoon , for three reasons of habit . Firstly , because , on fine Sundays , [he]133-mr. lorry often walked out , before dinner , with [the Doctor]1514-the doctor and [Lucie]174-lucie ; secondly , because , on unfavourable Sundays , [he]133-mr. lorry was accustomed to be with [them]1519-them as [the family friend]1520-the family friend , talking , reading , looking out of window , and generally getting through the day ; thirdly , because [he]133-mr. lorry happened to have [his]133-mr. lorry own little shrewd doubts to solve , and knew how the ways of [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s household]1522-the doctor ’s household pointed to that time as a likely time for solving them . [A quainter corner than [the corner where [the Doctor]1514-the doctor lived]1524-the corner where the doctor lived]1523-a quainter corner than the corner where the doctor lived , was not to be found in [London]3-london . There was no way through [it]1523-a quainter corner than the corner where the doctor lived , and the front windows of [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s lodgings]1527-the doctor ’s lodgings commanded [a pleasant little vista of [street]1529-street that had a congenial air of retirement on [it]1528-a pleasant little vista of street that had a congenial air of retirement on it]1528-a pleasant little vista of street that had a congenial air of retirement on it . There were [few buildings]1530-few buildings then , north of [the Oxford - road]1531-the oxford - road , and forest - trees flourished , and wild flowers grew , and the hawthorn blossomed , in [the now vanished fields]1532-the now vanished fields . As a consequence , country airs circulated in [Soho]58-soho with vigorous freedom , instead of languishing into [the parish]1533-the parish like [stray paupers without [a settlement]1535-a settlement]1534-stray paupers without a settlement ; and there was many a good south wall , not far off , on which the peaches ripened in [their]1536-their season . The summer light struck into the corner brilliantly in the earlier part of the day ; but , when [the streets]732-the streets grew hot , [the corner]1538-the corner was in shadow , though not in shadow so remote but that [you]1539-you could see beyond [it]1538-the corner into a glare of brightness . It was [a cool spot]1540-a cool spot , staid but cheerful , [a wonderful place for echoes]1541-a wonderful place for echoes , and a very harbour from [the raging streets]1542-the raging streets . There ought to have been a tranquil bark in such an anchorage , and there was . [The Doctor]1514-the doctor occupied two floors of [a large stiff house]1544-a large stiff house , where several callings purported to be pursued by day , but whereof little was audible any day , and which was shunned by all of [them]1545-them at night . In [a building at the back , attainable by [a courtyard]1547-a courtyard where a plane - tree rustled its green leaves , [church - organs]1548-church - organs claimed to be made]1546-a building at the back , attainable by a courtyard where a plane - tree rustled its green leaves , church - organs claimed to be made , and silver to be chased , and likewise gold to be beaten by [some mysterious giant who had a golden arm starting out of the wall of [the front hall]1550-the front hall]1549-some mysterious giant who had a golden arm starting out of the wall of the front hall -- as if [he]1549-some mysterious giant who had a golden arm starting out of the wall of the front hall had beaten [himself]1549-some mysterious giant who had a golden arm starting out of the wall of the front hall precious , and menaced a similar conversion of [all visitors]1551-all visitors . Very little of these trades , or of [a lonely lodger rumoured to live up - stairs]1552-a lonely lodger rumoured to live up - stairs , or of [a dim coach - trimming maker]1553-a dim coach - trimming maker asserted to have [a counting - house below]1554-a counting - house below , was ever heard or seen . Occasionally , [a stray workman]1555-a stray workman putting [his]1555-a stray workman coat on , traversed [the hall]1556-the hall , or [a stranger]1557-a stranger peered about there , or a distant clink was heard across [the courtyard]915-the courtyard , or a thump from the golden giant . These , however , were only the exceptions required to prove the rule that the sparrows in the plane - tree behind [the house]951-the house , and the echoes in the corner before it , had their own way from Sunday morning unto Saturday night . [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette received [such patients]1560-such patients [here]4902-here as [his]170-doctor manette old reputation , and its revival in the floating whispers of [his]170-doctor manette story , brought [him]170-doctor manette . [His]170-doctor manette scientific knowledge , and [his]170-doctor manette vigilance and skill in conducting ingenious experiments , brought [him]170-doctor manette otherwise into moderate request , and [he]170-doctor manette earned as much as [he]170-doctor manette wanted . These things were within [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s knowledge , thoughts , and notice , when [he]133-mr. lorry rang the door - bell of [the tranquil house]1562-the tranquil house in [the corner]1538-the corner , on the fine Sunday afternoon . “ [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette at [home]858-home ? ”[133-mr. lorry] Expected [home]858-home . “ [Miss Lucie]175-lucie at [home]858-home ? ”[133-mr. lorry] Expected [home]858-home . “ [Miss Pross]183-miss pross at [home]858-home ? ”[133-mr. lorry] Possibly at [home]858-home , but of a certainty impossible for [handmaid]1567-handmaid to anticipate intentions of [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , as to admission or denial of the fact . “ As [I]133-mr. lorry am at [home]858-home [myself]133-mr. lorry , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , “ [I]133-mr. lorry ’ll go [upstairs]5354-upstairs . ”[133-mr. lorry] Although [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s daughter]1569-the doctor ’s daughter had known nothing of [the country]956-the country of [her]1569-the doctor ’s daughter birth , [she]1569-the doctor ’s daughter appeared to have innately derived from [it]1571-it that ability to make much of little means , which is one of its most useful and most agreeable characteristics . Simple as the furniture was , [it]1571-it was set off by so many little adornments , of no value but for their taste and fancy , that its effect was delightful . The disposition of everything in [the rooms]1572-the rooms , from the largest object to the least ; the arrangement of colours , the elegant variety and contrast obtained by thrift in trifles , by delicate hands , clear eyes , and good sense ; were at once so pleasant in themselves , and so expressive of [their]1572-the rooms originator , that , as [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry stood looking about [him]133-mr. lorry , the very chairs and tables seemed to ask [him]133-mr. lorry , with something of that peculiar expression which [he]133-mr. lorry knew so well by this time , whether [he]133-mr. lorry approved ? There were [three rooms on a floor]1573-three rooms on a floor , and , the doors by which [they]1573-three rooms on a floor communicated being put open that the air might pass freely through [them]1573-three rooms on a floor all , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , smilingly observant of that fanciful resemblance which [he]133-mr. lorry detected all around [him]133-mr. lorry , walked from one to another . [The first]1574-the first was [the best room]1575-the best room , and in [it]1574-the first were [Lucie]175-lucie ’s birds , and flowers , and books , and desk , and work - table , and box of water - colours ; the second was [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s consulting - room]1577-the doctor ’s consulting - room , used also as [the dining - room]1578-the dining - room ; the third , changingly speckled by the rustle of the plane - tree in [the yard]1579-the yard , was [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s bedroom]1581-the doctor ’s bedroom , and there , in a corner , stood the disused shoemaker ’s bench and tray of tools , much as [it]1582-it had stood on [the fifth floor of [the dismal house]1584-the dismal house]1583-the fifth floor of the dismal house by [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop , in [the suburb of [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine in [Paris]7-paris]1586-the suburb of saint antoine in paris . “ [I]133-mr. lorry wonder , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , pausing in [his]133-mr. lorry looking about , “ that [he]133-mr. lorry keeps that reminder of [his]133-mr. lorry sufferings about [him]133-mr. lorry ! ”[133-mr. lorry] “ And why wonder at that ? ”[133-mr. lorry] was the abrupt inquiry that made [him]133-mr. lorry start . It proceeded from [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , [the wild red woman , strong of hand]1587-the wild red woman , strong of hand , whose acquaintance [he]133-mr. lorry had first made at [the Royal George Hotel]59-the royal george hotel at [Dover]15-dover , and had since improved . “ [I]133-mr. lorry should have thought-- ”[133-mr. lorry] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry began . “ Pooh ! [You]133-mr. lorry ’d have thought ! ”[183-miss pross] said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ; and [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry left off . “ How do [you]133-mr. lorry do ? ”[1588-that lady] inquired [that lady]1588-that lady then -- sharply , and yet as if to express that [she]1588-that lady bore [him]133-mr. lorry no malice . “ [I]133-mr. lorry am pretty well , [I]133-mr. lorry thank [you]133-mr. lorry , ”[133-mr. lorry] answered [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , with meekness ; “ how are [you]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Nothing to boast of , ”[183-miss pross] said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . “ Indeed ? ”[183-miss pross] “ Ah ! indeed ! ”[183-miss pross] said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . “ [I]183-miss pross am very much put out about [[my]183-miss pross Ladybird]5355-my ladybird . ”[183-miss pross] “ Indeed ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ For gracious sake say something else besides ‘ indeed , ’ or [you]133-mr. lorry ’ll fidget [me]183-miss pross to death , ”[183-miss pross] said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross : whose character ( dissociated from stature ) was shortness . “ Really , then ? ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , as an amendment . “ Really , is bad enough , ”[183-miss pross] returned [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “ but better . [The corner]1538-the corner has been mentioned as [a wonderful corner for echoes]1601-a wonderful corner for echoes ; it had begun to echo so resoundingly to the tread of coming feet , that it seemed as though the very mention of that weary pacing to and fro had set it going . “ Here [they]1604-the father and daughter are ! ”[183-miss pross] said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , rising to break up the conference ; “ and now [we]5380-we shall have hundreds of [people]360-people pretty soon ! ”[183-miss pross] It was such [a curious corner in [its]1538-the corner acoustical properties , such a peculiar Ear of [a place]1603-a place]1602-a curious corner in its acoustical properties , such a peculiar ear of a place , that as [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry stood at the open window , looking for [the father and daughter]1604-the father and daughter whose steps [he]133-mr. lorry heard , [he]133-mr. lorry fancied [they]1604-the father and daughter would never approach . Not only would the echoes die away , as though the steps had gone ; but , echoes of other steps that never came would be heard in [their]1604-the father and daughter stead , and would die away for good when they seemed close at hand . However , [father]5144-father and [daughter]900-daughter did at last appear , and [Miss Pross]183-miss pross was ready at [the street]662-the street door to receive [them]1604-the father and daughter . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross was a pleasant sight , albeit wild , and red , and grim , taking off [[her]183-miss pross darling]1608-her darling ’s bonnet when [she]183-miss pross came up - [stairs]967-stairs , and touching it up with the ends of [her]183-miss pross handkerchief , and blowing the dust off it , and folding [her]183-miss pross mantle ready for laying by , and smoothing [her]183-miss pross rich hair with as much pride as [she]183-miss pross could possibly have taken in [her]183-miss pross own hair if [she]183-miss pross had been the vainest and handsomest of [women]671-women . [[Her]183-miss pross darling]1608-her darling was a pleasant sight too , embracing [her]183-miss pross and thanking [her]183-miss pross , and protesting against [her]183-miss pross taking so much trouble for [her]183-miss pross -- which last [she]183-miss pross only dared to do playfully , or [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , sorely hurt , would have retired to [[her]183-miss pross own chamber]1612-her own chamber and cried . In the arrangements of [the little household]1618-the little household , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross took charge of [the lower regions]1619-the lower regions , and always acquitted [herself]183-miss pross marvellously . [Her]183-miss pross dinners , of a very modest quality , were so well cooked and so well served , and so neat in their contrivances , half English and half French , that nothing could be better . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ’s friendship being of the thoroughly practical kind , [she]183-miss pross had ravaged [Soho]58-soho and [the adjacent provinces]1620-the adjacent provinces , in search of impoverished French , who , tempted by shillings and half - crowns , would impart culinary mysteries to [her]183-miss pross . From [these decayed sons and [daughters of Gaul]1622-daughters of gaul]1621-these decayed sons and daughters of gaul , [she]183-miss pross had acquired such wonderful arts , that [the woman]1008-the woman and [girl who formed the staff of domestics]1624-girl who formed the staff of domestics regarded [her]183-miss pross as quite [a Sorceress]1625-a sorceress , or [Cinderella]187-cinderella ’s Godmother : who would send out for a fowl , a rabbit , a vegetable or two from [the garden]1626-the garden , and change [them]1627-them into anything [she]183-miss pross pleased . On this occasion , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , responding to [Ladybird]184-ladybird ’s pleasant face and pleasant efforts to please [her]183-miss pross , unbent exceedingly ; so the dinner was very pleasant , too . It was an oppressive day , and , after dinner , [Lucie]175-lucie proposed that the wine should be carried out under [the plane - tree]1635-the plane - tree , and [they]1636-they should sit there in the air . As everything turned upon [her]175-lucie , and revolved about [her]175-lucie , [they]1636-they went out under the plane - tree , and [she]175-lucie carried the wine down for the special benefit of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . Still , [the Hundreds of [people]360-people]1639-the hundreds of people did not present [themselves]1639-the hundreds of people . [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay presented [himself]162-darnay while [they]1636-they were sitting under the plane - tree , but [he]162-darnay was only One . [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette received [him]162-darnay kindly , and so did [Lucie]175-lucie . But , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross suddenly became afflicted with a twitching in the head and body , and retired into [the house]951-the house . [She]183-miss pross was not unfrequently [the victim of this disorder]1642-the victim of this disorder , and [she]183-miss pross called it , in familiar conversation , “ [a fit of the jerks]5382-a fit of the jerks . ”[183-miss pross] [The Doctor]1514-the doctor was in [his]1514-the doctor best condition , and looked specially young . [He]162-darnay had been talking all day , on many subjects , and with unusual vivacity . “ Pray , [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , ”[162-darnay] said [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay , as [they]1636-they sat under the plane - tree -- and [he]162-darnay said it in the natural pursuit of the topic in hand , which happened to be [the old buildings of London--“have [you]170-doctor manette seen much of [the Tower]60-the tower]5383-the old buildings of london--“have you seen much of the tower ? ”[162-darnay] “ [Lucie]175-lucie and [I]162-darnay have been [there]4887-there ; but only casually . [We]1636-they have seen enough of it , to know that [it]4887-there teems with interest ; little more . ”[162-darnay] “ _ [I]162-darnay _ have been [there]4887-there , as [you]170-doctor manette remember , ”[162-darnay] said [Darnay]162-darnay , with a smile , though reddening a little angrily , “ in another character , and not in a character that gives facilities for seeing much of it . [They]5386-they told [me]162-darnay a curious thing when [I]162-darnay was [there]4887-there . ”[162-darnay] “ What was that ? ”[175-lucie] [Lucie]175-lucie asked . “ In making some alterations , [the workmen]5388-the workmen came upon [an old dungeon]5389-an old dungeon , which had been , for many years , built up and forgotten . Every stone of [its]5389-an old dungeon inner wall was covered by inscriptions which had been carved by [prisoners]5390-prisoners -- dates , names , complaints , and prayers . Upon a corner stone in an angle of the wall , [one prisoner , who seemed to have gone to execution]5391-one prisoner , who seemed to have gone to execution , had cut as [his]5391-one prisoner , who seemed to have gone to execution last work , three letters . They were done with some very poor instrument , and hurriedly , with an unsteady hand . At first , they were read as D. I. C. ; but , on being more carefully examined , the last letter was found to be G. There was no record or legend of [any prisoner with those initials]5392-any prisoner with those initials , and many fruitless guesses were made what the name could have been . At length , it was suggested that the letters were not initials , but the complete word , DIG . The floor was examined very carefully under the inscription , and , in the earth beneath a stone , or tile , or some fragment of paving , were found the ashes of a paper , mingled with the ashes of a small leathern case or bag . What [the unknown prisoner]5393-the unknown prisoner had written will never be read , but [he]162-darnay had written something , and hidden it away to keep it from [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler . ”[175-lucie] “ [[My]175-lucie father]4969-my father , ”[175-lucie] exclaimed [Lucie]175-lucie , “ [you]162-darnay are ill ! ”[175-lucie] [He]162-darnay had suddenly started up , with [his]162-darnay hand to [his]162-darnay head . [His]162-darnay manner and [his]162-darnay look quite terrified [them]1644-they all . “ No , [[my]162-darnay dear]5097-my dear , not ill . There are large drops of rain falling , and they made [me]162-darnay start . [We]1644-they had better go in . ”[162-darnay] [He]162-darnay recovered [himself]162-darnay almost instantly . But , [he]162-darnay said not a single word in reference to the discovery that had been told of , and , as [they]1644-they went into [the house]951-the house , the business eye of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry either detected , or fancied it detected , on [his]162-darnay face , as it turned towards [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , the same singular look that had been upon it when it turned towards [him]162-darnay in [the passages of [the Court House]1647-the court house]1646-the passages of the court house . [He]162-darnay recovered [himself]162-darnay so quickly , however , that [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry had doubts of [his]133-mr. lorry business eye . The arm of the golden giant in [the hall]1556-the hall was not more steady than [he]162-darnay was , when [he]162-darnay stopped under [it]1649-it to remark to [them]1644-they that [he]162-darnay was not yet proof against slight surprises ( if [he]162-darnay ever would be ) , and that the rain had startled [him]162-darnay . Tea - time , and [Miss Pross]183-miss pross making tea , with another fit of the jerks upon [her]183-miss pross , and yet [no Hundreds of [people]360-people]1616-no hundreds of people . [Mr. Carton]172-carton had lounged in , but [he]172-carton made only Two . The night was so very sultry , that although [they]1644-they sat with doors and windows open , [they]1644-they were overpowered by heat . When the tea - table was done with , [they]1644-they all moved to one of the windows , and looked out into the heavy twilight . [Lucie]175-lucie sat by [[her]175-lucie father]5008-her father ; [Darnay]162-darnay sat beside [her]175-lucie ; [Carton]172-carton leaned against a window . The curtains were long and white , and some of the thunder - gusts that whirled into the corner , caught them up to the ceiling , and waved them like spectral wings . “ The rain - drops are still falling , large , heavy , and few , ”[170-doctor manette] said [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette . “ It comes slowly . ”[170-doctor manette] “ It comes surely , ”[172-carton] said [Carton]172-carton . [They]1644-they spoke low , as [people watching and waiting mostly]1653-people watching and waiting mostly do ; as people in [a dark room]1654-a dark room , watching and waiting for Lightning , always do . There was a great hurry in the streets of [people]360-people speeding away to get shelter before the storm broke ; [the wonderful corner for echoes]1656-the wonderful corner for echoes resounded with the echoes of footsteps coming and going , yet not a footstep was there . “ A multitude of [people]360-people , and yet a solitude ! ”[162-darnay] said [Darnay]162-darnay , when [they]1644-they had listened for a while . “ Is it not impressive , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ? ”[175-lucie] asked [Lucie]175-lucie . “ Sometimes , [I]175-lucie have sat [here]4902-here of an evening , until [I]175-lucie have fancied -- but even the shade of a foolish fancy makes [me]175-lucie shudder to - night , when all is so black and solemn-- ”[175-lucie] “ Let [us]1644-they shudder too . [We]1644-they may know what it is . ”[177-carton] “ It will seem nothing to [you]162-darnay . Such whims are only impressive as [we]1644-they originate them , [I]177-carton think ; they are not to be communicated . [I]177-carton have sometimes sat alone here of an evening , listening , until [I]177-carton have made the echoes out to be the echoes of all the footsteps that are coming by - and - bye into [our]1644-they lives . ”[177-carton] “ There is a great crowd coming one day into [our]1644-they lives , if that be so , ”[177-carton] [Sydney Carton]177-carton struck in , in [his]177-carton moody way . The footsteps were incessant , and the hurry of them became more and more rapid . [The corner]1538-the corner echoed and re - echoed with the tread of feet ; some , as it seemed , under the windows ; some , as it seemed , in [the room]565-the room ; some coming , some going , some breaking off , some stopping altogether ; all in [the distant streets]1659-the distant streets , and not one within sight . “ Are all these footsteps destined to come to all of [us]1644-they , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , or are [we]1644-they to divide them among [us]1644-they ? ”[172-carton] “ [I]172-carton do n’t know , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay ; [I]172-carton told [you]162-darnay it was a foolish fancy , but [you]162-darnay asked for it . When [I]172-carton have yielded [myself]172-carton to it , [I]172-carton have been alone , and then [I]172-carton have imagined [them]5399-them the footsteps of [the people who are to come into [my]172-carton life]5400-the people who are to come into my life , and [[my]172-carton father]4969-my father ’s . ”[172-carton] “ [I]172-carton take [them]5399-them into [mine]172-carton ! ”[172-carton] said [Carton]172-carton . “ _ [I]172-carton _ ask no questions and make no stipulations . There is a great crowd bearing down upon [us]5402-us , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , and [I]172-carton see [them]5399-them -- by the Lightning . ”[172-carton] [He]172-carton added the last words , after there had been a vivid flash which had shown [him]172-carton lounging in the window . “ And [I]172-carton hear [them]5399-them ! ”[172-carton] [he]172-carton added again , after a peal of thunder . “ Here [they]5399-them come , fast , fierce , and furious ! ”[172-carton] It was the rush and roar of rain that [he]172-carton typified , and it stopped [him]172-carton , for no voice could be heard in it . A memorable storm of thunder and lightning broke with that sweep of water , and there was not a moment ’s interval in crash , and fire , and rain , until after the moon rose at midnight . The great bell of [Saint Paul ’s]61-saint paul ’s was striking one in the cleared air , when [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , escorted by [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , high - booted and bearing a lantern , set forth on [his]133-mr. lorry return - passage to [Clerkenwell]57-clerkenwell . There were solitary patches of road on the way between [Soho]58-soho and [Clerkenwell]57-clerkenwell , and [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , mindful of foot - pads , always retained [Jerry]133-mr. lorry for this service : though it was usually performed a good two hours earlier . “ What a night it has been ! Almost a night , [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , “ to bring the dead out of [their]5399-them graves . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry never see the night [myself]133-mr. lorry , [master]5403-master -- nor yet [I]133-mr. lorry do n’t expect to -- what would do that , ”[133-mr. lorry] answered [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . “ Good night , [Mr. Carton]172-carton , ”[1660-the man of business] said [the man of business]1660-the man of business . “ Good night , [Mr. Darnay]162-darnay . Shall [we]5404-we ever see such a night again , together ! ”[1660-the man of business] Perhaps . Perhaps , see [the great crowd of [people]360-people with its rush and roar , bearing down upon [them]360-people , too . CHAPTER VII . Monseigneur in [Town Monseigneur]1663-town monseigneur , one of [the great lords in power at [the Court]4990-the court]1664-the great lords in power at the court]1661-the great crowd of people with its rush and roar , bearing down upon them , too . chapter vii . monseigneur in town monseigneur , one of the great lords in power at the court , held [his]1663-town monseigneur fortnightly reception in [[his]1663-town monseigneur grand hotel in [Paris]7-paris]1666-his grand hotel in paris . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur was in [[his]188-monseigneur inner room]1667-his inner room , [[his]188-monseigneur sanctuary of sanctuaries]1668-his sanctuary of sanctuaries , the Holiest of Holiests to [the crowd of [worshippers]1670-worshippers]1669-the crowd of worshippers in [the suite of rooms without]1671-the suite of rooms without . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur was about to take [his]188-monseigneur chocolate . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur could swallow a great many things with ease , and was by some few sullen minds supposed to be rather rapidly swallowing [France]2-france ; but , [his]188-monseigneur morning ’s chocolate could not so much as get into the throat of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , without the aid of [four strong men besides [the Cook]1673-the cook]1672-four strong men besides the cook . Yes . It took [four men , all four ablaze with gorgeous decoration]1674-four men , all four ablaze with gorgeous decoration , and [the Chief of [them]1674-four men , all four ablaze with gorgeous decoration]1675-the chief of them unable to exist with fewer than two gold watches in [his]1675-the chief of them pocket , emulative of the noble and chaste fashion set by [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , to conduct the happy chocolate to [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ’s lips . One lacquey carried the chocolate - pot into the sacred presence ; a second , milled and frothed the chocolate with the little instrument [he]1675-the chief of them bore for that function ; [a third , presented the favoured napkin]1676-a third , presented the favoured napkin ; a fourth ( [he]1677-he of the two gold watches ) , poured the chocolate out . It was impossible for [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur to dispense with one of [these attendants on the chocolate]1678-these attendants on the chocolate and hold [his]188-monseigneur high place under the admiring Heavens . [Deep]189-deep would have been the blot upon [his]188-monseigneur escutcheon if [his]188-monseigneur chocolate had been ignobly waited on by [only three men]1679-only three men ; [he]188-monseigneur must have died of two . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had been out at a little supper last night , where the Comedy and [the Grand Opera]1680-the grand opera were charmingly represented . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur was out at a little supper most nights , with [fascinating company]1681-fascinating company . So polite and so impressible was [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , that the Comedy and the Grand Opera had far more influence with [him]188-monseigneur in the tiresome articles of state affairs and state secrets , than the needs of [all France]1682-all france . A happy circumstance for [France]2-france , as the like always is for [all countries]1683-all countries similarly favoured!--always was for [England]1-england ( by way of example ) , in the regretted days of [the merry Stuart who sold it]1684-the merry stuart who sold it . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had one truly noble idea of general public business , which was , to let everything go on in its own way ; of particular public business , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had the other truly noble idea that it must all go [his]188-monseigneur way -- tend to [his]188-monseigneur own power and pocket . Of [his]188-monseigneur pleasures , general and particular , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had the other truly noble idea , that [the world]519-the world was made for [them]1686-them . The text of [his]188-monseigneur order ( altered from the original by only a pronoun , which is not much ) ran : “ [The earth]5405-the earth and the fulness thereof are mine , saith [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur . ”[188-monseigneur] Yet , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had slowly found that vulgar embarrassments crept into [his]188-monseigneur affairs , both private and public ; and [he]188-monseigneur had , as to both classes of affairs , allied [himself]188-monseigneur perforce with [a Farmer - General]1687-a farmer - general . As to finances public , because [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur could not make anything at all of [them]1688-them , and must consequently let [them]1688-them out to [somebody who could]1689-somebody who could ; as to finances private , because [Farmer - Generals]1690-farmer - generals were rich , and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , after generations of great luxury and expense , was growing poor . Hence [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had taken [[his]188-monseigneur sister]1691-his sister from [a convent]1692-a convent , while there was yet time to ward off the impending veil , the cheapest garment [she]1691-his sister could wear , and had bestowed [her]1691-his sister as a prize upon [a very rich Farmer - General]1693-a very rich farmer - general , poor in [family]1694-family . Which [Farmer - General]1695-farmer - general , carrying an appropriate cane with a golden apple on the top of it , was now among the company in [the outer rooms]1696-the outer rooms , much prostrated before by [mankind]1697-mankind -- always excepting [superior mankind of the blood of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1698-superior mankind of the blood of monseigneur , who , [[his]188-monseigneur own wife]1699-his own wife included , looked down upon [him]188-monseigneur with the loftiest contempt . [A sumptuous man]1700-a sumptuous man was [the Farmer - General]1701-the farmer - general . Thirty horses stood in [[his]1701-the farmer - general stables]1702-his stables , [twenty - four male domestics]1703-twenty - four male domestics sat in [[his]1701-the farmer - general halls]1704-his halls , [six body - women waited on [[his]1701-the farmer - general wife]4987-his wife]1705-six body - women waited on his wife . As one who pretended to do nothing but plunder and forage where [he]1701-the farmer - general could , [the Farmer - General]1701-the farmer - general -- howsoever [his]1701-the farmer - general matrimonial relations conduced to social morality -- was at least the greatest reality among [the personages who attended at [the hotel of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1709-the hotel of monseigneur that day]1708-the personages who attended at the hotel of monseigneur that day . For , [the rooms]1572-the rooms , though a beautiful scene to look at , and adorned with every device of decoration that the taste and skill of the time could achieve , were , in truth , not a sound business ; considered with any reference to the scarecrows in the rags and nightcaps elsewhere ( and not so far off , either , but that [the watching towers of [Notre Dame]28-notre dame]1711-the watching towers of notre dame , almost equidistant from the two extremes , could see [them]1712-them both ) , [they]1712-them would have been an exceedingly uncomfortable business -- if that could have been [anybody]636-anybody ’s business , at [the house of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1714-the house of monseigneur . [Military officers destitute of military knowledge]1715-military officers destitute of military knowledge ; [naval officers]1716-naval officers with no idea of [a ship]1717-a ship ; [civil officers without a notion of affairs]1718-civil officers without a notion of affairs ; brazen ecclesiastics , of [the worst world worldly , with sensual eyes , loose tongues , and looser lives]1719-the worst world worldly , with sensual eyes , loose tongues , and looser lives ; all totally unfit for [their]1712-them several callings , all lying horribly in pretending to belong to [them]1712-them , but all nearly or [remotely of the order of Monseigneur]1720-remotely of the order of monseigneur , and therefore foisted on all public employments from which anything was to be got ; these were to be told off by the score and the score . [People not immediately connected with Monseigneur or the State]1721-people not immediately connected with monseigneur or the state , yet equally unconnected with anything that was real , or with lives passed in travelling by [any straight road]1722-any straight road to any true earthly end , were no less abundant . [Doctors who made great fortunes out of dainty remedies for imaginary disorders that never existed]1723-doctors who made great fortunes out of dainty remedies for imaginary disorders that never existed , smiled upon [[their]1723-doctors who made great fortunes out of dainty remedies for imaginary disorders that never existed courtly patients]1724-their courtly patients in [the ante - chambers of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1725-the ante - chambers of monseigneur . Projectors who had discovered every kind of remedy for the little evils with which the State was touched , except the remedy of setting to work in earnest to root out a single sin , poured [their]1723-doctors who made great fortunes out of dainty remedies for imaginary disorders that never existed distracting babble into any ears [they]1723-doctors who made great fortunes out of dainty remedies for imaginary disorders that never existed could lay hold of , at the reception of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur . [Unbelieving Philosophers who were remodelling [the world]519-the world with words , and making card - towers of [Babel]64-babel]1726-unbelieving philosophers who were remodelling the world with words , and making card - towers of babel to scale the skies with , talked with [Unbelieving Chemists who had an eye on the transmutation of metals]1728-unbelieving chemists who had an eye on the transmutation of metals , at this wonderful gathering accumulated by [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur . [Exquisite gentlemen of the finest breeding , which was at that remarkable time -- and has been since -- to be known by its fruits of indifference to every natural subject of human interest]1729-exquisite gentlemen of the finest breeding , which was at that remarkable time -- and has been since -- to be known by its fruits of indifference to every natural subject of human interest , were in the most exemplary state of exhaustion , at [the hotel of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1709-the hotel of monseigneur . [Such homes]1731-such homes had these various notabilities left behind [them]1731-such homes in [the fine world of [Paris]7-paris]1732-the fine world of paris , that [the spies among [the assembled devotees of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur -- forming a goodly half of [the polite company]1735-the polite company]1734-the assembled devotees of monseigneur -- forming a goodly half of the polite company]1733-the spies among the assembled devotees of monseigneur -- forming a goodly half of the polite company -- would have found it hard to discover among [the angels of that sphere]1736-the angels of that sphere [one solitary wife]1737-one solitary wife , who , in [her]1737-one solitary wife manners and appearance , owned to being [a Mother]1738-a mother . Indeed , except for the mere act of bringing [a troublesome creature]1739-a troublesome creature into [this world]976-this world -- which does not go far towards the realisation of the name of [mother]5143-mother -- there was no such thing known to the fashion . [Peasant women]1742-peasant women kept [the unfashionable babies]1743-the unfashionable babies close , and brought [them]1743-the unfashionable babies up , and charming [grandmammas of sixty dressed and supped as at twenty]1744-grandmammas of sixty dressed and supped as at twenty . The leprosy of unreality disfigured [every human creature in attendance upon [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1745-every human creature in attendance upon monseigneur . In [the outermost room]1746-the outermost room were [half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in [them]1747-half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in them that things in general were going rather wrong that things in general were going rather wrong]1747-half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in them that things in general were going rather wrong . As a promising way of setting [them]1747-half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in them that things in general were going rather wrong right , half of [the half - dozen]1748-the half - dozen had become [members of [a fantastic sect of Convulsionists]1750-a fantastic sect of convulsionists]1749-members of a fantastic sect of convulsionists , and were even then considering within [themselves]1747-half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in them that things in general were going rather wrong whether [they]1747-half a dozen exceptional people who had had , for a few years , some vague misgiving in them that things in general were going rather wrong should foam , rage , roar , and turn cataleptic on the spot -- thereby setting up a highly intelligible finger - post to the Future , for [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ’s guidance . Besides [these Dervishes]1751-these dervishes , were other three who had rushed into another sect , which mended matters with a jargon about “ [the Centre of Truth]5406-the centre of truth : ”[190-man] holding that [Man]190-man had got out of [the Centre of Truth]5406-the centre of truth -- which did not need much demonstration -- but had not got out of the Circumference , and that [he]190-man was to be kept from flying out of the Circumference , and was even to be shoved back into [the Centre]1753-the centre , by fasting and seeing of spirits . Among these , accordingly , much discoursing with spirits went on -- and it did a world of good which never became manifest . But , the comfort was , that [all the company at [the grand hotel of Monseigneur]1755-the grand hotel of monseigneur]1754-all the company at the grand hotel of monseigneur were perfectly dressed . If the Day of Judgment had only been ascertained to be a dress day , [everybody there]1128-everybody there would have been eternally correct . Such frizzling and powdering and sticking up of hair , such delicate complexions artificially preserved and mended , such gallant swords to look at , and such delicate honour to the sense of smell , would surely keep anything going , for ever and ever . [The exquisite gentlemen of the finest breeding]1757-the exquisite gentlemen of the finest breeding wore little pendent trinkets that chinked as they languidly moved ; these golden fetters rang like precious little bells ; and what with that ringing , and with the rustle of silk and brocade and fine linen , there was a flutter in the air that fanned [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine and [his]144-saint antoine devouring hunger far away . Dress was the one unfailing talisman and charm used for keeping all things in [their]1758-their places . [Everybody]1759-everybody was dressed for a Fancy Ball that was never to leave off . From [the Palace of the Tuileries]1760-the palace of the tuileries , through [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur and [the whole Court]5341-the whole court , through [the Chambers]1762-the chambers , [the Tribunals of Justice]1763-the tribunals of justice , and [all society]1764-all society ( except [the scarecrows]742-the scarecrows ) , the Fancy Ball descended to [the Common Executioner]1766-the common executioner : who , in pursuance of the charm , was required to officiate “ frizzled , powdered , in a gold - laced coat , pumps , and white silk stockings . ”[1766-the common executioner] At the gallows and the wheel -- the axe was a rarity -- [Monsieur Paris]191-monsieur paris , as it was the episcopal mode among [[his]191-monsieur paris brother Professors of [the provinces]1768-the provinces]1767-his brother professors of the provinces , [Monsieur Orleans]192-monsieur orleans , and [the rest]367-the rest , to call [him]191-monsieur paris , presided in this dainty dress . And who among [the company at [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ’s reception in that seventeen hundred and eightieth year of [[our]1771-our Lord]998-our lord]1770-the company at monseigneur ’s reception in that seventeen hundred and eightieth year of our lord , could possibly doubt , that a system rooted in [a frizzled hangman , powdered , gold - laced , pumped , and white - silk stockinged]1773-a frizzled hangman , powdered , gold - laced , pumped , and white - silk stockinged , would see the very stars out ! [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur having eased [[his]188-monseigneur four men]1774-his four men of [their]1774-his four men burdens and taken [his]188-monseigneur chocolate , caused the doors of [the Holiest of Holiests]1775-the holiest of holiests to be thrown open , and issued forth . Then , what submission , what cringing and fawning , what servility , what abject humiliation ! As to bowing down in body and spirit , nothing in that way was left for Heaven -- which may have been one among other reasons why [the worshippers of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]1776-the worshippers of monseigneur never troubled it . Bestowing a word of promise here and a smile there , a whisper on [one happy slave]1777-one happy slave and a wave of the hand on another , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur affably passed through [[his]188-monseigneur rooms]1778-his rooms to [the remote region of [the Circumference of Truth]1780-the circumference of truth]1779-the remote region of the circumference of truth . There , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur turned , and came back again , and so in due course of time got [himself]188-monseigneur shut up in [[his]188-monseigneur sanctuary]1781-his sanctuary by [the chocolate sprites]1782-the chocolate sprites , and was seen no more . The show being over , the flutter in the air became quite a little storm , and the precious little bells went ringing [downstairs]1229-downstairs . There was soon but [one person left of all the crowd]1784-one person left of all the crowd , and [he]1784-one person left of all the crowd , with [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd hat under [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd arm and [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd snuff - box in [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd hand , slowly passed among the mirrors on [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd way out . “ [I]993-this person devote [you]5407-you , ”[993-this person] said [this person]993-this person , stopping at the last door on [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd way , and turning in the direction of [the sanctuary]1786-the sanctuary , “ to [the Devil]5059-the devil ! ”[993-this person] With that , [he]1784-one person left of all the crowd shook the snuff from [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd fingers as if [he]1784-one person left of all the crowd had shaken the dust from [his]1784-one person left of all the crowd feet , and quietly walked [downstairs]1229-downstairs . [He]1784-one person left of all the crowd was [a man of about sixty , handsomely dressed , haughty in manner , and with a face like a fine mask]1788-a man of about sixty , handsomely dressed , haughty in manner , and with a face like a fine mask . A face of a transparent paleness ; every feature in it clearly defined ; one set expression on it . The nose , beautifully formed otherwise , was very slightly pinched at the top of each nostril . In those two compressions , or dints , the only little change that the face ever showed , resided . They persisted in changing colour sometimes , and they would be occasionally dilated and contracted by something like a faint pulsation ; then , [they]1789-they gave a look of treachery , and cruelty , to the whole countenance . Examined with attention , its capacity of helping such a look was to be found in the line of the mouth , and the lines of the orbits of the eyes , being much too horizontal and thin ; still , in the effect of the face made , it was a handsome face , and a remarkable one . [Its owner]1790-its owner went [downstairs]1229-downstairs into [the courtyard]915-the courtyard , got into [[his]1790-its owner carriage]1793-his carriage , and drove away . [Not many people]1794-not many people had talked with [him]1790-its owner at [the reception]1795-the reception ; [he]1790-its owner had stood in a little space apart , and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur might have been warmer in [his]1790-its owner manner . It appeared , under the circumstances , rather agreeable to [him]1790-its owner to see [the common people]1796-the common people dispersed before [his]1790-its owner horses , and often barely escaping from being run down . [[His]1790-its owner man]1797-his man drove as if [he]1797-his man were charging [an enemy]1798-an enemy , and the furious recklessness of [the man]472-the man brought no check into the face , or to the lips , of [the master]1800-the master . The complaint had sometimes made itself audible , even in [that deaf city]1801-that deaf city and dumb age , that , in [the narrow streets without footways]1802-the narrow streets without footways , the fierce patrician custom of hard driving endangered and maimed [the mere vulgar]1803-the mere vulgar in a barbarous manner . But , [few]1804-few cared enough for that to think of it a second time , and , in this matter , as in all others , [the common wretches]1805-the common wretches were left to get out of [their]1805-the common wretches difficulties as [they]1805-the common wretches could . With a wild rattle and clatter , and an inhuman abandonment of consideration not easy to be understood in these days , [the carriage]917-the carriage dashed through [streets]1807-streets and swept round corners , with [women]671-women screaming before it , and [men]568-men clutching [each other]1035-each other and clutching [children]683-children out of its way . At last , swooping at a street corner by [a fountain]1812-a fountain , one of its wheels came to a sickening little jolt , and there was a loud cry from a number of voices , and the horses reared and plunged . But for the latter inconvenience , [the carriage]917-the carriage probably would not have stopped ; [carriages]1814-carriages were often known to drive on , and leave [their]1814-carriages wounded behind , and why not ? But [the frightened valet]1815-the frightened valet had got down in a hurry , and there were twenty hands at the horses ’ bridles . “ What has gone wrong ? ”[1816-monsieur] said [Monsieur]1816-monsieur , calmly looking out . [A tall man in a nightcap]1817-a tall man in a nightcap had caught up a bundle from among the feet of the horses , and had laid it on the basement of [the fountain]1818-the fountain , and was down in the mud and wet , howling over it like a wild animal . “ Pardon , [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis ! ”[1819-a ragged and submissive man] said [a ragged and submissive man]1819-a ragged and submissive man , “ it is [a child]894-a child . ”[1819-a ragged and submissive man] “ Why does [he]1822-the tall man make that abominable noise ? Is it [[his]1822-the tall man child]5410-his child ? ”[1819-a ragged and submissive man] “ Excuse [me]1819-a ragged and submissive man , [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis -- it is a pity -- yes . ”[1819-a ragged and submissive man] [The fountain]1818-the fountain was a little removed ; for [the street]662-the street opened , where [it]1818-the fountain was , into a space some ten or twelve yards square . As [the tall man]1822-the tall man suddenly got up from the ground , and came running at [the carriage]917-the carriage , [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis clapped [his]193-monsieur the marquis hand for an instant on [his]193-monsieur the marquis sword - hilt . “ Killed ! ”[472-the man] shrieked [the man]472-the man , in wild desperation , extending both arms at [their]1825-their length above [his]472-the man head , and staring at [him]193-monsieur the marquis . “ Dead ! ”[717-the people] [The people]717-the people closed round , and looked at [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis . There was nothing revealed by the many eyes that looked at [him]193-monsieur the marquis but watchfulness and eagerness ; there was no visible menacing or anger . Neither did [the people]717-the people say anything ; after the first cry , [they]717-the people had been silent , and [they]717-the people remained so . The voice of [the submissive man who had spoken]1828-the submissive man who had spoken , was flat and tame in its extreme submission . [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis ran [his]193-monsieur the marquis eyes over [them]717-the people all , as if [they]717-the people had been mere rats come out of [their]717-the people holes . [He]193-monsieur the marquis took out [his]193-monsieur the marquis purse . “ It is extraordinary to [me]193-monsieur the marquis , ”[193-monsieur the marquis] said [he]193-monsieur the marquis , “ that [[you]717-the people people]5411-you people can not take care of [yourselves]717-the people and [[your]717-the people children]5412-your children . One or the other of [you]717-the people is for ever in the way . How do [I]193-monsieur the marquis know what injury [you]717-the people have done [[my]193-monsieur the marquis horses]5413-my horses . See ! Give [him]5413-my horses that . ”[193-monsieur the marquis] [He]193-monsieur the marquis threw out a gold coin for [the valet]1829-the valet to pick up , and all the heads craned forward that all the eyes might look down at it as it fell . [The tall man]1822-the tall man called out again with a most unearthly cry , “ Dead ! ”[1822-the tall man] [He]193-monsieur the marquis was arrested by the quick arrival of [another man]5275-another man , for whom the rest made way . On seeing [him]1822-the tall man , [the miserable creature]1832-the miserable creature fell upon [his]1822-the tall man shoulder , sobbing and crying , and pointing to the fountain , where [some women]1833-some women were stooping over the motionless bundle , and moving gently about it . [They]1833-some women were as silent , however , as [the men]1834-the men . “ [I]1835-the last comer know all , [I]1835-the last comer know all , ”[1835-the last comer] said [the last comer]1835-the last comer . “ Be [a brave man]5414-a brave man , [[my]1835-the last comer [Gaspard]194-gaspard]5036-my gaspard ! It is better for [the poor little plaything]5416-the poor little plaything to die so , than to live . [It]5416-the poor little plaything has died in a moment without pain . Could it have lived an hour as happily ? ”[1835-the last comer] “ [You]1836-the marquis are [a philosopher]5417-a philosopher , [you]1836-the marquis there , ”[1836-the marquis] said [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , smiling . “ How do [they]1834-the men call [you]1836-the marquis ? ”[1836-the marquis] “ [They]1834-the men call [me]1835-the last comer [Defarge]146-madame defarge . ”[1835-the last comer] “ Of what trade ? ”[1835-the last comer] “ [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis , [vendor of wine]5418-vendor of wine . ”[1835-the last comer] “ Pick up that , [philosopher]5419-philosopher and [vendor of wine]5418-vendor of wine , ”[1836-the marquis] said [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , throwing [him]1836-the marquis another gold coin , “ and spend it as [you]1836-the marquis will . The horses there ; are [they]1834-the men right ? ”[1836-the marquis] Without deigning to look at [the assemblage]1838-the assemblage a second time , [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis leaned back in [his]193-monsieur the marquis seat , and was just being driven away with the air of [a gentleman who had accidentally broke some common thing , and had paid for it , and could afford to pay for it]1839-a gentleman who had accidentally broke some common thing , and had paid for it , and could afford to pay for it ; when [his]193-monsieur the marquis ease was suddenly disturbed by a coin flying into [his]193-monsieur the marquis carriage , and ringing on its floor . “ Hold ! ”[193-monsieur the marquis] said [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis . “ Hold the horses ! Who threw that ? ”[193-monsieur the marquis] [He]193-monsieur the marquis looked to the spot where [Defarge]146-madame defarge [the vendor of wine]1840-the vendor of wine had stood , a moment before ; but [the wretched father]1841-the wretched father was grovelling on [his]1841-the wretched father face on the pavement in that spot , and the figure that stood beside [him]1841-the wretched father was the figure of [a dark stout woman]1842-a dark stout woman , knitting . “ [You]5421-you dogs ! ”[1836-the marquis] said [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , but smoothly , and with an unchanged front , except as to the spots on [his]1836-the marquis nose : “ [I]1836-the marquis would ride over any of [you]5421-you very willingly , and exterminate [you]5421-you from [the earth]5405-the earth . If [I]1836-the marquis knew which rascal threw at [the carriage]917-the carriage , and if [that brigand]5424-that brigand were sufficiently near it , [he]5424-that brigand should be crushed under the wheels . ”[1836-the marquis] So cowed was [their]1844-their condition , and so long and hard [their]1844-their experience of what [such a man]1845-such a man could do to [them]1844-their , within the law and beyond it , that not a voice , or a hand , or even an eye was raised . Among [the men]1834-the men , [not one]1847-not one . But [the woman who stood knitting]1848-the woman who stood knitting looked up steadily , and looked [the Marquis]1836-the marquis in the face . It was not for [his]1836-the marquis dignity to notice it ; [his]1836-the marquis contemptuous eyes passed over [her]1848-the woman who stood knitting , and over [all the other rats]1850-all the other rats ; and [he]1836-the marquis leaned back in [his]1836-the marquis seat again , and gave the word “ Go on ! ”[1836-the marquis] [He]1836-the marquis was driven on , and [other carriages]1851-other carriages came whirling by in quick succession ; [the Minister]1852-the minister , [the State - Projector]1853-the state - projector , [the Farmer - General]1701-the farmer - general , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor , [the Lawyer]1856-the lawyer , [the Ecclesiastic]1857-the ecclesiastic , [the Grand Opera]1680-the grand opera , the Comedy , the whole Fancy Ball in a bright continuous flow , came whirling by . The rats had crept out of [their]1844-their holes to look on , and [they]1844-their remained looking on for hours ; [soldiers]1859-soldiers and [police]1860-police often passing between [them]1844-their and the spectacle , and making a barrier behind which [they]1844-their slunk , and through which [they]1844-their peeped . [The father]899-the father had long ago taken up [his]899-the father bundle and bidden [himself]899-the father away with it , when [the women who had tended the bundle while it lay on the base of the fountain]1862-the women who had tended the bundle while it lay on the base of the fountain , sat there watching the running of the water and the rolling of the Fancy Ball -- when [the one woman who had stood conspicuous , knitting , still knitted on with the steadfastness of Fate]1863-the one woman who had stood conspicuous , knitting , still knitted on with the steadfastness of fate . The water of the fountain ran , [the swift river]1864-the swift river ran , the day ran into evening , so much life in [the city]1496-the city ran into death according to rule , time and tide waited for [no man]1866-no man , the rats were sleeping close together in [their]1844-their dark holes again , the Fancy Ball was lighted up at supper , all things ran their course . CHAPTER VIII . Monseigneur in the Country A beautiful landscape , with the corn bright in it , but not abundant . Patches of poor rye where corn should have been , patches of poor peas and beans , patches of most coarse vegetable substitutes for wheat . On inanimate nature , as on [the men]1834-the men and [women who cultivated it , a prevalent tendency towards an appearance of vegetating unwillingly -- a dejected disposition to give up , and wither away]1868-women who cultivated it , a prevalent tendency towards an appearance of vegetating unwillingly -- a dejected disposition to give up , and wither away . [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis in [[his]193-monsieur the marquis travelling carriage]1869-his travelling carriage ( which might have been lighter ) , conducted by four post - horses and [two postilions]1870-two postilions , fagged up [a steep hill]1871-a steep hill . A blush on the countenance of [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis was no impeachment of [his]193-monsieur the marquis high breeding ; it was not from within ; it was occasioned by an external circumstance beyond [his]193-monsieur the marquis control -- the setting sun . The sunset struck so brilliantly into [the travelling carriage]1872-the travelling carriage when it gained [the hill - top]1873-the hill - top , that [its]1872-the travelling carriage occupant was steeped in crimson . “ It will die out , ”[193-monsieur the marquis] said [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis , glancing at [his]193-monsieur the marquis hands , “ directly . ”[193-monsieur the marquis] In effect , the sun was so low that it dipped at the moment . When the heavy drag had been adjusted to the wheel , and [the carriage]917-the carriage slid down hill , with a cinderous smell , in a cloud of dust , the red glow departed quickly ; the sun and [the Marquis]1836-the marquis going down together , there was no glow left when the drag was taken off . But , there remained [a broken country]1876-a broken country , bold and open , [a little village]1877-a little village at [the bottom of the hill]1878-the bottom of the hill , a broad sweep and rise beyond [it]1877-a little village , [a church - tower]1879-a church - tower , [a windmill]1880-a windmill , [a forest for the chase]1881-a forest for the chase , and a crag with [a fortress on [it]1883-it used as [a prison]4986-a prison]1882-a fortress on it used as a prison . Round upon all these darkening objects as the night drew on , [the Marquis]1836-the marquis looked , with the air of [one who was coming near [home]858-home]1886-one who was coming near home . [The village]1888-the village had [[its]1888-the village one poor street]1889-its one poor street , with [[its]1888-the village poor brewery]1890-its poor brewery , [poor tannery]1891-poor tannery , [poor tavern]1892-poor tavern , [poor stable - yard for relays of post - horses]1893-poor stable - yard for relays of post - horses , [poor fountain]1894-poor fountain , all usual poor appointments . [It]1888-the village had [[its]1888-the village poor people]1895-its poor people too . [All [its]1888-the village people]1896-all its people were poor , and [many of [them]1896-all its people]1897-many of them were sitting at [their]1897-many of them doors , shredding spare onions and the like for supper , while [many]1898-many were at the fountain , washing leaves , and grasses , and any such small yieldings of the earth that could be eaten . Expressive signs of what made [them]1896-all its people poor , were not wanting ; the tax for [the state]308-the state , the tax for [the church]1900-the church , the tax for [the lord]1901-the lord , tax local and [tax general]1902-tax general , were to be paid [here]4902-here and to be paid [there]4887-there , according to solemn inscription in [the little village]1905-the little village , until the wonder was , that there was [any village]1906-any village left unswallowed . [Few children]1907-few children were to be seen , and no dogs . As to [the men]1834-the men and [women]671-women , [their]1896-all its people choice on [earth]1323-earth was stated in the prospect -- Life on the lowest terms that could sustain it , down in [the little village]1905-the little village under [the mill]1912-the mill ; or captivity and Death in [the dominant prison on [the crag]1914-the crag]1913-the dominant prison on the crag . Heralded by [a courier in advance]1915-a courier in advance , and by the cracking of [his]1915-a courier in advance postilions ’ whips , which twined snake - like about [their]1896-all its people heads in the evening air , as if [he]1915-a courier in advance came attended by the Furies , [Monsieur]1916-monsieur [the Marquis]1836-the marquis drew up in [[his]1836-the marquis travelling carriage]1869-his travelling carriage at [the posting - house]1919-the posting - house gate . It was hard by [the fountain]1818-the fountain , and [the peasants]1921-the peasants suspended [their]1921-the peasants operations to look at [him]1836-the marquis . [He]1836-the marquis looked at [them]1921-the peasants , and saw in [them]1921-the peasants , without knowing it , the slow sure filing down of misery - worn face and figure , that was to make [the meagreness of Frenchmen]1922-the meagreness of frenchmen an English superstition which should survive the truth through the best part of a hundred years . [Monsieur the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis cast [his]1836-the marquis eyes over the submissive faces that drooped before [him]1836-the marquis , as the like of [himself]1836-the marquis had drooped before [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur of [the Court]4990-the court -- only the difference was , that these faces drooped merely to suffer and not to propitiate -- when [a grizzled mender of [the roads]1925-the roads]1924-a grizzled mender of the roads joined [the group]1401-the group . “ Bring [me]1836-the marquis hither [that fellow]5425-that fellow ! ”[1836-the marquis] said [the Marquis]1836-the marquis to [the courier]1928-the courier . [The fellow]748-the fellow was brought , cap in hand , and [the other fellows]1930-the other fellows closed round to look and listen , in the manner of [the people at [the [Paris]7-paris fountain]1932-the paris fountain]1931-the people at the paris fountain . “ [I]1931-the people at the paris fountain passed [you]1931-the people at the paris fountain on [the road]377-the road ? ”[1931-the people at the paris fountain] “ [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , it is true . [I]1836-the marquis had the honour of being passed on [the road]377-the road . ”[1836-the marquis] “ Coming up [the hill]375-the hill , and at [the top of [the hill]375-the hill]5429-the top of the hill , both ? ”[1931-the people at the paris fountain] “ [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , it is true . ”[1931-the people at the paris fountain] “ What did [you]1931-the people at the paris fountain look at , so fixedly ? ”[1836-the marquis] “ [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , [I]748-the fellow looked at [the man]472-the man . ”[748-the fellow] [He]748-the fellow stooped a little , and with [his]748-the fellow tattered blue cap pointed under [the carriage]917-the carriage . [All [his]748-the fellow fellows]1934-all his fellows stooped to look under [the carriage]917-the carriage . “ [What man]5432-what man , [pig]5433-pig ? And why look there ? ”[1934-all his fellows] “ Pardon , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ; [he]472-the man swung by the chain of the shoe -- the drag . ”[1836-the marquis] “ Who ? ”[1936-the traveller] demanded [the traveller]1936-the traveller . “ [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , [the man]472-the man . ”[1936-the traveller] “ May [the Devil]5059-the devil carry away [these idiots]5436-these idiots ! How do [you]1931-the people at the paris fountain call [the man]472-the man ? [You]1931-the people at the paris fountain know [all the men of [this part of [the country]956-the country]5439-this part of the country]5438-all the men of this part of the country . Who was [he]472-the man ? ”[1836-the marquis] “ [Your]1931-the people at the paris fountain clemency , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ! [He]472-the man was not of [this part of [the country]956-the country]5439-this part of the country . Of all the days of [my]1836-the marquis life , [I]1836-the marquis never saw [him]472-the man . ”[1836-the marquis] “ Swinging by the chain ? To be suffocated ? ”[1936-the traveller] “ With [your]1931-the people at the paris fountain gracious permission , that was the wonder of it , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur .
