Find out [some respectable woman with a little property]2254-some respectable woman with a little property -- [somebody in the landlady way]2255-somebody in the landlady way , or lodging - letting way -- and marry [her]2254-some respectable woman with a little property , against a rainy day . That ’s the kind of thing for _ [you]0-i _ . Now think of it , [Sydney]177-carton . ” “[177-carton] [I]0-i ’ll think of it , ” said [Sydney]177-carton . CHAPTER XII . [The Fellow of Delicacy]5602-the fellow of delicacy [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver having made up [his]171-mr. stryver mind to that magnanimous bestowal of good fortune on [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s daughter]1569-the doctor ’s daughter , resolved to make [her]1569-the doctor ’s daughter happiness known to [her]1569-the doctor ’s daughter before [he]171-mr. stryver left [town]334-town for the Long Vacation . After some mental debating of the point , [he]171-mr. stryver came to the conclusion that it would be as well to get all the preliminaries done with , and [they]5606-they could then arrange at [their]5606-they leisure whether [he]171-mr. stryver should give [her]1569-the doctor ’s daughter [his]171-mr. stryver hand a week or two before [Michaelmas Term]67-michaelmas term , or in the little Christmas vacation between it and [Hilary]68-hilary . As to the strength of [his]171-mr. stryver case , [he]171-mr. stryver had not a doubt about it , but clearly saw [his]171-mr. stryver way to the verdict . Argued with [the jury]1124-the jury on substantial worldly grounds -- the only grounds ever worth taking into account -- it was a plain case , and had not a weak spot in it . [He]171-mr. stryver called [himself]171-mr. stryver for [the plaintiff]5608-the plaintiff , there was no getting over [his]171-mr. stryver evidence , [the counsel for]5609-the counsel for [the defendant]5610-the defendant threw up [his]171-mr. stryver brief , and [the jury]1124-the jury did not even turn to consider . After trying it , [Stryver]171-mr. stryver , C. J. , was satisfied that no plainer case could be . Accordingly , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver inaugurated [the Long Vacation]5612-the long vacation with a formal proposal to take [Miss Manette]140-miss manette to [Vauxhall Gardens]69-vauxhall gardens ; that failing , to [Ranelagh]70-ranelagh ; that unaccountably failing too , it behoved [him]171-mr. stryver to present [himself]171-mr. stryver in [Soho]58-soho , and there declare [his]171-mr. stryver noble mind . Towards [Soho]58-soho , therefore , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver shouldered [his]171-mr. stryver way from [the Temple]1027-the temple , while the bloom of [the Long Vacation]5612-the long vacation ’s infancy was still upon it . [Anybody who had seen [him]171-mr. stryver projecting [himself]171-mr. stryver into [Soho]58-soho while [he]171-mr. stryver was yet on [[Saint Dunstan]71-saint dunstan ’s side of [Temple Bar]18-temple bar]5616-saint dunstan ’s side of temple bar]5615-anybody who had seen him projecting himself into soho while he was yet on saint dunstan ’s side of temple bar , bursting in [his]171-mr. stryver full - blown way along [the pavement]727-the pavement , to the jostlement of [all weaker people]5618-all weaker people , might have seen how safe and strong [he]171-mr. stryver was . [His]171-mr. stryver way taking [him]171-mr. stryver past [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , and [he]171-mr. stryver both banking at [Tellson]134-tellson ’s and knowing [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry as [the intimate friend of [the Manettes]203-the manettes]5619-the intimate friend of the manettes , it entered [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver ’s mind to enter the bank , and reveal to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry the brightness of the [Soho]58-soho horizon . So , [he]133-mr. lorry pushed open the door with the weak rattle in its throat , stumbled down the two steps , got past [the two ancient cashiers]5620-the two ancient cashiers , and shouldered [himself]133-mr. lorry into [the musty back closet where [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry]5621-the musty back closet where mr. lorry sat at great books ruled for figures , with perpendicular iron bars to [his]133-mr. lorry window as if that were ruled for figures too , and everything under the clouds were a sum . “[0-i] Halloa ! ” said [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver . “[0-i] How do [you]2256-you do ? [I]0-i hope [you]2256-you are well ! ” It was [Stryver]171-mr. stryver ’s grand peculiarity that [he]171-mr. stryver always seemed too big for any place , or space . [He]171-mr. stryver was so much too big for [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , that [old clerks in distant corners]5622-old clerks in distant corners looked up with looks of remonstrance , as though [he]171-mr. stryver squeezed [them]5622-old clerks in distant corners against the wall . [The House]951-the house [itself]951-the house , magnificently reading the paper quite in the far - off perspective , lowered displeased , as if the [Stryver]171-mr. stryver head had been butted into its responsible waistcoat . [The discreet Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry said , in a sample tone of the voice [he]133-mr. lorry would recommend under the circumstances , “[0-i] How do [you]2256-you do , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver ? Good morning . ” Then [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver turned and burst out of [the Bank]531-the bank , causing such a concussion of air on [his]171-mr. stryver passage through , that to stand up against [it]5633-it bowing behind the two counters , required the utmost remaining strength of [the two ancient clerks]5634-the two ancient clerks . [Those venerable and feeble persons]5635-those venerable and feeble persons were always seen by [the public]5636-the public in the act of bowing , and were popularly believed , when [they]5635-those venerable and feeble persons had bowed [a customer]5625-a customer out , still to keep on bowing in [the empty office]5638-the empty office until [they]5635-those venerable and feeble persons bowed [another customer]5639-another customer in . [The barrister]1425-the barrister was keen enough to divine that [the banker]5641-the banker would not have gone so far in [his]5641-the banker expression of opinion on any less solid ground than moral certainty . [He]171-mr. stryver even showed surprise when [he]171-mr. stryver saw [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , and was altogether in an absent and preoccupied state . “[0-i] Well ! ” said [that good - natured emissary]5644-that good - natured emissary , after a full half - hour of bootless attempts to bring [him]171-mr. stryver round to the question . “[0-i] [I]0-i have been to [Soho]58-soho . ” “[0-i] To [Soho]58-soho ? ” repeated [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver , coldly . “[0-i] Oh , to be sure ! [I]0-i know this must always be a sore subject with [the family]5478-the family ; let [us]2296-we say no more about it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t understand [you]0-i , ” said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “[0-i] [I]0-i dare say not , ” rejoined [Stryver]171-mr. stryver , nodding [his]171-mr. stryver head in a smoothing and final way ; “[0-i] no matter , no matter . ” “[0-i] But it does matter , ” [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry urged . “[0-i] No it does n’t ; [I]0-i assure [you]0-i it does n’t . Having supposed that there was sense where there is no sense , and a laudable ambition where there is not a laudable ambition , [I]0-i am well out of [my]0-i mistake , and no harm is done . [Young women]2299-young women have committed similar follies often before , and have repented [them]2299-young women in poverty and obscurity often before . In an unselfish aspect , [I]0-i am sorry that the thing is dropped , because it would have been a bad thing for [me]0-i in a worldly point of view ; in a selfish aspect , [I]0-i am glad that the thing has dropped , because it would have been a bad thing for [me]0-i in a worldly point of view -- it is hardly necessary to say [I]0-i could have gained nothing by it . There is no harm at all done . [I]0-i have not proposed to [the young lady]642-the young lady , and , between [ourselves]2301-ourselves , [I]0-i am by no means certain , on reflection , that [I]0-i ever should have committed [myself]0-i to that extent . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , [you]0-i can not control the mincing vanities and giddinesses of [empty - headed girls]2302-empty - headed girls ; [you]0-i must not expect to do it , or [you]0-i will always be disappointed . Now , pray say no more about it . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i , [I]0-i regret it on account of [others]672-others , but [I]0-i am satisfied on [my]0-i own account . And [I]0-i am really very much obliged to [you]0-i for allowing [me]0-i to sound [you]0-i , and for giving [me]0-i [your]0-i advice ; [you]0-i know [the young lady]642-the young lady better than [I]0-i do ; [you]0-i were right , it never would have done . ” [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry was so taken aback , that [he]133-mr. lorry looked quite stupidly at [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver shouldering [him]133-mr. lorry towards the door , with an appearance of showering generosity , forbearance , and goodwill , on [his]171-mr. stryver erring head . “[0-i] Make the best of it , [[my]0-i dear [sir]4862-sir]2305-my dear sir , ” said [Stryver]171-mr. stryver ; “[4862-sir] say no more about it ; thank [you]4862-sir again for allowing [me]0-i to sound [you]4862-sir ; good night ! ” [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry was out in the night , before [he]133-mr. lorry knew where [he]133-mr. lorry was . [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver was lying back on [his]171-mr. stryver sofa , winking at [his]171-mr. stryver ceiling . [CHAPTER XIII]206-chapter xiii . [The Fellow of No Delicacy]5645-the fellow of no delicacy If [Sydney Carton]177-carton ever shone anywhere , [he]177-carton certainly never shone in [the house of [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette]5646-the house of doctor manette . [He]177-carton had been [there]4887-there often , during a whole year , and had always been [the same moody and morose lounger there]5648-the same moody and morose lounger there . When [he]177-carton cared to talk , [he]177-carton talked well ; but , the cloud of caring for nothing , which overshadowed [him]177-carton with such a fatal darkness , was very rarely pierced by the light within [him]177-carton . And yet [he]177-carton did care something for [the streets that environed that house]5649-the streets that environed that house , and for the senseless stones that made [their]5649-the streets that environed that house pavements . Many a night [he]177-carton vaguely and unhappily wandered [there]4887-there , when wine had brought no transitory gladness to [him]177-carton ; many a dreary daybreak revealed [his]177-carton solitary figure lingering [there]4887-there , and still lingering there when the first beams of the sun brought into strong relief , removed beauties of architecture in spires of [churches]5652-churches and [lofty buildings]5653-lofty buildings , as perhaps the quiet time brought some sense of better things , else forgotten and unattainable , into [his]177-carton mind . Of late , the neglected bed in [the Temple Court]5654-the temple court had known [him]177-carton more scantily than ever ; and often when [he]177-carton had thrown [himself]177-carton upon [it]5655-it no longer than a few minutes , [he]177-carton had got up again , and haunted [that neighbourhood]5656-that neighbourhood . On a day in August , when [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver ( after notifying to [[his]2307-his jackal]5591-his jackal that “[2307-his] [he]2307-his had thought better of that marrying matter ” ) had carried [his]2307-his delicacy into [Devonshire]74-devonshire , and when the sight and scent of flowers in [the City streets]5658-the city streets had some waifs of goodness in them for the worst , of health for the sickliest , and of youth for the oldest , [Sydney]177-carton ’s feet still trod those stones . From being irresolute and purposeless , [his]177-carton feet became animated by an intention , and , in the working out of that intention , [they]5659-they took [him]177-carton to [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s door . [He]177-carton was shown up - stairs , and found [Lucie]174-lucie at [her]174-lucie work , alone . [She]174-lucie had never been quite at [her]174-lucie ease with [him]177-carton , and received [him]177-carton with some little embarrassment as [he]177-carton seated [himself]177-carton near [her]174-lucie table . But , looking up at [his]177-carton face in the interchange of [the first few common - places]5661-the first few common - places , [she]174-lucie observed a change in it . “[2307-his] [I]0-i fear [you]2308-you are not well , [Mr. Carton]172-carton ! ” “[172-carton] No . But the life [I]0-i lead , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , is not conducive to health . What is to be expected of , or by , such profligates ? ” “[2307-his] Is it not -- forgive [me]0-i ; [I]0-i have begun the question on [my]0-i lips -- a pity to live no better life ? ” “[0-i] God knows it is a shame ! ” “[0-i] Then why not change it ? ” Looking gently at [him]177-carton again , [she]174-lucie was surprised and saddened to see that there were tears in [his]177-carton eyes . There were tears in [his]177-carton voice too , as [he]177-carton answered : “[0-i] It is too late for that . [I]0-i shall never be better than [I]0-i am . [I]0-i shall sink lower , and be worse . ” [He]177-carton leaned an elbow on [her]174-lucie table , and covered [his]177-carton eyes with [his]177-carton hand . The table trembled in the silence that followed . [She]174-lucie had never seen [him]177-carton softened , and was much distressed . [He]177-carton knew [her]174-lucie to be so , without looking at [her]174-lucie , and said : “[0-i] Pray forgive [me]0-i , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette . [I]0-i break down before the knowledge of what [I]0-i want to say to [you]140-miss manette . Will [you]140-miss manette hear [me]0-i ? ” “[140-miss manette] If it will do [you]140-miss manette any good , [Mr. Carton]172-carton , if it would make [you]140-miss manette happier , it would make [me]0-i very glad ! ” “[149-god] [God]149-god bless [you]140-miss manette for [your]140-miss manette sweet compassion ! ” [He]0-i unshaded [his]0-i face after a little while , and spoke steadily . “[149-god] Do n’t be afraid to hear [me]0-i . Do n’t shrink from anything [I]0-i say . [I]0-i am like one who died young . All [my]0-i life might have been . ” “[172-carton] No , [Mr. Carton]172-carton . [I]0-i am sure that the best part of it might still be ; [I]0-i am sure that [you]172-carton might be much , much worthier of [yourself]172-carton . ” “[140-miss manette] Say of [you]140-miss manette , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , and although [I]0-i know better -- although in the mystery of [my]0-i own wretched heart [I]0-i know better -- [I]0-i shall never forget it ! ” [She]140-miss manette was pale and trembling . [He]172-carton came to [her]140-miss manette relief with a fixed despair of [himself]172-carton which made the interview unlike any other that could have been holden . “[0-i] If it had been possible , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , that [you]140-miss manette could have returned the love of [the man [you]140-miss manette see before [yourself]140-miss manette]2309-the man you see before yourself -- flung away , wasted , drunken , poor creature of misuse as [you]140-miss manette know [him]2309-the man you see before yourself to be -- [he]2309-the man you see before yourself would have been conscious this day and hour , in spite of [his]2309-the man you see before yourself happiness , that [he]2309-the man you see before yourself would bring [you]140-miss manette to misery , bring [you]140-miss manette to sorrow and repentance , blight [you]140-miss manette , disgrace [you]140-miss manette , pull [you]140-miss manette down with [him]2309-the man you see before yourself . [I]0-i know very well that [you]140-miss manette can have no tenderness for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i ask for none ; [I]0-i am even thankful that it can not be . ” “[0-i] Without it , can [I]0-i not save [you]140-miss manette , [Mr. Carton]172-carton ? Can [I]0-i not recall [you]140-miss manette -- forgive [me]0-i again!--to a better course ? Can [I]0-i in no way repay [your]140-miss manette confidence ? [I]0-i know this is a confidence , ” [she]140-miss manette modestly said , after a little hesitation , and in earnest tears , “[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]140-miss manette would say this to [no one else]2310-no one else . No , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , to none . If [you]140-miss manette will hear [me]0-i through a very little more , all [you]140-miss manette can ever do for [me]0-i is done . [I]0-i wish [you]140-miss manette to know that [you]140-miss manette have been the last dream of [my]0-i soul . In [my]0-i degradation [I]0-i have not been so degraded but that the sight of [you]140-miss manette with [[your]140-miss manette father]4947-your father , and of [this home]2312-this home made such a home by [you]140-miss manette , has stirred old shadows that [I]0-i thought had died out of [me]0-i . Since [I]0-i knew [you]140-miss manette , [I]0-i have been troubled by a remorse that [I]0-i thought would never reproach [me]0-i again , and have heard whispers from old voices impelling [me]0-i upward , that [I]0-i thought were silent for ever . [I]0-i have had unformed ideas of striving afresh , beginning anew , shaking off sloth and sensuality , and fighting out the abandoned fight . A dream , all a dream , that ends in nothing , and leaves the sleeper where [he]2313-he lay down , but [I]0-i wish [you]140-miss manette to know that [you]140-miss manette inspired it . ” “[140-miss manette] Will nothing of it remain ? [O Mr. Carton]172-carton , think again ! Try again ! ” “[140-miss manette] No , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette ; all through it , [I]0-i have known [myself]0-i to be quite undeserving . And yet [I]0-i have had the weakness , and have still the weakness , to wish [you]140-miss manette to know with what a sudden mastery [you]140-miss manette kindled [me]0-i , heap of ashes that [I]0-i am , into fire -- a fire , however , inseparable in its nature from [myself]0-i , quickening nothing , lighting nothing , doing no service , idly burning away . ” “[140-miss manette] Since it is [my]0-i misfortune , [Mr. Carton]172-carton , to have made [you]140-miss manette more unhappy than [you]140-miss manette were before [you]140-miss manette knew [me--]0-i ” “[0-i] Do n’t say that , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette , for [you]140-miss manette would have reclaimed [me]0-i , if anything could . In the hour of [my]0-i death , [I]0-i shall hold sacred the one good remembrance -- and shall thank and bless [you]140-miss manette for it -- that [my]0-i last avowal of [myself]0-i was made to [you]140-miss manette , and that [my]0-i name , and faults , and miseries were gently carried in [your]140-miss manette heart . May it otherwise be light and happy ! ” [He]172-carton was so unlike what [he]172-carton had ever shown [himself]172-carton to be , and it was so sad to think how much [he]172-carton had thrown away , and how much [he]172-carton every day kept down and perverted , that [Lucie Manette]174-lucie wept mournfully for [him]172-carton as [he]172-carton stood looking back at [her]174-lucie . “[140-miss manette] Be comforted ! ” [he]172-carton said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am not worth such feeling , [Miss Manette]140-miss manette . CHAPTER XIV . [The Honest Tradesman]5662-the honest tradesman To the eyes of [Mr. Jeremiah Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , sitting on [his]156-mr. cruncher stool in [Fleet - street]38-fleet - street with [[his]156-mr. cruncher grisly urchin]5663-his grisly urchin beside [him]156-mr. cruncher , a vast number and variety of objects in movement were every day presented . Who could sit upon anything in [Fleet - street]962-fleet - street during the busy hours of the day , and not be dazed and deafened by two immense processions , [one ever tending westward with the sun]5665-one ever tending westward with the sun , [the other ever tending eastward from the sun]5666-the other ever tending eastward from the sun , both ever tending to [the plains beyond the range of red and purple where the sun goes down]5667-the plains beyond the range of red and purple where the sun goes down ! With [his]156-mr. cruncher straw in [his]156-mr. cruncher mouth , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher sat watching the two streams , like [the heathen rustic who has for several centuries been on duty watching one stream]5668-the heathen rustic who has for several centuries been on duty watching one stream -- saving that [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher had no expectation of [their]5669-their ever running dry . Nor would it have been an expectation of a hopeful kind , since a small part of [his]156-mr. cruncher income was derived from the pilotage of [timid women]5670-timid women ( mostly of a full habit and past the middle term of life ) from [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s side of the tides]5671-tellson ’s side of the tides to [the opposite shore]5672-the opposite shore . Brief as such companionship was in every separate instance , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher never failed to become so interested in [the lady]2231-the lady as to express a strong desire to have the honour of drinking [her]2231-the lady very good health . And it was from the gifts bestowed upon [him]156-mr. cruncher towards the execution of this benevolent purpose , that [he]156-mr. cruncher recruited [his]156-mr. cruncher finances , as just now observed . Time was , when [a poet]5674-a poet sat upon a stool in [a public place]5675-a public place , and mused in the sight of [men]568-men . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , sitting on a stool in [a public place]5675-a public place , but not being [a poet]5674-a poet , mused as little as possible , and looked about [him]156-mr. cruncher . It fell out that [he]156-mr. cruncher was thus engaged in a season when [crowds]5366-crowds were few , and [belated women few]5680-belated women few , and when [his]156-mr. cruncher affairs in general were so unprosperous as to awaken a strong suspicion in [his]156-mr. cruncher breast that [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher must have been “[2324-a man who would give his life , to keep a life you love beside you] flopping ” in some pointed manner , when an unusual concourse pouring down [Fleet - street westward]5681-fleet - street westward , attracted [his]156-mr. cruncher attention . Looking that way , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher made out that some kind of funeral was coming along , and that there was popular objection to this funeral , which engendered uproar . “[159-young jerry] [Young Jerry]159-young jerry , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , turning to [[his]156-mr. cruncher offspring]5682-his offspring , “[159-young jerry] it ’s a buryin ’ . ” “[159-young jerry] Hooroar , [father]5144-father ! ” cried [Young Jerry]159-young jerry . [The young gentleman]5683-the young gentleman uttered this exultant sound with mysterious significance . [The elder gentleman]5684-the elder gentleman took the cry so ill , that [he]5684-the elder gentleman watched [his]5684-the elder gentleman opportunity , and smote [the young gentleman]5683-the young gentleman on the ear . “[5144-father] What [d’ye]2326-d’ye mean ? What are [you]159-young jerry hooroaring at ? What do [you]159-young jerry want to conwey to [[your]159-young jerry own father]2327-your own father , [[you]159-young jerry young Rip]2328-you young rip ? [This boy]2329-this boy is a getting too many for _ [me]0-i _ ! ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , surveying [him]2329-this boy . “[2329-this boy] [Him]2329-this boy and [his]2329-this boy hooroars ! Do n’t let [me]0-i hear no more of [you]159-young jerry , or [you]159-young jerry shall feel some more of [me]0-i . [D’ye]2326-d’ye hear ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i warn’t doing no harm , ” [Young Jerry]159-young jerry protested , rubbing [his]159-young jerry cheek . “[0-i] Drop it then , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ; “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n’t have none of _ [your]159-young jerry _ no harms . Get a top of that there seat , and look at [the crowd]1386-the crowd . ” [[His]156-mr. cruncher son]955-his son obeyed , and [the crowd]1386-the crowd approached ; [they]1386-the crowd were bawling and hissing round [a dingy hearse]5688-a dingy hearse and [dingy mourning coach]5689-dingy mourning coach , in which [mourning coach]5690-mourning coach there was only [one mourner]5691-one mourner , dressed in the dingy trappings that were considered essential to the dignity of the position . The position appeared by no means to please [him]156-mr. cruncher , however , with an increasing rabble surrounding [the coach]376-the coach , deriding [him]156-mr. cruncher , making grimaces at [him]156-mr. cruncher , and incessantly groaning and calling out : “[1386-the crowd] Yah ! [Spies]2331-spies ! Tst ! Yaha ! [Spies]2331-spies ! ” with many compliments too numerous and forcible to repeat . Funerals had at all times a remarkable attraction for [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ; [he]156-mr. cruncher always pricked up [his]156-mr. cruncher senses , and became excited , when a funeral passed [Tellson]134-tellson ’s . Naturally , therefore , a funeral with this uncommon attendance excited [him]156-mr. cruncher greatly , and [he]156-mr. cruncher asked of [the first man who ran against [him]156-mr. cruncher]5693-the first man who ran against him : “[2331-spies] What is it , [brother]2333-brother ? What ’s it about ? ” “[0-i] _ [I]0-i _ do n’t know , ” said [the man]472-the man . “[2331-spies] [Spies]2331-spies ! [Yaha]2335-yaha ! Tst ! [Spies]2331-spies ! ” [He]156-mr. cruncher asked [another man]5275-another man . “[2331-spies] Who is it ? ” “[0-i] _ [I]0-i _ do n’t know , ” returned [the man]472-the man , clapping [his]472-the man hands to [his]472-the man mouth nevertheless , and vociferating in a surprising heat and with the greatest ardour , “[0-i] [Spies]2331-spies ! [Yaha]2335-yaha ! Tst , tst ! Spi -- ies ! ” At length , [a person better informed on the merits of the case]5697-a person better informed on the merits of the case , tumbled against [him]156-mr. cruncher , and from [this person]993-this person [he]156-mr. cruncher learned that the funeral was the funeral of [one Roger Cly]168-cly . “[2338-he] Was [he]2338-he [a spy]1220-a spy ? ” asked [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher . “[2340-old bailey spy] [Old Bailey spy]2340-old bailey spy , ” returned [[his]156-mr. cruncher informant]5699-his informant . “[2340-old bailey spy] Yaha ! Tst ! Yah ! [Old Bailey Spi -- i -- ies]2341-old bailey spi -- i -- ies ! ” “[2341-old bailey spi -- i -- ies] Why , to be sure ! ” exclaimed [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher , recalling the Trial at which [he]0-i had assisted . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve seen [him]2338-he . Dead , is [he]2338-he ? ” “[2338-he] Dead as mutton , ” returned [the other]756-the other , “[2338-he] and ca n’t be too dead . Have ’em out , there ! [Spies]2331-spies ! Pull ’em out , there ! [Spies]2331-spies ! ” The idea was so acceptable in the prevalent absence of any idea , that [the crowd]1386-the crowd caught it up with eagerness , and loudly repeating the suggestion to have ’em out , and to pull [’em]5702-’em out , mobbed [the two vehicles]5703-the two vehicles so closely that [they]5703-the two vehicles came to a stop . On [the crowd]1386-the crowd ’s opening the coach doors , [the one mourner]5705-the one mourner scuffled out by [himself]5705-the one mourner and was in [their]1386-the crowd hands for a moment ; but [he]5705-the one mourner was so alert , and made such good use of [his]5705-the one mourner time , that in another moment [he]5705-the one mourner was scouring away up [a bye - street]5706-a bye - street , after shedding [his]5705-the one mourner cloak , hat , long hatband , white pocket - handkerchief , and other symbolical tears . These , [the people]717-the people tore to pieces and scattered far and wide with great enjoyment , while [the tradesmen]5708-the tradesmen hurriedly shut up [[their]5708-the tradesmen shops]5709-their shops ; for [a crowd in those times]5710-a crowd in those times stopped at nothing , and was a monster much dreaded . [They]1386-the crowd had already got the length of opening [the hearse]5711-the hearse to take the coffin out , when [some brighter genius]5712-some brighter genius proposed instead , its being escorted to its destination amidst general rejoicing . Practical suggestions being much needed , this suggestion , too , was received with acclamation , and [the coach]376-the coach was immediately filled with eight inside and a dozen out , while [as many people]5714-as many people got on the roof of [the hearse]5711-the hearse as could by any exercise of ingenuity stick upon it . Among [the first of [these volunteers]5717-these volunteers]5716-the first of these volunteers was [Jerry Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher [himself]156-mr. cruncher , who modestly concealed [his]156-mr. cruncher spiky head from the observation of [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , in [the further corner of [the mourning coach]5719-the mourning coach]5718-the further corner of the mourning coach . [The officiating undertakers]5720-the officiating undertakers made some protest against these changes in the ceremonies ; but , the river being alarmingly near , and several voices remarking on the efficacy of cold immersion in bringing [refractory members of the profession to reason]5721-refractory members of the profession to reason , the protest was faint and brief . The remodelled procession started , with a chimney - sweep driving [the hearse]5711-the hearse -- advised by [the regular driver]5723-the regular driver , who was perched beside [him]5723-the regular driver , under close inspection , for the purpose -- and with [a pieman]5724-a pieman , also attended by [[his]5723-the regular driver cabinet minister]5725-his cabinet minister , driving [the mourning coach]5719-the mourning coach . [A bear - leader]5727-a bear - leader , [a popular street character of the time]5728-a popular street character of the time , was impressed as an additional ornament , before the cavalcade had gone far down [the Strand]5729-the strand ; and [his]5723-the regular driver bear , who was black and very mangy , gave quite an Undertaking air to that part of the procession in which [he]5723-the regular driver walked . Thus , with beer - drinking , pipe - smoking , song - roaring , and infinite caricaturing of woe , the disorderly procession went its way , recruiting at every step , and all [the shops]718-the shops shutting up before [it]5711-the hearse . [Its]5711-the hearse destination was [the old church of [Saint Pancras]207-saint pancras , far off in [the fields]2120-the fields]5731-the old church of saint pancras , far off in the fields . [It]5711-the hearse got [there]4887-there in course of time ; insisted on pouring into [the burial - ground]5734-the burial - ground ; finally , accomplished the interment of [the deceased Roger Cly]5735-the deceased roger cly in its own way , and highly to its own satisfaction . [The dead man]5736-the dead man disposed of , and [the crowd]1386-the crowd being under the necessity of providing some other entertainment for [itself]1386-the crowd , [another brighter genius]5738-another brighter genius ( or perhaps the same ) conceived the humour of impeaching [casual passers - by]5739-casual passers - by , as [Old Bailey spies]5740-old bailey spies , and wreaking vengeance on [them]5739-casual passers - by . Chase was given to [some scores of inoffensive persons who had never been near [the Old Bailey]1064-the old bailey in [their]5741-some scores of inoffensive persons who had never been near the old bailey in their lives , in the realisation of this fancy , and they were roughly hustled and maltreated lives , in the realisation of this fancy , and [they]5741-some scores of inoffensive persons who had never been near the old bailey in their lives , in the realisation of this fancy , and they were roughly hustled and maltreated were roughly hustled and maltreated]5741-some scores of inoffensive persons who had never been near the old bailey in their lives , in the realisation of this fancy , and they were roughly hustled and maltreated . The transition to the sport of window - breaking , and thence to the plundering of [public - houses]5743-public - houses , was easy and natural . At last , after several hours , when [sundry summer - houses]5744-sundry summer - houses had been pulled down , and some area - railings had been torn up , to arm [the more belligerent spirits]5745-the more belligerent spirits , a rumour got about that [the Guards]5746-the guards were coming . Before this rumour , [the crowd]1386-the crowd gradually melted away , and perhaps [the Guards]5746-the guards came , and perhaps [they]5746-the guards never came , and this was the usual progress of [a mob]5749-a mob . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher did not assist at the closing sports , but had remained behind in [the churchyard]5750-the churchyard , to confer and condole with [the undertakers]5751-the undertakers . [The place]791-the place had a soothing influence on [him]156-mr. cruncher . [He]156-mr. cruncher procured a pipe from [a neighbouring public - house]5753-a neighbouring public - house , and smoked it , looking in at the railings and maturely considering [the spot]5754-the spot . “[2331-spies] [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , apostrophising [himself]156-mr. cruncher in [his]156-mr. cruncher usual way , “[156-mr. cruncher] [you]156-mr. cruncher see that there Cly that day , and [you]156-mr. cruncher see with [your]156-mr. cruncher own eyes that [he]2344-he was [a young ’ un and a straight made ’ un]2345-a young ’ un and a straight made ’ un . ” Having smoked [his]156-mr. cruncher pipe out , and ruminated a little longer , [he]156-mr. cruncher turned [himself]156-mr. cruncher about , that [he]156-mr. cruncher might appear , before the hour of closing , on [[his]156-mr. cruncher station at [Tellson]134-tellson ’s]5755-his station at tellson ’s . Whether [his]156-mr. cruncher meditations on mortality had touched [his]156-mr. cruncher liver , or whether [his]156-mr. cruncher general health had been previously at all amiss , or whether [he]156-mr. cruncher desired to show a little attention to [an eminent man]5756-an eminent man , is not so much to the purpose , as that [he]156-mr. cruncher made a short call upon [[his]156-mr. cruncher medical adviser]5757-his medical adviser -- [a distinguished surgeon]5758-a distinguished surgeon -- on [his]156-mr. cruncher way back . Going a fishing . ” “[0-i] [Your]0-i fishing - rod gets rayther rusty ; do n’t it , [father]5144-father ? ” “[5144-father] Never [you]0-i mind . ” “[5144-father] Shall [you]0-i bring any fish [home]858-home , [father]5144-father ? ” “[5144-father] If [I]0-i do n’t , [you]0-i ’ll have short commons , to - morrow , ” returned [that gentleman]5256-that gentleman , shaking [his]0-i head ; “[5144-father] that ’s questions enough for [you]0-i ; [I]0-i ai n’t a going out , till [you]0-i ’ve been long abed . ” [He]5144-father devoted [himself]5144-father during the remainder of the evening to keeping a most vigilant watch on [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher , and sullenly holding [her]155-mrs. cruncher in conversation that [she]155-mrs. cruncher might be prevented from meditating any petitions to [his]5144-father disadvantage . With this view , [he]5144-father urged [[his]5144-father son]955-his son to hold [her]155-mrs. cruncher in conversation also , and led [the unfortunate woman]5770-the unfortunate woman a hard life by dwelling on any causes of complaint [he]5144-father could bring against [her]155-mrs. cruncher , rather than [he]5144-father would leave [her]155-mrs. cruncher for a moment to [her]155-mrs. cruncher own reflections . [The devoutest person]5771-the devoutest person could have rendered no greater homage to the efficacy of an honest prayer than [he]5144-father did in this distrust of [[his]5144-father wife]4987-his wife . It was as if [a professed unbeliever in ghosts]5773-a professed unbeliever in ghosts should be frightened by a ghost story . “[0-i] And mind [you]2353-your ! ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher . “[2353-your] No games to - morrow ! If [I]0-i , as [a honest tradesman]5147-a honest tradesman , succeed in providing a jinte of meat or two , none of [your]2353-your not touching of it , and sticking to bread . If [I]0-i , as [a honest tradesman]5147-a honest tradesman , am able to provide a little beer , none of [your]2353-your declaring on water . When [you]2353-your go to [Rome]47-rome , do as [Rome]47-rome does . [Rome]47-rome will be a ugly customer to [you]2353-your , if [you]2353-your do n’t . _ I_’m [your]2353-your Rome , [you]2353-your know . ” Then [he]0-i began grumbling again : “[2353-your] With [your]2353-your flying into the face of [your]2353-your own wittles and drink ! [I]0-i do n’t know how scarce [you]2353-your may n’t make the wittles and drink here , by [your]2353-your flopping tricks and [your]2353-your unfeeling conduct . Look at [[your]2353-your boy]2356-your boy : [he]2356-your boy _ is _ [your’n]2356-your boy , ai n’t [he]2356-your boy ? [He]2356-your boy ’s as thin as a lath . Do [you]2353-your call [yourself]2353-your [a mother]1738-a mother , and not know that [a mother]1738-a mother ’s first duty is to blow [[her]1738-a mother boy]2359-her boy out ? ” This touched [Young Jerry]159-young jerry on [a tender place]5774-a tender place ; who adjured [[his]159-young jerry mother]1010-his mother to perform [her]1010-his mother first duty , and , whatever else [she]1010-his mother did or neglected , above all things to lay especial stress on the discharge of that maternal function so affectingly and delicately indicated by [[his]159-young jerry other parent]5776-his other parent . Thus the evening wore away with [the Cruncher family]5777-the cruncher family , until [Young Jerry]159-young jerry was ordered to bed , and [[his]159-young jerry mother]1010-his mother , laid under similar injunctions , obeyed [them]5777-the cruncher family . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher beguiled the earlier watches of the night with solitary pipes , and did not start upon [his]156-mr. cruncher excursion until nearly one o’clock . Towards that small and ghostly hour , [he]156-mr. cruncher rose up from [his]156-mr. cruncher chair , took a key out of [his]156-mr. cruncher pocket , opened a locked cupboard , and brought forth a sack , a crowbar of convenient size , a rope and chain , and other fishing tackle of that nature . Disposing these articles about [him]156-mr. cruncher in skilful manner , [he]156-mr. cruncher bestowed a parting defiance on [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher , extinguished the light , and went out . [Young Jerry]159-young jerry , who had only made a feint of undressing when [he]159-young jerry went to bed , was not long after [[his]159-young jerry father]1015-his father . Under cover of the darkness [he]159-young jerry followed out of [the room]565-the room , followed down the stairs , followed down [the court]4990-the court , followed out into [the streets]732-the streets . [He]159-young jerry was in no uneasiness concerning [his]159-young jerry getting into [the house]951-the house again , for [it]951-the house was full of [lodgers]5784-lodgers , and the door stood ajar all night . Impelled by a laudable ambition to study the art and mystery of [[his]159-young jerry father]1015-his father ’s honest calling , [Young Jerry]159-young jerry , keeping as close to [house]5145-house fronts , walls , and doorways , as [his]159-young jerry eyes were close to [one another]411-one another , held [[his]159-young jerry honoured parent]5788-his honoured parent in view . [The honoured parent]5789-the honoured parent steering Northward , had not gone far , when [he]5789-the honoured parent was joined by [another disciple of [Izaak Walton]208-izaak walton]5790-another disciple of izaak walton , and [the two]883-the two trudged on together . Within half an hour from the first starting , [they]883-the two were beyond the winking lamps , and [the more than winking watchmen]5792-the more than winking watchmen , and were out upon [a lonely road]5793-a lonely road . [Another fisherman]5794-another fisherman was picked up here -- and that so silently , that if [Young Jerry]159-young jerry had been superstitious , [he]159-young jerry might have supposed [the second follower of the gentle craft]5795-the second follower of the gentle craft to have , all of a sudden , split [himself]5795-the second follower of the gentle craft into two . [The three]396-the three went on , and [Young Jerry]159-young jerry went on , until [the three]396-the three stopped under a bank overhanging [the road]377-the road . Upon the top of the bank was a low brick wall , surmounted by an iron railing . In the shadow of bank and wall [the three]396-the three turned out of [the road]377-the road , and up a blind lane , of which the wall -- there , risen to some eight or ten feet high -- formed one side . Crouching down in a corner , peeping up [the lane]5801-the lane , the next object that [Young Jerry]159-young jerry saw , was the form of [[his]159-young jerry honoured parent]5788-his honoured parent , pretty well defined against a watery and clouded moon , nimbly scaling an iron gate . [He]159-young jerry was soon over , and then [the second fisherman]5803-the second fisherman got over , and then [the third]5804-the third . [They]396-the three all dropped softly on the ground within the gate , and lay there a little -- listening perhaps . Then , [they]396-the three moved away on [their]396-the three hands and knees . It was now [Young Jerry]159-young jerry ’s turn to approach the gate : which [he]159-young jerry did , holding [his]159-young jerry breath . Crouching down again in a corner there , and looking in , [he]159-young jerry made out [the three fishermen creeping through some rank grass]5805-the three fishermen creeping through some rank grass ! and all the gravestones in [the churchyard]5750-the churchyard -- it was [a large churchyard that [they]396-the three were in -- looking on like ghosts in white , while [the church tower]5808-the church tower [itself]5808-the church tower]5807-a large churchyard that they were in -- looking on like ghosts in white , while the church tower itself looked on like the ghost of a monstrous giant . [They]396-the three did not creep far , before [they]396-the three stopped and stood upright . And then [they]396-the three began to fish . [They]396-the three fished with a spade , at first . Presently [the honoured parent]5789-the honoured parent appeared to be adjusting some instrument like a great corkscrew . Whatever tools [they]396-the three worked with , [they]396-the three worked hard , until the awful striking of the church clock so terrified [Young Jerry]159-young jerry , that [he]159-young jerry made off , with [his]159-young jerry hair as stiff as [[his]159-young jerry father]1015-his father ’s . But , [his]159-young jerry long - cherished desire to know more about these matters , not only stopped [him]159-young jerry in [his]159-young jerry running away , but lured [him]159-young jerry back again . [They]396-the three were still fishing perseveringly , when [he]159-young jerry peeped in at the gate for the second time ; but , now [they]396-the three seemed to have got a bite . There was a screwing and complaining sound down below , and [their]396-the three bent figures were strained , as if by a weight . By slow degrees the weight broke away the earth upon it , and came to the surface . [Young Jerry]159-young jerry very well knew what it would be ; but , when [he]159-young jerry saw it , and saw [[his]159-young jerry honoured parent]5788-his honoured parent about to wrench it open , [he]159-young jerry was so frightened , being new to the sight , that [he]159-young jerry made off again , and never stopped until [he]159-young jerry had run a mile or more . [He]159-young jerry would not have stopped then , for anything less necessary than breath , it being a spectral sort of race that [he]159-young jerry ran , and one highly desirable to get to the end of . [He]159-young jerry had a strong idea that [the coffin [he]159-young jerry had seen]5812-the coffin he had seen was running after [him]159-young jerry ; and , pictured as hopping on behind [him]159-young jerry , bolt upright , upon its narrow end , always on the point of overtaking [him]159-young jerry and hopping on at [his]159-young jerry side -- perhaps taking [his]159-young jerry arm -- it was [a pursuer to shun]5813-a pursuer to shun . [It]5812-the coffin he had seen was [an inconsistent and ubiquitous fiend]5814-an inconsistent and ubiquitous fiend too , for , while it was making the whole night behind [him]159-young jerry dreadful , [he]159-young jerry darted out into [the roadway]5815-the roadway to avoid [dark alleys]5816-dark alleys , fearful of its coming hopping out of [them]5816-dark alleys like [a dropsical boy]5817-a dropsical boy ’s kite without tail and wings . [It]5812-the coffin he had seen hid in doorways too , rubbing its horrible shoulders against doors , and drawing them up to [its]5812-the coffin he had seen ears , as if it were laughing . [It]5812-the coffin he had seen got into shadows on [the road]377-the road , and lay cunningly on its back to trip [him]159-young jerry up . All this time [it]5812-the coffin he had seen was incessantly hopping on behind and gaining on [him]159-young jerry , so that when [the boy]5819-the boy got to [his]5819-the boy own door [he]5819-the boy had reason for being half dead . And even then it would not leave [him]159-young jerry , but followed [him]159-young jerry [upstairs]5354-upstairs with a bump on [every stair]5821-every stair , scrambled into bed with [him]159-young jerry , and bumped down , dead and heavy , on [his]159-young jerry breast when [he]159-young jerry fell asleep . From [his]159-young jerry oppressed slumber , [Young Jerry]159-young jerry in [[his]159-young jerry closet]5822-his closet was awakened after daybreak and before sunrise , by the presence of [[his]159-young jerry father]1015-his father in [the family room]5824-the family room . Something had gone wrong with [him]159-young jerry ; at least , so [Young Jerry]159-young jerry inferred , from the circumstance of [his]159-young jerry holding [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher by the ears , and knocking the back of [her]155-mrs. cruncher head against the head - board of the bed . “[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]2360-you [I]0-i would , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , “[0-i] and [I]0-i did . ” “[159-young jerry] [Jerry]159-young jerry , [Jerry]159-young jerry , [Jerry]159-young jerry ! ” [[his]159-young jerry wife]4987-his wife implored . “[159-young jerry] [You]2360-you oppose [yourself]2360-you to the profit of the business , ” said [Jerry]159-young jerry , “[159-young jerry] and [me]0-i and [[my]0-i partners]2361-my partners suffer . [You]2360-you was to honour and obey ; why the devil do n’t [you]2360-you ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i try to be [a good wife]2362-a good wife , [Jerry]159-young jerry , ” [the poor woman]5826-the poor woman protested , with tears . “[159-young jerry] Is it being [a good wife]2362-a good wife to oppose [[your]0-i husband]5131-your husband ’s business ?
