[We]6277-we can kill as well as [the men]1834-the men when the place is taken ! ”[146-madame defarge] And to [her]4987-his wife , with a shrill thirsty cry , trooping [women]671-women variously armed , but all armed alike in hunger and revenge . Cannon , muskets , fire and smoke ; but , still [the deep ditch]2900-the deep ditch , the single drawbridge , the massive stone walls , and [the eight great towers]2901-the eight great towers . Slight displacements of [the raging sea]2902-the raging sea , made by the falling wounded . Flashing weapons , blazing torches , smoking waggonloads of wet straw , hard work at neighbouring barricades in all directions , shrieks , volleys , execrations , bravery without stint , boom smash and rattle , and the furious sounding of [the living sea]2884-the living sea ; but , still [the deep ditch]2900-the deep ditch , and the single drawbridge , and the massive stone walls , and [the eight great towers]2901-the eight great towers , and still [Defarge]146-madame defarge of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop at [his]2891-his gun , grown doubly hot by the service of Four fierce hours . A white flag from within [the fortress]2671-the fortress , and a parley -- this dimly perceptible through the raging storm , nothing audible in it -- suddenly [the sea]599-the sea rose immeasurably wider and higher , and swept Defarge of [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop over [the lowered drawbridge]2910-the lowered drawbridge , past the massive stone outer walls , in among [the eight great towers surrendered]2911-the eight great towers surrendered ! So resistless was the force of the ocean bearing [him]2891-his on , that even to draw [his]2891-his breath or turn [his]2891-his head was as impracticable as if [he]2891-his had been struggling in the surf at [the South Sea]2912-the south sea , until [he]2891-his was landed in [the outer courtyard of [the Bastille]2914-the bastille]2913-the outer courtyard of the bastille . There , against an angle of a wall , [he]2891-his made a struggle to look about [him]2891-his . [Jacques Three]148-jacques was nearly at [his]2891-his side ; [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , still heading [some of [[her]146-madame defarge women]2916-her women]2915-some of her women , was visible in the inner distance , and [her]146-madame defarge knife was in [her]146-madame defarge hand . Everywhere was tumult , exultation , deafening and maniacal bewilderment , astounding noise , yet furious dumb - show . “ [The Prisoners]1059-the prisoners ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ The Records ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ [The secret cells]6280-the secret cells ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ The instruments of torture ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ [The Prisoners]1059-the prisoners ! ”[146-madame defarge] Of all these cries , and ten thousand incoherences , “ [The Prisoners]1059-the prisoners ! ”[146-madame defarge] was the cry most taken up by [the sea]599-the sea that rushed in , as if there were an eternity of [people]360-people , as well as of time and space . When the foremost billows rolled past , bearing [the prison officers]2919-the prison officers with [them]2919-the prison officers , and threatening [them]2919-the prison officers all with instant death if [any secret nook]2920-any secret nook remained undisclosed , [Defarge]146-madame defarge laid [his]2891-his strong hand on the breast of [one of [these men]2922-these men]2921-one of these men -- [a man with a grey head]2923-a man with a grey head , who had a lighted torch in [his]2923-a man with a grey head hand -- separated [him]2923-a man with a grey head from the rest , and got [him]2923-a man with a grey head between [himself]2891-his and the wall . “ Show [me]146-madame defarge [the North Tower]29-north tower ! ”[146-madame defarge] said [Defarge]146-madame defarge . “ Quick ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ [I]472-the man will faithfully , ”[472-the man] replied [the man]472-the man , “ if [you]146-madame defarge will come with [me]472-the man . But there is [no one there]6283-no one there . ”[472-the man] “ What is the meaning of One Hundred and Five , [North Tower]29-north tower ? ”[146-madame defarge] asked [Defarge]146-madame defarge . “ Quick ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ The meaning , [monsieur]5071-monsieur ? ”[146-madame defarge] “ Does it mean [a captive]6285-a captive , or [a place of captivity]6286-a place of captivity ? Or do [you]5071-monsieur mean that [I]146-madame defarge shall strike [you]5071-monsieur dead ? ”[146-madame defarge] “ Kill [him]148-jacques ! ”[148-jacques] croaked [Jacques Three]148-jacques , who had come close up . “ [Monsieur]6287-monsieur , it is [a cell]6288-a cell . ”[148-jacques] “ Show it [me]146-madame defarge ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ Pass this way , then . ”[148-jacques] [Jacques Three]148-jacques , with [his]148-jacques usual craving on [him]148-jacques , and evidently disappointed by the dialogue taking a turn that did not seem to promise bloodshed , held by [Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s arm as [he]148-jacques held by the turnkey ’s . [Their]2925-they three heads had been close together during this brief discourse , and it had been as much as [they]2925-they could do to hear [one another]411-one another , even then : so tremendous was the noise of [the living ocean]2927-the living ocean , in its irruption into [the Fortress]85-the fortress , and [its]2927-the living ocean inundation of [the courts]2928-the courts and passages and staircases . All around outside , too , it beat the walls with a deep , hoarse roar , from which , occasionally , some partial shouts of tumult broke and leaped into the air like spray . Through [gloomy vaults where the light of day had never shone]2929-gloomy vaults where the light of day had never shone , past hideous doors of [dark dens and cages]2930-dark dens and cages , down [cavernous flights of steps]2931-cavernous flights of steps , and again up [steep rugged ascents of stone and brick]2932-steep rugged ascents of stone and brick , more like dry waterfalls than staircases , [Defarge]146-madame defarge , [the turnkey]2933-the turnkey , and [Jacques Three]148-jacques , linked hand and arm , went with all the speed [they]2925-they could make . Here and there , especially at first , the inundation started on [them]2925-they and swept by ; but when [they]2925-they had done descending , and were winding and climbing up [a tower]2934-a tower , [they]2925-they were alone . Hemmed in here by the massive thickness of walls and arches , the storm within [the fortress and without]2935-the fortress and without was only audible to [them]2925-they in a dull , subdued way , as if the noise out of which [they]2925-they had come had almost destroyed [their]2925-they sense of hearing . [The turnkey]2933-the turnkey stopped at a low door , put a key in a clashing lock , swung the door slowly open , and said , as [they]2925-they all bent [their]2925-they heads and passed in : “ One hundred and five , [North Tower]29-north tower ! ”[2933-the turnkey] There was a small , heavily - grated , unglazed window high in the wall , with a stone screen before it , so that the sky could be only seen by stooping low and looking up . There was a small chimney , heavily barred across , a few feet within . There was a heap of old feathery wood - ashes on the hearth . There was a stool , and table , and a straw bed . There were the four blackened walls , and a rusted iron ring in one of them . “ Pass that torch slowly along these walls , that [I]146-madame defarge may see them , ”[146-madame defarge] said [Defarge]146-madame defarge to [the turnkey]2933-the turnkey . [The man]472-the man obeyed , and [Defarge]146-madame defarge followed the light closely with [his]472-the man eyes . “ Stop!--Look here , [Jacques]148-jacques ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ A. M. ! ”[148-jacques] croaked [Jacques Three]148-jacques , as [he]148-jacques read greedily . “ [Alexandre Manette]234-alexandre manette , ”[146-madame defarge] said [Defarge]146-madame defarge in [his]472-the man ear , following the letters with [his]472-the man swart forefinger , deeply engrained with gunpowder . “ And here [he]234-alexandre manette wrote ‘ [a poor physician]6289-a poor physician . ’ And it was [he]234-alexandre manette , without doubt , who scratched a calendar on this stone . What is that in [your]148-jacques hand ? A crowbar ? Give it [me]472-the man ! ”[472-the man] [He]472-the man had still the linstock of [his]472-the man gun in [his]472-the man own hand . [He]472-the man made a sudden exchange of the two instruments , and turning on the worm - eaten stool and table , beat them to pieces in a few blows . “ Hold the light higher ! ”[472-the man] [he]472-the man said , wrathfully , to [the turnkey]2933-the turnkey . “ Look among those fragments with care , [Jacques]148-jacques . And see ! Here is [my]472-the man knife , ”[472-the man] throwing it to [him]472-the man ; “ rip open that bed , and search the straw . Hold the light higher , [you]148-jacques ! ”[472-the man] With a menacing look at the turnkey [he]472-the man crawled upon the hearth , and , peering up the chimney , struck and prised at its sides with the crowbar , and worked at the iron grating across it . In a few minutes , some mortar and dust came dropping down , which [he]472-the man averted [his]472-the man face to avoid ; and in it , and in the old wood - ashes , and in a crevice in the chimney into which [his]472-the man weapon had slipped or wrought itself , [he]472-the man groped with a cautious touch . “ Nothing in the wood , and nothing in the straw , [Jacques]148-jacques ? ”[472-the man] “ Nothing . ”[472-the man] “ Let [us]2941-they collect them together , in the middle of [the cell]6290-the cell . So ! Light them , [you]148-jacques ! ”[2933-the turnkey] [The turnkey]2933-the turnkey fired the little pile , which blazed high and hot . Stooping again to come out at the low - arched door , [they]2941-they left [it]2942-it burning , and retraced [their]2941-they way to [the courtyard]915-the courtyard ; seeming to recover [their]2941-they sense of hearing as [they]2941-they came down , until [they]2941-they were in the raging flood once more . [They]2941-they found [it]2944-it surging and tossing , in quest of [Defarge]146-madame defarge [himself]146-madame defarge . [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine was clamorous to have [[its]144-saint antoine wine - shop keeper]2945-its wine - shop keeper foremost in the guard upon [the governor who had defended [the Bastille]86-the bastille and shot [the people]717-the people]2946-the governor who had defended the bastille and shot the people . Otherwise , [the governor]2948-the governor would not be marched to [the Hotel de Ville]87-the hotel de ville for judgment . Otherwise , [the governor]2948-the governor would escape , and [the people]717-the people ’s blood ( suddenly of some value , after many years of worthlessness ) be unavenged . In the howling universe of passion and contention that seemed to encompass [this grim old officer]2951-this grim old officer conspicuous in [his]2951-this grim old officer grey coat and red decoration , there was but [one quite steady figure]2952-one quite steady figure , and that was [a woman]1959-a woman ’s . “ See , there is [[my]1959-a woman husband]5455-my husband ! ”[1959-a woman] [she]1959-a woman cried , pointing [him]2951-this grim old officer out . “ See [Defarge]146-madame defarge ! ”[1959-a woman] [She]1959-a woman stood immovable close to [the grim old officer]2954-the grim old officer , and remained immovable close to [him]2951-this grim old officer ; remained immovable close to [him]2951-this grim old officer through [the streets]732-the streets , as [Defarge]146-madame defarge and [the rest]367-the rest bore [him]2951-this grim old officer along ; remained immovable close to [him]2951-this grim old officer when [he]2951-this grim old officer was got near [his]2951-this grim old officer destination , and began to be struck at from behind ; remained immovable close to [him]2951-this grim old officer when the long - gathering rain of stabs and blows fell heavy ; was so close to [him]2951-this grim old officer when [he]2951-this grim old officer dropped dead under it , that , suddenly animated , [she]1959-a woman put [her]1959-a woman foot upon [his]2951-this grim old officer neck , and with [her]1959-a woman cruel knife -- long ready -- hewed off [his]2951-this grim old officer head . The hour was come , when [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine was to execute [his]144-saint antoine horrible idea of hoisting up [men]568-men for lamps to show what [he]144-saint antoine could be and do . [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine ’s blood was up , and the blood of tyranny and domination by the iron hand was down -- down on the steps of [the Hotel de Ville]2958-the hotel de ville where [the governor]2948-the governor ’s body lay -- down on the sole of the shoe of [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge where [she]146-madame defarge had trodden on the body to steady [it]2960-it for mutilation . “ Lower the lamp yonder ! ”[144-saint antoine] cried [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine , after glaring round for a new means of death ; “ here is [one of [[his]144-saint antoine soldiers]6293-his soldiers]6292-one of his soldiers to be left on guard ! ”[144-saint antoine] [The swinging sentinel]2961-the swinging sentinel was posted , and [the sea]599-the sea rushed on . [The sea of black and threatening waters]2963-the sea of black and threatening waters , and of destructive upheaving of wave against wave , whose depths were yet unfathomed and whose forces were yet unknown . The remorseless sea of turbulently swaying shapes , voices of vengeance , and faces hardened in the furnaces of suffering until the touch of pity could make no mark on [them]2964-them . But , in the ocean of [faces where every fierce and furious expression was in vivid life]2965-faces where every fierce and furious expression was in vivid life , there were [two groups of faces]2966-two groups of faces -- each seven in number -- so fixedly contrasting with the rest , that never did sea roll which bore more memorable wrecks with it . Seven faces of [prisoners , suddenly released by the storm]2967-prisoners , suddenly released by the storm that had burst [[their]2967-prisoners , suddenly released by the storm tomb]2968-their tomb , were carried high overhead : all scared , all lost , all wondering and amazed , as if the Last Day were come , and [those who rejoiced around [them]2967-prisoners , suddenly released by the storm]2969-those who rejoiced around them were lost spirits . [Other seven faces there]2970-other seven faces there were , carried higher , [seven dead faces , whose drooping eyelids and half - seen eyes awaited the Last Day]2971-seven dead faces , whose drooping eyelids and half - seen eyes awaited the last day . Impassive faces , yet with a suspended -- not an abolished -- expression on them ; [faces , rather , in a fearful pause , as having yet to raise the dropped lids of the eyes , and bear witness with the bloodless lips]2972-faces , rather , in a fearful pause , as having yet to raise the dropped lids of the eyes , and bear witness with the bloodless lips , “ [THOU]144-saint antoine DIDST IT ! ”[2972-faces , rather , in a fearful pause , as having yet to raise the dropped lids of the eyes , and bear witness with the bloodless lips] [Seven prisoners]2973-seven prisoners released , seven gory heads on pikes , the keys of [the accursed fortress of the eight strong towers]2974-the accursed fortress of the eight strong towers , some discovered letters and other memorials of [prisoners of old time , long dead of broken hearts,--such]2975-prisoners of old time , long dead of broken hearts,--such , and such -- like , the loudly echoing footsteps of [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine escort through [the [Paris]7-paris streets]2976-the paris streets in mid - July , one thousand seven hundred and eighty - nine . Now , [Heaven]225-heaven defeat the fancy of [Lucie Darnay]174-lucie , and keep these feet far out of [her]174-lucie life ! For , [they]2967-prisoners , suddenly released by the storm are headlong , mad , and dangerous ; and in the years so long after the breaking of the cask at [[Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s wine - shop door]2977-defarge ’s wine - shop door , they are not easily purified when once stained red . CHAPTER XXII . The Sea Still Rises [Haggard Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine had had only one exultant week , in which to soften [his]144-saint antoine modicum of hard and bitter bread to such extent as [he]144-saint antoine could , with the relish of fraternal embraces and congratulations , when [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge sat at [her]146-madame defarge counter , as usual , presiding over [the customers]772-the customers . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge wore no rose in [her]146-madame defarge head , for [the great brotherhood of [Spies]2331-spies]2979-the great brotherhood of spies had become , even in one short week , extremely chary of trusting [themselves]2979-the great brotherhood of spies to [the saint]6097-the saint ’s mercies . The lamps across [[his]144-saint antoine streets]5862-his streets had a portentously elastic swing with [them]2983-them . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , with [her]146-madame defarge arms folded , sat in the morning light and heat , contemplating [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop and [the street]662-the street . In both , there were several knots of [loungers]2986-loungers , squalid and miserable , but now with a manifest sense of power enthroned on [their]2986-loungers distress . The raggedest nightcap , awry on the wretchedest head , had this crooked significance in it : “ [I]2986-loungers know how hard it has grown for [me]2986-loungers , [the wearer of this]6294-the wearer of this , to support life in [myself]2986-loungers ; but do [you]6295-you know how easy it has grown for [me]2986-loungers , [the wearer of this]6294-the wearer of this , to destroy life in [you]6295-you ? ”[2986-loungers] Every lean bare arm , that had been without work before , had this work always ready for it now , that it could strike . The fingers of [the knitting women]2987-the knitting women were vicious , with the experience that [they]2986-loungers could tear . There was a change in the appearance of [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine ; the image had been hammering into this for hundreds of years , and the last finishing blows had told mightily on the expression . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge sat observing it , with such suppressed approval as was to be desired in [the leader of [the Saint Antoine women]2989-the saint antoine women]2988-the leader of the saint antoine women . [One of [[her]146-madame defarge sisterhood]2991-her sisterhood]2990-one of her sisterhood knitted beside [her]146-madame defarge . [The short , rather plump wife of [a starved grocer]2993-a starved grocer]2992-the short , rather plump wife of a starved grocer , and [the mother of [two children withal]2995-two children withal]2994-the mother of two children withal , [this lieutenant]2996-this lieutenant had already earned the complimentary name of [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance . “ Hark ! ”[236-the vengeance] said [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance . “ Listen , then ! Who comes ? ”[236-the vengeance] As if a train of powder laid from [the outermost bound of [Saint Antoine Quarter]88-saint antoine quarter]2998-the outermost bound of saint antoine quarter to [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop door , had been suddenly fired , a fast - spreading murmur came rushing along . “ It is [Defarge]146-madame defarge , ”[236-the vengeance] said madame . “ Silence , [patriots]6269-patriots ! ”[236-the vengeance] [Defarge]146-madame defarge came in breathless , pulled off a red cap [he]3000-he wore , and looked around [him]3000-he ! “ Listen , everywhere ! ”[5936-madame] said madame again . “ Listen to [him]3000-he ! ”[146-madame defarge] [Defarge]146-madame defarge stood , panting , against a background of eager eyes and open mouths , formed outside the door ; [all those within [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop]3001-all those within the wine - shop had sprung to [their]3001-all those within the wine - shop feet . “ Say then , [[my]3001-all those within the wine - shop husband]5455-my husband . What is it ? ”[3001-all those within the wine - shop] “ News from [the other world]1068-the other world ! ”[5936-madame] “ How , then ? ”[5936-madame] cried [madame]5936-madame , contemptuously . “ [The other world]1068-the other world ? ”[5936-madame] “ Does [everybody here]6301-everybody here recall [old Foulon]237-foulon , who told [the famished people]6302-the famished people that [they]6302-the famished people might eat grass , and who died , and went to [Hell]89-hell ? ”[5936-madame] “ [Everybody]1759-everybody ! ”[5936-madame] from all throats . “ The news is of [him]3000-he . [He]3000-he is among [us]6304-us ! ”[5936-madame] “ Among [us]6304-us ! ”[5936-madame] from the universal throat again . “ And dead ? ”[5936-madame] “ Not dead ! [He]3000-he feared [us]6304-us so much -- and with reason -- that [he]3000-he caused [himself]3000-he to be represented as dead , and had a grand mock - funeral . But [they]6304-us have found [him]3000-he alive , hiding in [the country]956-the country , and have brought [him]3000-he in . [I]5936-madame have seen [him]3000-he but now , on [his]3000-he way to [the Hotel de Ville]87-the hotel de ville , [a prisoner]6306-a prisoner . [I]5936-madame have said that [he]3000-he had reason to fear [us]6307-us . Say all ! _ Had _ [he]3000-he reason ? ”[5936-madame] [Wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten , if [he]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten had never known it yet , [he]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten would have known it in [his]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten heart of hearts if [he]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten could have heard the answering cry . A moment of profound silence followed . [Defarge]146-madame defarge and [[his]3004-wretched old sinner of more than threescore years and ten wife]4987-his wife looked steadfastly at [one another]411-one another . [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance stooped , and the jar of a drum was heard as [she]4987-his wife moved it at [her]4987-his wife feet behind the counter . “ [Patriots]238-patriots ! ”[146-madame defarge] said [Defarge]146-madame defarge , in a determined voice , “ are [we]238-patriots ready ? ”[146-madame defarge] Instantly [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s knife was in [her]146-madame defarge girdle ; the drum was beating in [the streets]732-the streets , as if it and [a drummer]3008-a drummer had flown together by magic ; and The Vengeance , uttering terrific shrieks , and flinging [her]236-the vengeance arms about [her]236-the vengeance head like all the forty Furies at once , was tearing from [house]5145-house to [house]5145-house , rousing [the women]2092-the women . [The men]1834-the men were terrible , in the bloody - minded anger with which [they]1834-the men looked from windows , caught up what arms [they]1834-the men had , and came pouring down into [the streets]732-the streets ; but , [the women]2092-the women were a sight to chill the boldest . From such household occupations as [their]1834-the men bare poverty yielded , from [[their]1834-the men children]1206-their children , from [[their]1834-the men aged]3016-their aged and [their]1834-the men sick crouching on the bare ground famished and naked , [they]1834-the men ran out with streaming hair , urging [one another]411-one another , and [themselves]1834-the men , to madness with the wildest cries and actions . [Villain Foulon]237-foulon taken , [[my]0-i sister]3018-my sister ! [Old Foulon]239-foulon taken , [[my]0-i mother]4973-my mother ! [Miscreant Foulon]3020-miscreant foulon taken , [[my]0-i daughter]5576-my daughter ! Then , [a score of others]3022-a score of others ran into the midst of these , beating [their]3022-a score of others breasts , tearing [their]3022-a score of others hair , and screaming , [Foulon]239-foulon alive ! Foulon who told [the starving people]3023-the starving people [they]3023-the starving people might eat grass ! Foulon who told [[my]0-i old father]3024-my old father that [he]3024-my old father might eat grass , when [I]0-i had no bread to give [him]3024-my old father ! [Foulon]239-foulon who told [[my]0-i baby]3025-my baby it might suck grass , when these breasts were dry with want ! [O mother of [God]149-god]3026-o mother of god , [this Foulon]3027-this foulon ! O Heaven [our]3028-us suffering ! Hear [me]0-i , [[my]0-i dead baby]3029-my dead baby and [[my]0-i withered father]3030-my withered father : [I]0-i swear on [my]0-i knees , on these stones , to avenge [you]3031-you on [Foulon]239-foulon ! [Husbands]3032-husbands , and [brothers]3033-brothers , and [young men]3034-young men , Give [us]3028-us the blood of [Foulon]239-foulon , Give [us]3028-us the head of [Foulon]239-foulon , Give [us]3028-us the heart of [Foulon]237-foulon , Give [us]3028-us the body and soul of [Foulon]239-foulon , Rend [Foulon]237-foulon to pieces , and dig [him]239-foulon into the ground , that grass may grow from [him]239-foulon ! With these cries , numbers of [the women]2092-the women , lashed into blind frenzy , whirled about , striking and tearing at [[their]2092-the women own friends]3036-their own friends until [they]2092-the women dropped into a passionate swoon , and were only saved by [the men belonging to [them]2092-the women]3037-the men belonging to them from being trampled under foot . Nevertheless , not a moment was lost ; not a moment ! [This Foulon]3027-this foulon was at [the Hotel de Ville]2958-the hotel de ville , and might be loosed . Never , if [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine knew [his]144-saint antoine own sufferings , insults , and wrongs ! [Armed men]331-armed men and [women]671-women flocked out of [the Quarter]3042-the quarter so fast , and drew even these last dregs after [them]2092-the women with such a force of suction , that within a quarter of an hour there was not a human creature in [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine ’s bosom but [a few old crones]3043-a few old crones and [the wailing children]3044-the wailing children . No . [They]2092-the women were all by that time choking [the Hall of [Examination]91-examination where [this old man , ugly and wicked]3046-this old man , ugly and wicked , was , and overflowing into [the adjacent open space and streets]3047-the adjacent open space and streets]3045-the hall of examination where this old man , ugly and wicked , was , and overflowing into the adjacent open space and streets . [The Defarges]218-the defarges , [husband]6005-husband and [wife]6006-wife , [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance , and [Jacques Three]148-jacques , were in the first press , and at no great distance from [him]3046-this old man , ugly and wicked in [the Hall]1556-the hall . “ See ! ”[5936-madame] cried [madame]5936-madame , pointing with [her]5936-madame knife . “ See [the old villain bound with ropes]6308-the old villain bound with ropes . That was well done to tie a bunch of grass upon [his]3046-this old man , ugly and wicked back . Ha , ha ! That was well done . Let [him]3046-this old man , ugly and wicked eat it now ! ”[5936-madame] [Madame]146-madame defarge put [her]5936-madame knife under [her]5936-madame arm , and clapped [her]5936-madame hands as at a play . [The people immediately behind [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge]3053-the people immediately behind madame defarge , explaining the cause of [her]146-madame defarge satisfaction to [those behind [them]3053-the people immediately behind madame defarge]3054-those behind them , and those again explaining to [others]672-others , and those to [others]672-others , [the neighbouring streets]3057-the neighbouring streets resounded with the clapping of hands . Similarly , during two or three hours of drawl , and the winnowing of many bushels of words , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s frequent expressions of impatience were taken up , with marvellous quickness , at a distance : the more readily , because [certain men who had by some wonderful exercise of agility climbed up the external architecture to look in from the windows]3058-certain men who had by some wonderful exercise of agility climbed up the external architecture to look in from the windows , knew [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge well , and acted as a telegraph between [her]146-madame defarge and [the crowd outside [the building]2157-the building]3059-the crowd outside the building . At length the sun rose so high that it struck a kindly ray as of hope or protection , directly down upon [the old prisoner]3061-the old prisoner ’s head . The favour was too much to bear ; in an instant the barrier of dust and chaff that had stood surprisingly long , went to the winds , and [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine had got [him]3061-the old prisoner ! It was known directly , to the furthest confines of [the crowd]1386-the crowd . [Defarge]146-madame defarge had but sprung over a railing and a table , and folded [the miserable wretch]3063-the miserable wretch in a deadly embrace -- [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge had but followed and turned [her]146-madame defarge hand in one of the ropes with which [he]3061-the old prisoner was tied -- [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance and [Jacques Three]148-jacques were not yet up with [them]3064-them , and [the men at the windows]3065-the men at the windows had not yet swooped into [the Hall]1556-the hall , like birds of prey from [their]3065-the men at the windows high perches -- when the cry seemed to go up , all over [the city]1496-the city , “ Bring [him]3061-the old prisoner out ! Bring [him]3061-the old prisoner to the lamp ! ”[236-the vengeance] Down , and up , and head foremost on the steps of [the building]2157-the building ; now , on [his]3061-the old prisoner knees ; now , on [his]3061-the old prisoner feet ; now , on [his]3061-the old prisoner back ; dragged , and struck at , and stifled by the bunches of grass and straw that were thrust into [his]3061-the old prisoner face by hundreds of hands ; torn , bruised , panting , bleeding , yet always entreating and beseeching for mercy ; now full of vehement agony of action , with a small clear space about [him]3061-the old prisoner as [the people]717-the people drew [one another]411-one another back that [they]717-the people might see ; now , a log of dead wood drawn through a forest of legs ; [he]3061-the old prisoner was hauled to the nearest street corner where one of the fatal lamps swung , and there [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge let [him]3061-the old prisoner go -- as a cat might have done to a mouse -- and silently and composedly looked at [him]3061-the old prisoner while [they]717-the people made ready , and while [he]3061-the old prisoner besought [her]146-madame defarge : [the women]2092-the women passionately screeching at [him]3061-the old prisoner all the time , and [the men]1834-the men sternly calling out to have [him]3061-the old prisoner killed with grass in [his]3061-the old prisoner mouth . Once , [he]3061-the old prisoner went aloft , and the rope broke , and [they]717-the people caught [him]3061-the old prisoner shrieking ; twice , [he]3061-the old prisoner went aloft , and the rope broke , and [they]717-the people caught [him]3061-the old prisoner shrieking ; then , the rope was merciful , and held [him]3061-the old prisoner , and [his]3061-the old prisoner head was soon upon a pike , with grass enough in the mouth for all [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine to dance at the sight of . Nor was this the end of the day ’s bad work , for [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine so shouted and danced [his]144-saint antoine angry blood up , that it boiled again , on hearing when the day closed in that [the son - in - law of the despatched]3073-the son - in - law of the despatched , [another of [[the people]717-the people ’s enemies]3076-the people ’s enemies and [insulters]3077-insulters]3074-another of the people ’s enemies and insulters , was coming into [Paris]7-paris under a guard five hundred strong , in cavalry alone . [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine wrote [his]144-saint antoine crimes on flaring sheets of paper , seized [him]3061-the old prisoner -- would have torn [him]3061-the old prisoner out of the breast of [an army to bear Foulon company]3078-an army to bear foulon company -- set [his]3061-the old prisoner head and heart on pikes , and carried the three spoils of the day , in Wolf - procession through [the streets]732-the streets . Not before dark night did [the men]1834-the men and [women]671-women come back to [the children]707-the children , wailing and breadless . Then , [[the miserable bakers]3083-the miserable bakers ’ shops]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops were beset by long files of [them]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops , patiently waiting to buy bad bread ; and while [they]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops waited with stomachs faint and empty , [they]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops beguiled the time by embracing [one another]411-one another on the triumphs of the day , and achieving [them]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops again in gossip . Gradually , these strings of [ragged people]3086-ragged people shortened and frayed away ; and then poor lights began to shine in high windows , and slender fires were made in [the streets]732-the streets , at which [neighbours]3088-neighbours cooked in common , afterwards supping at [their]3088-neighbours doors . Scanty and insufficient suppers those , and innocent of meat , as of most other sauce to wretched bread . Yet , [human fellowship]3089-human fellowship infused some nourishment into the flinty viands , and struck some sparks of cheerfulness out of [them]3084-the miserable bakers ’ shops . [Fathers]3090-fathers and [[mothers]3091-mothers who had had [their]3092-mothers who had had their full share in the worst of the day , played gently with their meagre children [full share in the worst of the day]3093-full share in the worst of the day , played gently with [[their]3092-mothers who had had their full share in the worst of the day , played gently with their meagre children meagre children]3094-their meagre children]3092-mothers who had had their full share in the worst of the day , played gently with their meagre children ; and [lovers]3095-lovers , with such [a world around [them]3095-lovers and before [them]3095-lovers]3096-a world around them and before them , loved and hoped . It was almost morning , when [[Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s wine - shop]2877-defarge ’s wine - shop parted with [[its]2877-defarge ’s wine - shop last knot of [customers]4941-customers]3098-its last knot of customers , and [Monsieur Defarge]147-defarge said to madame [[his]147-defarge wife]4987-his wife , in husky tones , while fastening the door : “ At last it is come , [[my]147-defarge dear]5097-my dear ! ”[147-defarge] “ Eh well ! ”[5936-madame] returned [madame]5936-madame . “ Almost . ”[144-saint antoine] [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine slept , [the Defarges]218-the defarges slept : even [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance slept with [[her]236-the vengeance starved grocer]3102-her starved grocer , and the drum was at rest . The drum ’s was the only voice in [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine that blood and hurry had not changed . [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance , as [custodian of the drum]3104-custodian of the drum , could have wakened [him]144-saint antoine up and had the same speech out of [him]144-saint antoine as before [the Bastille]86-the bastille fell , or [old Foulon]239-foulon was seized ; not so with the hoarse tones of [the men]1834-the men and women in [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine ’s bosom . CHAPTER XXIII . Fire Rises There was a change on [the village]1888-the village where [the fountain fell]3107-the fountain fell , and where [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads went forth daily to hammer out of the stones on [the highway]3109-the highway such morsels of bread as might serve for patches to hold [[his]144-saint antoine poor ignorant soul]3110-his poor ignorant soul and [his]144-saint antoine poor reduced body together . [The prison on the crag]2084-the prison on the crag was not so dominant as of yore ; there were [soldiers]1859-soldiers to guard [it]2084-the prison on the crag , but [not many]3113-not many ; there were [[officers]3114-officers to guard [the soldiers]2418-the soldiers]3115-officers to guard the soldiers , but [not one of [them]3115-officers to guard the soldiers]3117-not one of them knew what [[his]144-saint antoine men]3118-his men would do -- beyond this : that it would probably not be what [he]144-saint antoine was ordered . Far and wide lay [a ruined country]3119-a ruined country , yielding nothing but desolation . Every green leaf , every blade of grass and blade of grain , was as shrivelled and poor as [the miserable people]3120-the miserable people . Everything was bowed down , dejected , oppressed , and broken . Habitations , fences , domesticated animals , [men]568-men , [women]671-women , [children]683-children , and the soil that bore them -- all worn out . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ( often [a most worthy individual gentleman]3124-a most worthy individual gentleman ) was a national blessing , gave a chivalrous tone to things , was a polite example of luxurious and shining life , and a great deal more to equal purpose ; nevertheless , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur as [a class]3125-a class had , somehow or other , brought things to this . Strange that Creation , designed expressly for [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , should be so soon wrung dry and squeezed out ! There must be something short - sighted in the eternal arrangements , surely ! Thus it was , however ; and the last drop of blood having been extracted from the flints , and the last screw of the rack having been turned so often that its purchase crumbled , and it now turned and turned with nothing to bite , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur began to run away from a phenomenon so low and unaccountable . But , this was not the change on [the village]1888-the village , and on [many a village like [it]1888-the village]3127-many a village like it . For scores of years gone by , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur had squeezed it and wrung it , and had seldom graced it with [his]188-monseigneur presence except for the pleasures of the chase -- now , found in hunting [the people]717-the people ; now , found in hunting the beasts , for whose preservation [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur made edifying spaces of [barbarous and barren wilderness]3129-barbarous and barren wilderness . No . The change consisted in the appearance of strange faces of [low caste]3130-low caste , rather than in the disappearance of the high caste , chiselled , and otherwise beautified and beautifying features of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur . For , in these times , as [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads worked , solitary , in the dust , not often troubling [himself]188-monseigneur to reflect that dust [he]188-monseigneur was and to dust [he]188-monseigneur must return , being for the most part too much occupied in thinking how little [he]188-monseigneur had for supper and how much more [he]188-monseigneur would eat if [he]188-monseigneur had it -- in these times , as [he]188-monseigneur raised [his]188-monseigneur eyes from [his]188-monseigneur lonely labour , and viewed the prospect , [he]188-monseigneur would see [some rough figure approaching on foot , the like of which was once a rarity in those parts , but was now a frequent presence]3132-some rough figure approaching on foot , the like of which was once a rarity in those parts , but was now a frequent presence . As it advanced , [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads would discern without surprise , that it was [a shaggy - haired man , of almost barbarian aspect]3134-a shaggy - haired man , of almost barbarian aspect , tall , in wooden shoes that were clumsy even to the eyes of [a mender of [roads]2089-roads]5864-a mender of roads , grim , rough , swart , steeped in the mud and dust of [many highways]3137-many highways , dank with the marshy moisture of [many low grounds]3138-many low grounds , sprinkled with the thorns and leaves and moss of [many byways through woods]3139-many byways through woods . [Such a man]1845-such a man came upon [him]188-monseigneur , like a ghost , at noon in the July weather , as [he]188-monseigneur sat on [his]188-monseigneur heap of stones under a bank , taking such shelter as [he]188-monseigneur could get from a shower of hail . [The man]472-the man looked at [him]188-monseigneur , looked at [the village in [the hollow]2086-the hollow]3142-the village in the hollow , at [the mill]1912-the mill , and at [the prison on the crag]2084-the prison on the crag . When [he]472-the man had identified these objects in what benighted mind [he]472-the man had , [he]472-the man said , in a dialect that was just intelligible : “ How goes it , [Jacques]148-jacques ? ”[472-the man] “ All well , [Jacques]148-jacques . ”[472-the man] “ Touch then ! ”[3146-they] [They]3146-they joined hands , and [the man]472-the man sat down on the heap of stones . “ No dinner ? ”[472-the man] “ Nothing but supper now , ”[1970-the mender of roads] said [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads , with a hungry face . “ It is the fashion , ”[472-the man] growled [the man]472-the man . “ [I]472-the man meet no dinner anywhere . ”[472-the man] [He]472-the man took out a blackened pipe , filled it , lighted it with flint and steel , pulled at it until it was in a bright glow : then , suddenly held it from [him]472-the man and dropped something into it from between [his]472-the man finger and thumb , that blazed and went out in a puff of smoke . “ Touch then . ”[1970-the mender of roads] It was the turn of [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads to say it this time , after observing these operations . [They]3146-they again joined hands . “ To - night ? ”[1970-the mender of roads] said [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads . “ To - night , ”[472-the man] said [the man]472-the man , putting the pipe in [his]472-the man mouth . “ Where ? ”[472-the man] “ Here . ”[472-the man] [He]472-the man and [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads sat on the heap of stones looking silently at [one another]411-one another , with the hail driving in between [them]3146-they like a pigmy charge of bayonets , until the sky began to clear over [the village]1888-the village . “ Show [me]1936-the traveller ! ”[1936-the traveller] said [the traveller]1936-the traveller then , moving to [the brow of [the hill]375-the hill]3157-the brow of the hill . “ See ! ”[1936-the traveller] returned [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads , with extended finger . “ [You]1936-the traveller go down here , and straight through [the street]662-the street , and past the fountain-- ”[1936-the traveller] “ To [the Devil with all that]6311-the devil with all that ! ”[756-the other] interrupted [the other]756-the other , rolling [his]756-the other eye over [the landscape]3161-the landscape . “ _ [I]756-the other _ go through [no streets]6312-no streets and past [no fountains]6313-no fountains . Well ? ”[756-the other] “ Well ! About two leagues beyond [the summit of that hill above [the village]1888-the village]6314-the summit of that hill above the village . ”[1936-the traveller] “ Good . When do [you]1970-the mender of roads cease to work ? ”[1936-the traveller] “ At sunset . ”[756-the other] “ Will [you]1970-the mender of roads wake [me]1936-the traveller , before departing ? [I]1936-the traveller have walked two nights without resting . Let [me]1936-the traveller finish [my]1936-the traveller pipe , and [I]1936-the traveller shall sleep like [a child]894-a child . Will [you]1970-the mender of roads wake [me]1936-the traveller ? ”[1936-the traveller] “ Surely . ”[1936-the traveller] [The wayfarer]3162-the wayfarer smoked [his]3162-the wayfarer pipe out , put it in [his]3162-the wayfarer breast , slipped off [his]3162-the wayfarer great wooden shoes , and lay down on [his]3162-the wayfarer back on the heap of stones . [He]3162-the wayfarer was fast asleep directly . As [the road - mender]5911-the road - mender plied [his]3162-the wayfarer dusty labour , and the hail - clouds , rolling away , revealed bright bars and streaks of sky which were responded to by silver gleams upon the landscape , [the little man]3164-the little man ( who wore a red cap now , in place of [his]3164-the little man blue one ) seemed fascinated by [the figure on the heap of stones]3165-the figure on the heap of stones . [His]3164-the little man eyes were so often turned towards it , that [he]3164-the little man used [his]3164-the little man tools mechanically , and , [one]4965-one would have said , to very poor account . The bronze face , the shaggy black hair and beard , the coarse woollen red cap , the rough medley dress of home - spun stuff and hairy skins of beasts , the powerful frame attenuated by spare living , and the sullen and desperate compression of the lips in sleep , inspired [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads with awe . [The traveller]1936-the traveller had travelled far , and [his]3162-the wayfarer feet were footsore , and [his]3162-the wayfarer ankles chafed and bleeding ; [his]3162-the wayfarer great shoes , stuffed with leaves and grass , had been heavy to drag over the many long leagues , and [his]3162-the wayfarer clothes were chafed into holes , as [he]3162-the wayfarer [himself]3162-the wayfarer was into sores . Stooping down beside [him]3162-the wayfarer , [the road - mender]5911-the road - mender tried to get a peep at secret weapons in [his]3162-the wayfarer breast or where not ; but , in vain , for [he]3162-the wayfarer slept with [his]3162-the wayfarer arms crossed upon [him]3162-the wayfarer , and set as resolutely as [his]3162-the wayfarer lips . [Fortified towns with [[their]3170-fortified towns with their stockades , guard - houses , gates , trenches , and drawbridges stockades]3171-their stockades , [guard - houses]3172-guard - houses , gates , [trenches]3173-trenches , and [drawbridges]3174-drawbridges]3170-fortified towns with their stockades , guard - houses , gates , trenches , and drawbridges , seemed to [the mender of roads , to be so much air as against this figure]3175-the mender of roads , to be so much air as against this figure . And when [he]3162-the wayfarer lifted [his]3162-the wayfarer eyes from it to the horizon and looked around , [he]3162-the wayfarer saw in [his]3162-the wayfarer small fancy similar figures , stopped by no obstacle , tending to centres all over [France]2-france . [The man]472-the man slept on , indifferent to showers of hail and intervals of brightness , to sunshine on [his]472-the man face and shadow , to the paltering lumps of dull ice on [his]472-the man body and the diamonds into which the sun changed them , until the sun was low in the west , and the sky was glowing . Then , [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads having got [his]3162-the wayfarer tools together and all things ready to go down into [the village]1888-the village , roused [him]472-the man . “ Good ! ”[3179-the sleeper] said [the sleeper]3179-the sleeper , rising on [his]3179-the sleeper elbow . “ Two leagues beyond [the summit of [the hill]375-the hill]426-the summit of the hill ? ”[3179-the sleeper] “ About . ”[3179-the sleeper] “ About . Good ! ”[1970-the mender of roads] [The mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads went [home]858-home , with the dust going on before [him]1970-the mender of roads according to the set of the wind , and was soon at the fountain , squeezing [himself]1970-the mender of roads in among [the lean kine brought there to drink]3182-the lean kine brought there to drink , and appearing even to whisper to [them]3182-the lean kine brought there to drink in [his]1970-the mender of roads whispering to all [the village]1888-the village . When [the village]1888-the village had taken [its]1888-the village poor supper , it did not creep to bed , as it usually did , but came out of doors again , and remained there . A curious contagion of whispering was upon it , and also , when it gathered together at the fountain in the dark , another curious contagion of looking expectantly at the sky in one direction only . [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle , [chief functionary of [the place]791-the place]3185-chief functionary of the place , became uneasy ; went out on [[his]195-monsieur gabelle house]3187-his house - top alone , and looked in that direction too ; glanced down from behind [his]195-monsieur gabelle chimneys at the darkening faces by the fountain below , and sent word to [the sacristan who kept the keys of [the church]1900-the church]3188-the sacristan who kept the keys of the church , that there might be need to ring [the tocsin]3190-the tocsin by - and - bye . The night deepened . The trees environing [the old chateau]3191-the old chateau , keeping [its]3191-the old chateau solitary state apart , moved in a rising wind , as though they threatened the pile of building massive and dark in the gloom . Up [the two terrace flights of steps]3192-the two terrace flights of steps the rain ran wildly , and beat at the great door , like a swift messenger rousing [those within]3193-those within ; uneasy rushes of wind went through [the hall]1556-the hall , among the old spears and knives , and passed lamenting up the stairs , and shook the curtains of the bed where [the last Marquis]3195-the last marquis had slept . East , [West , North]3196-west , north , and South , through [the woods]3197-the woods , [four heavy - treading , unkempt figures]3198-four heavy - treading , unkempt figures crushed the high grass and cracked the branches , striding on cautiously to come together in [the courtyard]915-the courtyard . Four lights broke out there , and moved away in different directions , and all was black again . But , not for long . Presently , [the chateau]2016-the chateau began to make itself strangely visible by some light of [its]2016-the chateau own , as though [it]2016-the chateau were growing luminous . Then , a flickering streak played behind the architecture of the front , picking out transparent places , and showing where balustrades , arches , and windows were . Then it soared higher , and grew broader and brighter . Soon , from a score of the great windows , flames burst forth , and the stone faces awakened , stared out of fire . A faint murmur arose about [the house]951-the house from [the few people who were left there]3202-the few people who were left there , and there was a saddling of a horse and riding away . There was spurring and splashing through the darkness , and bridle was drawn in the space by [the village fountain]3203-the village fountain , and the horse in a foam stood at [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ’s door . “ Help , [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ! Help , [every one]685-every one ! ”[3190-the tocsin] [The tocsin]3190-the tocsin rang impatiently , but other help ( if that were any ) there was none . [The mender of [roads]2089-roads]1970-the mender of roads , and [two hundred and fifty particular friends]3207-two hundred and fifty particular friends , stood with folded arms at the fountain , looking at the pillar of fire in the sky . “ It must be forty feet high , ”[3198-four heavy - treading , unkempt figures] said [they]3198-four heavy - treading , unkempt figures , grimly ; and never moved . [The rider]467-the rider from [the chateau]2016-the chateau , and the horse in a foam , clattered away through [the village]1888-the village , and galloped up [the stony steep]3211-the stony steep , to [the prison on [the crag]1914-the crag]2084-the prison on the crag . At the gate , [a group of [officers]3114-officers]3214-a group of officers were looking at the fire ; removed from [them]3214-a group of officers , [a group of [soldiers]1859-soldiers]3216-a group of soldiers . “ Help , [gentlemen]4849-gentlemen -- [officers]3114-officers ! [The chateau]2016-the chateau is on fire ; valuable objects may be saved from the flames by timely aid ! Help , help ! ”[3218-the officers] [The officers]3218-the officers looked towards [the soldiers who looked at the fire]3219-the soldiers who looked at the fire ; gave no orders ; and answered , with shrugs and biting of lips , “ It must burn . ”[3218-the officers] As [the rider]467-the rider rattled down [the hill]375-the hill again and through [the street]662-the street , [the village]1888-the village was illuminating . [The mender of [roads]2089-roads]1970-the mender of roads , and [the two hundred and fifty particular friends]3226-the two hundred and fifty particular friends , inspired as [one man]1440-one man and [woman]5560-woman by the idea of lighting up , had darted into [[their]3229-their houses]3230-their houses , and were putting candles in every dull little pane of glass . The general scarcity of everything , occasioned candles to be borrowed in a rather peremptory manner of [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ; and in a moment of reluctance and hesitation on [that functionary]3231-that functionary ’s part , [the mender of [roads]2089-roads]1970-the mender of roads , once so submissive to authority , had remarked that [carriages]1814-carriages were good to make bonfires with , and that post - horses would roast . [The chateau]2016-the chateau was left to itself to flame and burn . In the roaring and raging of the conflagration , a red - hot wind , driving straight from [the infernal regions]3236-the infernal regions , seemed to be blowing the edifice away . With the rising and falling of the blaze , the stone faces showed as if [they]3237-they were in torment . When great masses of stone and timber fell , the face with the two dints in the nose became obscured : [anon]3238-anon struggled out of the smoke again , as if it were the face of [the cruel Marquis , burning at the stake and contending with the fire]3239-the cruel marquis , burning at the stake and contending with the fire . [The chateau]2016-the chateau burned ; the nearest trees , laid hold of by the fire , scorched and shrivelled ; trees at a distance , fired by [the four fierce figures]3241-the four fierce figures , begirt [the blazing edifice]3242-the blazing edifice with a new forest of smoke . Molten lead and iron boiled in the marble basin of the fountain ; the water ran dry ; the extinguisher tops of [the towers]3243-the towers vanished like ice before the heat , and trickled down into [four rugged wells of flame]3244-four rugged wells of flame . Great rents and splits branched out in the solid walls , like crystallisation ; stupefied birds wheeled about and dropped into the furnace ; [four fierce figures]3245-four fierce figures trudged away , East , West , North , and South , along [the night - enshrouded roads]3246-the night - enshrouded roads , guided by the beacon [they]3245-four fierce figures had lighted , towards [their]3245-four fierce figures next destination . [The illuminated village]3247-the illuminated village had seized hold of the tocsin , and , abolishing the lawful ringer , rang for joy . Not only that ; but [the village]1888-the village , light - headed with famine , fire , and bell - ringing , and bethinking itself that [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle had to do with the collection of rent and taxes -- though it was but a small instalment of taxes , and no rent at all , that [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle had got in those latter days -- became impatient for an interview with [him]195-monsieur gabelle , and , surrounding [[his]195-monsieur gabelle house]3187-his house , summoned [him]195-monsieur gabelle to come forth for personal conference . Whereupon , [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle did heavily bar [his]195-monsieur gabelle door , and retire to hold counsel with [himself]195-monsieur gabelle . The result of that conference was , that [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle again withdrew [himself]195-monsieur gabelle to [[his]195-monsieur gabelle housetop]3250-his housetop behind [his]195-monsieur gabelle stack of chimneys ; this time resolved , if [his]195-monsieur gabelle door were broken in ( [he]195-monsieur gabelle was [a small Southern man of retaliative temperament )]3251-a small southern man of retaliative temperament ) , to pitch [himself]195-monsieur gabelle head foremost over the parapet , and crush [a man or two below]3252-a man or two below . Probably , [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle passed a long night up there , with [the distant chateau]3253-the distant chateau for fire and candle , and the beating at [his]195-monsieur gabelle door , combined with the joy - ringing , for music ; not to mention [his]195-monsieur gabelle having an ill - omened lamp slung across [the road]377-the road before [[his]195-monsieur gabelle posting - house gate]3255-his posting - house gate , which [the village]1888-the village showed a lively inclination to displace in [his]195-monsieur gabelle favour . A trying suspense , to be passing a whole summer night on [the brink of [the black ocean]3258-the black ocean]3257-the brink of the black ocean , ready to take that plunge into it upon which [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle had resolved ! But , the friendly dawn appearing at last , and the rush - candles of [the village]1888-the village guttering out , [the people]717-the people happily dispersed , and [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle came down bringing [his]195-monsieur gabelle life with [him]195-monsieur gabelle for that while . Within a hundred miles , and in the light of other fires , there were [other functionaries less fortunate , that night and other nights , whom the rising sun]3261-other functionaries less fortunate , that night and other nights , whom the rising sun found hanging across [once - peaceful streets]3262-once - peaceful streets , where [they]3261-other functionaries less fortunate , that night and other nights , whom the rising sun had been born and bred ; also , there were [other villagers]3263-other villagers and [townspeople]3264-townspeople less fortunate than [the mender of roads]1970-the mender of roads and [[his]195-monsieur gabelle fellows]3266-his fellows , upon whom [the functionaries and soldiery]3267-the functionaries and soldiery turned with success , and whom [they]3267-the functionaries and soldiery strung up in [their]3267-the functionaries and soldiery turn . But , [the fierce figures]3268-the fierce figures were steadily wending East , West , North , and South , be that as it would ; and whosoever hung , fire burned . The altitude of the gallows that would turn to water and quench it , [no functionary]3269-no functionary , by any stretch of mathematics , was able to calculate successfully . CHAPTER XXIV . Drawn to [the Loadstone Rock]3270-the loadstone rock In such risings of fire and risings of [sea]581-sea -- [the firm earth]3272-the firm earth shaken by the rushes of [an angry ocean]3273-an angry ocean which had now no ebb , but was always on the flow , higher and higher , to the terror and wonder of [the beholders on]3274-the beholders on [the shore]491-the shore -- three years of tempest were consumed . Three more birthdays of [little Lucie]174-lucie had been woven by the golden thread into the peaceful tissue of the life of [[her]174-lucie home]3276-her home . Many a night and many a day had [its inmates]3277-its inmates listened to the echoes in the corner , with hearts that failed [them]3277-its inmates when [they]3277-its inmates heard the thronging feet . For , the footsteps had become to [their]3277-its inmates minds as the footsteps of [a people]3278-a people , tumultuous under a red flag and with [[their]3278-a people country]3279-their country declared in danger , changed into wild beasts , by terrible enchantment long persisted in . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , as [a class]3125-a class , had dissociated [himself]188-monseigneur from the phenomenon of [his]188-monseigneur not being appreciated : of [his]188-monseigneur being so little wanted in [France]2-france , as to incur considerable danger of receiving [his]188-monseigneur dismissal from it , and this life together . Like the fabled rustic who raised [the Devil with infinite pains]3281-the devil with infinite pains , and was so terrified at the sight of [him]188-monseigneur that [he]188-monseigneur could ask [the Enemy]3282-the enemy no question , but immediately fled ; so , [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , after boldly reading [the Lord]3283-the lord ’s Prayer backwards for a great number of years , and performing many other potent spells for compelling [the Evil One]3284-the evil one , no sooner beheld [him]188-monseigneur in [his]188-monseigneur terrors than [he]188-monseigneur took to [his]188-monseigneur noble heels . [The shining Bull ’s Eye of the Court]3285-the shining bull ’s eye of the court was gone , or it would have been the mark for a hurricane of national bullets . It had never been a good eye to see with -- had long had the mote in it of [Lucifer]241-lucifer ’s pride , [Sardanapalus]242-sardanapalus ’s luxury , and a mole ’s blindness -- but it had dropped out and was gone . [The Court]4990-the court , from that exclusive inner circle to [its]4990-the court outermost rotten ring of intrigue , corruption , and dissimulation , was all gone together . [Royalty]2532-royalty was gone ; had been besieged in [[its]2532-royalty Palace]3288-its palace and “ suspended , ”[2532-royalty] when the last tidings came over . The August of the year one thousand seven hundred and ninety - two was come , and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur was by this time scattered far and wide . As was natural , [the head - quarters and great gathering - place of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]3289-the head - quarters and great gathering - place of monseigneur , in [London]3-london , was [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s Bank]4863-tellson ’s bank . [Spirits]3291-spirits are supposed to haunt the places where [their]3291-spirits bodies most resorted , and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur without [a guinea]3292-a guinea haunted the spot where [his]188-monseigneur guineas used to be . Moreover , [it]3293-it was the spot to which such French intelligence as was most to be relied upon , came quickest . Again : [Tellson ’s]134-tellson was [a munificent house]3294-a munificent house , and extended great liberality to [old customers who had fallen from [[their]3295-old customers who had fallen from their high estate high estate]3296-their high estate]3295-old customers who had fallen from their high estate . Again : [those nobles who had seen the coming storm in time , and anticipating plunder or confiscation]3297-those nobles who had seen the coming storm in time , and anticipating plunder or confiscation , had made provident remittances to [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , were always to be heard of [there]4887-there by [[their]3297-those nobles who had seen the coming storm in time , and anticipating plunder or confiscation needy brethren]3299-their needy brethren . To which it must be added that [every new - comer from [France]2-france]3300-every new - comer from france reported [himself]3300-every new - comer from france and [his]3300-every new - comer from france tidings at [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , almost as a matter of course . For such variety of reasons , [Tellson]134-tellson ’s was at that time , as to [French intelligence]3301-french intelligence , a kind of High Exchange ; and this was so well known to [the public]5636-the public , and the inquiries made there were in consequence so numerous , that [Tellson]134-tellson ’s sometimes wrote the latest news out in a line or so and posted it in the Bank windows , for all who ran through [Temple Bar]18-temple bar to read . On a steaming , misty afternoon , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry sat at [his]133-mr. lorry desk , and [Charles Darnay]162-darnay stood leaning on it , talking with [him]133-mr. lorry in a low voice . The penitential den once set apart for interviews with [the House]951-the house , was now the news - Exchange , and was filled to overflowing . It was within half an hour or so of the time of closing . “ But , although [you]133-mr. lorry are [the youngest man that ever lived]6323-the youngest man that ever lived , ”[162-darnay] said [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , rather hesitating , “ [I]162-darnay must still suggest to [you--]133-mr. lorry ”[162-darnay] “ [I]133-mr. lorry understand . That [I]133-mr. lorry am too old ? ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ Unsettled weather , a long journey , uncertain means of travelling , [a disorganised country]6324-a disorganised country , [a city that may not be even safe for [you]133-mr. lorry]6325-a city that may not be even safe for you . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [[My]133-mr. lorry dear]5097-my dear [Charles]162-darnay , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , with cheerful confidence , “ [you]162-darnay touch some of the reasons for [my]133-mr. lorry going : not for [my]133-mr. lorry staying away . It is safe enough for [me]133-mr. lorry ; [nobody]356-nobody will care to interfere with [an old fellow of hard upon fourscore]6328-an old fellow of hard upon fourscore when there are so many people there much better worth interfering with . As to [its]6325-a city that may not be even safe for you being [a disorganised city]6329-a disorganised city , if [it]6325-a city that may not be even safe for you were not [a disorganised city]6329-a disorganised city there would be no occasion to send somebody from [[our]6331-our House]6332-our house here to [[our]6331-our House]6332-our house there , who knows [the city]1496-the city and the business , of old , and is in [Tellson]134-tellson ’s confidence . As to the uncertain travelling , the long journey , and the winter weather , if [I]133-mr. lorry were not prepared to submit [myself]133-mr. lorry to a few inconveniences for the sake of [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , after all these years , who ought to be ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]162-darnay wish [I]162-darnay were going [myself]162-darnay , ”[162-darnay] said [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , somewhat restlessly , and like one thinking aloud . “ Indeed ! [You]133-mr. lorry are [a pretty fellow to object and advise]6335-a pretty fellow to object and advise ! ”[133-mr. lorry] exclaimed [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ [You]133-mr. lorry wish [you]133-mr. lorry were going [yourself]133-mr. lorry ? And [you]133-mr. lorry [a Frenchman]6336-a frenchman born ? [One]4965-one can not help thinking , having had some sympathy for [the miserable people]3120-the miserable people , and having abandoned something to [them]3120-the miserable people , ”[133-mr. lorry] [he]133-mr. lorry spoke here in [his]133-mr. lorry former thoughtful manner , “ that [one]4965-one might be listened to , and might have the power to persuade to some restraint . Wishing [you]133-mr. lorry were going to [France]2-france at this time of day ! ”[133-mr. lorry] “ However , [I]162-darnay am not going , ”[162-darnay] said [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , with a smile . “ It is more to the purpose that [you]133-mr. lorry say [you]133-mr. lorry are . ”[162-darnay] “ And [I]133-mr. lorry am , in plain reality . The truth is , [[my]133-mr. lorry dear]5097-my dear [Charles]162-darnay , ”[133-mr. lorry] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry glanced at [the distant House]5630-the distant house , and lowered [his]133-mr. lorry voice , “ [you]162-darnay can have no conception of the difficulty with which [our]6345-our business is transacted , and of the peril in which [our]6345-our books and papers over yonder are involved . [The Lord above]6346-the lord above knows what the compromising consequences would be to [numbers of people]6347-numbers of people , if some of [our]6345-our documents were seized or destroyed ; and they might be , at any time , [you]162-darnay know , for who can say that [Paris]7-paris is not set afire to - day , or sacked to - morrow ! Now , a judicious selection from these with the least possible delay , and the burying of [them]6348-them , or otherwise getting of [them]6348-them out of harm ’s way , is within the power ( without loss of precious time ) of scarcely any one but [myself]133-mr. lorry , if [any one]2697-any one . And shall [I]133-mr. lorry hang back , when [Tellson]134-tellson ’s knows this and says this -- [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , whose bread [I]133-mr. lorry have eaten these sixty years -- because [I]133-mr. lorry am a little stiff about the joints ? Nonsense , sir!--And , [[my]133-mr. lorry dear]5097-my dear [Charles]162-darnay , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , glancing at [the House]951-the house again , “ [you]162-darnay are to remember , that getting things out of [Paris]7-paris at this present time , no matter what things , is next to an impossibility . Papers and precious matters were this very day brought to [us]6355-us here ( [I]133-mr. lorry speak in strict confidence ; it is not business - like to whisper it , even to [you]162-darnay ) , by [the strangest bearers [you]162-darnay can imagine]6356-the strangest bearers you can imagine , [every one of whom]6357-every one of whom had [his]6357-every one of whom head hanging on by a single hair as [he]6357-every one of whom passed the Barriers . At another time , [our]6355-us parcels would come and go , as easily as in business - like [Old England]92-old england ; but now , everything is stopped . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ And do [you]133-mr. lorry really go to - night ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry really go to - night , for the case has become too pressing to admit of delay . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ And do [you]133-mr. lorry take [no one]330-no one with [you]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [All sorts of [people]360-people]6359-all sorts of people have been proposed to [me]133-mr. lorry , but [I]133-mr. lorry will have nothing to say to [any of [them]6359-all sorts of people]6361-any of them . [I]133-mr. lorry intend to take [Jerry]133-mr. lorry . When [I]133-mr. lorry have executed this little commission , [I]133-mr. lorry shall , perhaps , accept [Tellson]134-tellson ’s proposal to retire and live at [my]133-mr. lorry ease . Time enough , then , to think about growing old . ”[133-mr. lorry] This dialogue had taken place at [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s usual desk , with [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur swarming within a yard or two of it , boastful of what [he]188-monseigneur would do to avenge [himself]188-monseigneur on [the rascal - people]3306-the rascal - people before long . It was too much the way of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur under [his]188-monseigneur reverses as [a refugee]3307-a refugee , and it was much too much the way of native British orthodoxy , to talk of this terrible Revolution as if it were the only harvest ever known under the skies that had not been sown -- as if nothing had ever been done , or omitted to be done , that had led to it -- as if [observers of the wretched millions in [France]2-france]3308-observers of the wretched millions in france , and of the misused and perverted resources that should have made [them]3308-observers of the wretched millions in france prosperous , had not seen it inevitably coming , years before , and had not in plain words recorded what [they]3308-observers of the wretched millions in france saw . Such vapouring , combined with the extravagant plots of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur for the restoration of a state of things that had utterly exhausted itself , and worn out [Heaven and earth]3309-heaven and earth as well as itself , was hard to be endured without some remonstrance by [any sane man who knew the truth]3310-any sane man who knew the truth . And it was such vapouring all about [his]188-monseigneur ears , like a troublesome confusion of blood in [his]188-monseigneur own head , added to a latent uneasiness in [his]188-monseigneur mind , which had already made [Charles Darnay]162-darnay restless , and which still kept [him]188-monseigneur so . Among [the talkers]3311-the talkers , was [Stryver]171-mr. stryver , of [[the King]4850-the king ’s Bench Bar]93-the king ’s bench bar , far on [his]171-mr. stryver way to state promotion , and , therefore , loud on the theme : broaching to [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , [his]188-monseigneur devices for blowing [the people]717-the people up and exterminating [them]717-the people from the face of [the earth]5405-the earth , and doing without [them]717-the people : and for accomplishing many similar objects akin in [their]717-the people nature to the abolition of eagles by sprinkling salt on the tails of the race . [Him]188-monseigneur , [Darnay]162-darnay heard with a particular feeling of objection ; and [Darnay]162-darnay stood divided between going away that [he]162-darnay might hear no more , and remaining to interpose [his]162-darnay word , when the thing that was to be , went on to shape itself out . [The House]951-the house approached [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , and laying a soiled and unopened letter before [him]133-mr. lorry , asked if [he]133-mr. lorry had yet discovered any traces of [the person to whom it was addressed]3316-the person to whom it was addressed ? [The House]951-the house laid the letter down so close to [Darnay]162-darnay that [he]162-darnay saw the direction -- the more quickly because it was [his]162-darnay own right name . The address , turned into English , ran : “ Very pressing . To [Monsieur]6365-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis St. Evrémonde]6366-the marquis st. evrémonde , of [France]2-france . Confided to the cares of [Messrs. Tellson]134-tellson and [Co.]204-co. , [Bankers]6367-bankers , [London]3-london , [England]1-england . ”[170-doctor manette] On the marriage morning , [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette had made it [his]170-doctor manette one urgent and express request to [Charles Darnay]162-darnay , that the secret of this name should be -- unless [he]170-doctor manette , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor , dissolved the obligation -- kept inviolate between [them]3319-them . [He]133-mr. lorry held the letter out inquiringly ; and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur looked at it , in the person of [this plotting and indignant refugee]3325-this plotting and indignant refugee ; and [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur looked at it in the person of [that plotting and indignant refugee]3326-that plotting and indignant refugee ; and This , That , and [The Other]756-the other , all had something disparaging to say , in French or in English , concerning the Marquis who was not to be found . “ [Nephew]6371-nephew , [I]4965-one believe -- but in any case degenerate successor -- of [the polished Marquis who was murdered]6372-the polished marquis who was murdered , ”[4965-one] said [one]4965-one . “ Happy to say , [I]4965-one never knew [him]6370-this gentleman . ”[4965-one] “ [A craven who abandoned [his]3330-this monseigneur post]6373-a craven who abandoned his post , ”[4967-another] said [another]4967-another -- [this Monseigneur]3330-this monseigneur had been got out of [Paris]7-paris , legs uppermost and half suffocated , in a load of hay--“some years ago . ”[4965-one] “ [Infected with the new doctrines]6374-infected with the new doctrines , ”[3331-a third] said [a third]3331-a third , eyeing the direction through [his]3331-a third glass in passing ; “ set [himself]3330-this monseigneur in opposition to [the last Marquis]3195-the last marquis , abandoned [the estates]6376-the estates when [he]3330-this monseigneur inherited [them]6376-the estates , and left [them]6376-the estates to [the ruffian herd]6377-the ruffian herd .
