[You]162-darnay may tell [him]6390-this fellow so , with [my]171-mr. stryver compliments . [You]162-darnay may also tell [him]6390-this fellow , from [me]171-mr. stryver , that after abandoning [his]6390-this fellow worldly goods and position to [this butcherly mob]6392-this butcherly mob , [I]171-mr. stryver wonder [he]6390-this fellow is not at the head of [them]6392-this butcherly mob . But , no , [gentlemen]4849-gentlemen , ”[171-mr. stryver] said [Stryver]171-mr. stryver , looking all round , and snapping [his]171-mr. stryver fingers , “ [I]171-mr. stryver know something of human nature , and [I]171-mr. stryver tell [you]4849-gentlemen that [you]4849-gentlemen ’ll never find [a fellow like [this fellow]6390-this fellow , trusting [himself]6390-this fellow to the mercies of such precious _ protégés _]6394-a fellow like this fellow , trusting himself to the mercies of such precious _ protégés _ . No , [gentlemen]4849-gentlemen ; [he]6390-this fellow ’ll always show ’em a clean pair of heels very early in the scuffle , and sneak away . ”[171-mr. stryver] With those words , and a final snap of [his]171-mr. stryver fingers , [Mr. Stryver]171-mr. stryver shouldered [himself]171-mr. stryver into [Fleet - street]962-fleet - street , amidst the general approbation of [[his]171-mr. stryver hearers]3333-his hearers . [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry and [Charles Darnay]162-darnay were left alone at the desk , in the general departure from [the Bank]531-the bank . “ Will [you]133-mr. lorry take charge of the letter ? ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ [You]133-mr. lorry know where to deliver it ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]171-mr. stryver do . ”[171-mr. stryver] “ Will [you]133-mr. lorry undertake to explain , that [we]6397-we suppose it to have been addressed here , on the chance of [our]6397-we knowing where to forward it , and that it has been here some time ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry will do so . Do [you]133-mr. lorry start for [Paris]7-paris from here ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ From here , at eight . ”[171-mr. stryver] “ [I]133-mr. lorry will come back , to see [you]133-mr. lorry off . ”[133-mr. lorry] Very ill at ease with [himself]162-darnay , and with [Stryver]171-mr. stryver and [most other men]3335-most other men , [Darnay]162-darnay made the best of [his]162-darnay way into the quiet of [the Temple]1027-the temple , opened the letter , and read it . These were its contents : “ [Prison of [the Abbaye]94-the abbaye]6398-prison of the abbaye , [Paris]7-paris . “[162-darnay] June 21 , 1792 . “ [MONSIEUR]6399-monsieur HERETOFORE [THE MARQUIS]1836-the marquis . “[162-darnay] After having long been in danger of [my]0-i life at the hands of [the village]1888-the village , [I]0-i have been seized , with great violence and indignity , and brought a long journey on foot to [Paris]7-paris . On [the road]377-the road [I]0-i have suffered a great deal . Nor is that all ; [[my]0-i house]3339-my house has been destroyed -- razed to the ground . “ The crime for which [I]193-monsieur the marquis am imprisoned , [Monsieur]6401-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , and for which [I]193-monsieur the marquis shall be summoned before the tribunal , and shall lose [my]193-monsieur the marquis life ( without [your]1836-the marquis so generous help ) , is , [they]1836-the marquis tell [me]193-monsieur the marquis , treason against the majesty of [the people]717-the people , in that [I]193-monsieur the marquis have acted against [them]1836-the marquis for [an emigrant]6404-an emigrant . It is in vain [I]193-monsieur the marquis represent that [I]193-monsieur the marquis have acted for [them]1836-the marquis , and not against , according to [your]1836-the marquis commands . It is in vain [I]193-monsieur the marquis represent that , before the sequestration of [emigrant property]6405-emigrant property , [I]193-monsieur the marquis had remitted the imposts [they]1836-the marquis had ceased to pay ; that [I]193-monsieur the marquis had collected no rent ; that [I]193-monsieur the marquis had had recourse to no process . The only response is , that [I]193-monsieur the marquis have acted for [an emigrant]6404-an emigrant , and where is [that emigrant]6407-that emigrant ? “[193-monsieur the marquis] Ah ! most gracious [Monsieur heretofore the Marquis]193-monsieur the marquis , where is [that emigrant]6407-that emigrant ? [I]0-i cry in [my]0-i sleep where is [he]6407-that emigrant ? [I]0-i demand of Heaven , will [he]6407-that emigrant not come to deliver [me]0-i ? No answer . Ah [Monsieur]3341-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , [I]0-i send [my]0-i desolate cry across [the sea]599-the sea , hoping it may perhaps reach [your]1836-the marquis ears through [the great bank of [Tilson]95-tilson known at [Paris]7-paris]3344-the great bank of tilson known at paris ! “ For the love of [Heaven]225-heaven , of justice , of generosity , of the honour of [your]1836-the marquis noble name , [I]0-i supplicate [you]1836-the marquis , [[Monsieur]6408-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis]1836-the marquis]6409-monsieur heretofore the marquis , to succour and release [me]0-i . [My]0-i fault is , that [I]0-i have been true to [you]1836-the marquis . Oh [Monsieur]6411-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , [I]0-i pray [you]1836-the marquis be [you]1836-the marquis true to [me]0-i ! “[0-i] From this prison here of horror , whence [I]0-i every hour tend nearer and nearer to destruction , [I]0-i send [you]3345-you , [Monsieur]3346-monsieur heretofore [the Marquis]1836-the marquis , the assurance of [my]0-i dolorous and unhappy service . “ [Your]3345-you afflicted , “[195-monsieur gabelle] [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle . ” The latent uneasiness in [Darnay]162-darnay ’s mind was roused to vigourous life by this letter . The peril of [an old servant]6413-an old servant and [a good one]6414-a good one , whose only crime was fidelity to [himself]6413-an old servant and [[his]6413-an old servant family]6415-his family , stared [him]162-darnay so reproachfully in the face , that , as [he]162-darnay walked to and fro in [the Temple]1027-the temple considering what to do , [he]162-darnay almost hid [his]162-darnay face from [the passersby]6417-the passersby . [He]162-darnay knew very well , that in [his]162-darnay horror of the deed which had culminated the bad deeds and bad reputation of [the old family house]6418-the old family house , in [his]162-darnay resentful suspicions of [[his]162-darnay uncle]6419-his uncle , and in the aversion with which [his]162-darnay conscience regarded the crumbling fabric that [he]162-darnay was supposed to uphold , [he]162-darnay had acted imperfectly . [He]162-darnay knew very well , that in [his]162-darnay love for [Lucie]174-lucie , [his]162-darnay renunciation of [his]162-darnay social place , though by no means new to [his]162-darnay own mind , had been hurried and incomplete . [He]162-darnay knew that [he]162-darnay ought to have systematically worked it out and supervised it , and that [he]162-darnay had meant to do it , and that it had never been done . The happiness of [[his]162-darnay own chosen English home]6420-his own chosen english home , the necessity of being always actively employed , the swift changes and troubles of the time which had followed on one another so fast , that the events of this week annihilated the immature plans of last week , and the events of the week following made all new again ; [he]162-darnay knew very well , that to the force of these circumstances [he]162-darnay had yielded:--not without disquiet , but still without continuous and accumulating resistance . That [he]162-darnay had watched the times for a time of action , and that [they]6421-they had shifted and struggled until the time had gone by , and [the nobility]6422-the nobility were trooping from [France]2-france by [every highway and byway]6423-every highway and byway , and [their]6422-the nobility property was in course of confiscation and destruction , and [their]6422-the nobility very names were blotting out , was as well known to [himself]162-darnay as it could be to any new authority in [France]2-france that might impeach [him]162-darnay for it . But , [he]162-darnay had oppressed [no man]1866-no man , [he]162-darnay had imprisoned [no man]1866-no man ; [he]162-darnay was so far from having harshly exacted payment of [his]162-darnay dues , that [he]162-darnay had relinquished them of [his]162-darnay own will , thrown [himself]162-darnay on a world with no favour in it , won [[his]162-darnay own private place [there]4887-there]6426-his own private place there , and earned [his]162-darnay own bread . [Monsieur Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle had held [the impoverished and involved estate]6428-the impoverished and involved estate on written instructions , to spare [the people]717-the people , to give [them]717-the people what little there was to give -- such fuel as [the heavy creditors]6430-the heavy creditors would let [them]717-the people have in the winter , and such produce as could be saved from the same grip in the summer -- and no doubt [he]195-monsieur gabelle had put the fact in plea and proof , for [his]195-monsieur gabelle own safety , so that it could not but appear now . This favoured the desperate resolution [Charles Darnay]162-darnay had begun to make , that [he]195-monsieur gabelle would go to [Paris]7-paris . Yes . Like the mariner in the old story , the winds and streams had driven [him]195-monsieur gabelle within the influence of [the Loadstone Rock]97-the loadstone rock , and it was drawing [him]195-monsieur gabelle to itself , and [he]195-monsieur gabelle must go . Everything that arose before [his]195-monsieur gabelle mind drifted [him]195-monsieur gabelle on , faster and faster , more and more steadily , to the terrible attraction . [His]195-monsieur gabelle latent uneasiness had been , that bad aims were being worked out in [[his]195-monsieur gabelle own unhappy land]6431-his own unhappy land by [bad instruments]6432-bad instruments , and that [he]195-monsieur gabelle who could not fail to know that [he]195-monsieur gabelle was better than [they]717-the people , was not there , trying to do something to stay bloodshed , and assert the claims of mercy and humanity . With this uneasiness half stifled , and half reproaching [him]195-monsieur gabelle , [he]195-monsieur gabelle had been brought to the pointed comparison of [himself]195-monsieur gabelle with [the brave old gentleman in whom duty was so strong]6433-the brave old gentleman in whom duty was so strong ; upon that comparison ( injurious to [himself]195-monsieur gabelle ) had instantly followed the sneers of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur , which had stung [him]195-monsieur gabelle bitterly , and those of [Stryver]171-mr. stryver , which above all were coarse and galling , for old reasons . Upon those , had followed [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ’s letter : the appeal of [an innocent prisoner , in danger of death]6434-an innocent prisoner , in danger of death , to [his]6434-an innocent prisoner , in danger of death justice , honour , and good name . [His]195-monsieur gabelle resolution was made . [He]195-monsieur gabelle must go to [Paris]7-paris . Yes . The Loadstone Rock was drawing [him]195-monsieur gabelle , and [he]195-monsieur gabelle must sail on , until [he]195-monsieur gabelle struck . [He]195-monsieur gabelle knew of no rock ; [he]195-monsieur gabelle saw hardly any danger . The intention with which [he]195-monsieur gabelle had done what [he]195-monsieur gabelle had done , even although [he]195-monsieur gabelle had left it incomplete , presented it before [him]195-monsieur gabelle in an aspect that would be gratefully acknowledged in [France]2-france on [his]195-monsieur gabelle presenting [himself]195-monsieur gabelle to assert it . Then , that glorious vision of doing good , which is so often the sanguine mirage of so many good minds , arose before [him]195-monsieur gabelle , and [he]195-monsieur gabelle even saw [himself]195-monsieur gabelle in the illusion with some influence to guide this raging Revolution that was running so fearfully wild . As [he]195-monsieur gabelle walked to and fro with [his]195-monsieur gabelle resolution made , [he]195-monsieur gabelle considered that neither [Lucie]174-lucie nor [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father must know of it until [he]195-monsieur gabelle was gone . [Lucie]174-lucie should be spared the pain of separation ; and [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father , always reluctant to turn [his]5008-her father thoughts towards the dangerous ground of old , should come to the knowledge of the step , as a step taken , and not in the balance of suspense and doubt . How much of the incompleteness of [his]195-monsieur gabelle situation was referable to [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father , through the painful anxiety to avoid reviving old associations of [France]2-france in [his]195-monsieur gabelle mind , [he]195-monsieur gabelle did not discuss with [himself]195-monsieur gabelle . But , that circumstance too , had had its influence in [his]195-monsieur gabelle course . [He]195-monsieur gabelle walked to and fro , with thoughts very busy , until it was time to return to [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s]959-tellson ’s and take leave of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . As soon as [he]195-monsieur gabelle arrived in [Paris]7-paris [he]195-monsieur gabelle would present [himself]195-monsieur gabelle to [this old friend]6439-this old friend , but [he]195-monsieur gabelle must say nothing of [his]195-monsieur gabelle intention now . [A carriage with post - horses]6440-a carriage with post - horses was ready at the Bank door , and [Jerry]133-mr. lorry was booted and equipped . “[195-monsieur gabelle] [I]0-i have delivered that letter , ” said [Charles Darnay]162-darnay to [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “[0-i] [I]0-i would not consent to [your]0-i being charged with any written answer , but perhaps [you]0-i will take a verbal one ? ” “[0-i] That [I]0-i will , and readily , ” said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , “[0-i] if it is not dangerous . ” “[0-i] Not at all . Though it is to [a prisoner in [the Abbaye]3349-the abbaye]3348-a prisoner in the abbaye . ” “[3348-a prisoner in the abbaye] What is [his]3348-a prisoner in the abbaye name ? ” said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , with [his]133-mr. lorry open pocket - book in [his]133-mr. lorry hand . “[195-monsieur gabelle] [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle . ” “[195-monsieur gabelle] [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle . And what is the message to [the unfortunate [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle in [prison]5014-prison]3350-the unfortunate gabelle in prison ? ” “[195-monsieur gabelle] Simply , ‘ that [he]3348-a prisoner in the abbaye has received the letter , and will come . ’ ” “[195-monsieur gabelle] Any time mentioned ? ” “[3348-a prisoner in the abbaye] [He]3348-a prisoner in the abbaye will start upon [his]3348-a prisoner in the abbaye journey to - morrow night . ” “[3352-any person] [Any person]3352-any person mentioned ? ” “[3352-any person] No . ” [He]0-i helped [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry to wrap [himself]133-mr. lorry in a number of coats and cloaks , and went out with [him]133-mr. lorry from the warm atmosphere of [the old Bank]6441-the old bank , into the misty air of [Fleet - street]38-fleet - street . “[3352-any person] [My]0-i love to [Lucie]174-lucie , and to [little Lucie]174-lucie , ” said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry at parting , “[3352-any person] and take precious care of [them]3353-them till [I]0-i come back . ” [Charles Darnay]162-darnay shook [his]162-darnay head and doubtfully smiled , as [the carriage]917-the carriage rolled away . That night -- it was the fourteenth of August -- [he]133-mr. lorry sat up late , and wrote two fervent letters ; one was to [Lucie]174-lucie , explaining the strong obligation [he]133-mr. lorry was under to go to [Paris]7-paris , and showing [her]174-lucie , at length , the reasons that [he]133-mr. lorry had , for feeling confident that [he]133-mr. lorry could become involved in no personal danger there ; the other was to [the Doctor]1514-the doctor , confiding [Lucie]174-lucie and [[their]6444-their dear child]6445-their dear child to [his]133-mr. lorry care , and dwelling on the same topics with the strongest assurances . To both , [he]133-mr. lorry wrote that [he]133-mr. lorry would despatch letters in proof of [his]133-mr. lorry safety , immediately after [his]133-mr. lorry arrival . It was a hard day , that day of being among [them]6444-their , with the first reservation of [their]6444-their joint lives on [his]133-mr. lorry mind . It was a hard matter to preserve the innocent deceit of which [they]6444-their were profoundly unsuspicious . But , an affectionate glance at [[his]133-mr. lorry wife]4987-his wife , so happy and busy , made [him]133-mr. lorry resolute not to tell [her]4987-his wife what impended ( [he]133-mr. lorry had been half moved to do it , so strange it was to [him]133-mr. lorry to act in anything without [her]4987-his wife quiet aid ) , and the day passed quickly . Early in the evening [he]133-mr. lorry embraced [her]4987-his wife , and [[her]4987-his wife scarcely less dear namesake]6447-her scarcely less dear namesake , pretending that [he]133-mr. lorry would return by - and - bye ( an imaginary engagement took [him]133-mr. lorry out , and [he]133-mr. lorry had secreted a valise of clothes ready ) , and so [he]133-mr. lorry emerged into the heavy mist of [the heavy streets]6448-the heavy streets , with a heavier heart . The unseen force was drawing [him]133-mr. lorry fast to itself , now , and all the tides and winds were setting straight and strong towards it . [He]133-mr. lorry left [his]133-mr. lorry two letters with [a trusty porter]6449-a trusty porter , to be delivered half an hour before midnight , and no sooner ; took horse for [Dover]15-dover ; and began [his]133-mr. lorry journey . “[0-i] For the love of Heaven , of justice , of generosity , of the honour of [your]3354-your noble name ! ” was [the poor prisoner]6450-the poor prisoner ’s cry with which [he]133-mr. lorry strengthened [his]133-mr. lorry sinking heart , as [he]133-mr. lorry left all that was dear on [earth]1323-earth behind [him]133-mr. lorry , and floated away for [the Loadstone Rock]3270-the loadstone rock . The end of the second book . Book the Third -- the Track of a Storm CHAPTER I. In [Secret]98-secret [The traveller]1936-the traveller fared slowly on [his]1936-the traveller way , who fared towards [Paris]7-paris from [England]1-england in the autumn of the year one thousand seven hundred and ninety - two . More than enough of [bad roads]6454-bad roads , bad equipages , and bad horses , [he]133-mr. lorry would have encountered to delay [him]133-mr. lorry , though [the fallen and unfortunate King of [France]2-france]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france had been upon [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france throne in all [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france glory ; but , the changed times were fraught with other obstacles than these . [[Every town]6456-every town - gate and [village taxing - house]6458-village taxing - house]6457-every town - gate and village taxing - house had [[its]6456-every town band of [citizen - patriots]6460-citizen - patriots]6459-its band of citizen - patriots , with [their]6459-its band of citizen - patriots national muskets in a most explosive state of readiness , who stopped [all comers and goers]6461-all comers and goers , cross - questioned [them]6461-all comers and goers , inspected [their]6461-all comers and goers papers , looked for [their]6461-all comers and goers names in lists of [their]6461-all comers and goers own , turned [them]6461-all comers and goers back , or sent [them]6461-all comers and goers on , or stopped [them]6461-all comers and goers and laid [them]6461-all comers and goers in hold , as [their]6461-all comers and goers capricious judgment or fancy deemed best for the dawning Republic One and Indivisible , of Liberty , Equality , Fraternity , or Death . [A very few French leagues of [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france journey]6462-a very few french leagues of his journey were accomplished , when [Charles Darnay]162-darnay began to perceive that for [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france along [these country roads]6463-these country roads there was no hope of return until [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france should have been declared [a good citizen]6464-a good citizen at [Paris]7-paris . Whatever might befall now , [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france must on to [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france journey ’s end . Not [a mean village]6465-a mean village closed upon [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france , not a common barrier dropped across [the road]377-the road behind [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france , but [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france knew it to be another iron door in the series that was barred between [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france and [England]1-england . The universal watchfulness so encompassed [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france , that if [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france had been taken in a net , or were being forwarded to [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france destination in a cage , [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france could not have felt [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france freedom more completely gone . This universal watchfulness not only stopped [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france on [the highway]3109-the highway twenty times in a stage , but retarded [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france progress twenty times in a day , by riding after [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france and taking [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france back , riding before [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france and stopping [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france by anticipation , riding with [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france and keeping [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france in charge . [He]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france had been days upon [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france journey in [France]2-france alone , when [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france went to bed tired out , in [a little town]6468-a little town on [the high road]6469-the high road , still a long way from [Paris]7-paris . Nothing but the production of the afflicted [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ’s letter from [[his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france prison of [the Abbaye]3349-the abbaye]6470-his prison of the abbaye would have got [him]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france on so far . [His]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france difficulty at [the guard - house]938-the guard - house in [this small place]6473-this small place had been such , that [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france felt [his]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france journey to have come to a crisis . And [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france was , therefore , as little surprised as [a man]449-a man could be , to find [himself]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france awakened at [the small inn to which [he]6455-the fallen and unfortunate king of france had been remitted until morning , in the middle of the night]6475-the small inn to which he had been remitted until morning , in the middle of the night . Awakened by [a timid local functionary]6476-a timid local functionary and [three armed patriots in rough red caps and with pipes in [their]6477-three armed patriots in rough red caps and with pipes in their mouths , who sat down on the bed mouths , who sat down on the bed]6477-three armed patriots in rough red caps and with pipes in their mouths , who sat down on the bed . “[3355-emigrant] [Emigrant]3355-emigrant , ” said [the functionary]6478-the functionary , “[3355-emigrant] [I]0-i am going to send [you]3355-emigrant on to [Paris]7-paris , under [an escort]3356-an escort . ” “[3357-citizen] [Citizen]3357-citizen , [I]0-i desire nothing more than to get to [Paris]7-paris , though [I]0-i could dispense with [the escort]3358-the escort . ” “[3360-the good patriot] Silence ! ” growled [a red - cap]6479-a red - cap , striking at the coverlet with the butt - end of [his]6479-a red - cap musket . “[3360-the good patriot] Peace , [aristocrat]3359-aristocrat ! ” “[3359-aristocrat] It is as [the good patriot]3360-the good patriot says , ” observed [the timid functionary]6480-the timid functionary . “[3360-the good patriot] [You]3355-emigrant are [an aristocrat]2572-an aristocrat , and must have [an escort]3356-an escort -- and must pay for it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have no choice , ” said [Charles Darnay]162-darnay . “[0-i] Choice ! Listen to [him]3360-the good patriot ! ” cried [the same scowling red - cap]6481-the same scowling red - cap . “[3360-the good patriot] As if it was not a favour to be protected from the lamp - iron ! ” “[3360-the good patriot] It is always as [the good patriot]3360-the good patriot says , ” observed [the functionary]6478-the functionary . “[3360-the good patriot] Rise and dress [yourself]3355-emigrant , [emigrant]3355-emigrant . ” [Darnay]162-darnay complied , and was taken back to [the guard - house]938-the guard - house , where [other patriots in rough red caps]6484-other patriots in rough red caps were smoking , drinking , and sleeping , by a watch - fire . [Here]4902-here [he]162-darnay paid a heavy price for [[his]162-darnay escort]6486-his escort , and hence [he]162-darnay started with [it]6486-his escort on [the wet , wet roads]6487-the wet , wet roads at three o’clock in the morning . [The escort]3358-the escort were [two mounted patriots]6489-two mounted patriots in red caps and tri - coloured cockades , armed with national muskets and sabres , who rode one on either side of [him]162-darnay . [The escorted]6490-the escorted governed [his]6490-the escorted own horse , but a loose line was attached to [his]6490-the escorted bridle , the end of which one of [the patriots]6491-the patriots kept girded round [his]6490-the escorted wrist . In this state [they]6489-two mounted patriots set forth with the sharp rain driving in [their]6489-two mounted patriots faces : clattering at a heavy dragoon trot over [the uneven town pavement]6492-the uneven town pavement , and out upon [the mire - deep roads]6493-the mire - deep roads . In [this state]6494-this state [they]6489-two mounted patriots traversed without change , except of horses and pace , all the mire - deep leagues that lay between [them]6489-two mounted patriots and [the capital]332-the capital . [They]6489-two mounted patriots travelled in the night , halting an hour or two after daybreak , and lying by until the twilight fell . [The escort]3358-the escort were so wretchedly clothed , that [they]6489-two mounted patriots twisted straw round [their]6489-two mounted patriots bare legs , and thatched [their]6489-two mounted patriots ragged shoulders to keep the wet off . Apart from the personal discomfort of being so attended , and apart from such considerations of present danger as arose from one of [the patriots]6491-the patriots being chronically drunk , and carrying [his]6490-the escorted musket very recklessly , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay did not allow the restraint that was laid upon [him]162-darnay to awaken any serious fears in [his]162-darnay breast ; for , [he]162-darnay reasoned with [himself]162-darnay that it could have no reference to the merits of an individual case that was not yet stated , and of representations , confirmable by [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner in [the Abbaye]3349-the abbaye , that were not yet made . But when [they]6489-two mounted patriots came to [the town of Beauvais]6500-the town of beauvais -- which [they]6489-two mounted patriots did at eventide , when [the streets]732-the streets were filled with [people]360-people -- [he]162-darnay could not conceal from [himself]162-darnay that the aspect of affairs was very alarming . [An ominous crowd]6503-an ominous crowd gathered to see [him]162-darnay dismount of [the posting - yard]6504-the posting - yard , and many voices called out loudly , “[3355-emigrant] Down with [the emigrant]3365-the emigrant ! ” [He]162-darnay stopped in the act of swinging [himself]162-darnay out of [his]162-darnay saddle , and , resuming it as [his]162-darnay safest place , said : “[3355-emigrant] [Emigrant]3355-emigrant , [[my]0-i friends]3367-my friends ! Do [you]3367-my friends not see [me]0-i here , in [France]2-france , of [my]0-i own will ? ” “[3367-my friends] [You]3365-the emigrant are [a cursed emigrant]3368-a cursed emigrant , ” cried [a farrier]6505-a farrier , making at [him]3365-the emigrant in a furious manner through the press , hammer in hand ; “[3365-the emigrant] and [you]3365-the emigrant are [a cursed aristocrat]3369-a cursed aristocrat ! ” [The postmaster]1942-the postmaster interposed [himself]1942-the postmaster between [this man]5081-this man and [the rider]467-the rider ’s bridle ( at which [he]1942-the postmaster was evidently making ) , and soothingly said , “[3365-the emigrant] Let [him]3365-the emigrant be ; let [him]3365-the emigrant be ! [He]3365-the emigrant will be judged at [Paris]7-paris . ” “[3365-the emigrant] Judged ! ” repeated [the farrier]6509-the farrier , swinging [his]6509-the farrier hammer . “[3365-the emigrant] Ay ! and condemned as [a traitor]3370-a traitor . ” At this [the crowd]1386-the crowd roared approval . Checking [the postmaster]1942-the postmaster , who was for turning [his]1942-the postmaster horse ’s head to [the yard]1579-the yard ( [the drunken patriot]6513-the drunken patriot sat composedly in [his]6513-the drunken patriot saddle looking on , with the line round [his]6513-the drunken patriot wrist ) , [Darnay]162-darnay said , as soon as [he]162-darnay could make [his]162-darnay voice heard : “[3370-a traitor] [Friends]859-friends , [you]859-friends deceive [yourselves]859-friends , or [you]859-friends are deceived . [I]0-i am not [a traitor]3370-a traitor . ” “[0-i] [He]0-i lies ! ” cried [the smith]725-the smith . “[0-i] [He]0-i is [a traitor]3370-a traitor since the decree . [His]0-i life is forfeit to [the people]717-the people . [His]0-i cursed life is not [his]0-i own ! ” At the instant when [Darnay]162-darnay saw a rush in the eyes of [the crowd]1386-the crowd , which another instant would have brought upon [him]162-darnay , [the postmaster]1942-the postmaster turned [his]1942-the postmaster horse into [the yard]1579-the yard , [the escort]3358-the escort rode in close upon [his]1942-the postmaster horse ’s flanks , and [the postmaster]1942-the postmaster shut and barred the crazy double gates . [The farrier]6509-the farrier struck a blow upon [them]1386-the crowd with [his]6509-the farrier hammer , and [the crowd]1386-the crowd groaned ; but , no more was done . “[725-the smith] What is this decree that [the smith]725-the smith spoke of ? ” [Darnay]162-darnay asked [the postmaster]1942-the postmaster , when [he]1942-the postmaster had thanked [him]1942-the postmaster , and stood beside [him]1942-the postmaster in [the yard]1579-the yard . “[725-the smith] Truly , a decree for selling the property of [emigrants]3376-emigrants . ” “[725-the smith] When passed ? ” “[725-the smith] On the fourteenth . ” “[725-the smith] The day [I]0-i left [England]1-england ! ” “[1759-everybody] [Everybody]1759-everybody says it is but one of several , and that there will be [others]672-others -- if there are not already -- banishing [all emigrants]3379-all emigrants , and condemning [all]5873-all to death who return . That is what [he]725-the smith meant when [he]725-the smith said [your]3381-your life was not [your]3381-your own . ” “[725-the smith] But there are no such decrees yet ? ” “[725-the smith] What do [I]0-i know ! ” said [the postmaster]1942-the postmaster , shrugging [his]1942-the postmaster shoulders ; “[725-the smith] there may be , or there will be . It is all the same . What would [you]3381-your have ? ” [They]6525-they rested on some straw in [a loft]6526-a loft until the middle of the night , and then rode forward again when all [the town]600-the town was asleep . Among the many wild changes observable on familiar things which made this wild ride unreal , not the least was the seeming rarity of sleep . After long and lonely spurring over [dreary roads]6528-dreary roads , [they]6525-they would come to [a cluster of [poor cottages]6530-poor cottages]6529-a cluster of poor cottages , not steeped in darkness , but all glittering with lights , and would find [the people , in a ghostly manner in the dead of the night]6531-the people , in a ghostly manner in the dead of the night , circling hand in hand round a shrivelled tree of Liberty , or all drawn up together singing a Liberty song . Happily , however , there was sleep in [Beauvais]25-beauvais that night to help [them]6525-they out of it and [they]6525-they passed on once more into solitude and loneliness : jingling through the untimely cold and wet , among [impoverished fields that had yielded no fruits of [the earth]5405-the earth that year]6532-impoverished fields that had yielded no fruits of the earth that year , diversified by the blackened remains of [burnt houses]6534-burnt houses , and by the sudden emergence from ambuscade , and sharp reining up across [their]6525-they way , of [patriot patrols on the watch]6535-patriot patrols on the watch on all [the roads]1925-the roads . [Daylight]246-daylight at last found [them]6525-they before [the wall of [Paris]7-paris]6537-the wall of paris . The barrier was closed and strongly guarded when [they]6525-they rode up to [it]6537-the wall of paris . “[3381-your] Where are the papers of [this prisoner]3382-this prisoner ? ” demanded [a resolute - looking man in authority , who was summoned out by [the guard]340-the guard]6538-a resolute - looking man in authority , who was summoned out by the guard . Naturally struck by the disagreeable word , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay requested [the speaker]865-the speaker to take notice that [he]162-darnay was [a free traveller]6541-a free traveller and [French citizen]6542-french citizen , in charge of an escort which [the disturbed state of [the country]956-the country]6543-the disturbed state of the country had imposed upon [him]162-darnay , and which [he]162-darnay had paid for . “[3381-your] Where , ” repeated [the same personage]6545-the same personage , without taking any heed of [him]162-darnay whatever , “[3381-your] are the papers of [this prisoner]3382-this prisoner ? ” [The drunken patriot]6513-the drunken patriot had them in [his]6513-the drunken patriot cap , and produced them . Casting [his]6513-the drunken patriot eyes over [Gabelle]195-monsieur gabelle ’s letter , [the same personage in authority]6547-the same personage in authority showed some disorder and surprise , and looked at [Darnay]162-darnay with a close attention . [He]6513-the drunken patriot left [escort]6548-escort and escorted without saying a word , however , and went into [the guard - room]6549-the guard - room ; meanwhile , [they]6550-they sat upon [their]6550-they horses outside the gate . Looking about [him]6513-the drunken patriot while in this state of suspense , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay observed that the gate was held by [a mixed guard of [soldiers]1859-soldiers and [patriots]6269-patriots]6551-a mixed guard of soldiers and patriots , the latter far outnumbering [the former]6554-the former ; and that while ingress into [the city]1496-the city for [[peasants]6556-peasants ’ carts bringing in supplies]6557-peasants ’ carts bringing in supplies , and for similar traffic and [traffickers]6558-traffickers , was easy enough , egress , even for [the homeliest people]6559-the homeliest people , was very difficult . [A numerous medley of [men]568-men]6560-a numerous medley of men and [women , not to mention beasts and vehicles of various sorts]6562-women , not to mention beasts and vehicles of various sorts , was waiting to issue forth ; but , the previous identification was so strict , that [they]6550-they filtered through the barrier very slowly . [Some of [these people]6564-these people]6563-some of these people knew [their]6563-some of these people turn for examination to be so far off , that [they]6563-some of these people lay down on the ground to sleep or smoke , while [others]672-others talked together , or loitered about . The red cap and tri - colour cockade were universal , both among [men]568-men and [women]671-women . When [he]6568-he had sat in [his]6568-he saddle some half - hour , taking note of these things , [Darnay]162-darnay found [himself]162-darnay confronted by [the same man in authority]6569-the same man in authority , who directed [the guard to open the barrier]6570-the guard to open the barrier . Then [he]162-darnay delivered to [the escort , drunk and sober]6571-the escort , drunk and sober , a receipt for [the escorted]6490-the escorted , and requested [him]6571-the escort , drunk and sober to dismount . [He]162-darnay did so , and [the two patriots]6573-the two patriots , leading [his]6573-the two patriots tired horse , turned and rode away without entering [the city]1496-the city . [He]162-darnay accompanied [[his]162-darnay conductor]6575-his conductor into [a guard - room]6576-a guard - room , smelling of common wine and tobacco , where [certain soldiers and [patriots , asleep and awake , drunk and sober]6578-patriots , asleep and awake , drunk and sober , and in various neutral states between sleeping and waking , drunkenness and sobriety]6577-certain soldiers and patriots , asleep and awake , drunk and sober , and in various neutral states between sleeping and waking , drunkenness and sobriety , were standing and lying about . The light in [the guard - house]938-the guard - house , half derived from the waning oil - lamps of the night , and half from the overcast day , was in a correspondingly uncertain condition . Some registers were lying open on a desk , and [an officer of a coarse , dark aspect]6580-an officer of a coarse , dark aspect , presided over these . “[3381-your] [Citizen Defarge]247-defarge , ” said [he]6580-an officer of a coarse , dark aspect to [[Darnay]162-darnay ’s conductor]6581-darnay ’s conductor , as [he]6580-an officer of a coarse , dark aspect took a slip of paper to write on . “[247-defarge] Is this [the emigrant Evrémonde]3384-the emigrant evrémonde ? ” “[472-the man] This is [the man]472-the man . ” “[472-the man] [Your]3386-you age , Evrémonde ? ” “[3386-you] Thirty - seven . ” “[3386-you] Married , Evrémonde ? ” “[3386-you] Yes . ” “[3386-you] Where married ? ” “[3386-you] In [England]1-england . ” “[3386-you] Without doubt . Where is [[your]3386-you wife]3387-your wife , [Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde ? ” “[248-charles evrémonde] In [England]1-england . ” “[248-charles evrémonde] Without doubt . [You]3386-you are consigned , Evrémonde , to [the prison of La Force]3388-the prison of la force . ” “[3386-you] Just Heaven ! ” exclaimed [Darnay]162-darnay . “[3386-you] Under what law , and for what offence ? ” [The officer]6582-the officer looked up from [his]6582-the officer slip of paper for a moment . “[3389-we] [We]3389-we have new laws , Evrémonde , and new offences , since [you]3386-you were [here]4902-here . ” [He]0-i said it with a hard smile , and went on writing . “[0-i] [I]0-i entreat [you]3386-you to observe that [I]0-i have come [here]4902-here voluntarily , in response to that written appeal of [a fellow - countryman which lies before [you]3386-you]3392-a fellow - countryman which lies before you . [I]0-i demand no more than the opportunity to do so without delay . Is not that [my]0-i right ? ” “[3376-emigrants] [Emigrants]3376-emigrants have no rights , [Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde , ” was the stolid reply . [The officer]6582-the officer wrote until [he]6582-the officer had finished , read over to [himself]6582-the officer what [he]6582-the officer had written , sanded it , and handed it to [Defarge]247-defarge , with the words “[248-charles evrémonde] In secret . ” [Defarge]247-defarge motioned with the paper to [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner that [he]247-defarge must accompany [him]247-defarge . [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner obeyed , and [a guard of two armed patriots]6586-a guard of two armed patriots attended [them]6587-them . “[248-charles evrémonde] Is it [you]3386-you , ” said [Defarge]247-defarge , in a low voice , as [they]6587-them went down [the guardhouse steps]6588-the guardhouse steps and turned into [Paris]7-paris , “[3386-you] who married [the daughter of [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette]3394-the daughter of doctor manette , once [a prisoner in [the Bastille]2914-the bastille]3395-a prisoner in the bastille that is no more ? ” “[170-doctor manette] Yes , ” replied [Darnay]162-darnay , looking at [him]3386-you with surprise . “[170-doctor manette] [My]0-i name is [Defarge]247-defarge , and [I]0-i keep [a wine - shop in [the Quarter Saint Antoine]3398-the quarter saint antoine]3397-a wine - shop in the quarter saint antoine . Possibly [you]3386-you have heard of [me]0-i . ” “[3386-you] [[My]0-i wife]5044-my wife came to [[your]3386-you house]3400-your house to reclaim [[her]5044-my wife father]5008-her father ? Yes ! ” The word “[6006-wife] [wife]6006-wife ” seemed to serve as a gloomy reminder to [Defarge]247-defarge , to say with sudden impatience , “[3386-you] In the name of [that sharp female newly - born]3403-that sharp female newly - born , and called [La Guillotine]249-la guillotine , why did [you]3386-you come to [France]2-france ? ” “[0-i] [You]3386-you heard [me]0-i say why , a minute ago . Do [you]3386-you not believe it is the truth ? ” “[3386-you] A bad truth for [you]3386-you , ” said [Defarge]247-defarge , speaking with knitted brows , and looking straight before [him]3386-you . “[3386-you] Indeed [I]0-i am lost [here]4902-here . All here is so unprecedented , so changed , so sudden and unfair , that [I]0-i am absolutely lost . Will [you]3386-you render [me]0-i a little help ? ” “[3386-you] [None]5570-none . ” [Defarge]247-defarge spoke , always looking straight before [him]3386-you . “[3386-you] Will [you]3386-you answer [me]0-i a single question ? ” “[3386-you] Perhaps . According to its nature . [You]3386-you can say what it is . ” “[3386-you] In [this prison]3406-this prison that [I]0-i am going to so unjustly , shall [I]0-i have some free communication with [the world outside]3407-the world outside ? ” “[3386-you] [You]3386-you will see . ” “[3386-you] [I]0-i am not to be buried there , prejudged , and without any means of presenting [my]0-i case ? ” “[3386-you] [You]3386-you will see . But , what then ? [Other people]586-other people have been similarly buried in [worse prisons]3409-worse prisons , before now . ” “[586-other people] But never by [me]0-i , [Citizen Defarge]247-defarge . ” [Defarge]247-defarge glanced darkly at [him]0-i for answer , and walked on in a steady and set silence . The deeper [he]247-defarge sank into this silence , the fainter hope there was -- or so [Darnay]162-darnay thought -- of [his]247-defarge softening in any slight degree . [He]0-i , therefore , made haste to say : “[586-other people] It is of the utmost importance to [me]0-i ( [you]3386-you know , [Citizen]3357-citizen , even better than [I]0-i , of how much importance ) , that [I]0-i should be able to communicate to [[Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry of [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s Bank]19-tellson ’s bank]3411-mr. lorry of tellson ’s bank , [an English gentleman who is now in [Paris]7-paris]3412-an english gentleman who is now in paris , the simple fact , without comment , that [I]0-i have been thrown into [the prison of La Force]3388-the prison of la force . Will [you]3386-you cause that to be done for [me]0-i ? ” “[3386-you] [I]0-i will do , ” [Defarge]247-defarge doggedly rejoined , “[3386-you] nothing for [you]3386-you . [My]0-i duty is to [[my]0-i country]3414-my country and [the People]717-the people . [I]0-i am [the sworn servant of [both]5188-both]3416-the sworn servant of both , against [you]3386-you . [I]0-i will do nothing for [you]3386-you . ” [Charles Darnay]162-darnay felt it hopeless to entreat [him]247-defarge further , and [his]162-darnay pride was touched besides . As [they]6589-they walked on in silence , [he]162-darnay could not but see how used [the people]717-the people were to the spectacle of [prisoners]5390-prisoners passing along [the streets]732-the streets . [The very children]6593-the very children scarcely noticed [him]162-darnay . [A few passers]6594-a few passers turned [their]6594-a few passers heads , and a few shook [their]6594-a few passers fingers at [him]162-darnay as [an aristocrat]2572-an aristocrat ; otherwise , that [a man in good clothes]6596-a man in good clothes should be going to [prison]5014-prison , was no more remarkable than that [a labourer in working clothes]6598-a labourer in working clothes should be going to work . In [one narrow , dark , and dirty street through which [they]6589-they passed]6599-one narrow , dark , and dirty street through which they passed , [an excited orator , mounted on a stool]6600-an excited orator , mounted on a stool , was addressing [an excited audience]6601-an excited audience on the crimes against [the people]717-the people , of [the king]4850-the king and [the royal family]6604-the royal family . The few words that [he]162-darnay caught from [this man]5081-this man ’s lips , first made it known to [Charles Darnay]162-darnay that [the king]4850-the king was in [prison]5014-prison , and that [the foreign ambassadors]6608-the foreign ambassadors had one and all left [Paris]7-paris . On [the road]377-the road ( except at [Beauvais]25-beauvais ) [he]162-darnay had heard absolutely nothing . [The escort]3358-the escort and the universal watchfulness had completely isolated [him]162-darnay . That [he]162-darnay had fallen among far greater dangers than those which had developed [themselves]6589-they when [he]162-darnay left [England]1-england , [he]162-darnay of course knew now . That perils had thickened about [him]162-darnay fast , and might thicken faster and faster yet , [he]162-darnay of course knew now . [He]162-darnay could not but admit to [himself]162-darnay that [he]162-darnay might not have made this journey , if [he]162-darnay could have foreseen the events of a few days . And yet [his]162-darnay misgivings were not so dark as , imagined by the light of this later time , they would appear . Troubled as the future was , it was [the unknown future]6611-the unknown future , and in [its]6611-the unknown future obscurity there was ignorant hope . The horrible massacre , days and nights long , which , within a few rounds of the clock , was to set a great mark of blood upon the blessed garnering time of harvest , was as far out of [his]162-darnay knowledge as if it had been a hundred thousand years away . The “[0-i] sharp female newly - born , and called [La Guillotine]249-la guillotine , ” was hardly known to [him]162-darnay , or to the generality of [people]360-people , by name . The frightful deeds that were to be soon done , were probably unimagined at that time in the brains of [the doers]6613-the doers . How could [they]6613-the doers have a place in the shadowy conceptions of a gentle mind ? Of unjust treatment in detention and hardship , and in cruel separation from [[his]162-darnay wife]4987-his wife and [child]5132-child , [he]162-darnay foreshadowed the likelihood , or the certainty ; but , beyond this , [he]162-darnay dreaded nothing distinctly . With this on [his]162-darnay mind , which was enough to carry into [a dreary prison courtyard]6616-a dreary prison courtyard , [he]162-darnay arrived at [the prison of [La Force]99-la force]3388-the prison of la force . [A man with a bloated face]6618-a man with a bloated face opened the strong wicket , to whom [Defarge]247-defarge presented “[249-la guillotine] [The Emigrant Evrémonde]3384-the emigrant evrémonde . ” “[5059-the devil] What [the Devil]5059-the devil ! How many more of [them]3384-the emigrant evrémonde ! ” exclaimed [the man with the bloated face]6619-the man with the bloated face . [Defarge]247-defarge took [his]162-darnay receipt without noticing the exclamation , and withdrew , with [[his]162-darnay two fellow - patriots]6620-his two fellow - patriots . “[5059-the devil] What [the Devil]5059-the devil , [I]0-i say again ! ” exclaimed [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler , left with [[his]5087-the gaoler wife]4987-his wife . “[0-i] How many more ! ” [[The gaoler]5087-the gaoler ’s wife]6624-the gaoler ’s wife , being provided with no answer to the question , merely replied , “[0-i] [One]4965-one must have patience , [[my]0-i dear]5097-my dear ! ” [Three turnkeys who entered responsive to a bell]6625-three turnkeys who entered responsive to a bell [she]6624-the gaoler ’s wife rang , echoed the sentiment , and [one]4965-one added , “[4965-one] For the love of [Liberty]108-liberty ; ” which sounded in [that place]6627-that place like an inappropriate conclusion . [The prison of [La Force]99-la force]3388-the prison of la force was [a gloomy prison]6629-a gloomy prison , dark and filthy , and with a horrible smell of foul sleep in it . Extraordinary how soon the noisome flavour of imprisoned sleep , becomes manifest in all such places that are ill cared for ! “[4965-one] In secret , too , ” grumbled [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler , looking at the written paper . “[4965-one] As if [I]0-i was not already full to bursting ! ” [He]5087-the gaoler stuck the paper on a file , in an ill - humour , and [Charles Darnay]162-darnay awaited [his]162-darnay further pleasure for half an hour : sometimes , pacing to and fro in [the strong arched room]6631-the strong arched room : sometimes , resting on a stone seat : in either case detained to be imprinted on the memory of [the chief]6632-the chief and [[his]6632-the chief subordinates]6633-his subordinates . “[4965-one] Come ! ” said [the chief]6632-the chief , at length taking up [his]6632-the chief keys , “[4965-one] come with [me]0-i , [emigrant]3355-emigrant . ” Through [the dismal prison]6635-the dismal prison twilight , [his]6632-the chief new charge accompanied [him]6632-the chief by [corridor]6636-corridor and staircase , many doors clanging and locking behind [them]6637-they , until [they]6637-they came into [a large , low , vaulted chamber , crowded with [prisoners of both sexes]6639-prisoners of both sexes]6638-a large , low , vaulted chamber , crowded with prisoners of both sexes . [The women]2092-the women were seated at a long table , reading and writing , knitting , sewing , and embroidering ; [the men]1834-the men were for the most part standing behind [their]1834-the men chairs , or lingering up and down [the room]565-the room . In the instinctive association of [prisoners]5390-prisoners with shameful crime and disgrace , [the new - comer]6046-the new - comer recoiled from [this company]6645-this company . But the crowning unreality of [his]6632-the chief long unreal ride , was , [their]6637-they all at once rising to receive [him]6632-the chief , with every refinement of manner known to the time , and with all the engaging graces and courtesies of life . So strangely clouded were these refinements by the prison manners and gloom , so spectral did they become in the inappropriate squalor and misery through which [they]6637-they were seen , that [Charles Darnay]162-darnay seemed to stand in [a company of the dead]6646-a company of the dead . [Ghosts all]6647-ghosts all ! [The ghost of beauty]6648-the ghost of beauty , the ghost of stateliness , the ghost of elegance , the ghost of pride , the ghost of frivolity , [the ghost of wit]6649-the ghost of wit , [the ghost of youth]6650-the ghost of youth , [the ghost of age]6651-the ghost of age , all waiting [their]6637-they dismissal from [the desolate shore]6652-the desolate shore , all turning on [him]6632-the chief eyes that were changed by the death [they]6637-they had died in coming [there]4887-there . It struck [him]6632-the chief motionless . [The gaoler]5087-the gaoler standing at [his]6632-the chief side , and [the other gaolers moving about , who would have been well enough as to appearance in the ordinary exercise of]6655-the other gaolers moving about , who would have been well enough as to appearance in the ordinary exercise of [their]6655-the other gaolers moving about , who would have been well enough as to appearance in the ordinary exercise of functions , looked so extravagantly coarse contrasted with [sorrowing mothers]6656-sorrowing mothers and [blooming daughters who were there]6657-blooming daughters who were there -- with the apparitions of [the coquette]6658-the coquette , [the young beauty]6659-the young beauty , and [the mature woman delicately bred]6660-the mature woman delicately bred -- that the inversion of all experience and likelihood which the scene of shadows presented , was heightened to its utmost . Surely , ghosts all . Surely , the long unreal ride some progress of disease that had brought [him]6632-the chief to these gloomy shades ! “[0-i] In the name of [the assembled companions]3424-the assembled companions in misfortune , ” said [a gentleman of courtly appearance and address]6661-a gentleman of courtly appearance and address , coming forward , “[0-i] [I]0-i have the honour of giving [you]3425-you welcome to [La Force]99-la force , and of condoling with [you]3425-you on the calamity that has brought [you]3425-you among [us]3426-us . May it soon terminate happily ! It would be an impertinence elsewhere , but it is not so here , to ask [your]3425-you name and condition ? ” [Charles Darnay]162-darnay roused [himself]162-darnay , and gave the required information , in words as suitable as [he]162-darnay could find . “[0-i] But [I]0-i hope , ” said [the gentleman]4926-the gentleman , following [the chief gaoler]6663-the chief gaoler with [his]0-i eyes , who moved across [the room]565-the room , “[0-i] that [you]3425-you are not in secret ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not understand the meaning of the term , but [I]0-i have heard [them]3427-them say so . ” “[3427-them] Ah , what a pity ! [We]3426-us so much regret it ! But take courage ; [several members of [our]3426-us society]3428-several members of our society have been in secret , at first , and it has lasted but a short time . ” Then [he]0-i added , raising [his]0-i voice , “[0-i] [I]0-i grieve to inform [the society]3429-the society -- in secret . ” There was a murmur of commiseration as [Charles Darnay]162-darnay crossed [the room]565-the room to a grated door where [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler awaited [him]162-darnay , and many voices -- among which , the soft and compassionate voices of [women]671-women were conspicuous -- gave [him]162-darnay good wishes and encouragement . [He]162-darnay turned at the grated door , to render the thanks of [his]162-darnay heart ; it closed under [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler ’s hand ; and the apparitions vanished from [his]162-darnay sight forever . [The wicket]6669-the wicket opened on a stone staircase , leading upward . When [they]6670-they had ascended forty steps ( [the prisoner of half an hour already counted them]6671-the prisoner of half an hour already counted them ) , [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler opened a low black door , and [they]6670-they passed into [a solitary cell]6673-a solitary cell . It struck cold and damp , but was not dark . “[3430-you] [Yours]3430-you , ” said [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler . “[3430-you] Why am [I]0-i confined alone ? ” “[3430-you] How do [I]0-i know ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can buy pen , ink , and paper ? ” “[0-i] Such are not [my]0-i orders . [You]3430-you will be visited , and can ask then . At present , [you]3430-you may buy [your]3430-you food , and nothing more . ” There were in [the cell]6290-the cell , a chair , a table , and a straw mattress . As [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler made a general inspection of these objects , and of the four walls , before going out , a wandering fancy wandered through the mind of [the prisoner leaning against the wall opposite to [him]5087-the gaoler]6677-the prisoner leaning against the wall opposite to him , that [this gaoler]6678-this gaoler was so unwholesomely bloated , both in face and person , as to look like [a man who had been drowned and filled with water]6679-a man who had been drowned and filled with water . When [the gaoler]5087-the gaoler was gone , [he]0-i thought in the same wandering way , “[3430-you] Now am [I]0-i left , as if [I]0-i were dead . ” Stopping then , to look down at the mattress , [he]0-i turned from it with a sick feeling , and thought , “[0-i] And here in [these crawling creatures]3431-these crawling creatures is the first condition of the body after death . ” “[0-i] Five paces by four and a half , five paces by four and a half , five paces by four and a half . ” [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner walked to and fro in [[his]5091-the prisoner cell]6682-his cell , counting its measurement , and the roar of [the city]1496-the city arose like muffled drums with a wild swell of voices added to [them]3431-these crawling creatures . “[0-i] [He]0-i made shoes , [he]0-i made shoes , [he]0-i made shoes . ” [The prisoner]5091-the prisoner counted the measurement again , and paced faster , to draw [his]5091-the prisoner mind with [him]5091-the prisoner from that latter repetition . “[0-i] The ghosts that vanished when the wicket closed . There was one among [them]3431-these crawling creatures , the appearance of [a lady dressed in black , who was leaning in the embrasure of a window]3432-a lady dressed in black , who was leaning in the embrasure of a window , and [she]3432-a lady dressed in black , who was leaning in the embrasure of a window had a light shining upon [her]3432-a lady dressed in black , who was leaning in the embrasure of a window golden hair , and [she]3432-a lady dressed in black , who was leaning in the embrasure of a window looked like * * * * Let [us]3433-us ride on again , for God ’s sake , through [the illuminated villages]3434-the illuminated villages with [the people]717-the people all awake ! * * * * [He]0-i made shoes , [he]0-i made shoes , [he]0-i made shoes . * * * * Five paces by four and a half . ” With such scraps tossing and rolling upward from the depths of [his]5091-the prisoner mind , [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner walked faster and faster , obstinately counting and counting ; and the roar of [the city]1496-the city changed to this extent -- that it still rolled in like muffled drums , but with the wail of voices that [he]5091-the prisoner knew , in the swell that rose above [them]717-the people . CHAPTER II . [The Grindstone Tellson ’s Bank]6687-the grindstone tellson ’s bank , established in [the Saint Germain Quarter of [Paris]7-paris]101-the saint germain quarter of paris , was in a wing of [a large house]6688-a large house , approached by [a courtyard]1547-a courtyard and shut off from [the street]662-the street by a high wall and a strong gate . [The house]951-the house belonged to [a great nobleman who had lived in [it]951-the house until [he]6692-a great nobleman who had lived in it until he made a flight from the troubles made a flight from the troubles]6692-a great nobleman who had lived in it until he made a flight from the troubles , in [[his]6692-a great nobleman who had lived in it until he made a flight from the troubles own cook]6693-his own cook ’s dress , and got across the borders . [A mere beast of the chase flying from hunters]6694-a mere beast of the chase flying from hunters , [he]6692-a great nobleman who had lived in it until he made a flight from the troubles was still in [his]6692-a great nobleman who had lived in it until he made a flight from the troubles metempsychosis no other than the same Monseigneur , the preparation of whose chocolate for whose lips had once occupied [three strong men besides [the cook in question]6696-the cook in question]6695-three strong men besides the cook in question . [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur gone , and [the three strong men]6697-the three strong men absolving [themselves]6697-the three strong men from the sin of having drawn [his]188-monseigneur high wages , by being more than ready and willing to cut [his]188-monseigneur throat on the altar of the dawning Republic one and indivisible of Liberty , Equality , Fraternity , or Death , [[Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ’s house]6698-monseigneur ’s house had been first sequestrated , and then confiscated . For , all things moved so fast , and decree followed [decree]6699-decree with that fierce precipitation , that now upon the third night of the autumn month of September , [patriot emissaries of the law]6700-patriot emissaries of the law were in possession of [[Monseigneur]188-monseigneur ’s house]6698-monseigneur ’s house , and had marked [it]951-the house with the tri - colour , and were drinking brandy in [[its]951-the house state apartments]6702-its state apartments . [A place of business in [London]3-london like [Tellson]134-tellson ’s place of business in [Paris]7-paris]6703-a place of business in london like tellson ’s place of business in paris , would soon have driven [the House]951-the house out of [its]951-the house mind and into [the Gazette]102-the gazette . For , what would staid British responsibility and respectability have said to orange - trees in boxes in [a Bank courtyard]6705-a bank courtyard , and even to a Cupid over the counter ? Yet such things were . [Tellson]134-tellson ’s had whitewashed the Cupid , but [he]134-tellson was still to be seen on the ceiling , in the coolest linen , aiming ( as [he]134-tellson very often does ) at money from morning to night . [Bankruptcy]251-bankruptcy must inevitably have come of [this young Pagan]6706-this young pagan , in [Lombard - street]103-lombard - street , [London]3-london , and also of [a curtained alcove in the rear of [the immortal boy]6708-the immortal boy]6707-a curtained alcove in the rear of the immortal boy , and also of a looking - glass let into the wall , and also of [clerks not at all old , who danced in public on the slightest provocation]6709-clerks not at all old , who danced in public on the slightest provocation . Yet , [a French Tellson ’s]6710-a french tellson ’s could get on with these things exceedingly well , and , as long as the times held together , [no man]1866-no man had taken fright at them , and drawn out [his]1866-no man money . What money would be drawn out of [Tellson]134-tellson ’s henceforth , and what would lie there , lost and forgotten ; what plate and jewels would tarnish in [[Tellson]134-tellson ’s hiding - places]6712-tellson ’s hiding - places , while [the depositors]6713-the depositors rusted in [prisons]6714-prisons , and when [they]6713-the depositors should have violently perished ; how many accounts with [Tellson]134-tellson ’s never to be balanced in [this world]976-this world , must be carried over into the next ; [no man]1866-no man could have said , that night , any more than [Mr. Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry could , though [he]133-mr. lorry thought heavily of these questions . [He]133-mr. lorry sat by a newly - lighted wood fire ( the blighted and unfruitful year was prematurely cold ) , and on [his]133-mr. lorry honest and courageous face there was a deeper shade than the pendent lamp could throw , or any object in [the room]565-the room distortedly reflect -- a shade of horror . [He]133-mr. lorry occupied [rooms in [the Bank]531-the bank]6718-rooms in the bank , in [his]133-mr. lorry fidelity to [the House of which [he]133-mr. lorry had grown to be a part]6720-the house of which he had grown to be a part , like strong root - ivy . It chanced that [they]6718-rooms in the bank derived a kind of security from the patriotic occupation of [the main building]6721-the main building , but [the true - hearted old gentleman]6722-the true - hearted old gentleman never calculated about that . All such circumstances were indifferent to [him]133-mr. lorry , so that [he]133-mr. lorry did [his]133-mr. lorry duty . On the opposite side of [the courtyard]915-the courtyard , under a colonnade , was extensive standing -- for [carriages]1814-carriages -- where , indeed , [some carriages of Monseigneur yet stood]6725-some carriages of monseigneur yet stood . Against two of the pillars were fastened two great flaring flambeaux , and in the light of these , standing out in the open air , was a large grindstone : a roughly mounted thing which appeared to have hurriedly been brought [there]4887-there from [some neighbouring smithy]6727-some neighbouring smithy , or [other workshop]6728-other workshop . Rising and looking out of window at these harmless objects , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry shivered , and retired to [his]133-mr. lorry seat by the fire . [He]133-mr. lorry had opened , not only the glass window , but the lattice blind outside [it]4887-there , and [he]133-mr. lorry had closed both again , and [he]133-mr. lorry shivered through [his]133-mr. lorry frame . From [the streets]732-the streets beyond the high wall and the strong gate , there came the usual night hum of [the city]1496-the city , with now and then an indescribable ring in it , weird and unearthly , as if some unwonted sounds of a terrible nature were going up to [Heaven]298-heaven . “[0-i] Thank [God]149-god , ” said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , clasping [his]133-mr. lorry hands , “[149-god] that [no one]330-no one near and dear to [me]0-i is in [this dreadful town]3437-this dreadful town to - night . May [He]3438-he have mercy on [all who are in danger]3439-all who are in danger ! ” Soon afterwards , the bell at the great gate sounded , and [he]133-mr. lorry thought , “[3438-he] [They]3440-they have come back ! ” and sat listening . But , there was no loud irruption into [the courtyard]915-the courtyard , as [he]133-mr. lorry had expected , and [he]133-mr. lorry heard the gate clash again , and all was quiet . The nervousness and dread that were upon [him]133-mr. lorry inspired that vague uneasiness respecting [the Bank]531-the bank , which a great change would naturally awaken , with such feelings roused . [It]531-the bank was well guarded , and [he]133-mr. lorry got up to go among [the trusty people who were watching it]6734-the trusty people who were watching it , when [his]133-mr. lorry door suddenly opened , and two figures rushed in , at sight of which [he]133-mr. lorry fell back in amazement . [Lucie]174-lucie and [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father ! [Lucie]174-lucie with [her]174-lucie arms stretched out to [him]133-mr. lorry , and with that old look of earnestness so concentrated and intensified , that it seemed as though it had been stamped upon [her]174-lucie face expressly to give force and power to it in this one passage of [her]174-lucie life . “[3438-he] What is this ? ” cried [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , breathless and confused . “[3438-he] What is the matter ? What is it ? ” With the look fixed upon [him]133-mr. lorry , in [her]174-lucie paleness and wildness , [she]174-lucie panted out in [his]133-mr. lorry arms , imploringly , “[0-i] O [[my]0-i dear friend]2725-my dear friend ! [[My]0-i husband]5455-my husband ! ” “[5131-your husband] [[Your]174-lucie husband]5131-your husband , [Lucie]174-lucie ? ” “[162-darnay] [Charles]162-darnay . ” “[162-darnay] What of [Charles]162-darnay ? ” “[162-darnay] Here . “ Here , in [Paris]7-paris ? ”[162-darnay] “ Has been [here]4902-here some days -- three or four -- [I]3445-the old man do n’t know how many -- [I]3445-the old man ca n’t collect [my]3445-the old man thoughts . An errand of generosity brought [him]162-darnay here unknown to [us]6737-us ; [he]162-darnay was stopped at the barrier , and sent to [prison]5014-prison . ”[3445-the old man] [The old man]3445-the old man uttered an irrepressible cry . Almost at the same moment , the bell of the great gate rang again , and a loud noise of feet and voices came pouring into [the courtyard]915-the courtyard . “ What is that noise ? ”[1514-the doctor] said [the Doctor]1514-the doctor , turning towards the window . “ Do n’t look ! ”[133-mr. lorry] cried [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ Do n’t look out ! [Manette]170-doctor manette , for [your]170-doctor manette life , do n’t touch the blind ! ”[133-mr. lorry] [The Doctor]1514-the doctor turned , with [his]1514-the doctor hand upon the fastening of the window , and said , with a cool , bold smile : “ [[My]3449-i dear friend]2725-my dear friend , [I]3449-i have a charmed life in [this city]497-this city . [I]3449-i have been [a Bastille prisoner]6741-a bastille prisoner . There is [no patriot]6742-no patriot in [Paris]7-paris -- in [Paris]7-paris ? In [France]2-france -- who , knowing [me]3449-i to have been [a prisoner in [the Bastille]86-the bastille]3395-a prisoner in the bastille , would touch [me]3449-i , except to overwhelm [me]3449-i with embraces , or carry [me]3449-i in triumph . [My]3449-i old pain has given [me]3449-i a power that has brought [us]6744-us through the barrier , and gained [us]6744-us news of [Charles]162-darnay [there]4887-there , and brought [us]6744-us [here]4902-here . Looked out upon a throng of [men]568-men and [women]671-women : not enough in number , or near enough , to fill [the courtyard]915-the courtyard : not more than forty or fifty in all . [The people in possession of [the house]951-the house]3460-the people in possession of the house had let [them]3460-the people in possession of the house in at the gate , and [they]3460-the people in possession of the house had rushed in to work at [the grindstone]3462-the grindstone ; it had evidently been set up there for [their]3460-the people in possession of the house purpose , as in [a convenient and retired spot]3463-a convenient and retired spot . But , [such awful workers]3464-such awful workers , and such awful work ! [The grindstone]3462-the grindstone had a double handle , and , turning at it madly were [two men , whose faces , as [their]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise [long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone]3467-long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought [their]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of [the wildest savages]3468-the wildest savages in [their]3468-the wildest savages most barbarous disguise]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise . The eye could not detect one creature in [the group]1401-the group free from the smear of blood . Shouldering [one another to get next at the sharpening - stone]3472-one another to get next at the sharpening - stone , were [men stripped to the waist]3473-men stripped to the waist , with the stain all over [their]3473-men stripped to the waist limbs and bodies ; [men in all sorts of rags]3474-men in all sorts of rags , with the stain upon those rags ; [men]568-men devilishly set off with spoils of [women]671-women ’s lace and silk and ribbon , with the stain dyeing those trifles through and through . Hatchets , knives , bayonets , swords , all brought to be sharpened , were all red with it . Some of the hacked swords were tied to the wrists of [those who carried them]3477-those who carried them , with strips of linen and fragments of dress : ligatures various in kind , but all deep of the one colour . And as [the frantic wielders of these weapons]3478-the frantic wielders of these weapons snatched [them]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise from the stream of sparks and tore away into [the streets]732-the streets , the same red hue was red in [their]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise frenzied eyes;--eyes which [any unbrutalised beholder]3480-any unbrutalised beholder would have given twenty years of life , to petrify with a well - directed gun . All this was seen in a moment , as the vision of [a drowning man]3481-a drowning man , or of [any human creature at any very great pass]3482-any human creature at any very great pass , could see [a world]3483-a world if it were there . [They]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise drew back from the window , and [the Doctor]1514-the doctor looked for explanation in [[his]1514-the doctor friend]1325-his friend ’s ashy face . “ [They]3466-two men , whose faces , as their long hair flapped back when the whirlings of the grindstone brought their faces up , were more horrible and cruel than the visages of the wildest savages in their most barbarous disguise are , ”[1514-the doctor] [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry whispered the words , glancing fearfully round at [the locked room]3486-the locked room , “ murdering [the prisoners]1059-the prisoners . If [you]1325-his friend are sure of what [you]1325-his friend say ; if [you]1325-his friend really have the power [you]1325-his friend think [you]1325-his friend have -- as [I]133-mr. lorry believe [you]1325-his friend have -- make [yourself]1325-his friend known to [these devils]6759-these devils , and get taken to [La Force]99-la force . It may be too late , [I]133-mr. lorry do n’t know , but let it not be a minute later ! ”[133-mr. lorry] [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette pressed [his]170-doctor manette hand , hastened bareheaded out of [the room]565-the room , and was in [the courtyard]915-the courtyard when [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry regained the blind . [His]133-mr. lorry streaming white hair , [his]133-mr. lorry remarkable face , and the impetuous confidence of [his]133-mr. lorry manner , as [he]133-mr. lorry put the weapons aside like water , carried [him]133-mr. lorry in an instant to the heart of [the concourse]3489-the concourse at the stone . For a few moments there was a pause , and a hurry , and a murmur , and the unintelligible sound of [his]133-mr. lorry voice ; and then [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry saw [him]133-mr. lorry , surrounded by all , and in the midst of a line of twenty men long , all linked shoulder to shoulder , and hand to shoulder , hurried out with cries of--“Live [the Bastille prisoner]6760-the bastille prisoner ! Help for [the Bastille prisoner]6760-the bastille prisoner ’s kindred in [La Force]99-la force ! Room for [the Bastille prisoner in front there]6762-the bastille prisoner in front there ! Save [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner Evrémonde at [La Force]99-la force ! ”[133-mr. lorry] and a thousand answering shouts . [He]133-mr. lorry closed the lattice again with a fluttering heart , closed the window and the curtain , hastened to [Lucie]174-lucie , and told [her]174-lucie that [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father was assisted by [the people]717-the people , and gone in search of [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband . [He]133-mr. lorry found [[her]174-lucie child]689-her child and [Miss Pross]183-miss pross with [her]174-lucie ; but , it never occurred to [him]133-mr. lorry to be surprised by [their]3494-their appearance until a long time afterwards , when [he]133-mr. lorry sat watching [them]3494-their in such quiet as the night knew . [Lucie]174-lucie had , by that time , fallen into a stupor on the floor at [his]133-mr. lorry feet , clinging to [his]133-mr. lorry hand . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross had laid [the child]3495-the child down on [his]133-mr. lorry own bed , and [her]3495-the child head had gradually fallen on the pillow beside [her]3495-the child pretty charge . O the long , long night , with the moans of [the poor wife]3496-the poor wife ! And O the long , long night , with no return of [[her]3495-the child father]5008-her father and no tidings ! Twice more in the darkness the bell at the great gate sounded , and the irruption was repeated , and the grindstone whirled and spluttered . “ What is it ? ”[174-lucie] cried [Lucie]174-lucie , affrighted . “ Hush ! [The soldiers]2418-the soldiers ’ swords are sharpened [there]4887-there , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ [The place]791-the place is [national property]6767-national property now , and used as [a kind of armoury]6768-a kind of armoury , [[my]133-mr. lorry love]494-my love . ”[133-mr. lorry] Twice more in all ; but , the last spell of work was feeble and fitful . Soon afterwards the day began to dawn , and [he]133-mr. lorry softly detached [himself]133-mr. lorry from the clasping hand , and cautiously looked out again . A man , so besmeared that [he]133-mr. lorry might have been [a sorely wounded soldier creeping back to consciousness on a field of slain]3498-a sorely wounded soldier creeping back to consciousness on a field of slain , was rising from the pavement by the side of the grindstone , and looking about [him]133-mr. lorry with a vacant air . Shortly , [this worn - out murderer]3499-this worn - out murderer descried in the imperfect light one of [the carriages of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]3500-the carriages of monseigneur , and , staggering to [that gorgeous vehicle]3501-that gorgeous vehicle , climbed in at the door , and shut [himself]133-mr. lorry up to take [his]133-mr. lorry rest on its dainty cushions . The great grindstone , [Earth]252-earth , had turned when [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry looked out again , and the sun was red on [the courtyard]915-the courtyard . But , the lesser grindstone stood alone there in the calm morning air , with a red upon it that the sun had never given , and would never take away . CHAPTER III . The Shadow One of the first considerations which arose in the business mind of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry when business hours came round , was this:--that [he]133-mr. lorry had no right to imperil [Tellson]134-tellson ’s by sheltering [the wife of [an emigrant prisoner under the Bank roof]3504-an emigrant prisoner under the bank roof]3503-the wife of an emigrant prisoner under the bank roof . [His]133-mr. lorry own possessions , safety , life , [he]133-mr. lorry would have hazarded for [Lucie]174-lucie and [[her]174-lucie child]689-her child , without a moment ’s demur ; but the great trust [he]133-mr. lorry held was not [his]133-mr. lorry own , and as to that business charge [he]133-mr. lorry was [a strict man of business]3506-a strict man of business .
