At first , [his]133-mr. lorry mind reverted to [Defarge]247-defarge , and [he]133-mr. lorry thought of finding out [the wine - shop]661-the wine - shop again and taking counsel with [its master]3508-its master in reference to [the safest dwelling - place in]3509-the safest dwelling - place in [the distracted state of [the city]1496-the city]3510-the distracted state of the city . But , the same consideration that suggested [him]133-mr. lorry , repudiated [him]133-mr. lorry ; [he]133-mr. lorry lived in [the most violent Quarter]3512-the most violent quarter , and doubtless was influential [there]4887-there , and deep in [its]4887-there dangerous workings . [Noon]253-noon coming , and [the Doctor]1514-the doctor not returning , and every minute ’s delay tending to compromise [Tellson]134-tellson ’s , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry advised with [Lucie]174-lucie . [She]174-lucie said that [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father had spoken of hiring [a lodging]3516-a lodging for a short term , in [that Quarter]875-that quarter , near [the Banking - house]3518-the banking - house . As there was no business objection to this , and as [he]133-mr. lorry foresaw that even if it were all well with [Charles]162-darnay , and [he]133-mr. lorry were to be released , [he]133-mr. lorry could not hope to leave [the city]1496-the city , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry went out in quest of such [a lodging]3516-a lodging , and found [a suitable one]3521-a suitable one , high up in [a removed by - street where the closed blinds in all the other windows of [a high melancholy square of buildings marked [deserted homes]3524-deserted homes]3523-a high melancholy square of buildings marked deserted homes]3522-a removed by - street where the closed blinds in all the other windows of a high melancholy square of buildings marked deserted homes . To [this lodging]3525-this lodging [he]133-mr. lorry at once removed [Lucie]174-lucie and [[her]174-lucie child]689-her child , and [Miss Pross]183-miss pross : giving [them]3527-them what comfort [he]133-mr. lorry could , and much more than [he]133-mr. lorry had [himself]133-mr. lorry . [He]133-mr. lorry left [Jerry]133-mr. lorry with [them]3527-them , as [a figure to fill a doorway that would bear considerable knocking on the head]3528-a figure to fill a doorway that would bear considerable knocking on the head , and returned to [his]133-mr. lorry own occupations . A disturbed and doleful mind [he]133-mr. lorry brought to bear upon [them]3527-them , and slowly and heavily the day lagged on with [him]133-mr. lorry . It wore itself out , and wore [him]133-mr. lorry out with it , until [the Bank]531-the bank closed . [He]133-mr. lorry was again alone in [[his]133-mr. lorry room]5378-his room of the previous night , considering what to do next , when [he]133-mr. lorry heard a foot upon the stair . In a few moments , [a man]449-a man stood in [his]133-mr. lorry presence , who , with a keenly observant look at [him]133-mr. lorry , addressed [him]133-mr. lorry by [his]133-mr. lorry name . “ [[Your]449-a man servant]6770-your servant , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry . “ Do [you]449-a man know [me]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] [He]133-mr. lorry was [a strongly made man with dark curling hair , from forty - five to fifty years of age]3532-a strongly made man with dark curling hair , from forty - five to fifty years of age . For answer [he]133-mr. lorry repeated , without any change of emphasis , the words : “ Do [you]449-a man know [me]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry have seen [you]449-a man somewhere . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Perhaps at [[my]133-mr. lorry wine - shop]6771-my wine - shop ? ”[133-mr. lorry] Much interested and agitated , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry said : “ [You]449-a man come from [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Yes . [I]133-mr. lorry come from [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ And what says [he]170-doctor manette ? What does [he]170-doctor manette send [me]133-mr. lorry ? ”[133-mr. lorry] [Defarge]247-defarge gave into [his]247-defarge anxious hand , an open scrap of paper . It bore the words in [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s writing : “ [Charles]162-darnay is safe , but [I]1514-the doctor can not safely leave [this place]6772-this place yet . [I]1514-the doctor have obtained the favour that [the bearer]6773-the bearer has a short note from [Charles]162-darnay to [[his]162-darnay wife]4987-his wife . Let [the bearer]6773-the bearer see [[his]162-darnay wife]4987-his wife . ”[1514-the doctor] It was dated from [La Force]99-la force , within an hour . “ Will [you]247-defarge accompany [me]133-mr. lorry , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , joyfully relieved after reading this note aloud , “ to where [[his]162-darnay wife]4987-his wife resides ? ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Yes , ”[247-defarge] returned [Defarge]247-defarge . Scarcely noticing as yet , in what a curiously reserved and mechanical way [Defarge]247-defarge spoke , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry put on [his]133-mr. lorry hat and [they]3534-they went down into [the courtyard]915-the courtyard . There , [they]3534-they found [two women]3536-two women ; [one]4965-one , knitting . “ [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , surely ! ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , who had left [her]4965-one in exactly the same attitude some seventeen years ago . “ It is [she]146-madame defarge , ”[770-her husband] observed [[her]4965-one husband]770-her husband . “ Does [Madame]146-madame defarge go with [us]3534-they ? ”[133-mr. lorry] inquired [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , seeing that [she]4965-one moved as [they]3534-they moved . “ Yes . That [she]146-madame defarge may be able to recognise the faces and know [the persons]6778-the persons . It is for [their]6778-the persons safety . ”[133-mr. lorry] Beginning to be struck by [Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s manner , [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry looked dubiously at [him]770-her husband , and led the way . [Both the women]3539-both the women followed ; [the second woman]3540-the second woman being [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance . [They]3534-they passed through [the intervening streets]3542-the intervening streets as quickly as [they]3534-they might , ascended [the staircase of [the new domicile]3544-the new domicile]3543-the staircase of the new domicile , were admitted by [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , and found [Lucie]174-lucie weeping , alone . [She]174-lucie was thrown into [a transport]3545-a transport by the tidings [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry gave [her]174-lucie of [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband , and clasped the hand that delivered [his]770-her husband note -- little thinking what it had been doing near [him]770-her husband in the night , and might , but for a chance , have done to [him]770-her husband . “ DEAREST,--Take courage . [I]146-madame defarge am well , and [[your]174-lucie father]4947-your father has influence around [me]146-madame defarge . [You]174-lucie can not answer this . Kiss [[our]6780-our child]6781-our child for [me]146-madame defarge . ”[146-madame defarge] That was all the writing . It was so much , however , to [her]174-lucie who received it , that [she]174-lucie turned from [Defarge]146-madame defarge to [[his]770-her husband wife]4987-his wife , and kissed one of the hands that knitted . It was a passionate , loving , thankful , womanly action , but the hand made no response -- dropped cold and heavy , and took to its knitting again . There was something in its touch that gave [Lucie]174-lucie a check . [She]174-lucie stopped in the act of putting the note in [her]174-lucie bosom , and , with [her]174-lucie hands yet at [her]174-lucie neck , looked terrified at [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge met the lifted eyebrows and forehead with a cold , impassive stare . “ [[My]133-mr. lorry dear]5097-my dear , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , striking in to explain ; “ there are frequent risings in [the streets]732-the streets ; and , although it is not likely they will ever trouble [you]5097-my dear , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge wishes to see those whom [she]146-madame defarge has the power to protect at such times , to the end that [she]146-madame defarge may know [them]6784-them -- that [she]146-madame defarge may identify [them]6784-them . [I]133-mr. lorry believe , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , rather halting in [his]133-mr. lorry reassuring words , as the stony manner of [all the three]3548-all the three impressed itself upon [him]133-mr. lorry more and more , “ [I]247-defarge state the case , [Citizen Defarge]247-defarge ? ”[247-defarge] [Defarge]247-defarge looked gloomily at [[his]247-defarge wife]4987-his wife , and gave no other answer than a gruff sound of acquiescence . “ [You]5097-my dear had better , [Lucie]174-lucie , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , doing all [he]133-mr. lorry could to propitiate , by tone and manner , “ have [the dear child]6785-the dear child [here]4902-here , and [our]3548-all the three good Pross . [Our]3548-all the three good Pross , [Defarge]247-defarge , is [an English lady]4956-an english lady , and knows no French . ”[133-mr. lorry] [The lady in question]3550-the lady in question , whose rooted conviction that [she]3550-the lady in question was more than a match for [any foreigner]3551-any foreigner , was not to be shaken by distress and , danger , appeared with folded arms , and observed in English to [The Vengeance , whom [her]3550-the lady in question eyes first encountered]236-the vengeance , “ Well , [I]3550-the lady in question am sure , [Boldface]254-boldface ! [I]3550-the lady in question hope _ [you]254-boldface _ are pretty well ! ”[3550-the lady in question] [She]3550-the lady in question also bestowed a British cough on [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ; but , neither of [the two]883-the two took much heed of [her]3550-the lady in question . “ Is that [[his]133-mr. lorry child]5410-his child ? ”[146-madame defarge] said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , stopping in [her]146-madame defarge work for the first time , and pointing [her]146-madame defarge knitting - needle at [little Lucie]174-lucie as if it were the finger of [Fate]255-fate . “ Yes , [madame]5936-madame , ”[133-mr. lorry] answered [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ; “ this is [[our]6790-our poor prisoner ’s darling daughter]6791-our poor prisoner ’s darling daughter , and [only child]6792-only child . ”[133-mr. lorry] [The shadow attendant on [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge and [her]146-madame defarge party]3553-the shadow attendant on madame defarge and her party seemed to fall so threatening and dark on [the child]3495-the child , that [[her]3495-the child mother]5561-her mother instinctively kneeled on the ground beside [her]3495-the child , and held [her]3495-the child to [her]5561-her mother breast . [The shadow attendant on [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge and [her]146-madame defarge party]3553-the shadow attendant on madame defarge and her party seemed then to fall , threatening and dark , on both [the mother]3557-the mother and [the child]3495-the child . “ It is enough , [[my]146-madame defarge husband]5455-my husband , ”[146-madame defarge] said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . “ [I]146-madame defarge have seen [them]6794-them . [We]6795-we may go . ”[146-madame defarge] But , the suppressed manner had enough of menace in it -- not visible and presented , but indistinct and withheld -- to alarm [Lucie]174-lucie into saying , as [she]174-lucie laid [her]174-lucie appealing hand on [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s dress : “ [You]146-madame defarge will be good to [[my]174-lucie poor husband]6796-my poor husband . [You]146-madame defarge will do [him]6796-my poor husband no harm . [You]146-madame defarge will help [me]174-lucie to see [him]6796-my poor husband if [you]146-madame defarge can ? ”[174-lucie] “ [[Your]146-madame defarge husband]5131-your husband is not [my]146-madame defarge business here , ”[146-madame defarge] returned [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , looking down at [her]146-madame defarge with perfect composure . “ It is [the daughter of [[your]146-madame defarge father]4947-your father who is [my]146-madame defarge business here]6798-the daughter of your father who is my business here . ”[146-madame defarge] “ For [my]146-madame defarge sake , then , be merciful to [[my]146-madame defarge husband]5455-my husband . For [[my]146-madame defarge child]2642-my child ’s sake ! [She]2642-my child will put [her]2642-my child hands together and pray [you]146-madame defarge to be merciful . [We]6802-we are more afraid of [you]146-madame defarge than of [these others]6803-these others . ”[146-madame defarge] [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge received it as a compliment , and looked at [[her]146-madame defarge husband]770-her husband . [Defarge]146-madame defarge , who had been uneasily biting [his]770-her husband thumb - nail and looking at [her]146-madame defarge , collected [his]770-her husband face into a sterner expression . “ What is it that [[your]146-madame defarge husband]5131-your husband says in that little letter ? ”[146-madame defarge] asked [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , with a lowering smile . “ Influence ; [he]5131-your husband says something touching influence ? ”[146-madame defarge] “ That [[my]174-lucie father]4969-my father , ”[174-lucie] said [Lucie]174-lucie , hurriedly taking the paper from [her]174-lucie breast , but with [her]174-lucie alarmed eyes on [her]174-lucie questioner and not on it , “ has much influence around [him]5131-your husband . ”[174-lucie] “ Surely it will release [him]5131-your husband ! ”[146-madame defarge] said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . “ Let it do so . ”[146-madame defarge] “ As [a wife]2833-a wife and [mother]5143-mother , ”[174-lucie] cried [Lucie]174-lucie , most earnestly , “ [I]174-lucie implore [you]146-madame defarge to have pity on [me]174-lucie and not to exercise any power that [you]146-madame defarge possess , against [[my]174-lucie innocent husband]6808-my innocent husband , but to use it in [his]5131-your husband behalf . [O sister - woman]6809-o sister - woman , think of [me]174-lucie . As [a wife]2833-a wife and [mother]5143-mother ! ”[174-lucie] [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge looked , coldly as ever , at the suppliant , and said , turning to [[her]146-madame defarge friend]3560-her friend The Vengeance : “ [The wives and [mothers]3091-mothers [we]6814-we have been used to see]6812-the wives and mothers we have been used to see , since [we]6814-we were as little as [this child]6815-this child , and much less , have not been greatly considered ? [We]6814-we have known _ [[their]6816-their _ husbands]6817-their _ husbands and [fathers]3090-fathers laid in [prison]5014-prison and kept from [them]6816-their , often enough ? All [our]6814-we lives , [we]6814-we have seen [[our]6814-we sister - women]6820-our sister - women suffer , in [themselves]6820-our sister - women and in [[their]6820-our sister - women children]1206-their children , poverty , nakedness , hunger , thirst , sickness , misery , oppression and neglect of all kinds ? ”[146-madame defarge] “ [We]6814-we have seen nothing else , ”[236-the vengeance] returned [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance . “ [We]6814-we have borne this a long time , ”[146-madame defarge] said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , turning [her]146-madame defarge eyes again upon [Lucie]174-lucie . “ Judge [you]174-lucie ! Is it likely that the trouble of [one wife]6822-one wife and [mother]5143-mother would be much to [us]6814-we now ? ”[174-lucie] [She]174-lucie resumed [her]174-lucie knitting and went out . [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance followed . [Defarge]146-madame defarge went last , and closed the door . “ Courage , [[my]133-mr. lorry dear]5097-my dear [Lucie]174-lucie , ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , as [he]133-mr. lorry raised [her]174-lucie . “ Courage , courage ! So far all goes well with [us]6814-we -- much , much better than it has of late gone with [many poor souls]6825-many poor souls . Cheer up , and have a thankful heart . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ [I]133-mr. lorry am not thankless , [I]133-mr. lorry hope , but [that dreadful woman]6826-that dreadful woman seems to throw a shadow on [me]133-mr. lorry and on all [my]133-mr. lorry hopes . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ Tut , tut ! ”[133-mr. lorry] said [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ; “ what is this despondency in the brave little breast ? A shadow indeed ! No substance in it , [Lucie]174-lucie . ”[133-mr. lorry] But the shadow of the manner of [these Defarges]3562-these defarges was dark upon [himself]133-mr. lorry , for all that , and in [his]133-mr. lorry secret mind it troubled [him]133-mr. lorry greatly . CHAPTER IV . Calm in [Storm Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette did not return until the morning of the fourth day of [his]170-doctor manette absence . So much of what had happened in that dreadful time as could be kept from the knowledge of [Lucie]174-lucie was so well concealed from [her]174-lucie , that not until long afterwards , when [France]2-france and [she]174-lucie were far apart , did [she]174-lucie know that [eleven hundred defenceless prisoners of both sexes and all ages]3563-eleven hundred defenceless prisoners of both sexes and all ages had been killed by [the populace]3564-the populace ; that four days and nights had been darkened by this deed of horror ; and that the air around [her]174-lucie had been tainted by [the slain]3565-the slain . [She]174-lucie only knew that there had been an attack upon [the prisons]3566-the prisons , that [all political prisoners]3567-all political prisoners had been in danger , and that [some]2119-some had been dragged out by [the crowd]1386-the crowd and murdered . To [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor communicated under an injunction of secrecy on which [he]1514-the doctor had no need to dwell , that [the crowd]1386-the crowd had taken [him]1514-the doctor through a scene of carnage to [the prison of [La Force]99-la force]3388-the prison of la force . That , in [the prison]2442-the prison [he]1514-the doctor had found a self - appointed Tribunal sitting , before which [the prisoners]1059-the prisoners were brought singly , and by which [they]1059-the prisoners were rapidly ordered to be put forth to be massacred , or to be released , or ( in a few cases ) to be sent back to [[their]1059-the prisoners cells]3575-their cells . That , presented by [[his]1514-the doctor conductors]3576-his conductors to [this Tribunal]3577-this tribunal , [he]1514-the doctor had announced [himself]1514-the doctor by name and profession as having been for eighteen years [a secret and unaccused prisoner in [the Bastille]86-the bastille]3578-a secret and unaccused prisoner in the bastille ; that , one of [the body so sitting in judgment]3579-the body so sitting in judgment had risen and identified [him]1514-the doctor , and that [this man]5081-this man was [Defarge]146-madame defarge . That , hereupon [he]1514-the doctor had ascertained , through the registers on the table , that [[his]1514-the doctor son - in - law]3581-his son - in - law was among [the living prisoners]3582-the living prisoners , and had pleaded hard to [the Tribunal]3583-the tribunal -- of whom [some members]3584-some members were asleep and [some awake]3585-some awake , [some dirty with murder and some clean]3586-some dirty with murder and some clean , some sober and some not -- for [his]1514-the doctor life and liberty . That , in the first frantic greetings lavished on [himself]1514-the doctor as [a notable sufferer under the overthrown system]3587-a notable sufferer under the overthrown system , it had been accorded to [him]1514-the doctor to have [Charles Darnay]162-darnay brought before [the lawless Court]3588-the lawless court , and examined . That , [he]1514-the doctor seemed on the point of being at once released , when the tide in [his]1514-the doctor favour met with some unexplained check ( not intelligible to [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ) , which led to a few words of secret conference . That , [the man sitting as President]3590-the man sitting as president had then informed [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette that [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner must remain in custody , but should , for [his]1514-the doctor sake , be held inviolate in [safe custody]3592-safe custody . That , immediately , on a signal , [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner was removed to [the interior of [the prison]2442-the prison]3594-the interior of the prison again ; but , that [he]1514-the doctor , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor , had then so strongly pleaded for permission to remain and assure [himself]1514-the doctor that [[his]1514-the doctor son - in - law]3581-his son - in - law was , through no malice or mischance , delivered to [the concourse whose murderous yells outside the gate had often drowned the proceedings]3598-the concourse whose murderous yells outside the gate had often drowned the proceedings , that [he]1514-the doctor had obtained the permission , and had remained in [that Hall of Blood]3599-that hall of blood until the danger was over . The sights [he]1514-the doctor had seen [there]4887-there , with brief snatches of food and sleep by intervals , shall remain untold . The mad joy over [the prisoners who were saved]3601-the prisoners who were saved , had astounded [him]1514-the doctor scarcely less than the mad ferocity against [those who were cut to pieces]3602-those who were cut to pieces . [One prisoner there was , [he]1514-the doctor said , who had been discharged into [the street]662-the street free , but at whom [a mistaken savage]3605-a mistaken savage had thrust a pike as [he]3605-a mistaken savage passed out]3603-one prisoner there was , he said , who had been discharged into the street free , but at whom a mistaken savage had thrust a pike as he passed out . Being besought to go to [him]3605-a mistaken savage and dress the wound , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor had passed out at the same gate , and had found [him]3605-a mistaken savage in the arms of [a company of Samaritans , who were seated on the bodies of [[their]3607-a company of samaritans , who were seated on the bodies of their victims victims]3608-their victims]3607-a company of samaritans , who were seated on the bodies of their victims . With an inconsistency as monstrous as anything in this awful nightmare , [they]3607-a company of samaritans , who were seated on the bodies of their victims had helped [the healer]3609-the healer , and tended [the wounded man]3610-the wounded man with the gentlest solicitude -- had made a litter for [him]3610-the wounded man and escorted [him]3610-the wounded man carefully from the spot -- had then caught up [their]3607-a company of samaritans , who were seated on the bodies of their victims weapons and plunged anew into a butchery so dreadful , that [the Doctor]1514-the doctor had covered [his]1514-the doctor eyes with [his]1514-the doctor hands , and swooned away in the midst of it . As [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry received these confidences , and as [he]133-mr. lorry watched the face of [[his]133-mr. lorry friend]1325-his friend now sixty - two years of age , a misgiving arose within [him]133-mr. lorry that such dread experiences would revive the old danger . But , [he]133-mr. lorry had never seen [[his]133-mr. lorry friend]1325-his friend in [his]1325-his friend present aspect : [he]133-mr. lorry had never at all known [him]1325-his friend in [his]1325-his friend present character . For the first time [the Doctor]1514-the doctor felt , now , that [his]1514-the doctor suffering was strength and power . For the first time [he]1514-the doctor felt that in that sharp fire , [he]1514-the doctor had slowly forged the iron which could break the prison door of [[[his]133-mr. lorry daughter]889-his daughter ’s husband]3616-his daughter ’s husband , and deliver [him]1514-the doctor . “ It all tended to a good end , [[my]1514-the doctor friend]492-my friend ; it was not mere waste and ruin . As [[my]1514-the doctor beloved child]6828-my beloved child was helpful in restoring [me]1514-the doctor to [myself]1514-the doctor , [I]1514-the doctor will be helpful now in restoring the dearest part of [herself]6828-my beloved child to [her]6828-my beloved child ; by the aid of [Heaven]225-heaven [I]1514-the doctor will do it ! ”[1514-the doctor] Thus , [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette . And when [Jarvis Lorry]133-mr. lorry saw the kindled eyes , the resolute face , the calm strong look and bearing of [the man whose life always seemed to [him]133-mr. lorry]3617-the man whose life always seemed to him to have been stopped , like a clock , for so many years , and then set going again with an energy which had lain dormant during the cessation of its usefulness , [he]133-mr. lorry believed . Greater things than [the Doctor]1514-the doctor had at that time to contend with , would have yielded before [his]1514-the doctor persevering purpose . While [he]1514-the doctor kept [himself]1514-the doctor in [his]1514-the doctor place , as [a physician , whose business was with all degrees of mankind]3619-a physician , whose business was with all degrees of mankind , bond and free , rich and poor , bad and good , [he]1514-the doctor used [his]1514-the doctor personal influence so wisely , that [he]1514-the doctor was soon [the inspecting physician of [three prisons]3621-three prisons]3620-the inspecting physician of three prisons , and among [them of [La Force]99-la force]3622-them of la force . [He]1514-the doctor could now assure [Lucie]174-lucie that [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband was no longer confined alone , but was mixed with the general body of [prisoners]5390-prisoners ; [he]1514-the doctor saw [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband weekly , and brought sweet messages to [her]174-lucie , straight from [his]1514-the doctor lips ; sometimes [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband [himself]770-her husband sent a letter to [her]174-lucie ( though never by [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s hand ) , but [she]174-lucie was not permitted to write to [him]770-her husband : for , among the many wild suspicions of plots in [the prisons]3566-the prisons , the wildest of all pointed at [emigrants who were known to have made friends or permanent connections abroad]3629-emigrants who were known to have made friends or permanent connections abroad . This new life of [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s was an anxious life , no doubt ; still , [the sagacious Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry saw that there was a new sustaining pride in it . Nothing unbecoming tinged the pride ; it was a natural and worthy one ; but [he]133-mr. lorry observed it as a curiosity . [The Doctor]1514-the doctor knew , that up to that time , [his]1514-the doctor imprisonment had been associated in the minds of [[his]1514-the doctor daughter]889-his daughter and [[his]1514-the doctor friend]1325-his friend , with [his]1514-the doctor personal affliction , deprivation , and weakness . Now that this was changed , and [he]1514-the doctor knew [himself]1514-the doctor to be invested through that old trial with forces to which [they]3634-they both looked for [Charles]162-darnay ’s ultimate safety and deliverance , [he]1514-the doctor became so far exalted by the change , that [he]1514-the doctor took the lead and direction , and required [them]3634-they as [the weak]3635-the weak , to trust to [him]1514-the doctor as the strong . The preceding relative positions of [himself]1514-the doctor and [Lucie]174-lucie were reversed , yet only as the liveliest gratitude and affection could reverse them , for [he]1514-the doctor could have had no pride but in rendering some service to [her]174-lucie who had rendered so much to [him]1514-the doctor . “ All curious to see , ”[133-mr. lorry] thought [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , in [his]133-mr. lorry amiably shrewd way , “ but all natural and right ; so , take the lead , [[my]133-mr. lorry dear friend]2725-my dear friend , and keep it ; it could n’t be in better hands . ”[133-mr. lorry] But , though [the Doctor]1514-the doctor tried hard , and never ceased trying , to get [Charles Darnay]162-darnay set at liberty , or at least to get [him]162-darnay brought to trial , the public current of the time set too strong and fast for [him]1514-the doctor . The new era began ; [the king]4850-the king was tried , doomed , and beheaded ; [the Republic of [Liberty]108-liberty]107-the republic of liberty , Equality , Fraternity , or Death , declared for victory or death against [the world]519-the world in arms ; the black flag waved night and day from [the great towers of [Notre Dame]28-notre dame]3639-the great towers of notre dame ; [three hundred thousand men , summoned to rise against the tyrants of the earth]3640-three hundred thousand men , summoned to rise against the tyrants of the earth , rose from [all the varying soils of [France]2-france]3641-all the varying soils of france , as if the dragon ’s teeth had been sown broadcast , and had yielded fruit equally on hill and plain , on rock , in gravel , and alluvial mud , under the bright sky of [the South]110-the south and under the clouds of [the North]3642-the north , in fell and forest , in [the vineyards]3643-the vineyards and [the olive - grounds]3644-the olive - grounds and among the cropped grass and the stubble of the corn , along the fruitful banks of [the broad rivers]3645-the broad rivers , and in the sand of [the sea - shore]3646-the sea - shore . What private solicitude could rear itself against the deluge of the Year One of [Liberty]108-liberty -- the deluge rising from below , not falling from above , and with the windows of Heaven shut , not opened ! There was no pause , no pity , no peace , no interval of relenting rest , no measurement of time . Though days and nights circled as regularly as when time was young , and the evening and morning were the first day , other count of time there was none . Hold of it was lost in the raging fever of [a nation]3647-a nation , as it is in the fever of [one patient]3648-one patient . Now , breaking the unnatural silence of [a whole city]3649-a whole city , [the executioner]3650-the executioner showed [the people]717-the people the head of [the king]4850-the king -- and now , it seemed almost in the same breath , the head of [[his]4850-the king fair wife]3653-his fair wife which had had eight weary months of imprisoned widowhood and misery , to turn it grey . And yet , observing the strange law of contradiction which obtains in all such cases , the time was long , while it flamed by so fast . [A revolutionary tribunal in [the capital]332-the capital]3654-a revolutionary tribunal in the capital , and [forty or fifty thousand revolutionary committees all over [the land]3657-the land]3656-forty or fifty thousand revolutionary committees all over the land ; a law of the Suspected , which struck away all security for liberty or life , and delivered over [any good and innocent person]3658-any good and innocent person to [any bad and guilty one]3659-any bad and guilty one ; [prisons]6714-prisons gorged with [people who had committed no offence , and could obtain no hearing]3661-people who had committed no offence , and could obtain no hearing ; these things became the established order and nature of appointed things , and seemed to be ancient usage before [they]3662-they were many weeks old . Above all , [one hideous figure]3663-one hideous figure grew as familiar as if it had been before the general gaze from the foundations of [the world]519-the world -- [the figure of the sharp female called [La Guillotine]249-la guillotine]3665-the figure of the sharp female called la guillotine . It was the popular theme for jests ; it was the best cure for headache , it infallibly prevented the hair from turning grey , it imparted a peculiar delicacy to the complexion , it was the National Razor which shaved close : who kissed [La Guillotine]249-la guillotine , looked through the little window and sneezed into the sack . It was the sign of the regeneration of [the human race]314-the human race . It superseded the Cross . Models of it were worn on breasts from which the Cross was discarded , and it was bowed down to and believed in where the Cross was denied . It sheared off heads so many , that it , and the ground it most polluted , were a rotten red . It was taken to pieces , like a toy - puzzle for [a young Devil]3667-a young devil , and was put together again when the occasion wanted it . It hushed [the eloquent]3668-the eloquent , struck down the powerful , abolished the beautiful and good . [Twenty - two friends of high public mark]3669-twenty - two friends of high public mark , [twenty - one living and one dead]3670-twenty - one living and one dead , it had lopped the heads off , in one morning , in as many minutes . The name of [the strong man of [Old Scripture]111-old scripture]3671-the strong man of old scripture had descended to [the chief functionary who worked it]3672-the chief functionary who worked it ; but , so armed , [he]3672-the chief functionary who worked it was stronger than [[his]3672-the chief functionary who worked it namesake]3673-his namesake , and blinder , and tore away the gates of [[God]149-god ’s own Temple]112-god ’s own temple every day . Among [these terrors]3674-these terrors , and the brood belonging to [them]3674-these terrors , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor walked with a steady head : confident in [his]1514-the doctor power , cautiously persistent in [his]1514-the doctor end , never doubting that [he]1514-the doctor would save [[Lucie]174-lucie ’s husband]2846-lucie ’s husband at last . Yet the current of the time swept by , so strong and deep , and carried the time away so fiercely , that [Charles]162-darnay had lain in prison one year and three months when [the Doctor]1514-the doctor was thus steady and confident . So much more wicked and distracted had the Revolution grown in that December month , that [the rivers of [the South]110-the south]3678-the rivers of the south were encumbered with the bodies of [the violently drowned by night]3679-the violently drowned by night , and [prisoners]5390-prisoners were shot in lines and [squares]3681-squares under the southern wintry sun . Still , [the Doctor]1514-the doctor walked among [the terrors]3683-the terrors with a steady head . [No man better known than [he]1514-the doctor , in [Paris]7-paris at that day]3684-no man better known than he , in paris at that day ; [no man in a stranger situation]3685-no man in a stranger situation . Silent , humane , indispensable in [hospital]3686-hospital and [prison]5014-prison , using [his]1514-the doctor art equally among [assassins]3688-assassins and [victims]3689-victims , [he]1514-the doctor was [a man apart]3690-a man apart . In the exercise of [his]1514-the doctor skill , the appearance and the story of [the Bastille Captive]3691-the bastille captive removed [him]1514-the doctor from [all other men]3692-all other men . [He]1514-the doctor was not suspected or brought in question , any more than if [he]1514-the doctor had indeed been recalled to life some eighteen years before , or were a Spirit moving among [mortals]3693-mortals . CHAPTER V. [The Wood - Sawyer]258-the wood - sawyer One year and three months . During all that time [Lucie]174-lucie was never sure , from hour to hour , but that [the Guillotine]249-la guillotine would strike off [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband ’s head next day . Every day , through [the stony streets]3695-the stony streets , the tumbrils now jolted heavily , filled with [Condemned]259-condemned . [Lovely girls]3696-lovely girls ; [bright women , brown - haired , black - haired , and grey]3697-bright women , brown - haired , black - haired , and grey ; [youths]3698-youths ; [stalwart men]3699-stalwart men and [old]3700-old ; [gentle born]3701-gentle born and [peasant born]3702-peasant born ; all red wine for La Guillotine , all daily brought into light from [the dark cellars of [the loathsome prisons]3704-the loathsome prisons]3703-the dark cellars of the loathsome prisons , and carried to [her]174-lucie through [the streets]732-the streets to slake [her]174-lucie devouring thirst . Liberty , equality , fraternity , or death;--the last , much the easiest to bestow , O Guillotine ! If the suddenness of [her]174-lucie calamity , and the whirling wheels of the time , had stunned [[the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s daughter]1569-the doctor ’s daughter into awaiting the result in idle despair , it would but have been with [her]174-lucie as it was with [many]1898-many . But , from the hour when [she]174-lucie had taken the white head to [her]174-lucie fresh young bosom in [the garret of [Saint Antoine]144-saint antoine]3709-the garret of saint antoine , [she]174-lucie had been true to [her]174-lucie duties . [She]174-lucie was truest to [them]3710-they in the season of trial , as [all the quietly loyal and good]3711-all the quietly loyal and good will always be . As soon as [they]3710-they were established in [[their]3710-they new residence]3712-their new residence , and [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father had entered on the routine of [his]5008-her father avocations , [she]174-lucie arranged [the little household]1618-the little household as exactly as if [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband had been [there]4887-there . Everything had its appointed place and its appointed time . Little Lucie [she]174-lucie taught , as regularly , as if [they]3710-they had all been united in [[their]3710-they English home]3717-their english home . The slight devices with which [she]174-lucie cheated [herself]174-lucie into the show of a belief that [they]3710-they would soon be reunited -- the little preparations for [his]5008-her father speedy return , the setting aside of [his]5008-her father chair and [his]5008-her father books -- these , and the solemn prayer at night for [one dear prisoner]3718-one dear prisoner especially , among [the many unhappy souls in [prison]5014-prison]3719-the many unhappy souls in prison and the shadow of death -- were almost the only outspoken reliefs of [her]174-lucie heavy mind . [She]174-lucie did not greatly alter in appearance . The plain dark dresses , akin to mourning dresses , which [she]174-lucie and [[her]174-lucie child]689-her child wore , were as neat and as well attended to as the brighter clothes of happy days . [She]174-lucie lost [her]174-lucie colour , and the old and intent expression was a constant , not an occasional , thing ; otherwise , [she]174-lucie remained very pretty and comely . Sometimes , at night on kissing [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father , [she]174-lucie would burst into the grief [she]174-lucie had repressed all day , and would say that [her]174-lucie sole reliance , under Heaven , was on [him]5008-her father . [He]5008-her father always resolutely answered : “ Nothing can happen to [him]5008-her father without [my]5008-her father knowledge , and [I]5008-her father know that [I]5008-her father can save [him]5008-her father , [Lucie]174-lucie . ”[5008-her father] [They]3723-they had not made the round of [their]3723-they changed life many weeks , when [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father said to [her]174-lucie , on coming [home]858-home one evening : “ [[My]5008-her father dear]5097-my dear , there is an upper window in [the prison]2442-the prison , to which [Charles]162-darnay can sometimes gain access at three in the afternoon . When [he]162-darnay can get to [it]6832-it -- which depends on many uncertainties and incidents -- [he]162-darnay might see [you]174-lucie in [the street]662-the street , [he]162-darnay thinks , if [you]174-lucie stood in a certain place that [I]5008-her father can show [you]174-lucie . But [you]174-lucie will not be able to see [him]162-darnay , [[my]5008-her father poor child]6834-my poor child , and even if [you]174-lucie could , it would be unsafe for [you]174-lucie to make a sign of recognition . ”[5008-her father] “ O show [me]5008-her father [the place]791-the place , [[my]5008-her father father]4969-my father , and [I]5008-her father will go [there]4887-there every day . ”[5008-her father] From that time , in all weathers , [she]3726-she waited there two hours . As the clock struck two , [she]3726-she was there , and at four [she]3726-she turned resignedly away . When it was not too wet or inclement for [[her]3726-she child]689-her child to be with [her]3726-she , [they]3728-they went together ; at other times [she]3726-she was alone ; but , [she]3726-she never missed a single day . It was the dark and dirty corner of [a small winding street]3729-a small winding street . The hovel of a cutter of wood into lengths for burning , was [the only house at that end]3730-the only house at that end ; all else was wall . On the third day of [her]3726-she being [there]4887-there , [he]3732-he noticed [her]3726-she . “ Good day , [citizeness]6838-citizeness . ”[3726-she] “ Good day , [citizen]3357-citizen . ”[3726-she] This mode of address was now prescribed by decree . It had been established voluntarily some time ago , among the more thorough patriots ; but , was now law for [everybody]1759-everybody . “ Walking [here]4902-here again , [citizeness]6838-citizeness ? ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [You]6838-citizeness see [me]3734-the wood - sawyer , [citizen]3357-citizen ! ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] [The wood - sawyer]3734-the wood - sawyer , who was [a little man with a redundancy of gesture]3735-a little man with a redundancy of gesture ( [he]3734-the wood - sawyer had once been [a mender of [roads]2089-roads]5864-a mender of roads ) , cast a glance at [the prison]2442-the prison , pointed at [the prison]2442-the prison , and putting [his]3734-the wood - sawyer ten fingers before [his]3734-the wood - sawyer face to represent bars , peeped through them jocosely . “ But it ’s not [my]3734-the wood - sawyer business , ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] said [he]3734-the wood - sawyer . And went on sawing [his]3734-the wood - sawyer wood . Next day [he]3734-the wood - sawyer was looking out for [her]3740-her , and accosted [her]3740-her the moment [she]3740-her appeared . “ What ? Walking here again , [citizeness]6838-citizeness ? ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ Yes , [citizen]3357-citizen . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ Ah ! [A child]894-a child too ! [[Your]894-a child mother]5011-your mother , is it not , [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer little citizeness]6847-my little citizeness ? ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ Do [I]174-lucie say yes , [mamma]6248-mamma ? ”[174-lucie] whispered [little Lucie]174-lucie , drawing close to [her]3740-her . “ Yes , [dearest]6849-dearest . ”[174-lucie] “ Yes , [citizen]3357-citizen . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ Ah ! But it ’s not [my]3741-his business . [My]3741-his work is [my]3741-his business . See [my]3741-his saw ! [I]3741-his call it [my]3741-his Little Guillotine . [La]113-la , la , la ; [La]113-la , la , la ! And off [his]3741-his head comes ! ”[3741-his] The billet fell as [he]3741-his spoke , and [he]3741-his threw it into a basket . “ [I]3741-his call [myself]3741-his [the Samson of the firewood guillotine]6851-the samson of the firewood guillotine . See here again ! Loo , loo , loo ; [Loo]260-loo , loo , loo ! And off _ [her]174-lucie _ head comes ! Now , [a child]894-a child . Tickle , tickle ; Pickle , pickle ! And off _ its _ head comes . [All the family]6853-all the family ! ”[3741-his] [Lucie]174-lucie shuddered as [he]3741-his threw two more billets into [his]3741-his basket , but it was impossible to be there while [the wood - sawyer]3734-the wood - sawyer was at work , and not be in [his]3741-his sight . Thenceforth , to secure [his]3741-his good will , [she]174-lucie always spoke to [him]3741-his first , and often gave [him]3741-his drink - money , which [he]3741-his readily received . [He]3741-his was [an inquisitive fellow]3743-an inquisitive fellow , and sometimes when [she]174-lucie had quite forgotten [him]3741-his in gazing at the prison roof and grates , and in lifting [her]174-lucie heart up to [[her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband , [she]174-lucie would come to [herself]174-lucie to find [him]3741-his looking at [her]174-lucie , with [his]3741-his knee on [his]3741-his bench and [his]3741-his saw stopped in its work . “ But it ’s not [my]3741-his business ! ”[3741-his] [he]3741-his would generally say at those times , and would briskly fall to [his]3741-his sawing again . In all weathers , in the snow and frost of winter , in the bitter winds of spring , in the hot sunshine of summer , in the rains of autumn , and again in the snow and frost of winter , [Lucie]174-lucie passed two hours of every day at [this place]6772-this place ; and every day on leaving [it]6772-this place , [she]174-lucie kissed [the prison wall]3746-the prison wall . [[Her]174-lucie husband]770-her husband saw [her]174-lucie ( so [she]174-lucie learned from [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father ) it might be once in five or six times : it might be twice or thrice running : it might be , not for a week or a fortnight together . It was enough that [he]3741-his could and did see [her]174-lucie when the chances served , and on that possibility [she]174-lucie would have waited out the day , seven days a week . These occupations brought [her]174-lucie round to the December month , wherein [[her]174-lucie father]5008-her father walked among [the terrors]3683-the terrors with a steady head . On a lightly - snowing afternoon [she]174-lucie arrived at [the usual corner]3751-the usual corner . It was a day of some wild rejoicing , and a festival . [She]174-lucie had seen [the houses]603-the houses , as [she]174-lucie came along , decorated with little pikes , and with little red caps stuck upon them ; also , with tricoloured ribbons ; also , with the standard inscription ( tricoloured letters were the favourite ) , Republic One and Indivisible . Liberty , Equality , Fraternity , or Death ! [The miserable shop of the wood - sawyer]3753-the miserable shop of the wood - sawyer was so small , that [its]3753-the miserable shop of the wood - sawyer whole surface furnished very indifferent space for this legend . [He]770-her husband had got [somebody]405-somebody to scrawl it up for [him]770-her husband , however , who had squeezed [Death]128-death in with most inappropriate difficulty . On [[his]770-her husband house]3187-his house - top , [he]770-her husband displayed pike and cap , as [a good citizen]6464-a good citizen must , and in a window [he]770-her husband had stationed [his]770-her husband saw inscribed as [his]770-her husband “ Little Sainte Guillotine”--for[770-her husband] [the great sharp female]3757-the great sharp female was by that time popularly canonised . [[His]770-her husband shop]3758-his shop was shut and [he]770-her husband was not there , which was a relief to [Lucie]174-lucie , and left [her]174-lucie quite alone . But , [he]770-her husband was not far off , for presently [she]174-lucie heard a troubled movement and a shouting coming along , which filled [her]174-lucie with fear . A moment afterwards , and [a throng of people]3759-a throng of people came pouring round the corner by the prison wall , in the midst of whom was [the wood - sawyer]3734-the wood - sawyer hand in hand with The Vengeance . There could not be [fewer than five hundred people]3761-fewer than five hundred people , and [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people were dancing like five thousand demons . There was no other music than [their]3761-fewer than five hundred people own singing . [They]3761-fewer than five hundred people danced to the popular Revolution song , keeping a ferocious time that was like a gnashing of teeth in unison . [Men]568-men and [women]671-women danced together , [women]671-women danced together , [men]568-men danced together , as hazard had brought [them]3761-fewer than five hundred people together . At first , [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people were a mere storm of coarse red caps and coarse woollen rags ; but , as [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people filled [the place]791-the place , and stopped to dance about [Lucie]174-lucie , some ghastly apparition of [a dance - figure gone raving mad]3767-a dance - figure gone raving mad arose among [them]3761-fewer than five hundred people . [They]3761-fewer than five hundred people advanced , retreated , struck at [one another]411-one another ’s hands , clutched at [one another]411-one another ’s heads , spun round alone , caught [one another]411-one another and spun round in pairs , until many of [them]3761-fewer than five hundred people dropped . While [those were down]3771-those were down , the rest linked hand in hand , and all spun round together : then the ring broke , and in separate rings of two and four [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people turned and turned until [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people all stopped at once , began again , struck , clutched , and tore , and then reversed the spin , and all spun round another way . Suddenly [they]3761-fewer than five hundred people stopped again , paused , struck out the time afresh , formed into lines the width of the public way , and , with [their]3761-fewer than five hundred people heads low down and [their]3761-fewer than five hundred people hands high up , swooped screaming off . No fight could have been half so terrible as this dance . It was so emphatically a fallen sport -- a something , once innocent , delivered over to all devilry -- a healthy pastime changed into a means of angering the blood , bewildering the senses , and steeling the heart . Such grace as was visible in it , made it the uglier , showing how warped and perverted all things good by nature were become . The maidenly bosom bared to this , [the pretty almost - child]3772-the pretty almost - child ’s head thus distracted , the delicate foot mincing in this slough of blood and dirt , were types of the disjointed time . This was the Carmagnole . As it passed , leaving [Lucie]174-lucie frightened and bewildered in the doorway of [[the wood - sawyer]3734-the wood - sawyer ’s house]3774-the wood - sawyer ’s house , the feathery snow fell as quietly and lay as white and soft , as if it had never been . “ O [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer father]4969-my father ! ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] for [he]3734-the wood - sawyer stood before [her]174-lucie when [she]174-lucie lifted up the eyes [she]174-lucie had momentarily darkened with [her]174-lucie hand ; “ such a cruel , bad sight . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [I]3734-the wood - sawyer know , [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer dear]5097-my dear , [I]3734-the wood - sawyer know . [I]3734-the wood - sawyer have seen it many times . Do n’t be frightened ! Not one of [them]3761-fewer than five hundred people would harm [you]174-lucie . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [I]3734-the wood - sawyer am not frightened for [myself]3734-the wood - sawyer , [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer father]4969-my father . But when [I]3734-the wood - sawyer think of [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer husband]5455-my husband , and the mercies of [these people--]6858-these people-- ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [We]6859-we will set [him]5455-my husband above [their]3761-fewer than five hundred people mercies very soon . [I]3734-the wood - sawyer left [him]5455-my husband climbing to the window , and [I]3734-the wood - sawyer came to tell [you]174-lucie . There is [no one here to see]6860-no one here to see . [You]174-lucie may kiss [your]174-lucie hand towards that highest shelving roof . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [I]3734-the wood - sawyer do so , [father]5144-father , and [I]3734-the wood - sawyer send [him]5455-my husband [my]3734-the wood - sawyer Soul with it ! ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ [You]174-lucie can not see [him]5455-my husband , [[my]3734-the wood - sawyer poor dear]6862-my poor dear ? ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] “ No , [father]5144-father , ”[174-lucie] said [Lucie]174-lucie , yearning and weeping as [she]174-lucie kissed [her]174-lucie hand , “ no . ”[174-lucie] A footstep in the snow . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . “ [I]146-madame defarge salute [you]174-lucie , [citizeness]6838-citizeness , ”[146-madame defarge] from [the Doctor]1514-the doctor . “ [I]3734-the wood - sawyer salute [you]174-lucie , [citizen]3357-citizen . ”[3734-the wood - sawyer] This in passing . Nothing more . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge gone , like a shadow over [the white road]3776-the white road . “ Give [me]146-madame defarge [your]174-lucie arm , [[my]146-madame defarge love]494-my love . Pass from here with an air of cheerfulness and courage , for [his]5144-father sake . That was well done ; ”[146-madame defarge] [they]3777-they had left the spot ; “ it shall not be in vain . [Charles]162-darnay is summoned for to - morrow . ”[146-madame defarge] “ For to - morrow ! ”[146-madame defarge] “ There is no time to lose . [I]146-madame defarge am well prepared , but there are precautions to be taken , that could not be taken until [he]162-darnay was actually summoned before [the Tribunal]3583-the tribunal . [He]162-darnay has not received the notice yet , but [I]146-madame defarge know that [he]162-darnay will presently be summoned for to - morrow , and removed to [the Conciergerie]6868-the conciergerie ; [I]146-madame defarge have timely information . [You]146-madame defarge are not afraid ? ”[146-madame defarge] [She]146-madame defarge could scarcely answer , “ [I]146-madame defarge trust in [you]3778-i . ”[146-madame defarge] “ Do so , implicitly . [Your]174-lucie suspense is nearly ended , [[my]3778-i darling]2648-my darling ; [he]162-darnay shall be restored to [you]174-lucie within a few hours ; [I]3778-i have encompassed [him]162-darnay with every protection . [I]3778-i must see [Lorry]133-mr. lorry . ”[3778-i] [He]3778-i stopped . There was a heavy lumbering of wheels within hearing . [They]3779-they both knew too well what it meant . One . Two . Three . Three tumbrils faring away with [their]3780-their dread loads over the hushing snow . “ [I]1514-the doctor must see [Lorry]133-mr. lorry , ”[1514-the doctor] [the Doctor]1514-the doctor repeated , turning [her]146-madame defarge another way . [The staunch old gentleman]3782-the staunch old gentleman was still in [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman trust ; had never left it . [He]3782-the staunch old gentleman and [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman books were in frequent requisition as to property confiscated and made national . What [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman could save for [the owners]3783-the owners , [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman saved . [No better man]3784-no better man living to hold fast by what [Tellson]134-tellson ’s had in keeping , and to hold [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman peace . A murky red and yellow sky , and a rising mist from [the Seine]114-the seine , denoted the approach of darkness . It was almost dark when [they]3779-they arrived at [the Bank]531-the bank . [The stately residence of [Monseigneur]188-monseigneur]3786-the stately residence of monseigneur was altogether blighted and deserted . Above a heap of dust and ashes in [the court]4990-the court , ran the letters : National Property . Republic One and Indivisible . Liberty , Equality , Fraternity , or Death ! Who could that be with [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry -- [the owner of the riding - coat upon the chair]3788-the owner of the riding - coat upon the chair -- who must not be seen ? From whom newly arrived , did [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman come out , agitated and surprised , to take [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman favourite in [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman arms ? To whom did [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman appear to repeat [her]3789-her faltering words , when , raising [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman voice and turning [his]3782-the staunch old gentleman head towards the door of [the room from which [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman had issued]3790-the room from which he had issued , [he]3782-the staunch old gentleman said : “ Removed to [the Conciergerie]6868-the conciergerie , and summoned for to - morrow ? ”[3782-the staunch old gentleman] CHAPTER VI . Triumph [The dread tribunal of [five Judges]3792-five judges]3791-the dread tribunal of five judges , [Public Prosecutor]3793-public prosecutor , and [determined Jury]3794-determined jury , sat every day . [Their]3791-the dread tribunal of five judges lists went forth every evening , and were read out by [the gaolers of [the various prisons]3796-the various prisons to [[their]3795-the gaolers of the various prisons to their prisoners prisoners]3797-their prisoners]3795-the gaolers of the various prisons to their prisoners . [The standard gaoler]3798-the standard gaoler - joke was , “ Come out and listen to the Evening Paper , [you]6871-you inside there ! ”[3798-the standard gaoler] “ [Charles Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde , called [Darnay]162-darnay ! ”[3798-the standard gaoler] So at last began the Evening Paper at [La Force]99-la force . When a name was called , [its owner]1790-its owner stepped apart into a spot reserved for [those who were announced as being thus fatally recorded]3800-those who were announced as being thus fatally recorded . [Charles Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde , called [Darnay]162-darnay , had reason to know the usage ; [he]248-charles evrémonde had seen [hundreds]3801-hundreds pass away so . [[His]248-charles evrémonde bloated gaoler]3802-his bloated gaoler , who wore spectacles to read with , glanced over them to assure [himself]3802-his bloated gaoler that [he]3802-his bloated gaoler had taken [his]3802-his bloated gaoler place , and went through the list , making a similar short pause at each name . There were twenty - three names , but only twenty were responded to ; for one of [the prisoners so summoned]3803-the prisoners so summoned had died in [gaol]3804-gaol and been forgotten , and two had already been guillotined and forgotten . The list was read , in [the vaulted chamber where [Darnay]162-darnay had seen [the associated prisoners]3806-the associated prisoners on the night of [his]162-darnay arrival]3805-the vaulted chamber where darnay had seen the associated prisoners on the night of his arrival . Every one of those had perished in the massacre ; [every human creature [he]162-darnay had since cared for and parted with]3807-every human creature he had since cared for and parted with , had died on the scaffold . There were hurried words of farewell and kindness , but the parting was soon over . It was the incident of every day , and [the society of [La Force]99-la force]3808-the society of la force were engaged in the preparation of some games of forfeits and a little concert , for that evening . [They]3806-the associated prisoners crowded to [the grates]3809-the grates and shed tears there ; but , twenty places in [the projected entertainments]3810-the projected entertainments had to be refilled , and the time was , at best , short to the lock - up hour , when [the common rooms]3811-the common rooms and [corridors]3812-corridors would be delivered over to the great dogs who kept watch there through the night . [The prisoners]1059-the prisoners were far from insensible or unfeeling ; [their]1059-the prisoners ways arose out of the condition of the time . Similarly , though with a subtle difference , a species of fervour or intoxication , known , without doubt , to have led [some persons to brave the guillotine unnecessarily , and to die by it]3814-some persons to brave the guillotine unnecessarily , and to die by it , was not mere boastfulness , but a wild infection of the wildly shaken public mind . In seasons of pestilence , [some of [us]3816-us]3815-some of us will have a secret attraction to the disease -- a terrible passing inclination to die of it . And all of [us]3816-us have like wonders hidden in [our]3816-us breasts , only needing circumstances to evoke them . The passage to [the Conciergerie]6868-the conciergerie was short and dark ; the night in [its]6868-the conciergerie vermin - haunted cells was long and cold . Next day , [fifteen prisoners]3818-fifteen prisoners were put to the bar before [Charles Darnay]162-darnay ’s name was called . [All the fifteen]3819-all the fifteen were condemned , and the trials of the whole occupied an hour and a half . “ [Charles Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde , called [Darnay]162-darnay , ”[3822-the turbulent audience] was at length arraigned . [[His]162-darnay judges]3820-his judges sat upon the Bench in feathered hats ; but the rough red cap and tricoloured cockade was the head - dress otherwise prevailing . Looking at [the Jury]1124-the jury and [the turbulent audience]3822-the turbulent audience , [he]162-darnay might have thought that the usual order of things was reversed , and that [the felons]3823-the felons were trying [the honest men]3824-the honest men . [The lowest , cruelest , and worst populace of [a city]3826-a city]3825-the lowest , cruelest , and worst populace of a city , never without its quantity of low , cruel , and bad , were [the directing spirits of the scene]3827-the directing spirits of the scene : noisily commenting , applauding , disapproving , anticipating , and precipitating the result , without a check . Of [the men , the greater part]3828-the men , the greater part were armed in various ways ; of [the women]2092-the women , [some]2119-some wore knives , some daggers , some ate and drank as [they]2119-some looked on , many knitted . Among [these last]3831-these last , was one , with a spare piece of knitting under [her]3832-her arm as [she]3832-her worked . [She]2092-the women was in a front row , by the side of [a man whom [he]162-darnay had never seen since [his]162-darnay arrival at [the Barrier]5114-the barrier , but whom [he]162-darnay directly remembered as [Defarge]146-madame defarge]3833-a man whom he had never seen since his arrival at the barrier , but whom he directly remembered as defarge . [He]162-darnay noticed that [she]2092-the women once or twice whispered in [his]162-darnay ear , and that [she]2092-the women seemed to be [[his]162-darnay wife]4987-his wife ; but , what [he]162-darnay most noticed in the two figures was , that although [they]3836-they were posted as close to [himself]162-darnay as [they]3836-they could be , [they]3836-they never looked towards [him]162-darnay . [They]3836-they seemed to be waiting for something with a dogged determination , and [they]3836-they looked at [the Jury]1124-the jury , but at nothing else . Under [the President]3838-the president sat [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette , in [his]170-doctor manette usual quiet dress . As well as [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner could see , [he]170-doctor manette and [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry were [the only men there , unconnected with [the Tribunal]3583-the tribunal , who wore [their]3836-they usual clothes , and had not assumed the coarse garb of the Carmagnole]3840-the only men there , unconnected with the tribunal , who wore their usual clothes , and had not assumed the coarse garb of the carmagnole . [Charles Evrémonde]248-charles evrémonde , called [Darnay]162-darnay , was accused by [the public prosecutor]3842-the public prosecutor as [an emigrant]6404-an emigrant , whose life was forfeit to [the Republic]3844-the republic , under the decree which banished all [emigrants on pain of Death]3845-emigrants on pain of death . It was nothing that the decree bore date since [his]248-charles evrémonde return to [France]2-france . There [he]248-charles evrémonde was , and there was the decree ; [he]248-charles evrémonde had been taken in [France]2-france , and [his]248-charles evrémonde head was demanded . “ Take off [his]248-charles evrémonde head ! ”[1353-the audience] cried [the audience]1353-the audience . “ [An enemy to [the Republic]3844-the republic]6872-an enemy to the republic ! ”[1353-the audience] [The President]3838-the president rang [his]3838-the president bell to silence those cries , and asked [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner whether it was not true that [he]5091-the prisoner had lived many years in [England]1-england ? Undoubtedly it was . Was [he]5091-the prisoner not [an emigrant]6404-an emigrant then ? What did [he]5091-the prisoner call [himself]5091-the prisoner ? Not [an emigrant]6404-an emigrant , [he]3838-the president hoped , within the sense and spirit of the law . Why not ? [the President]3838-the president desired to know . Because [he]3838-the president had voluntarily relinquished a title that was distasteful to [him]3838-the president , and a station that was distasteful to [him]3838-the president , and had left [[his]3838-the president country]1171-his country -- [he]3838-the president submitted before the word emigrant in the present acceptation by [the Tribunal]3583-the tribunal was in use -- to live by [[his]3838-the president own industry]3854-his own industry in [England]1-england , rather than on the industry of [the overladen people of [France]2-france]3855-the overladen people of france . What proof had [he]3838-the president of this ? [He]3838-the president handed in the names of [two witnesses]3856-two witnesses ; [Theophile Gabelle]261-theophile gabelle , and [Alexandre Manette]234-alexandre manette . But [he]3838-the president had married in [England]1-england ? [the President]3838-the president reminded [him]3838-the president . True , but not [an English woman]3858-an english woman . [A citizeness of [France]2-france]3859-a citizeness of france ? Yes . By birth . [Her]3858-an english woman name and [family]1694-family ? “ [Lucie Manette]174-lucie , [only daughter of [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette]6874-only daughter of doctor manette , [the good physician who sits there]6875-the good physician who sits there . ”[3838-the president] This answer had a happy effect upon [the audience]1353-the audience . Cries in exaltation of [the well - known good physician]3862-the well - known good physician rent [the hall]1556-the hall . So capriciously were [the people]717-the people moved , that tears immediately rolled down several ferocious countenances which had been glaring at [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner a moment before , as if with impatience to pluck [him]5091-the prisoner out into [the streets]732-the streets and kill [him]5091-the prisoner . On these few steps of [his]5091-the prisoner dangerous way , [Charles Darnay]162-darnay had set [his]5091-the prisoner foot according to [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette ’s reiterated instructions . [The same cautious counsel]3867-the same cautious counsel directed every step that lay before [him]5091-the prisoner , and had prepared every inch of [[his]5091-the prisoner road]2529-his road . [The President]3838-the president asked , why had [he]5091-the prisoner returned to [France]2-france when [he]5091-the prisoner did , and not sooner ? [He]5091-the prisoner had not returned sooner , [he]5091-the prisoner replied , simply because [he]5091-the prisoner had no means of living in [France]2-france , save those [he]5091-the prisoner had resigned ; whereas , in [England]1-england , [he]5091-the prisoner lived by giving instruction in the French language and literature . [He]5091-the prisoner had returned when [he]5091-the prisoner did , on the pressing and written entreaty of [a French citizen]3870-a french citizen , who represented that [his]5091-the prisoner life was endangered by [his]5091-the prisoner absence . [He]5091-the prisoner had come back , to save [a citizen]3871-a citizen ’s life , and to bear [his]5091-the prisoner testimony , at whatever personal hazard , to the truth . Was [that criminal]3872-that criminal in the eyes of [the Republic]3844-the republic ? [The populace]3564-the populace cried enthusiastically , “ No ! ”[3564-the populace] and [the President]3838-the president rang [his]3838-the president bell to quiet [them]3564-the populace . Which it did not , for [they]3564-the populace continued to cry “ No ! ”[3564-the populace] until [they]3564-the populace left off , of [their]3564-the populace own will . [The President]3838-the president required the name of [that citizen]3877-that citizen . [The accused]1126-the accused explained that [the citizen]3879-the citizen was [[his]1126-the accused first witness]3880-his first witness . [He]3838-the president also referred with confidence to [the citizen]3879-the citizen ’s letter , which had been taken from [him]3838-the president at the Barrier , but which [he]3838-the president did not doubt would be found among the papers then before [the President]3838-the president . [The Doctor]1514-the doctor had taken care that it should be there -- had assured [him]3838-the president that it would be there -- and at this stage of the proceedings it was produced and read . [Citizen Gabelle]262-citizen gabelle was called to confirm it , and did so . [Citizen Gabelle]262-citizen gabelle hinted , with infinite delicacy and politeness , that in the pressure of business imposed on [the Tribunal]3583-the tribunal by [the multitude of enemies of [the Republic with which it]3886-the republic with which it]3885-the multitude of enemies of the republic with which it had to deal , [he]3838-the president had been slightly overlooked in [[his]3838-the president prison of [the Abbaye]3349-the abbaye]6470-his prison of the abbaye -- in fact , had rather passed out of [the Tribunal]116-the tribunal ’s patriotic remembrance -- until three days ago ; when [he]3838-the president had been summoned before it , and had been set at liberty on [the Jury]1124-the jury ’s declaring [themselves]1124-the jury satisfied that the accusation against [him]3838-the president was answered , as to [himself]3838-the president , by the surrender of [the citizen Evrémonde]3890-the citizen evrémonde , called [Darnay]162-darnay . [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette was next questioned . [His]170-doctor manette high personal popularity , and the clearness of [his]170-doctor manette answers , made a great impression ; but , as [he]170-doctor manette proceeded , as [he]170-doctor manette showed that [the Accused]1126-the accused was [[his]170-doctor manette first friend]3892-his first friend on [his]170-doctor manette release from [his]170-doctor manette long imprisonment ; that , [the accused]1126-the accused had remained in [England]1-england , always faithful and devoted to [[his]1126-the accused daughter]889-his daughter and [himself]1126-the accused in [their]3895-their exile ; that , so far from being in favour with [the Aristocrat government]3896-the aristocrat government [there]4887-there , [he]1126-the accused had actually been tried for [his]1126-the accused life by [it]3896-the aristocrat government , as [the foe of [England]1-england]3898-the foe of england and [friend of [the United States]3900-the united states]3899-friend of the united states -- as [he]1126-the accused brought these circumstances into view , with the greatest discretion and with the straightforward force of truth and earnestness , [the Jury]1124-the jury and [the populace]3564-the populace became one . At last , when [he]1126-the accused appealed by name to [Monsieur Lorry]263-monsieur lorry , [an English gentleman then and there present]3903-an english gentleman then and there present , who , like [himself]263-monsieur lorry , had been [a witness on that English trial]3904-a witness on that english trial and could corroborate [his]263-monsieur lorry account of it , [the Jury]1124-the jury declared that [they]1124-the jury had heard enough , and that [they]1124-the jury were ready with [their]1124-the jury votes if [the President]3838-the president were content to receive [them]1124-the jury . At every vote ( [the Jurymen]3907-the jurymen voted aloud and individually ) , [the populace]3564-the populace set up a shout of applause . All the voices were in [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner ’s favour , and [the President]3838-the president declared [him]5091-the prisoner free . Then , began one of those extraordinary scenes with which [the populace]3564-the populace sometimes gratified [their]3564-the populace fickleness , or [their]3564-the populace better impulses towards generosity and mercy , or which [they]3564-the populace regarded as some set - off against [their]3564-the populace swollen account of cruel rage . [No man]1866-no man can decide now to which of these motives such extraordinary scenes were referable ; it is probable , to a blending of all the three , with the second predominating . No sooner was the acquittal pronounced , than tears were shed as freely as blood at another time , and such fraternal embraces were bestowed upon [the prisoner]5091-the prisoner by as many of both sexes as could rush at [him]5091-the prisoner , that after [his]5091-the prisoner long and unwholesome confinement [he]5091-the prisoner was in danger of fainting from exhaustion ; none the less because [he]5091-the prisoner knew very well , that [the very same people , carried by another current]3914-the very same people , carried by another current , would have rushed at [him]5091-the prisoner with the very same intensity , to rend [him]5091-the prisoner to pieces and strew [him]5091-the prisoner over [the streets]732-the streets . [His]5091-the prisoner removal , to make way for [other accused persons who were to be tried]3916-other accused persons who were to be tried , rescued [him]5091-the prisoner from these caresses for the moment . [Five]3917-five were to be tried together , next , as [enemies of [the Republic]3844-the republic]3918-enemies of the republic , forasmuch as [they]3917-five had not assisted it by word or deed . So quick was [the Tribunal]116-the tribunal to compensate [itself]116-the tribunal and [the nation]3920-the nation for a chance lost , that [these five]3921-these five came down to [him]5091-the prisoner before [he]5091-the prisoner left [the place]791-the place , condemned to die within twenty - four hours . [The first of [them]3921-these five]3923-the first of them told [him]5091-the prisoner so , with the customary prison sign of Death -- a raised finger -- and [they]3921-these five all added in words , “ Long live [the Republic]3844-the republic ! ”[3921-these five] [The five]3924-the five had had , it is true , [no audience]3925-no audience to lengthen [their]3924-the five proceedings , for when [he]5091-the prisoner and [Doctor Manette]170-doctor manette emerged from the gate , there was a great crowd about it , in which there seemed to be every face [he]5091-the prisoner had seen in [Court]1082-court -- except two , for which [he]5091-the prisoner looked in vain . On [his]5091-the prisoner coming out , [the concourse]3489-the concourse made at [him]5091-the prisoner anew , weeping , embracing , and shouting , [all by turns and all together]3928-all by turns and all together , until the very tide of the river on the bank of which the mad scene was acted , seemed to run mad , like [the people on [the shore]491-the shore]3929-the people on the shore . [They]3924-the five put [him]5091-the prisoner into a great chair [they]3924-the five had among [them]3924-the five , and which [they]3924-the five had taken either out of [the Court itself]3931-the court itself , or one of [[its]3931-the court itself rooms]3932-its rooms or [passages]3933-passages . Over the chair [they]3924-the five had thrown a red flag , and to the back of it [they]3924-the five had bound a pike with a red cap on its top . In this car of triumph , not even [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s entreaties could prevent [his]5091-the prisoner being carried to [[his]5091-the prisoner home]3935-his home on [men]568-men ’s shoulders , with a confused sea of red caps heaving about [him]5091-the prisoner , and casting up to sight from the stormy deep such wrecks of faces , that [he]5091-the prisoner more than once misdoubted [his]5091-the prisoner mind being in confusion , and that [he]5091-the prisoner was in the tumbril on [his]5091-the prisoner way to [the Guillotine]3937-the guillotine . In wild dreamlike procession , embracing whom [they]3924-the five met and pointing [him]5091-the prisoner out , [they]3924-the five carried [him]5091-the prisoner on . Reddening [the snowy streets]3938-the snowy streets with the prevailing Republican colour , in winding and tramping through [them]3938-the snowy streets , as [they]3924-the five had reddened [them]3938-the snowy streets below the snow with a deeper dye , [they]3924-the five carried [him]5091-the prisoner thus into [the courtyard of [the building where [he]5091-the prisoner lived]3940-the building where he lived]3939-the courtyard of the building where he lived . [[Her]3941-her father]5008-her father had gone on before , to prepare [her]3941-her , and when [[her]3941-her husband]770-her husband stood upon [his]770-her husband feet , [she]3941-her dropped insensible in [his]770-her husband arms . As [he]770-her husband held [her]3941-her to [his]770-her husband heart and turned [her]3941-her beautiful head between [his]770-her husband face and [the brawling crowd]3944-the brawling crowd , so that [his]770-her husband tears and [her]3941-her lips might come together unseen , [a few of [the people]717-the people]3945-a few of the people fell to dancing . Instantly , [all the rest]3947-all the rest fell to dancing , and [the courtyard]915-the courtyard overflowed with the Carmagnole . Then , [they]3947-all the rest elevated into the vacant chair [a young woman from the crowd]3949-a young woman from the crowd to be carried as [the Goddess of Liberty]3950-the goddess of liberty , and then swelling and overflowing out into [the adjacent streets]3951-the adjacent streets , and along [[the river]1494-the river ’s bank]3953-the river ’s bank , and over [the bridge]3954-the bridge , [the Carmagnole]264-the carmagnole absorbed [them]3947-all the rest every one and whirled [them]3947-all the rest away . After grasping [the Doctor]1514-the doctor ’s hand , as [he]1514-the doctor stood victorious and proud before [him]1514-the doctor ; after grasping the hand of [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry , who came panting in breathless from [his]133-mr. lorry struggle against the waterspout of [the Carmagnole]3956-the carmagnole ; after kissing [little Lucie]174-lucie , who was lifted up to clasp [her]174-lucie arms round [his]133-mr. lorry neck ; and after embracing [the ever zealous and faithful Pross who lifted [her]174-lucie]3957-the ever zealous and faithful pross who lifted her ; [he]133-mr. lorry took [[his]133-mr. lorry wife]4987-his wife in [his]133-mr. lorry arms , and carried [her]4987-his wife up to [[their]3959-their rooms]3960-their rooms . “ [Lucie]174-lucie ! [My]133-mr. lorry own ! [I]133-mr. lorry am safe . ”[133-mr. lorry] “ O dearest [Charles]162-darnay , let [me]3959-their thank [God]149-god for this on [my]3959-their knees as [I]3959-their have prayed to [Him]149-god . ”[3959-their] [They]3959-their all reverently bowed [their]3959-their heads and hearts . When [she]4987-his wife was again in [his]133-mr. lorry arms , [he]133-mr. lorry said to [her]4987-his wife : “ And now speak to [[your]4987-his wife father]4947-your father , [dearest]6849-dearest . [No other man in all this [France]2-france]6879-no other man in all this france could have done what [he]133-mr. lorry has done for [me]133-mr. lorry . ”[133-mr. lorry] [She]4987-his wife laid [her]4987-his wife head upon [[her]4987-his wife father]5008-her father ’s breast , as [she]4987-his wife had laid [his]133-mr. lorry poor head on [her]4987-his wife own breast , long , long ago .
