Be sure [you]4729-you are there , [my]0-i soul , ” said [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance , calling after [her]4720-her , for [she]4720-her had already turned into [the street]662-the street , “[4729-you] before the tumbrils arrive ! ” [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge slightly waved [her]146-madame defarge hand , to imply that [she]146-madame defarge heard , and might be relied upon to arrive in good time , and so went through the mud , and round the corner of the prison wall . [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance and [the Juryman]7476-the juryman , looking after [her]4720-her as [she]4720-her walked away , were highly appreciative of [her]4720-her fine figure , and [her]4720-her superb moral endowments . There were [many women at that time , upon whom the time laid a dreadfully disfiguring hand]7691-many women at that time , upon whom the time laid a dreadfully disfiguring hand ; but , there was not one among [them]7691-many women at that time , upon whom the time laid a dreadfully disfiguring hand more to be dreaded than [this ruthless woman]7692-this ruthless woman , now taking [her]7692-this ruthless woman way along [the streets]732-the streets . Of [a strong and fearless character , of shrewd sense and readiness , of great determination]7694-a strong and fearless character , of shrewd sense and readiness , of great determination , of that kind of beauty which not only seems to impart to [its possessor firmness and animosity , but to strike into others an instinctive recognition of those qualities]7695-its possessor firmness and animosity , but to strike into others an instinctive recognition of those qualities ; the troubled time would have heaved [her]4720-her up , under any circumstances . But , imbued from [her]4720-her childhood with a brooding sense of wrong , and an inveterate hatred of [a class]3125-a class , opportunity had developed [her]4720-her into [a tigress]7697-a tigress . [She]4720-her was absolutely without pity . If [she]4720-her had ever had the virtue in [her]4720-her , it had quite gone out of [her]4720-her . It was nothing to [her]4720-her , that [an innocent man]7698-an innocent man was to die for the sins of [[his]7698-an innocent man forefathers]7699-his forefathers ; [she]4720-her saw , not [him]7698-an innocent man , but [them]7699-his forefathers . It was nothing to [her]4720-her , that [[his]7698-an innocent man wife]4987-his wife was to be made [a widow]7394-a widow and [[his]7698-an innocent man daughter]889-his daughter [an orphan]4923-an orphan ; that was insufficient punishment , because [they]7699-his forefathers were [[her]4720-her natural enemies]7704-her natural enemies and [her]4720-her prey , and as such had no right to live . To appeal to [her]4720-her , was made hopeless by [her]4720-her having no sense of pity , even for [herself]4720-her . If [she]4720-her had been laid low in [the streets]732-the streets , in any of the many encounters in which [she]4720-her had been engaged , [she]4720-her would not have pitied [herself]4720-her ; nor , if [she]4720-her had been ordered to the axe to - morrow , would [she]4720-her have gone to it with any softer feeling than a fierce desire to change places with [the man who sent [her]4720-her there]7706-the man who sent her there . Such a heart [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge carried under [her]146-madame defarge rough robe . Carelessly worn , it was a becoming robe enough , in a certain weird way , and [her]146-madame defarge dark hair looked rich under [her]146-madame defarge coarse red cap . Lying hidden in [her]146-madame defarge bosom , was a loaded pistol . Lying hidden at [her]146-madame defarge waist , was a sharpened dagger . Thus accoutred , and walking with the confident tread of [such a character]7707-such a character , and with the supple freedom of [a woman who had habitually walked in [her]146-madame defarge girlhood]7708-a woman who had habitually walked in her girlhood , bare - foot and bare - legged , on [the brown sea - sand]7709-the brown sea - sand , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge took [her]146-madame defarge way along [the streets]732-the streets . Now , when the journey of [the travelling coach]7711-the travelling coach , at that very moment waiting for the completion of [its]7711-the travelling coach load , had been planned out last night , the difficulty of taking [Miss Pross]183-miss pross in it had much engaged [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry ’s attention . It was not merely desirable to avoid overloading [the coach]376-the coach , but it was of the highest importance that the time occupied in examining [it]376-the coach and [its passengers]421-its passengers , should be reduced to the utmost ; since [their]421-its passengers escape might depend on the saving of only a few seconds here and there . Finally , [he]133-mr. lorry had proposed , after anxious consideration , that [Miss Pross]183-miss pross and [Jerry]133-mr. lorry , who were at liberty to leave [the city]1496-the city , should leave [it]376-the coach at three o’clock in [the lightest - wheeled conveyance]7715-the lightest - wheeled conveyance known to that period . Unencumbered with luggage , [they]421-its passengers would soon overtake [the coach]376-the coach , and , passing [it]376-the coach and preceding [it]376-the coach on [the road]377-the road , would order [its]376-the coach horses in advance , and greatly facilitate [its]376-the coach progress during the precious hours of the night , when delay was the most to be dreaded . Seeing in this arrangement the hope of rendering real service in that pressing emergency , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross hailed it with joy . [She]183-miss pross and [Jerry]133-mr. lorry had beheld [the coach]376-the coach start , had known who it was that [Solomon]186-solomon brought , had passed some ten minutes in tortures of suspense , and were now concluding [their]421-its passengers arrangements to follow [the coach]376-the coach , even as [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , taking [her]146-madame defarge way through [the streets]732-the streets , now drew nearer and nearer to [the else - deserted lodging in which [they]421-its passengers held [their]421-its passengers consultation]7721-the else - deserted lodging in which they held their consultation . “[4732-you] Now what do [you]4732-you think , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , whose agitation was so great that [she]183-miss pross could hardly speak , or stand , or move , or live : “[4732-you] what do [you]4732-you think of [our]4733-our not starting from [this courtyard]4734-this courtyard ? [Another carriage]6144-another carriage having already gone from here to - day , it might awaken suspicion . ” “[4732-you] [My]0-i opinion , [miss]4912-miss , ” returned [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , “[4912-miss] is as [you]4912-miss ’re right . Likewise wot [I]0-i ’ll stand by [you]4912-miss , right or wrong . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am so distracted with fear and hope for [our]4733-our precious creatures , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , wildly crying , “[0-i] that [I]0-i am incapable of forming any plan . Are _ [you]4732-you _ capable of forming any plan , [[my]0-i dear]5097-my dear good [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ? ” “[156-mr. cruncher] Respectin ’ a future spear o ’ life , [miss]4912-miss , ” returned [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , “[4912-miss] [I]0-i hope so . Respectin ’ any present use o ’ this here blessed old head o ’ mine , [I]0-i think not . Would [you]4912-miss do [me]0-i the favour , [miss]4912-miss , to take notice o ’ two promises and wows wot it is [my]0-i wishes fur to record in this here crisis ? ” “[4912-miss] Oh , for gracious sake ! ” cried [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , still wildly crying , “[4912-miss] record them at once , and get [them]4740-them out of the way , like [an excellent man]4741-an excellent man . ” “[4741-an excellent man] First , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , who was all in a tremble , and who spoke with an ashy and solemn visage , “[4741-an excellent man] [them]4740-them poor things well out o ’ this , never no more will [I]0-i do it , never no more ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am quite sure , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , ” returned [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] that [you]156-mr. cruncher never will do it again , whatever it is , and [I]0-i beg [you]156-mr. cruncher not to think it necessary to mention more particularly what it is . ” “[4912-miss] No , [miss]4912-miss , ” returned [Jerry]156-mr. cruncher , “[4912-miss] it shall not be named to [you]4912-miss . Second : [them]4740-them poor things well out o ’ this , and never no more will [I]0-i interfere with [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher ’s flopping , never no more ! ” “[155-mrs. cruncher] Whatever housekeeping arrangement that may be , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , striving to dry [her]183-miss pross eyes and compose [herself]183-miss pross , “[155-mrs. cruncher] [I]0-i have no doubt it is best that [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher should have it entirely under [her]155-mrs. cruncher own superintendence.--O [[my]0-i poor darlings]4743-my poor darlings ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i go so far as to say , [miss]4912-miss , moreover , ” proceeded [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , with a most alarming tendency to hold forth as from a pulpit--“and[0-i] let [my]0-i words be took down and took to [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher through [yourself]4745-yourself -- that wot [my]0-i opinions respectin ’ flopping has undergone a change , and that wot [I]0-i only hope with all [my]0-i heart as [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher may be a flopping at the present time . ” “[155-mrs. cruncher] There , there , there ! [I]0-i hope [she]155-mrs. cruncher is , [[my]0-i dear man]4746-my dear man , ” cried [the distracted Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] and [I]0-i hope [she]155-mrs. cruncher finds it answering [her]155-mrs. cruncher expectations . ” “[0-i] Forbid it , ” proceeded [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , with additional solemnity , additional slowness , and additional tendency to hold forth and hold out , “[0-i] as anything wot [I]0-i have ever said or done should be wisited on [my]0-i earnest wishes for [them]4747-them poor creeturs now ! Forbid it as [we]4748-we should n’t all flop ( if it was anyways conwenient ) to get [’em]4749-’em out o ’ this here dismal risk ! Forbid it , [miss]4912-miss ! Wot [I]0-i say , for-_bid _ it ! ” This was [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ’s conclusion after a protracted but vain endeavour to find a better one . And still [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , pursuing [her]146-madame defarge way along [the streets]732-the streets , came nearer and nearer . “[0-i] If [we]4748-we ever get back to [[our]4748-we native land]4751-our native land , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] [you]4752-you may rely upon [my]0-i telling [Mrs. Cruncher]155-mrs. cruncher as much as [I]0-i may be able to remember and understand of what [you]4752-you have so impressively said ; and at all events [you]4752-you may be sure that [I]0-i shall bear witness to [your]4752-you being thoroughly in earnest at this dreadful time . Now , pray let [us]4748-we think ! [My]0-i esteemed [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , let [us]4748-we think ! ” Still , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , pursuing [her]146-madame defarge way along [the streets]732-the streets , came nearer and nearer . “[156-mr. cruncher] If [you]4752-you were to go before , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[4752-you] and stop [the vehicle and horses]4753-the vehicle and horses from coming here , and were to wait somewhere for [me]0-i ; would n’t that be best ? ” [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher thought it might be best . “[4752-you] Where could [you]4752-you wait for [me]0-i ? ” asked [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher was so bewildered that [he]156-mr. cruncher could think of no locality but [Temple Bar]18-temple bar . Alas ! [Temple Bar]18-temple bar was hundreds of miles away , and [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge was drawing very near indeed . “[4752-you] By the cathedral door , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . “[4752-you] Would it be much out of the way , to take [me]0-i in , near the great cathedral door between [the two towers]4754-the two towers ? ” “[4912-miss] No , [miss]4912-miss , ” answered [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher . “[4912-miss] Then , like the best of [men]568-men , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[4912-miss] go to [the posting - house]1919-the posting - house straight , and make that change . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am doubtful , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , hesitating and shaking [his]0-i head , “[0-i] about leaving of [you]4912-miss , [you]4912-miss see . [We]4758-we do n’t know what may happen . ” “[4758-we] Heaven knows [we]4758-we do n’t , ” returned [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[4758-we] but have no fear for [me]0-i . Take [me]0-i in at [the cathedral]4759-the cathedral , at [Three o’Clock]4760-three o’clock , or as near [it]4759-the cathedral as [you]4912-miss can , and [I]0-i am sure it will be better than [our]4758-we going from here . [I]0-i feel certain of it . There ! Bless [you]4912-miss , [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher ! Think - not of [me]0-i , but of the lives that may depend on both of [us]4758-we ! ” This exordium , and [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ’s two hands in quite agonised entreaty clasping [his]156-mr. cruncher , decided [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher . With an encouraging nod or two , [he]156-mr. cruncher immediately went out to alter the arrangements , and left [her]183-miss pross by [herself]183-miss pross to follow as [she]183-miss pross had proposed . The having originated a precaution which was already in course of execution , was a great relief to [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . The necessity of composing [her]183-miss pross appearance so that it should attract no special notice in [the streets]732-the streets , was another relief . [She]183-miss pross looked at [her]183-miss pross watch , and it was twenty minutes past two . [She]183-miss pross had no time to lose , but must get ready at once . Afraid , in [her]183-miss pross extreme perturbation , of the loneliness of [the deserted rooms]7725-the deserted rooms , and of half - imagined faces peeping from behind every open door in [them]7725-the deserted rooms , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross got a basin of cold water and began laving [her]183-miss pross eyes , which were swollen and red . Haunted by [her]183-miss pross feverish apprehensions , [she]183-miss pross could not bear to have [her]183-miss pross sight obscured for a minute at a time by the dripping water , but constantly paused and looked round to see that there was [no one]330-no one watching [her]183-miss pross . In one of those pauses [she]183-miss pross recoiled and cried out , for [she]183-miss pross saw a figure standing in [the room]565-the room . [The basin]7728-the basin fell to the ground broken , and the water flowed to the feet of [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . By strange stern ways , and through much staining blood , those feet had come to meet that water . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge looked coldly at [her]183-miss pross , and said , “[4653-the wife of evrémonde] [The wife of [Evrémonde]272-evrémonde]4653-the wife of evrémonde ; where is [she]4653-the wife of evrémonde ? ” It flashed upon [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ’s mind that the doors were all standing open , and would suggest the flight . [Her]183-miss pross first act was to shut [them]7725-the deserted rooms . There were four in [the room]565-the room , and [she]183-miss pross shut [them]7725-the deserted rooms all . [She]183-miss pross then placed [herself]183-miss pross before the door of [the chamber which [Lucie]174-lucie had occupied]7730-the chamber which lucie had occupied . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s dark eyes followed [her]183-miss pross through this rapid movement , and rested on [her]183-miss pross when it was finished . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross had nothing beautiful about [her]183-miss pross ; years had not tamed the wildness , or softened the grimness , of [her]183-miss pross appearance ; but , [she]183-miss pross too was [a determined woman]7731-a determined woman in [her]183-miss pross different way , and [she]183-miss pross measured [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge with [her]183-miss pross eyes , every inch . “[272-evrémonde] [You]4762-you might , from [your]4762-you appearance , be [the wife of [Lucifer]241-lucifer]4763-the wife of lucifer , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , in [her]183-miss pross breathing . “[4762-you] Nevertheless , [you]4762-you shall not get the better of [me]0-i . [I]0-i am [an Englishwoman]4764-an englishwoman . ” [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge looked at [her]183-miss pross scornfully , but still with something of [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ’s own perception that [they]7732-they two were at bay . [She]183-miss pross saw [a tight , hard , wiry woman before [her]183-miss pross]7733-a tight , hard , wiry woman before her , as [Mr. Lorry]133-mr. lorry had seen in the same figure [a woman with a strong hand , in the years gone by]7734-a woman with a strong hand , in the years gone by . [She]183-miss pross knew full well that [Miss Pross]183-miss pross was [[the family]5478-the family ’s devoted friend]7736-the family ’s devoted friend ; [Miss Pross]183-miss pross knew full well that [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge was [[the family]5478-the family ’s malevolent enemy]7738-the family ’s malevolent enemy . “[4764-an englishwoman] On [my]0-i way yonder , ” said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , with a slight movement of [her]146-madame defarge hand towards the fatal spot , “[4765-they] where [they]4765-they reserve [my]0-i chair and [my]0-i knitting for [me]0-i , [I]0-i am come to make [my]0-i compliments to [her]4766-her in passing . [I]0-i wish to see [her]4766-her . ” “[4766-her] [I]0-i know that [your]0-i intentions are evil , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] and [you]0-i may depend upon it , [I]0-i ’ll hold [my]0-i own against [them]4765-they . ” [Each]509-each spoke in [her]509-each own language ; [neither]7740-neither understood [the other]756-the other ’s words ; [both]5188-both were very watchful , and intent to deduce from look and manner , what the unintelligible words meant . “[0-i] It will do [her]4766-her no good to keep [herself]4766-her concealed from [me]0-i at this moment , ” said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . “[4766-her] [Good patriots]4767-good patriots will know what that means . Let [me]0-i see [her]4766-her . Go tell [her]4766-her that [I]0-i wish to see [her]4766-her . Do [you]0-i hear ? ” “[0-i] If those eyes of [yours]0-i were bed - winches , ” returned [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] and [I]0-i was an English four - poster , [they]4765-they should n’t loose a splinter of [me]0-i . No , [[you]0-i wicked foreign woman]4768-you wicked foreign woman ; [I]0-i am [your]0-i match . ” [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge was not likely to follow these idiomatic remarks in detail ; but , [she]146-madame defarge so far understood [them]4765-they as to perceive that [she]146-madame defarge was set at naught . “[0-i] [Woman imbecile and pig - like]4769-woman imbecile and pig - like ! ” said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge , frowning . “[0-i] [I]0-i take no answer from [you]0-i . [I]0-i demand to see [her]4766-her . Either tell [her]4766-her that [I]0-i demand to see [her]4766-her , or stand out of the way of the door and let [me]0-i go to [her]4766-her ! ” This , with an angry explanatory wave of [her]146-madame defarge right arm . “[0-i] [I]0-i little thought , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] that [I]0-i should ever want to understand [your]0-i nonsensical language ; but [I]0-i would give all [I]0-i have , except the clothes [I]0-i wear , to know whether [you]0-i suspect the truth , or any part of it . ” Neither of [them]7743-them for a single moment released [the other]756-the other ’s eyes . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge had not moved from the spot where [she]146-madame defarge stood when [Miss Pross]183-miss pross first became aware of [her]146-madame defarge ; but , [she]146-madame defarge now advanced one step . “[0-i] [I]0-i am [a Briton]4770-a briton , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] [I]0-i am desperate . [I]0-i do n’t care an English Twopence for [myself]0-i . [I]0-i know that the longer [I]0-i keep [you]0-i [here]4902-here , the greater hope there is for [[my]0-i Ladybird]5355-my ladybird . [I]0-i ’ll not leave a handful of that dark hair upon [your]0-i head , if [you]0-i lay a finger on [me]0-i ! ” Thus [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , with a shake of [her]183-miss pross head and a flash of [her]183-miss pross eyes between every rapid sentence , and every rapid sentence a whole breath . Thus [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , who had never struck a blow in [her]183-miss pross life . But , [her]183-miss pross courage was of that emotional nature that it brought the irrepressible tears into [her]183-miss pross eyes . This was a courage that [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge so little comprehended as to mistake for weakness . “[0-i] Ha , ha ! ” [she]183-miss pross laughed , “[0-i] [[you]0-i poor wretch]4773-you poor wretch ! What are [you]0-i worth ! [I]0-i address [myself]0-i to [that Doctor]4464-that doctor . ” Then [she]183-miss pross raised [her]183-miss pross voice and called out , “[4464-that doctor] [Citizen Doctor]6911-citizen doctor ! [Wife of Evrémonde]4776-wife of evrémonde ! [Child of Evrémonde]4655-child of evrémonde ! [Any person]3352-any person but [this miserable fool]4779-this miserable fool , answer [the Citizeness Defarge]294-the citizeness defarge ! ” Perhaps the following silence , perhaps some latent disclosure in the expression of [Miss Pross]183-miss pross ’s face , perhaps a sudden misgiving apart from either suggestion , whispered to [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge that [they]4783-they were gone . Three of the doors [she]183-miss pross opened swiftly , and looked in . “[294-the citizeness defarge] [Those rooms]4780-those rooms are all in disorder , there has been hurried packing , there are odds and ends upon the ground . There is [no one]330-no one in [that room]4782-that room behind [you]0-i ! Let [me]0-i look . ” “[0-i] Never ! ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , who understood the request as perfectly as [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge understood the answer . “[0-i] If [they]4783-they are not in [that room]4782-that room , [they]4783-they are gone , and can be pursued and brought back , ” said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge to [herself]146-madame defarge . “[0-i] As long as [you]0-i do n’t know whether [they]4783-they are in [that room]4782-that room or not , [you]0-i are uncertain what to do , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross to [herself]183-miss pross ; “[0-i] and [you]0-i shall not know that , if [I]0-i can prevent [your]0-i knowing it ; and know that , or not know that , [you]0-i shall not leave [here]4902-here while [I]0-i can hold [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have been in [the streets]732-the streets from the first , nothing has stopped [me]0-i , [I]0-i will tear [you]0-i to pieces , but [I]0-i will have [you]0-i from that door , ” said [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge . “[0-i] [We]4788-we are alone at the top of [a high house]4789-a high house in [a solitary courtyard]4790-a solitary courtyard , [we]4788-we are not likely to be heard , and [I]0-i pray for bodily strength to keep [you]0-i [here]4902-here , while every minute [you]0-i are [here]4902-here is worth a hundred thousand guineas to [[my]0-i darling]2648-my darling , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge made at the door . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , on the instinct of the moment , seized [her]146-madame defarge round the waist in both [her]183-miss pross arms , and held [her]146-madame defarge tight . It was in vain for [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge to struggle and to strike ; [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , with the vigorous tenacity of love , always so much stronger than hate , clasped [her]146-madame defarge tight , and even lifted [her]146-madame defarge from the floor in the struggle that [they]4788-we had . The two hands of [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge buffeted and tore [her]146-madame defarge face ; but , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , with [her]183-miss pross head down , held [her]146-madame defarge round the waist , and clung to [her]146-madame defarge with more than the hold of [a drowning woman]7745-a drowning woman . Soon , [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s hands ceased to strike , and felt at [her]146-madame defarge encircled waist . “[0-i] It is under [my]0-i arm , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , in smothered tones , “[4794-you] [you]4794-you shall not draw it . [I]0-i am stronger than [you]4794-you , [I]0-i bless [Heaven]225-heaven for it . [I]0-i hold [you]4794-you till one or other of [us]4795-us faints or dies ! ” [Madame Defarge]146-madame defarge ’s hands were at [her]146-madame defarge bosom . [Miss Pross]183-miss pross looked up , saw what it was , struck at it , struck out a flash and a crash , and stood alone -- blinded with smoke . All this was in a second . As the smoke cleared , leaving an awful stillness , it passed out on the air , like the soul of [the furious woman whose body lay lifeless on the ground]7746-the furious woman whose body lay lifeless on the ground . In the first fright and horror of [her]183-miss pross situation , [Miss Pross]183-miss pross passed the body as far from [it]146-madame defarge as [she]183-miss pross could , and ran down [the stairs]808-the stairs to call for fruitless help . Happily , [she]183-miss pross bethought [herself]183-miss pross of the consequences of what [she]183-miss pross did , in time to check [herself]183-miss pross and go back . It was dreadful to go in at the door again ; but , [she]183-miss pross did go in , and even went near it , to get the bonnet and other things that [she]183-miss pross must wear . These [she]183-miss pross put on , out on [the staircase]5048-the staircase , first shutting and locking the door and taking away the key . [She]183-miss pross then sat down on the stairs a few moments to breathe and to cry , and then got up and hurried away . By good fortune [she]183-miss pross had a veil on [her]183-miss pross bonnet , or [she]183-miss pross could hardly have gone along [the streets]732-the streets without being stopped . By good fortune , too , [she]183-miss pross was naturally so peculiar in appearance as not to show disfigurement like [any other woman]7750-any other woman . [She]183-miss pross needed both advantages , for the marks of gripping fingers were deep in [her]183-miss pross face , and [her]183-miss pross hair was torn , and [her]183-miss pross dress ( hastily composed with unsteady hands ) was clutched and dragged a hundred ways . In crossing [the bridge]3954-the bridge , [she]183-miss pross dropped the door key in [the river]1494-the river . Arriving at [the cathedral]4759-the cathedral some few minutes before [[her]183-miss pross escort]7754-her escort , and waiting there , [she]183-miss pross thought , what if the key were already taken in a net , what if it were identified , what if the door were opened and the remains discovered , what if [she]183-miss pross were stopped at the gate , sent to [prison]5014-prison , and charged with murder ! In the midst of these fluttering thoughts , [the escort]3358-the escort appeared , took [her]183-miss pross in , and took [her]183-miss pross away . “[0-i] Is there any noise in [the streets]732-the streets ? ” [she]183-miss pross asked [him]4797-you . “[0-i] The usual noises , ” [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher replied ; and looked surprised by the question and by [her]183-miss pross aspect . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t hear [you]4797-you , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross . “[0-i] What do [you]4797-you say ? ” It was in vain for [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher to repeat what [he]156-mr. cruncher said ; [Miss Pross]183-miss pross could not hear [him]156-mr. cruncher . “[4797-you] So [I]0-i ’ll nod [my]0-i head , ” thought [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , amazed , “[0-i] at all events [she]4798-she ’ll see that . ” And [she]183-miss pross did . “[4798-she] Is there any noise in [the streets]732-the streets now ? ” asked [Miss Pross]183-miss pross again , presently . Again [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher nodded [his]156-mr. cruncher head . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t hear it . ” “[0-i] Gone deaf in an hour ? ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , ruminating , with [his]156-mr. cruncher mind much disturbed ; “[4798-she] wot ’s come to [her]4798-she ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i feel , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , “[0-i] as if there had been a flash and a crash , and that crash was the last thing [I]0-i should ever hear in this life . ” “[0-i] Blest if [she]4798-she ai n’t in a queer condition ! ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , more and more disturbed . “[0-i] Wot can [she]4798-she have been a takin ’ , to keep [her]4798-she courage up ? Hark ! There ’s the roll of [them]4800-them dreadful carts ! [You]0-i can hear that , [miss]4912-miss ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can hear , ” said [Miss Pross]183-miss pross , seeing that [he]156-mr. cruncher spoke to [her]183-miss pross , “[0-i] nothing . O , [[my]0-i good man]4802-my good man , there was first a great crash , and then a great stillness , and that stillness seems to be fixed and unchangeable , never to be broken any more as long as [my]0-i life lasts . ” “[4798-she] If [she]4798-she do n’t hear the roll of those dreadful carts , now very nigh [their]4800-them journey ’s end , ” said [Mr. Cruncher]156-mr. cruncher , glancing over [his]0-i shoulder , “[4798-she] it ’s [my]0-i opinion that indeed [she]4798-she never will hear anything else in [this world]976-this world . ” And indeed [she]4798-she never did . CHAPTER XV . The Footsteps Die Out For Ever Along [the Paris streets]2976-the paris streets , [the death - carts]7758-the death - carts rumble , hollow and harsh . Six tumbrils carry the day ’s wine to [La Guillotine]249-la guillotine . All the devouring and insatiate Monsters imagined since imagination could record itself , are fused in the one realisation , Guillotine . And yet there is not in [France]2-france , with [its]2-france rich variety of soil and climate , a blade , a leaf , a root , a sprig , a peppercorn , which will grow to maturity under conditions more certain than those that have produced this horror . Crush humanity out of shape once more , under similar hammers , and it will twist itself into the same tortured forms . Sow the same seed of rapacious license and oppression over again , and it will surely yield the same fruit according to its kind . Six tumbrils roll along [the streets]732-the streets . Change these back again to what [they]4800-them were , [thou]7760-thou powerful enchanter , Time , and they shall be seen to be the carriages of [absolute monarchs]7761-absolute monarchs , the equipages of [feudal nobles]7762-feudal nobles , the toilettes of flaring Jezebels , the churches that are not [[[my]4798-she father]4969-my father ’s house]7764-my father ’s house but [dens of [thieves]348-thieves]7765-dens of thieves , [the huts of millions of [starving peasants]7768-starving peasants]7767-the huts of millions of starving peasants ! No ; [the great magician who majestically works out the appointed order of the Creator]7769-the great magician who majestically works out the appointed order of the creator , never reverses [his]7769-the great magician who majestically works out the appointed order of the creator transformations . “[4798-she] If [thou]4804-thou be changed into this shape by the will of [God]149-god , ” say [the seers]7770-the seers to [the enchanted]7771-the enchanted , in the wise Arabian stories , “[4798-she] then remain so ! But , if [thou]4804-thou wear this form through mere passing conjuration , then resume [thy]4804-thou former aspect ! ” Changeless and hopeless , the tumbrils roll along . As the sombre wheels of [the six carts]7772-the six carts go round , [they]7772-the six carts seem to plough up a long crooked furrow among [the populace]3564-the populace in [the streets]732-the streets . Ridges of faces are thrown to this side and to that , and the ploughs go steadily onward . So used are [the regular inhabitants of [the houses]603-the houses]7775-the regular inhabitants of the houses to the spectacle , that in many windows there are [no people]921-no people , and in [some the occupation of the hands]7778-some the occupation of the hands is not so much as suspended , while the eyes survey the faces in [the tumbrils]7779-the tumbrils . Here and there , [the inmate]7780-the inmate has [visitors]7781-visitors to see the sight ; then [he]7780-the inmate points [his]7780-the inmate finger , with something of the complacency of [a curator]7782-a curator or [authorised exponent]7783-authorised exponent , to [this cart]7784-this cart and to this , and seems to tell who sat here yesterday , and [who there the day before]7785-who there the day before . Of [the riders in the tumbrils]7786-the riders in the tumbrils , [some]2119-some observe these things , and all things on [their]2119-some last roadside , with an impassive stare ; [others]672-others , with a lingering interest in the ways of life and [men]568-men . [Some , seated with drooping heads]7790-some , seated with drooping heads , are sunk in silent despair ; again , there are some so heedful of [their]7790-some , seated with drooping heads looks that [they]7790-some , seated with drooping heads cast upon the multitude such glances as [they]7790-some , seated with drooping heads have seen in [theatres]7791-theatres , and in pictures . [Several]7792-several close [their]7792-several eyes , and think , or try to get [their]7792-several straying thoughts together . Only one , and [he]7793-he [a miserable creature , of a crazed aspect]7794-a miserable creature , of a crazed aspect , is so shattered and made drunk by horror , that [he]7793-he sings , and tries to dance . Not one of [the whole number]7795-the whole number appeals by look or gesture , to the pity of [the people]717-the people . There is [a guard of sundry horsemen riding abreast of the tumbrils]7797-a guard of sundry horsemen riding abreast of the tumbrils , and faces are often turned up to some of [them]7797-a guard of sundry horsemen riding abreast of the tumbrils , and [they]7797-a guard of sundry horsemen riding abreast of the tumbrils are asked some question . It would seem to be always the same question , for , it is always followed by a press of [people]360-people towards the third cart . [The horsemen abreast of that cart]7799-the horsemen abreast of that cart , frequently point out [one man]1440-one man in it with [their]7799-the horsemen abreast of that cart swords . The leading curiosity is , to know which is [he]1440-one man ; [he]1440-one man stands at the back of the tumbril with [his]1440-one man head bent down , to converse with [a mere girl who sits on the side of [the cart]7802-the cart]7801-a mere girl who sits on the side of the cart , and holds [his]1440-one man hand . [He]1440-one man has no curiosity or care for the scene about [him]1440-one man , and always speaks to [the girl]4443-the girl . Here and there in [the long street of St. Honore]7804-the long street of st. honore , cries are raised against [him]1440-one man . If [they]717-the people move [him]1440-one man at all , it is only to a quiet smile , as [he]1440-one man shakes [his]1440-one man hair a little more loosely about [his]1440-one man face . [He]1440-one man can not easily touch [his]1440-one man face , [his]1440-one man arms being bound . On the steps of [a church]7805-a church , awaiting the coming - up of the tumbrils , stands [the Spy]6057-the spy and prison - sheep . [He]1440-one man looks into the first of [them]717-the people : not there . [He]1440-one man looks into the second : not there . [He]1440-one man already asks [himself]1440-one man , “[4805-her] Has [he]4805-her sacrificed [me]0-i ? ” when [his]1440-one man face clears , as [he]1440-one man looks into the third . “[4805-her] Which is [Evrémonde]272-evrémonde ? ” says [a man behind [him]1440-one man]7807-a man behind him . “[272-evrémonde] That . At the back there . ” “[4805-her] With [his]4805-her hand in [the girl]4443-the girl ’s ? ” “[4805-her] Yes . ” [The man]472-the man cries , “[4805-her] Down , Evrémonde ! To [the Guillotine]3937-the guillotine [all aristocrats]4808-all aristocrats ! Down , Evrémonde ! ” “[3937-the guillotine] Hush , hush ! ” [the Spy]6057-the spy entreats [him]472-the man , timidly . “[3937-the guillotine] And why not , [citizen]3357-citizen ? ” “[4805-her] [He]4805-her is going to pay the forfeit : it will be paid in five minutes more . Let [him]4805-her be at peace . ” But [the man]472-the man continuing to exclaim , “[4805-her] Down , Evrémonde ! ” the face of [Evrémonde]272-evrémonde is for a moment turned towards [him]472-the man . [Evrémonde]272-evrémonde then sees [the Spy]6057-the spy , and looks attentively at [him]6057-the spy , and goes [his]472-the man way . The clocks are on the stroke of three , and the furrow ploughed among [the populace]3564-the populace is turning round , to come on into the place of execution , and end . The ridges thrown to this side and to that , now crumble in and close behind the last plough as it passes on , for all are following to [the Guillotine]291-sainte guillotine . In front of [it]291-sainte guillotine , seated in chairs , as in [a garden of public diversion]7813-a garden of public diversion , are a number of [women]671-women , busily knitting . On one of the fore - most chairs , stands [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance , looking about for [[her]236-the vengeance friend]3560-her friend . “[4805-her] Thérèse ! ” [she]236-the vengeance cries , in [her]236-the vengeance shrill tones . “[4805-her] Who has seen [her]4805-her ? Thérèse Defarge ! ” “[4805-her] [She]4805-her never missed before , ” says [a knitting - woman of the sisterhood]7816-a knitting - woman of the sisterhood . “[4805-her] No ; nor will [she]4805-her miss now , ” cries [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance , petulantly . “[4805-her] Thérèse . ” “[4805-her] Louder , ” [the woman]1008-the woman recommends . Ay ! Louder , [Vengeance]236-the vengeance , much louder , and still [she]4805-her will scarcely hear [thee]7818-thee . Louder yet , [Vengeance]236-the vengeance , with a little oath or so added , and yet it will hardly bring [her]4805-her . Send [other women]7819-other women up and down to seek [her]4805-her , lingering somewhere ; and yet , although [the messengers]6987-the messengers have done dread deeds , it is questionable whether of [their]6987-the messengers own wills [they]6987-the messengers will go far enough to find [her]4805-her ! “[4805-her] Bad Fortune ! ” cries [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance , stamping [her]236-the vengeance foot in the chair , “[4805-her] and here are the tumbrils ! And [Evrémonde]272-evrémonde will be despatched in a wink , and [she]4805-her not here ! See [her]4805-her knitting in [my]0-i hand , and [her]4805-her empty chair ready for [her]4805-her . [I]0-i cry with vexation and disappointment ! ” As [The Vengeance]236-the vengeance descends from [her]236-the vengeance elevation to do it , the tumbrils begin to discharge [their]6987-the messengers loads . [The ministers of [Sainte Guillotine]291-sainte guillotine]7821-the ministers of sainte guillotine are robed and ready . [Crash!--A]295-crash!--a head is held up , and [the knitting - women who scarcely lifted [their]7822-the knitting - women who scarcely lifted their eyes to look at it a moment ago when it could think and speak eyes to look at it a moment ago when it could think and speak]7822-the knitting - women who scarcely lifted their eyes to look at it a moment ago when it could think and speak , count One . The second tumbril empties and moves on ; the third comes up . Crash!--And [the knitting - women]7823-the knitting - women , never faltering or pausing in [their]7823-the knitting - women Work , count Two . [The supposed Evrémonde]272-evrémonde descends , and [the seamstress]7824-the seamstress is lifted out next after [him]0-i . [He]0-i has not relinquished [her]7824-the seamstress patient hand in getting out , but still holds it as [he]0-i promised . [He]0-i gently places [her]7824-the seamstress with [her]7824-the seamstress back to the crashing engine that constantly whirrs up and falls , and [she]7824-the seamstress looks into [his]0-i face and thanks [him]0-i . “[0-i] But for [you]4810-you , [dear stranger]4811-dear stranger , [I]0-i should not be so composed , for [I]0-i am naturally [a poor little thing , faint of heart]4812-a poor little thing , faint of heart ; nor should [I]0-i have been able to raise [my]0-i thoughts to [Him]4813-him who was put to death , that [we]4814-we might have hope and comfort here to - day . [I]0-i think [you]4810-you were sent to [me]0-i by [Heaven]225-heaven . ” “[225-heaven] Or [you]4810-you to [me]0-i , ” says [Sydney Carton]177-carton . “[4810-you] Keep [your]4810-you eyes upon [me]0-i , [dear child]4815-dear child , and mind no other object . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i mind nothing while [I]0-i hold [your]4810-you hand . [I]0-i shall mind nothing when [I]0-i let it go , if [they]4816-they are rapid . ” “[0-i] [They]4816-they will be rapid . Fear not ! ” [The two]883-the two stand in [the fast - thinning throng of victims]7826-the fast - thinning throng of victims , but [they]883-the two speak as if [they]883-the two were alone . Eye to eye , voice to voice , hand to hand , heart to heart , [these two children of the Universal Mother , else so wide apart and differing]7827-these two children of the universal mother , else so wide apart and differing , have come together on [the dark highway]7828-the dark highway , to repair [home]858-home together , and to rest in [her]7830-her bosom . “[4817-brave and generous friend] [Brave and generous friend]4817-brave and generous friend , will [you]4810-you let [me]0-i ask [you]4810-you one last question ? [I]0-i am very ignorant , and it troubles [me]0-i -- just a little . ” “[4818-a cousin] Tell [me]0-i what it is . ” “[4818-a cousin] [I]0-i have [a cousin]4818-a cousin , [an only relative]4819-an only relative and [an orphan]4923-an orphan , like [myself]0-i , whom [I]0-i love very dearly . [She]4818-a cousin is five years younger than [I]0-i , and [she]4818-a cousin lives in [[a farmer]4821-a farmer ’s house in [the south country]4823-the south country]4822-a farmer ’s house in the south country . [Poverty]296-poverty parted [us]4824-us , and [she]4818-a cousin knows nothing of [my]0-i fate -- for [I]0-i can not write -- and if [I]0-i could , how should [I]0-i tell [her]4818-a cousin ! It is better as it is . ” “[4818-a cousin] Yes , yes : better as it is . ” “[4818-a cousin] What [I]0-i have been thinking as [we]4824-us came along , and what [I]0-i am still thinking now , as [I]0-i look into [your]4825-you kind strong face which gives [me]0-i so much support , is this:--If [the Republic]274-the republic really does good to [the poor]4826-the poor , and [they]4826-the poor come to be less hungry , and in all ways to suffer less , [she]4818-a cousin may live a long time : [she]4818-a cousin may even live to be old . ” “[4827-my gentle sister] What then , [[my]0-i gentle sister]4827-my gentle sister ? ” “[4827-my gentle sister] Do [you]4827-my gentle sister think : ” the uncomplaining eyes in which there is so much endurance , fill with tears , and the lips part a little more and tremble : “[4827-my gentle sister] that it will seem long to [me]0-i , while [I]0-i wait for [her]4818-a cousin in [the better land where [I]0-i trust both [you]4825-you and [I]0-i will be mercifully sheltered]4828-the better land where i trust both you and i will be mercifully sheltered ? ” “[2642-my child] It can not be , [[my]0-i child]2642-my child ; there is no Time there , and no trouble there . ” “[4825-you] [You]4825-you comfort [me]0-i so much ! [I]0-i am so ignorant . Am [I]0-i to kiss [you]4825-you now ? Is the moment come ? ” “[0-i] Yes . ” [She]4818-a cousin kisses [his]0-i lips ; [he]0-i kisses [hers]4818-a cousin ; [they]7831-they solemnly bless [each other]1035-each other . The spare hand does not tremble as [he]0-i releases it ; nothing worse than a sweet , bright constancy is in the patient face . [She]4818-a cousin goes next before [him]0-i -- is gone ; [the knitting - women]7823-the knitting - women count [Twenty - Two]7834-twenty - two . “[0-i] [I]0-i am [the Resurrection and the Life]4830-the resurrection and the life , saith [the Lord]1901-the lord : [he]1901-the lord that believeth in [me]0-i , though [he]1901-the lord were dead , yet shall [he]1901-the lord live : and whosoever liveth and believeth in [me]0-i shall never die . ” The murmuring of many voices , the upturning of many faces , the pressing on of many footsteps in the outskirts of [the crowd]1386-the crowd , so that it swells forward in a mass , like one great heave of water , all flashes away . Twenty - Three . * * * * * [They]7836-they said of [him]0-i , about [the city]1496-the city that night , that it was [the peacefullest man]7838-the peacefullest man ’s face ever beheld [there]4887-there . [Many]1898-many added that [he]0-i looked sublime and prophetic . One of [the most remarkable sufferers by the same axe]7841-the most remarkable sufferers by the same axe -- [a woman]1959-a woman -- had asked at the foot of the same scaffold , not long before , to be allowed to write down the thoughts that were inspiring [her]1959-a woman . If [he]0-i had given any utterance to [his]0-i , and [they]1898-many were prophetic , [they]1898-many would have been these : “[0-i] [I]0-i see [Barsad]167-barsad , and Cly , Defarge , [The Vengeance]2997-the vengeance , [the Juryman]7476-the juryman , [the Judge]1094-the judge , long ranks of [the new oppressors who have risen on the destruction of the old]4835-the new oppressors who have risen on the destruction of the old , perishing by this retributive instrument , before it shall cease out of its present use . [I]0-i see [a beautiful city]4836-a beautiful city and [a brilliant people]4837-a brilliant people rising from [this abyss]4838-this abyss , and , in [their]4837-a brilliant people struggles to be truly free , in [their]4837-a brilliant people triumphs and defeats , through long years to come , [I]0-i see the evil of this time and of the previous time of which this is the natural birth , gradually making expiation for itself and wearing out . “ [I]0-i see the lives for which [I]0-i lay down [my]0-i life , peaceful , useful , prosperous and happy , in [that England]7843-that england which [I]0-i shall see no more . [I]0-i see [Her]7844-her with a child upon [her]7844-her bosom , who bears [my]0-i name . [I]0-i see [[her]7844-her father]5008-her father , aged and bent , but otherwise restored , and faithful to [all men in [his]5008-her father healing office]7846-all men in his healing office , and at peace . [I]0-i see [the good old man]4256-the good old man , so long [[their]4839-their friend]7848-their friend , in ten years ’ time enriching [them]4839-their with all [he]4256-the good old man has , and passing tranquilly to [his]4256-the good old man reward . “[0-i] [I]0-i see that [I]0-i hold a sanctuary in [their]4839-their hearts , and in the hearts of [[their]4839-their descendants]4458-their descendants , generations hence . [I]0-i see [her]4841-her , [an old woman]1962-an old woman , weeping for [me]0-i on the anniversary of this day . [I]0-i see [her]4841-her and [[her]4841-her husband]770-her husband , [their]4839-their course done , lying side by side in [their]4839-their last earthly bed , and [I]0-i know that [each]509-each was not more honoured and held sacred in [the other]756-the other ’s soul , than [I]0-i was in the souls of [both]5188-both . “ [I]0-i see [that child who lay upon [her]4841-her bosom and who bore [my]0-i name]7849-that child who lay upon her bosom and who bore my name , [a man winning [his]7850-a man winning his way up in that path of life which once was mine way up in that path of life which once was [mine]0-i]7850-a man winning his way up in that path of life which once was mine . [I]0-i see [him]7850-a man winning his way up in that path of life which once was mine winning it so well , that [my]0-i name is made illustrious there by the light of [his]7850-a man winning his way up in that path of life which once was mine . [I]0-i see the blots [I]0-i threw upon it , faded away . [I]0-i see [him]7850-a man winning his way up in that path of life which once was mine , fore - most of just [judges and honoured men]7851-judges and honoured men , bringing [a boy of [my]0-i name , with a forehead that [I]0-i know and golden hair , to this place -- then fair to look upon , with not a trace of this day ’s disfigurement]7852-a boy of my name , with a forehead that i know and golden hair , to this place -- then fair to look upon , with not a trace of this day ’s disfigurement -- and [I]0-i hear [him]0-i tell [the child]3495-the child [my]0-i story , with a tender and a faltering voice . “[0-i] It is a far , far better thing that [I]0-i do , than [I]0-i have ever done ; it is a far , far better rest that [I]0-i go to than [I]0-i have ever known . ” * * *
